text: 1:32 MinsFrankincense is a must have oil for me during the holiday season. I have grown the tree and used Frankincense tears as well as many brands of the essential oil. I have to say I am very pleased with the scent of the Frankincense Essential Oil from Natural Acres. It is a true Frankincense scent. The essential oil does not contain fillers, additives, base or carrier oils - and I know this from personal experience using oils that do and do not have these products added plus my own distillation experience.In addition to using this essential oil to scent potpourri or holiday decorations, it is good for clearing the mind as other therapeutic uses. This is not intended as medical advice it is simply my observation.The bottle comes with an attached plastic top with a dropper in it but it is easy to remove if you are like me and prefer a glass eye dropper (not included).High quality product that I highly recommend!Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

1:02 MinsI was pleasantly surprised when I opened this bottle of Grapefruit Essential Oil From Natural Acres. I don't like grapefruit but I have smelled plenty when people ate it around me and I did like the scent - citrusy and crisp - refreshing. That is exactly what this essential oil smelled like! I could tell it was citrusy yet the grapefruit smell came through as it should.The citrus smell is very stimulating and great for mental alertness - while I am not a doctor this is a personal observation from years of using different types of citrus essential oils. I felt more alert when I smelled this Grapefruit Essential Oil - and to me this is as expected.This is a 100% pure essential oil free of bases, carriers, additives and fillers. I know this because I tested it and I have distilled my own oils - so I know a quality oil when I see and smell it.I have been very impressed with the Natural Acres Brand Essential Oils and I do recommend them.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

1:47 MinsCedarwood Essential Oil has long been a staple in my essential oil kit. My most used purpose is in potpourri - however that is not the only possible use. While I am not a licensed doctor - and this is not intended as medical advice - there are a number of therapeutic uses of Cedarwood Essential Oil such as helping the skin recover from blemishes or rashes.I really liked the scent of this essential oil because it was not overpowering like some brands. The cedar scent came through - warm and woodsy. This is a 100% pure essential oil that is not diluted with a base or a carrier and there are no fillers or additives. How do I know that? I have distilled many essential oils in my time - and used many brands.This is a high quality product and I recommend it.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

2:19 MinsI have been using essential oils for many years, but Helichrysum Essential Oil is new to me even though I am very familiar with the plant. I was pleasantly surprised at the pleasing vibrant floral scent and suspect this is going to be one of my favorite essential oils from here on out.As someone who has distilled their own essential oils, I feel confident saying this is 100% pure essential oil - no fillers, additives, base or carrier oils.The 10ml bottle comes with a plastic top with a dropper on it. You can use it as it is or remove the top and use a glass eye dropper (not included).It does easily diffuse with water or mix into carrier oils.I like this oil and if you have not tried it, I recommend that you do - both for the therapeutic properties and the scent! This would be an ideal essential oil for perfumes or potpourri.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

3:22 MinsNatural Acres 100% pure Eucalyptus Essential Oil is just what it claims to be - no fillers, additives, base or carrier oils. This is important to me because I can dilute and mix the essential oil how I want to. I can add it to aromatherapy diffusers, carrier oils for massage and so much more.Eucalyptus Essential Oil is a must have in my household. I deal with allergies and lots of congestion and this is what I use this oil for - now this is not intended as medical advice. This is simply a statement of how I use this oil.The scent is not overbearing but rather mellow and I appreciate this. I could tell it worked when I opened the bottle and caught a whiff of the scent. I am very congested right now but I could smell this eucalyptus oil.I really like this essential oil and do recommend it. For those who are just getting into aromatherapy this is a must-have on hand oil as far as I am concerned.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

2:33 MinsI am quite familiar with Jojoba Oil as I have used it for years - and grown the plant from seed. I love that the Pure Body Naturals is organic. It is a high quality jojoba oil that I am happy to use in my bath and body products as well as my massage oils. This oil is great for your hair, skin and nails - best of all you can scent it with an essential oil of your choosing.I like that this oil is cold pressed and unrefined. In my opinion that is the best you can buy.It dilutes well with water so you can use it on your face without using it straight out of the bottle if you wish. It has made my skin feel softer and is great for adding shine to my hair.Another use is massaging it into my nails. They are quite brittle but after using this seem less brittle. I have not seen any growth yet, but I have not used this product for this purpose for very long.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

3:39 MinsI have never tried Tamanu Oil but since it was organic, I wanted to give it a try. I am very prone to breakouts and this is supposed to help. I did not see overnight results, however that does not mean it doesn't work.The product is a greenish-brown color and has a nutty smell. While the smell is not unpleasant, it is noticeable. It came with an eye dropper that made it very easy to put a drop or two of the oil on my fingers and then transfer to my face. The oil felt smooth going on and I could feel it drying on my skin. I assume it did remove some of the excess oil from my skin because it kind of felt that way but it did not dry my skin out.The bottle states it is good for a wide range of skin conditions but I do not feel like I have had it long enough at this point to say yes it works or no it does not.I will say this is a high quality product and if you are looking for a Tamanu Oil, I recommend this one.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

3:54 MinsThis is a high quality, cold pressed, grade A Sweet Almond Oil that I will use for diluting 100% essential oils for massage purposes. I will also use it for making bath and body products. I am very happy with the quality and the light scent of this product. It is rich in vitamins A, B and E making it an excellent oil for all kinds of uses on the skin.It is known to stimulate the skin and help renew skin skills thus reducing the signs of aging. It is a great body oil and leave-in hair conditioner. I often add a drop or two of rosemary oil to it and massage that into my hair and scalp. I have dark hair and the benefits are quite noticeable.I can tell I have used an oil on my skin because of the softer feeling but it is not greasy like some products I have tried.The only ingredient is pure sweet almond oil, which I appreciate. The flip cap it came with was very nice because It makes using the product easier.This is also a great product to use on dry skin. Try adding a drop or two to your bath water - but remember oil can make the tub slippery so use caution!This is a great product and the fact that it is cold pressed makes it one of the highest quality sweet almond oils you can get.Disclaimer: I did receive this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

6:37 MinsAs with all Ozeri products I have tried, the CardioTech Pro Series Blood Pressure Monitor is durable and as far as I can tell, accurate. As stated in my video I have not had a chance to have this calibrated at my doctors office, but the reading it took did seem correct.I appreciate that this came with two triple A batteries - and a very nice storage case. The company took care to wrap the monitor in bubble wrap before putting it into the case and I appreciate that.The velcro is large enough that attaching the band is not an issue - and neither is removing it from your wrist. I was not afraid that I would rip the velcro off.The batteries are easy to install and I appreciated the + and - signs so I clearly knew which battery went in which way. The battery compartment was easy to remove and reattach as well.Wrist monitors are often easier to use than the standard arm monitors. I really like this monitor. I found all the buttons easy to push and they were clearly marked. While I did read over the instruction manual, I did not do so before my first use. I wanted to see if someone who had no idea how to use one could do it. Very easy to operate!Everyone should have a blood pressure monitor in their home because you just never know when you might need it. I recommend this one.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

4:34 MinsI love baking and learning how to make new foods. I wanted the moon cake molds for the designs more than anything else, but once they arrived and I began to research how to use them, I was intrigued by the thought of making real moon cakes - something I have never seen. Of course, moon cakes are not the only thing this mold is good for making. Use it to make pretty stamped cookies - or fondant - or gumpaste decorations for cakes or cookies. Use it to make all kinds of desserts - even mini pies.The ABS/BPA free food grade plastic the mold is made of is plenty thick and durable so it will last for years to come. The plunger itself is metal with a  high quality stainless steel spring. It is easy to push up and down even though I have arthritis in my hands.The depth of the designs are thick enough that baking is not going to eliminate them. I am very impressed with the quality of this mold.It does take some effort to switch the molds out but this is a plus because they are not going to just fall out while you are pressing your design.I am very happy with my purchase.Disclaimer: I received this item for free or at a reduced price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. All opinions are my own.

Awesome idea with the beads that angle in all directions. Vibrations are strong and on point. Several different vibrating patterns that you can select. Plenty long enough and width is just right. My new favorite toy!

Either this is supposed to be inserted in you or it's supposed to simply vibrate against your perineum.If it's supposed to go in your rectum, it's way, way too big. I'm not an advanced user by any means, but I'm no beginner either. This thing is just way, way too wide. Normal adult male. 5'11" 185 lbs.If it's simply supposed to vibrate against your perineum for associative sensations, well that's no good either.Unimpressed and returned.
I was really after an extension that had one male, one female and I wasn't paying close enough attention and bought this. However, I've made it work. Good enough quality, fair price, fast shipping.

PROS:See below, but in short, gets the deep stuff and is safe for planes.Smells good.Strips wax down to the paint.CONS:Strips wax down to the paint.At $17/gallon, it’s expensive (yes, I know it’s a concentrate).Leaves a film if you’re not careful.As a concentrate, you have to mix it yourself and have a separate bottle.CONCLUSION:Any plane owner, without a doubt, should have this in their arsenal of cleaning supplies.THE STORY:I own three aircraft and I like to keep them sparkling clean. I have several cleaning agents that I use regularly, including:Windex, Plexi-Glass Cleaner, Goof Off and good ol' 100LL (plane gasoline).Windex is great for the bug guts. Windshield gets the Plexi-specific cleaner. 100LL for the oil/belly spray and Goof Off for the really hard to remove stuff. I use this sparingly as it likes to take paint with it...So I bought the Simple Green to see what, of the above, it could replace. My initial results, even in high concentrations, were not spectacular. Also, it leaves a surface film I wasn't impressed with.So there it sat on my shelf for five months, rarely used.Now, however, I have seen the light. I had some staining in the paint that a) I couldn't figure out and b) couldn't remove. None of the above products would remove this rainstreak-like staining that was on my tailcone. Even a coat of cleaner-wax wouldn't touch it.So I loaded up a new spray bottle with 1:2 concentrate of Simple Green Aviation. I could not believe the results when it ate right through it and left perfectly clean, bright white paint. So white, in fact, that it makes the rest of the plane look dull.So then I attacked directly behind the plane's exhaust tips, an area brown with grime and exhaust spray. This I’ve, after several repeated attempts at removal, always assumed was permanent. Well, it did take five applications (and wipings) of Simple Green 1:2, but it finally came out. I then quickly wiped the entire fuselage of the plane down and oh man does it pop now.So, in the proper concentration (and repeated applications if necessary), this definitely does the job when even caustic agents won't. I'm a believer now, for sure.

Two identical batteries puffed up and died within a couple months. The one that came with my plane died within one month. This replacement (same exact one) died in just over three months. Only used six times, if that.Junk batteries. Stay away.

It's currently one Navy Blue Sharpie for $10. The world's biggest rip off. However, I needed this exact one to match paint on a project. So I was willing to pay the price, but still.... a complete ripoff.

Working fine. Actually using two of them to make a three-axis 180deg elbow for a portable radio in my plane's cockpit. Despite the extra connections, reception is great. Had an issue where the center pin wasn't perfectly straight, so it wouldn't plug in, but a little fiddling straightened it and in it went.

I am only using the keyboard from this kit. It replaced a nice wireless Logitech that crapped out after only 1.5 years of service.The keys on this one are much quieter. The layout is EXACTLY what I wanted (windows keys on both sides of the keyboard with the arrows and Insert, Home, End, etc in the COMMON layout.Only thing I wish it had is an on/off switch, which the Logitech did have installed. It's nice to quickly flip it off and then set papers on top, knowing your computer won't receive accidental key presses.Another reviewer mentioned the lack of Num Lock and Caps Lock lights.... didn't notice it until now, but yeah that would've been awesome.

I had a nice five star review written for this phone, submitted to Amazon after only a few days of ownership.However, I now feel obligated to reduce it to a one-star rating.The phone, which I barely use since it's a backup to my primary smart phone, is suffering from several reboots throughout the day. This is when the phone is just sitting idle, on a call or on a txt. It doesn't care. Reboots.The battery life is much worse than I was expecting. I was expecting idle standby of around one week. Instead it's about 48 hours. That just doesn't cut it for a dumb phone.I wanted a simple, RELIABLE dumb phone and went with Samsung since it's such a big name. Unfortunately, the reliability just isn't there.Returned.

I've had my A6 for over two years now, purchased from Amazon.PROS:I have no other portables to compare this to, but RX battery life seems good if you want to use it as a scanner. Mine sat for around 18 hours and was still going strong RX'ing. Didn't try TX'ing, but know the battery wouldn't have handled it well.Backlight is nice.CONS:Like everyone else says, the interface is extremely counterintuitive. After two years, I still get confused by it. The biggest issue is channel selection. The buttons you'd think would allow you to switch between saved channels in fact switches between recent channels. Setting saved channel and alphanumeric names requires the owner's manual, no way around it. Just a screwy way to do things. Buttons that have two commands (alternate command activated via the Function key) are backwards. The more common command requires Function + Button and the less common command is just Button. Things like that really bring this radio down.The unit comes with a now-antiquated NIMH battery which carries all the burdens associated with NIMH. Doesn't hold a good charge and because TX requires much more juice, you can often RX all day, but won't be able to TX unless it's fully topped off.Just recently a LIPO battery has come on the market, but it's expensive. Fortunately, an alkaline AA adapter is available that replaces the battery pack with six AA batteries. This works much, much better. I'd love to try the new LIPO, though.Branded accessories are ridiculously, yet as expected, expensive. Generics come with the possibility of burning up the radio.The true purpose of this review, though, is to broadcast a fix for a common, frustrating issue: In the air, listening to a non-stop RX such as an ATIS frequency (or even a busy Approach), you'll find the radio cuts the RX off every eight seconds, for half a second. You can search the 'net for others that have this problem. To stop the radio from cutting out, you need to turn the WX ALERT off by pressing Function + Squelch (duhhhhh).CONCLUSION:I would not buy this again, unless I had to. Your choices are fairly limited to the Yaetsu or Sporty's units and maybe some oddballs. I went with ICOM since it's such a big name and I love my ICOM panel mounted radio. This thing, though, is just too goofy.

These are drop-in replacements for Lionel's G Gauge model train line. You can either use 6 C-cell batteries or one of these.Versus the C cells, the advantages are:The train is much, much faster with this pack, at least for a short time.Rechargeable and thus environmentally friendly, if that matters to you.Weighs less than 6 C-cells which makes the train much faster.Disadvantages:My batteries are date stamped. They are already over four years old. The kit doesn't appear to have ever been used, but it has sat somewhere for a very long time.The life is a fraction of what the 6 C's offer. Expect a half hour or less on this pack, whereas the 6 C's you'll get hour after hour after hour of solid performance... and the NiCd is super fast for a few minutes, then tapers off dramatically.Very long (10hr) charge time and you have to unplug it. Unlike Lion batteries, which charge quickly and then trickle.Would I do it again?Probably not. I was just curious to see how fast the train would go. Now that I know just how quickly these batteries drain, I'll just stick with C cells... given how long they last, what they cost isn't much of an issue.

I have a toy G gauge model train... it's the biggest size commonly available. Each car is maybe the size of a ferret or something. Anyhow, these little lights are great for illuminating the interior.I grind the little eye loop off the bottom of the lights with a bench grinder to create a flat surface. Then a dab of super glue and I glue it to the inside of the train car. A quick twist of the light and my interior is illuminated and looks great when playing with the train at night.All my lights were working upon arrival. One was turned on upon opening the package. Some are brighter than others, presumably from weaker batteries.Batteries are replaceable. These are nice, cheap little lights. Satisfied.
This was a cost effective way to get both the LH and RH switches and some extra track, too. Didn't do the math, but surely saved me a few bucks from buying each switch individually.

Requires Android 4.0 or higher.Some of us are Luddites that like their old Galaxy S2, still running 2.3 Froyo. Guess what app isn't compatible with that? That's right, the wemo app. For absolutely no good reason, either.I refuse to upgrade my phone (Froyo is simple and fast), so this has got to go. Returning tomorrow.

I bought the Lionel G Gauge Snoopy train a few weeks ago. Interestingly, that kit has a tanker and flatcar available separately. The only other individually sold car for the plastic battery-powered G Gauge line is this one. I bought it to help expand my train, which is now up to six or seven total pieces.The only thing left, as far as I can tell, are the passenger cars from the Polar Express kit, but they're not available separately. All the other G Gauge kits are the *same* cars just with different decals. This flat car, with the spools, is the last differently molded plastic car, minus the passenger cars. So it was a good buy in an otherwise limited lineup.Nice car, though it does cost a lot. Spools are removable for you or your toddler to play with. Will last forever, if not abused.

As always, the accessories are always more expensive than the base model product you're buying, but that's just life.There are two add-on cars for the Snoopy G gauge train. I bought both at the same time I bought the train itself. They're as well made and cute as what's included with the kit. May as well just bite the bullet to lengthen out your new toy!

As always, the accessories are always more expensive than the base model product you're buying, but that's just life.There are two add-on cars for the Snoopy G gauge train. I bought both at the same time I bought the train itself. They're as well made and cute as what's included with the kit. May as well just bite the bullet to lengthen out your new toy!

It's been 25 years since I've had a model train to play with. And now that I have a 2 y/o running around, I decided it was time to change that. Especially with a Christmas tree purchase coming up soon.I wanted something bigger than the O gauge you see everywhere else. Something that my daughter wouldn't get bored of quite so fast... thinking that bigger is better in that regard.I purchased this after reading all the reviews on the other Lionel G gauge train sets here on Amazon. The Snoopy train is the same thing, just different decals.It arrived quickly and in perfect condition.My word is it big. In reality, I may not have bought G gauge knowing just how big they are. Really, the size of the train itself is fine, but that size makes the track so cumbersome. It will quickly fill up a normal sized front room. Seriously, monster sized. The engine is the size of a small cat.These G gauge trains are presumably geared towards small children. Entirely plastic, more durable, more rough-housing resistant, simpler. Perfect for my needs. Batteries are not included with this kit, though I guess they are/were with the others. However, everyone complains the included batteries were junk, so I guess it's a wash.Assembly was quick, batteries were inserted and away we went. My 2 y/o had the remote understood in seconds. Very simple.PROS:The simplicity and durability of the train and cars seems very nice. While entirely plastic, they don't look cheap and chinsy. I think you could put this train on display and be proud of it.The most impressive thing with the kit, and maybe all trains do this now, is that if you are at full speed forward and your kid throws the remote to full speed reverse, the train slows and realistically comes to a halt, samples a "coming to a stop train noise" (sounds totally real) and then slowly picks up speed in reverse. It's probably a 10-15 second process. This is so much better than grinding to a stop and going full bore in reverse.The chugga chugga engine sounds are in sync with the speed of the train, up to and including, full stop, as explained above.CONS:There is a bell and whistle, but no actual smoke. :( No big deal, or a surprise, in this price range.The sounds are clearly recorded and replay in low quality. Higher quality playback would be great.The locomotive itself has no Snoopy livery. It is plain, generic black.The other decals look nice, but are still sort of plain. "Snoopy Railways" sounds kind of clunky. No variation of the wording from car to car is boring, as well. More variation in the decals, adding other Peanuts characters would be awesome.In a cost saving measure, it seems like all the G gauge trains are for the most part the exact same plastic, just with different colors and decals.CONCLUSION: I don't know if I would buy G gauge again, at least not without having an entire room dedicated to the train. The train itself is great, it's just too bad the track takes up so much room. If you're after something simple, durable and huge, then you can't go wrong, though.

Not much track for what you pay, but that's the way it always is with accessories. Track is sort of difficult to assemble by hand, but a pair of pliers instantly makes it much easier.Others are saying the photo isn't accurate. I can't really tell, but what I do know is this is the same track that is currently coming with all the G-gauge battery operated "toy" trains that Lionel is selling here via Amazon.

Not much track for what you pay, but that's the way it always is with accessories. Track is sort of difficult to assemble by hand, but a pair of pliers instantly makes it much easier.Others are saying the photo isn't accurate. I can't really tell, but what I do know is this is the same track that is currently coming with all the G-gauge battery operated "toy" trains that Lionel is selling here via Amazon.

IMPORANT NOTE: My hinges arrived with all four corners rounded. The current photo shows sharp right-angle corners. Since I actually needed rounded corners (and was going to grind them down), this worked out PERFECTLY for me. But the photo is indeed incorrect (only the corners, the rest of the photo is accurate).My local major-chain blue-logo bigbox store doesn't even CARRY non removable pin door hinges. What the heck?I was surprised that I had to resort to Amazon for NPR hinges and even then to a non-Prime merchant seller. The only Prime NPR hinges, in the size I needed, are not well reviewed.Anyhow, these Bolton hinges were delivered timely, are nice and heavy and seem very stout. They installed quickly and operate quietly.The bottom pin plate is thick and seems very tamper resistant. There is also a cogged set screw to further resist removable.I am very happy with these and would definitely buy more if I needed more.

The only difference a spark plug socket has from a normal socket is the rubber insert, allowing the plug to be held in place.These inserts are too hard of a rubber and/or the wrong size. The last two plugs I needed to remove, these failed to hold. So, they're basically useless.And, as everyone else has stated, they're next to impossible to remove from the packaging.Returned.

Needed to clean up an improperly bored hole on a gun part. This arrived quickly, was in perfect condition and performed flawlessly. I have been using Grizzly machines and parts for a couple years now as a semi-professional and they rarely let me down.

Wanted this to cover my motorcycle and metal lathe in the garage. Ordered the gray sheet. Very nice quality, exactly what I was looking for. Would not hesitate to put it on my bed. Instead, though, I cut it in two and now half covers my bike and the other half covers my lathe.

Solid product, but causes my auto-up windows to come back down as they feel the inserts and think it's a safety hazard (children's fingers, etc).The included manual takes note of this possibility and states it will go away after the plastic settles into the window channel. Not so in my case.So I can either leave them in and benefit from the rain guarding properties of the product (and lose out on the auto-up functionality of my car), or take them out and leave my windows up all the time (thus losing the cracked window benefit I specifically purchased them for).Very expensive at $100, esp since competitors are in the $30 range, but I guess that's part of the Cadillac Tax.Would I do it again? Probably... the guards add a bit of sporty look to a grandpa's sedan and allow me to keep the windows cracked, hopefully saving future cracked leather and dashboards (from overheating).

Tried these to see how I like them cleaning my wheels. I don't care much for the bigger brush (trying to save time with this gimmick is an exercise in futility), but I really like the lug nut brush. THAT does its job well.So not really worth the expense since I'm only using half the order, but I do like the slender lug brush. The hand written note thanking me for the purchase, found in the parcel, was a nice touch, too.

::EDIT:: The finish did not last 12 months. I don't drive the car this frame is on in the winter, so it literally sat in my driveway for the five months of salty winter that we had in Ohio in 2014-2015. Despite that, there is plenty of oxidation on the frame. It's still a nice frame, priced accordingly, but it's not going to last. ::END EDIT::Cheap, lightweight, no screws included. But it looks nice. The screw covers are a nice touch. No idea how long it will last. According to other reviewers, not very long.For a better fit, I did grind around 1/5" off the edges of my Ohio plate.

Excellent. Being a perfectionist, I needed four matching screws on my front plate. Only had two there currently, so I grabbed this kit.I did not need the plastic inserts as the frame backing itself was threaded. These screws' threads matched and threaded right in. Perfect fit for the plate, frame and frame cover.

Purchased from Prime merchant Bundred & Thick.I had the GI Camelbak issued in and during Basic. Personally, I think they're gross, but they do serve a purpose. I wanted something similar for bike riding this summer, but didn't want to spend the premium on the Camelbak name.So far, this seems perfectly fine. Good stitching and styling on the holder itself. Bought the black to keep things simple.Removed the bladder for inspection and noticed the hose was not fully screwed into the bladder. Tightened that down and am leak-free, especially under pressure (when I squeeze the bladder forcefully).Fits as fine and quasi-comfortably as the name-brand unit. For $20, this is a great value and suits my needs perfectly.

I have several of these. All perform well. Simple 1 mode on/off. Durable aluminum construction. Battery lasts a while.No idea if it's actually 1000 lumens, but it's plenty bright.Too bad the price is driven up simply because it's 1-mode, but it's worth it. I am ready to pitch my $8 3-mode lights now that I found these...

The Multisak seeks to alleviate the issue most dog walkers run into at some point, which is where to keep all the stuff you need.  On a summer's outing, I tend to juggle the leash, poop bags, a toy, treats, water, phone and keys. And the dog.According to it's description, the Multisak should be able to handle most of these easily, but the actual product falls down on the job somewhat.The Multisak has reflectors front and back, to help with night visibility. The bag is lightweight, and can be used with either a standard lead, or retractable leash, by attaching it to the handle and passing the lead through the bag. That part works, well enough, even on my 23' Flexi leash, which is a tad fatter than a standard retractable.  My cell phone, a Motorola Droid 2 Global, also fit in the pocket designated for one, however anything much larger than this model is not going to fit at all. If my phone had an Otterbox or similar bulky case, it would not have fit either.A brand new roll of dog poop bags, Bags On Board  brand, would not quite fit in the pocket meant for a bag roll. The circumference was fine, but the pocket was not deep enough, and the roll threatened to pop out until several bags had been dispensed and the roll shrank.The pocket for hand sanitizer is only suitable for the smallest of tube containers, and would not handle my small travel size Suave without using a stitch ripper to pull out the stitches keeping that pocket narrow. Still, again the pocket was not deep enough for another container I had, as it contours to the round bag, and narrows as the pocket goes down further.There is a thin elastic band with a tiny dog-lead style clip on the end, perhaps meant for keys, mounted in the large inner pocket. The action of the clip is not smooth, and it required two hands and some effort to open it. The problem with the large pocket is that it shares space with a retractable lead. The presence of one makes it not too useful for much else. Even without a retractable lead, the pocket is not big enough for a water bottle, unless the bottle is rather flat, and it would be a struggle to get it in and out past the cell phone and other accessories.If the other  supposed use of this pocket is to hold used poo bags until they can be disposed of, then I would hope that this ... no, scratch that... I would not try to get the bagged output of even the smallest dog through the opening dominated by a cell phone. Or keeping my cellphone in proximity to it afterward. Certainly not my keys, even if I had complete faith in the quality of the bags I used.  Ew.The Multisak is certainly a good idea, but the execution leaves it lacking in enough space to be useful. Unfortunately, the bag doesn't allow enough for the items it's intended to hold, and I was unable to use it for it's purpose. Depending on what you attempt to carry in it, your mileage may vary.

I got a puppy with a picky appetite. I went through the food the breeder sent him home with (Taste of the Wild Grain-Free for Puppy) only to find he refused to eat it. Same thing with Blue Buffalo Wilderness Puppy - and both of these are excellent, well rated foods with high end ingredients.  I tried wet foods, no dice. I tried Canyon Creek Ranch Natural Turkey & Barley Dry Puppy Food and while the puppy ate it, the ingredients spooked me.Finally, I went with the brand that my cat has been thriving on, Wellness. I was happy to see that the ingredients list is full of good things, no grain, no fillers, or other things that would make me worry. The puppy also dances around the food bowl when he sees the kibble scoop come out. He's now in danger of becoming a pig, so I supplement his diet with fresh peas and carrots, which he loves.Another review mentioned gas, which my puppy does indeed have once every few days. This was the same on the other two high end foods, TotW and BBW - I don't know if it's just something common to puppies on high quality kibble. It's not a constant weapon-of-mass-eruptions gas bombardment, but he will issue a silent but deadly at least once a week.  It's not very noteworthy, but all dogs are different and have different reactions to foods at times.The primary ingredient is chicken - and some dogs need a more novel protein to avoid stomach upset and gas, so your mileage may vary.[Edit] On that note, let me add that the Barkspawn's poop never quite firmed up on this food. Finally, in some frustration, I switched again to Blue Buffalo Dry Food for Puppies, Lamb & Oatmeal Recipe. I'm glad to say that the poop report is now clear skies, with chance of clouds (gas!) - that hasn't changed.  Entirely possible that I managed to get yet another dog with chicken allergy, and Wellness does not seem to make a lamb based puppy kibble.

I have a few pens now, the Preppy Platinums, a Parker Sonnet, a couple of pens that I don't even know what to call them but "kit pens" that I bought from a local wood turner that I am fond of.  The Preppy pens are fragile, the Parker is the one I use most often for letters and the kit pens are my every day writers.The Lamy Safari was a nice economical choice for an alternate pen with a different color ink. I'm using mine right now with Noodler's Red Rattler Eel ink in the Lamy Refill Converter (LZ24) (not included) to mark up a review copy of a document. The eel ink flows smoothly in the Safari, and the stock medium Lamy nib writes with little effort.As far as I know, this pen was offered with out ink or converter - I bought these things separately.The pen itself has a couple of nice features: The grip is notched to make it more comfortable and easy to grip between the thumb and forefinger. The body has a cut out 'window' so you can easily see the amount of ink remaining in the reservoir. The cap snaps on, rather than screws, but I haven't had any issues with the pen drying out.

This is not my first Noodler's Ink, but I can already tell it will soon become one of my favorites. For those unfamiliar with Noodler's and find the names slightly confusing (Eels? Bulletproof polar bears? What?!) here's a breakdown on what their names mean:Eel inks are lubricating inks. Polar inks are inks that will still perform in very cold conditions (and not cause havok in your pen due to freezing). Bulletproof (sometimes 'eternal') means that the ink will resist the attempts of a forger to change or remove writing without detection. The Noodler's bulletproof inks will give up when the paper is ready to fall apart, and at that point it's kind of obvious an average forger has been trying their hand at it.I once lost several pages of notes to water damage that were written in J. Herbin's Bleu Nuit and a generic blue-black cartridge refill.  Noodler's does have inks that are even more resistant to more sophisticated forgers (Warden series), but for my purposes, being water and alcohol resistant are all I need.I already own an 'eternal' black (Noodler's Heart of Darkness), but I have stationary that has a brown trim, and I much prefer a matching brown ink. The ink dries slightly lighter than it lays down. It's not so dark that you'd mistake it for a modern true black ink, but it's dark enough that it might pass for a much older 'black' ink that has faded with light and time.Fair warning - Noodler's inks are full almost to the very top. Have a care when you open the bottle.

I needed a replacement net light set, so I picked up the last set at a local Home Depot store.  Without much expectation for how they twinkled, I plugged them in and wrapped them around my azalea shrubs.The LED Lightshow Starry Night set is a 6' X 4' net with 96 cool-white LEDs, intended for outdoor light displays on shrubbery. Instead of abrupt blinking though, it gradually fades in an out, alternating which bulbs are lit in different patterns. There is no means of changing the pattern, which for my purposes, is fine.This is a beautiful display of twinkling lights.The price from one seller should not deter you however - get them for a more reasonable ~$25 from others.

I have a new puppy. He's the crazy, active, adorable, intelligent and mischievous puppy from hell... a barkspawn. He is not, however, a big eater. But active, growing puppies need fuel. Lots of it.  I had him on Blue Buffalo Wilderness Puppy food, and while he liked it better than Taste of the Wild which the breeder sent him home with, he picked at the kibble without great interest, and was slightly underweight. He refused Wellness wet puppy food entirely.I'm not used to picky eaters. His predecessors inhaled Natural Balance kibble and Wellness canned food, and whatever supplements I added to that, but not this little guy. Finally, in some desperation to get some food into him, I picked up a small bag of Canyon Creek at Petco and was rewarded by puppy finally paying attention to what was in his bowl.I don't like the idea of swapping through several varieties of dog food - I'd much rather find one that works for the puppy's needs, tastes, and myself and stick to it. Still, I researched the food while the puppy gained weight, something I didn't have the luxury of doing before my purchase, and I am alarmed enough that I will try another food, Wellness Core Dry for puppies tonight.The ingredients list for canyon Creek is not the best. Way down on the list is menadione (synthetic vitamin K) - a substance the FDA banned from use in human food due to it's links to liver damage and toxicity. Does it seem to have a lot of menadione? No. Do I want my puppy eating it anyway? Hell, no.Also, I get something of a squicky feeling knowing that another of Canyon Creek Ranch's products (Chicken Jerky treats) is under suspicion of containing a potentially deadly ingredient that has caused many pet deaths over the years. When will pet feed companies stop trusting crap ingredients from China? It doesn't give me a warm fuzzy feeling about the company, even though the puppy food has not been mentioned as being at all related.Because of these things, I cannot recommend Canyon Creek Ranch food. The search will have to go on for a puppy food that the barkspawn will eat that I won't worry is slowly killing him.

Cold Days marks the beginning of the second half of Dresden's saga. If you are new to the series, stop here, go back to Storm Front (The Dresden Files, Book 1), and read your way through the first thirteen books, then Side Jobs, and then come back. I'll wait here. Now  you're up to date, let's go -Preflight checklist: Jim Butcher, one of the best storytellers in modern fantasy, back in the saddle? Check. James Marsters is back as the Audible/audio incarnation of our favorite irreverent, overwhelmed, put upon, wise cracking wizard? Check. Geek/pop culture humor? Check. A crap-ton of magic gets thrown around? Check. The old crew is back in the fight? Check. Harry's up against something far out of his weight class? Check.Harry was only "mostly dead" and returns to the realization that he failed to avoid the consequences of the bargain he made with the Queen of Air and Darkness. He is now the Winter Knight, a role that Harry has dreaded for most of the series, and now has to live with. The fae have tortured Harry with their deadly games off and on for 13 books, but it all gets turned up to 11 once he is the Winter Queen's knight.If that's not bad enough, he will have to explain his 'death' and current role to the White Council - and to be clear, that and several related explanations do get sidestepped in Cold Days - There's too many people Harry needs to catch up with to cram it all into one book. Especially since he's got so much on his hands.Demonreach, the island he has attuned himself to, sitting on top of a network of magical ley lines, is about to explode, with enough force to cause Google to update it's satellite photos for the entire western hemisphere. Oh, and Mab's first task for Harry? No less than the assassination of the Winter Queen That Will Be - her own heir and daughter, Maeve.Everything's on the line again, and the only help Harry will find is in the form of his core posse - Thomas, the New and Improved apprentice Molly (now, with less crazy!), Karin, Toot Toot (and the Za Lord's army) and his dog Mouse all sign up for the fight. But the fight is never what Harry thinks it is.A lot of reveal in Cold Days about the neverending battle in the Fae lands, and the relationship between the Winter and Summer courts, and the Council Gatekeeper. The big picture starts to come into focus, and you, along with Harry, begin to realize the very, very deep waters the series is about to sail into. The stakes have gotten much higher. But with that comes the possibility that Butcher may wind up staging a world-as-we-know-it-ends-here apocalypse with every future installment, and that can wear out the novelty and interest of huge battles that threaten to turn into repeats.Which brings up what I didn't like about Cold Days. For the first time, Butcher disappoints by retracing territory he's covered before, and fairly thoroughly. Power not wholly Harry's own is used out of necessity, and with it comes the corruption of thoughts also not wholly his own. Dresden spent a number of books with a fallen angel infesting his every thought, giving him power beyond his own (hellfire), only now Lashiel has been replaced by the mantle of the Winter Knight and powers of winter cold and ice. He is tempted with power yet again - not power that he craves for himself, but power he needs to protect the people he loves, and the millions of innocent bystanders who will die if he doesn't. If you remember the Blackened Denarians story arc, this is playing out in very similar fashion so far. Temptation, power, corrupted thoughts, isolation, and distrust all come back in play in Harry's interpersonal relationships. I can't help but feel disappointed at this development. Why revisit this theme and angst again?Next theme is that Harry, out of fear for his friends, will try to buffer them from a lot of uncomfortable truths. In their emotional reunion, Thomas lampshades this, and seems to accept it as part of his brother's personality, though he works on trying to convince him to open his heart to the people dearest to him (Karin and Maggie).Finally, the Karin/Harry issue gets sent back through the wash cycle for another spin. With a dash of Molly thrown in to complicate matters. I would be very disappointed if Harry went down the Molly path romantically, for the very reasons that Harry himself has given in several books. However, the spectre of this possibility becomes far more possible in future installments after the dramatic conclusion of the events in Cold Days.Supposedly, Ghost Story was the middle of the Dresden series, so I anticipate that Cold Days should set the stage for the plot lines that follow.Buckle up. Or, as Murphy says "Get on the back, *itch!"It's going to be a helluva ride.

I recently found a game from my childhood, Dragonmaster, that I immediately broke out and started to play with friends. I quickly realized that the cards would accumulate wear rapidly if I didn't find a way to protect them. Fast.The cards are larger than the standard playing card, or collectible card game. They are more like tarot cards in size. This sleeve is perfectly sized at 70mm X 120mm (2.75" X 4.72") for this kind of card.It's clear on both sides, so cards with elaborate backs, or printed on both  sides are still useful, which means it's perfect for a thirty year old game, that uses tarot sized cards. It does make fan shuffling difficult, but the easy glide of the sleeves means that you can jog-shuffle a short deck together relatively quickly.

This game first fell into my hands thirty years ago, and it was an instant hit in my family, and when I unearthed it from the bottom of my desk last week, it was a hit again.Dragonmaster is a fantasy card game from Milton Bradley, long out of print. The game is a trick taking 3 to 4 person card game consisting of four rounds, with five games per round, with plastic gems used as currency. The play style is not unlike an odd cross between spades and hearts. Fair warning - neither the plastic gems, nor the cards are highly durable. The gems will get chipped and cloudy over time - I use glass counters like those used in M:TG and other card games. The cards will begin to split over time as well, but very quickly, the art will begin to wear with normal use. Protect them with card sleeves.The cards themselves look something like tarot cards, and are beautiful portraits in a soft style and color. The art is stunning, and the suits Dragonlords, Druids, Warriors and Nomads are all in their own themes. The cards however are *old* and can easily be damaged. I got large protective sleeves to stop white spots from rubbing into the surface from friction during normal play. The spots started to appear after only a couple of games on a wooden table.Each round starts with a Dragonmaster, and the object of the game is to accumulate the most gems by taking tricks, or forcing other people to take tricks, depending on which game is being played. The Dragonmaster controls the course of the game, but it doesn't guarantee he or she will win the game they have chosen.There are three play levels: Basic, Advanced and Expert. In expert games, other players can wrest control of a round from the current Dragonmaster by running a Power Play, and potentially gaining more gems.Basic is great for the whole family to play, but it will take teens and up to fully realize the fun of playing expert and advanced modes, which can get fairly competitive.

Square Enix merchandizing out yonder in Japan came out with an actual Mass Effect 3 series of figures, not to be confused with the "Mass Effect 3" line from Big Fish that are actually the likenesses of Mass Effect 2 characters.Square Enix (SE) Garrus is head and shoulders taller than Big Fish (BF) Garrus, and is considerably more poseable, with more flexible joints that allow a more natural movement. If you want to call anything about a scifi character wearing plate armor, who looks like his nearest relative is a dragon, "natural".SE Garrus lacks any kind of a base, so if, like me, you prefer your action figures to be 'free range' rather than displayed for all eternity in their original packaging, you'll have to test his reach and flexibility yourself to get him upright and balanced.  For a guy who supposedly has a stick up his butt as backup ammo, he could be a bit stiffer. That's the only quibble I have - lacking a base, stiffer joints might make for a wider range of standing poses for this figure.It took a few minutes of sorting him out to get him into a nicely dynamic pose wielding one of the two weapons he came with. He also has an extra pair of hands(because who couldn't use an extra set of hands?), though I have not tried to swap them out. I was sorry that of the two weapons he came with neither were the Widow (that BF Garrus has) or my beloved Mantis. Instead he carries a M29 Incisor sniper and an M15 Vindicator assault rifle. Sorry - no way to attach one to his back when not in use.In short, Square made a more dynamic figure, with a range of natural motion in all the joints, which the Big Fish version is not capable of. No stand, but Garrus stands on his own, towering over the BF figure.  Square Enix is also coming out with a number of other ME3 characters, including FemShep (Halleluja!) for all of us who have never pictured Sheploo as our favorite Commander.

Tessa Cutter went to Manhattan to chase her artistic dreams . She comes home to visit her family and when home she makes up the perfect pretend boyfriend—who lives in NYC who is wonderful, handsome and successful. Logan Ridley, who is sort of down on his luck when his personal training studio shut down but he was told of a job that where there is an opening- as a gyn teacher in Cutter’s Creek. Small town life- different from the Big Apple. Everywhere he goes, he hears about Tessa. He was looking forward to meeting her but when he did, she was horrible to him. And the book just went sideways from there. I get it, She comes home and it seems like everyone wants to keep “the baby” of the bunch little forever but that wasn’t the case. And here is this great guy and he is new to town and he gets the sharp edge of her tongue…it just fell flat for me. Even the ending , which seemed sort of rushed, didn’t fix the impression but Logan was a sweetheart of a hero and I loved his character. Tessa needed to grow up or she needed someone to really explain a few things. As it was, this book just didn’t do it for me.My rating: 3.8 stars ******A gifted copy was provided by the publisher via NETGALLEY for my honest review****

Great story about Gen Richards, who has been blind all her life and Chance Anderson the guy who has had a crush on her for a long time. There was an “incident” in the past and he has been not allowed near her since she was about 15//16 years old so Gen went from hero worshipping him to hating him. She found out one night that it was him following her around and she sort of blackmailed him into helping her do a “bucket list” of things she wants to do and from there the story beautifully unfolds. Chance has a story of why the “incident” happened and he would love ot set the record straight but getting Gen to believe him and he really has this guilt down pat… their love story unfolds and it is wonderful. Loved the supporting cast and Gen’s brother starts off as a jerk but by the end of the story, he does start to come down off his high horse. This is a winner of a story. I would love to see a story about Gen’s brother someday –I think there is more to him here-IMO.My rating: 4.0 stars *******A gifted copy was provided by the publisher via NETGALLEY for my honest review****

In the Moon series book #5, this is Jared and Taryn story. Jared Ayers, who is Jason’s older brother, likes the solitary life, works outside and wonders if he ‘ll ever meet his mate…that all changes when he called to do a job at Taryn Goldstone aka Ice Queen of Lake Tahoe’s home. Taryn is a real estate agent and she is known as the Ice Queen because she keeps her emotions under tight control and she rarely touches ANYONE even her young son. Its sad but true and the reason is because she is a gifted psychic with pyrokinesis ability and one slip and someone could get hurt or even killed.Jared comes for the job, he takes one look and his wolf gets one smell and its on. When Jason touched Taryn his wolf claimed her as theirs. She didn’t know how to respond to Jared. She had never really touched her own child. She loved him but to protect him, she never really touched him. There is danger coming because there is a man who is coming for Taryn- a man that the pack is familiar with. There are twists and turns that turn this into a roller coaster ride of a story. The chemistry between Jared and Taryn is great—I loved that Jared saw how out of depth that Taryn was yet he took his time and made sure to put her at east as much as he could and he loved her son and protected them both. There are surprises and a lot of emotion in this story that made this such a great story. Taryn is a good woman who has had a lot of things put to her in her life but we get to see some sassy side of her while Jared is definitely an alpha male who protects those he loves. This is part of a series but can be read as a standalone.My rating: 4.0 stars *******A gifted copy was provided by the publisher via NETGALLEY for my honest review****

Basically there are about 5 dragon queens in the realm that is story is in and each hold power over the court they “live” in. But that changes when one of those Queens successfully breaks the curse that had stopped the curse that prevented the new Queens from emerging; now there are new Queens everywhere. One is Viola who shifts into a 3 headed dragon-- a horse head which represents her “good” side & a goat head – her evil side plus her own dragon head. Now that she has changed, people are taking advantage of her status and to use her and bend her to their will, one was her boss until she was saved by a dragon task force & put under the care and protection of Sergei.What can I say about Viola—hmm—DOORMAT—she worked to put her husband thru medical school but he cheated on her and left her for a nurse after he got thru medical school. Then after her divorce, her boyfriend she was with took her for everything he could. It was like she had no real redeeming qualities. Then she had this weird thing about knitting-she would go insane if her knitting was harmed. I do not know if this was supposed to be this way , like a character setup but this heroine drove me nuts. Sergei is such a alpha dragon, and I liked him but Viola could have been tamed down a bit or given a bit more sassiness to make up for her doormat –like qualities. Would I read this author again, yes but did I like this book? No. I did like the Hero so that is why I did give it the rating I did.My rating: 2.5 stars *****A gifted copy was provided by the publisher via NETGALLEY for my honest review****

This book picks back up where book 1 ends. This book continues Sam and Jax's story and considering how book 1 ended, I didn’t like Sam and Jax would ever get an HEA. This book is a modern day tale on Cain and Abel's story. In this story, we see our couple trying to recover, get themselves to a place where they can get back on track .Jax is descended from Cain- and he carries a demon inside of him named Azirak who happens to be a royal demon. Now the demon has some ideas that do not conform to the plans that Jax and Sam have—the demon needs to feed on suffering and pain to live-that’s NOT want the MC need when they are trying to stay under the radar to survive. Appearances are never what they seem, especially when certain people want Samantha to play for their "team" and will not stop until death make it happen . Jax and Sam plan to not let his happen. There is an added twist by a new species that the author added and there are some new characters and there is a cliffhanger so until book3 which hopefully will let us know how Jax and Sam end up. I loved the pace and the flow. Jax and Sam still have that chemistry going and they still are going strong. This is a great series and I cannot wait to find out how everything goes.My rating: 4.0 stars *******A gifted copy was provided by the publisher via NETGALLEY for my honest review****

OMG, this was such an emotional and touching piece of writing that at times I had to stop and take a breath. I could feel the MC pain and I could feel the love that they had for each other. I am one of those who loves a teacher/student storyline and when I heard that this is what the book was about, I was all for it. I expected it to be a hot read and this was so different than that. Oh there were hot and sexy moments but really this was more of an emotional read.Bree Jacobs’s home life was a dark world, one she hated. The only place she found peace and some sort of happiness was when she was at school. Her mother was very unstable. She was horribly violent to her daughter. She had no one to talk to, no friends, no life. Her teacher, Axel takes notice and is the one who listens and pays attention. He is a few years older but they instantly connect like no one else. He wants to protect her , he sees her an someone who is being abused but no one really cares. At first it’s strictly innocent and he is there for her, making sure she knows he is there and listens but when she has the flu, he takes her home and cares for her and that when the boundary is crossed. I won’t go into details but its not tawdry but beautiful. You can feel the love between these two people. The story is told in mainly Axel’s viewpoint but at times we hear Bree’s side of things. We see how their relationship goes on and how they try to hide it so he won’t get in trouble but secrets are bound to come out and when that happens Axel ends up losing his job and leaves Bree behind. Heartbreak ensues and there is a separation when Axel leaves—really he has to because of all the turmoil when everyone finds out that that they have been having a relationship. Axel is a strong, loving man and his love is for Bree. His heartbreak is so deep when he leaves her…but he isn’t aware that he is leaving a piece of him behind. Bree is devastated when Axel leaves her. I cried several times while reading this book because the emotions are so real and raw in this story. Years pass and suddenly they are back in each other’s’ lives again. Bree is not the same girl she was years before. She has had to grow up, and all this time she wondered whatever happened to Axel and Axel has gone back to teaching which is how they end up meeting…without giving too much away, there are secrets involved and Bree is scared and hiding everything inside of her. There are twists and turns but the way the story ended was wonderful. I would love to read more in this story and the cast of supporting characters are great. Bree and Axel’s love story was so heartbreaking at times but the HEA was truly fantastic and will grab your heart and this is one romance story that you will remember and read over and over.

THE CONCLUSION OF THE DOM VS. DOMME TRILOGY –This final book shows how the relationship between Ian and Kathryn has continued to bloom. He has taken and broken her down and built her back up. He has shown her that she can be the perfect submissive. Their time together has been wonderful. Ian has been able to prove to Kate that she really is a submissive, that only her body craves his touch only. The writing in this book is great and the book continues along toward a stunning climax of epic proportions when someone shows up to try and throw a monkey wrench into the plans and detrail Ian and Kate’s happy life. Does it work or will they life happy ever after?I loved this final series in the book, would have liked to have seen the couple a year or so later to know how they were doing in an epilogue but overall this was a fantastic series and would totally recommend this author’s works to you.My rating:4.8 stars ********A gifted copy was provided by the author for my honest review****

This is a spin off from the Take No Prisoners series but can be read as a standalone. Hank “Montana” Patterson had to leave active duty due to an injury. He comes home to heal from that injury and finds out his father was shot at the same time. He and his dad never really got along which is why he joined the service.Sadie McClain is a huge actress and she came home to unwind and just try to distress. She and Hank were once in love and a couple in high school but she knew he needed to get away from his family and not stay to be on the ranch, around the family, namely his dad. Sadie knew he had a dream to be a SEAL and she turned down his marriage proposal even though it about killed her to do so. Sadie was with Hank’s dad when he got shot and realizes that her stalker is around and could be the one that shot at them. Hank shows up after his dad has been shot and offers to help guard Sadie until the person/persons responsible are caught but what he didn’t realize was being around his ex was how hard, how painful the memories of his lost love are. Hank never, ever stopped loving her—but what he didn’t realize was, Sadie never stopped loving him either. Sadie can’t resist being around Hank- the memories of the past come calling back and she wonders if they will ever stop, for the love she has for him. Sadie is also fighting to stay alive because she has this stalker after her. The twists and turns in this book will keep you on the edge of your seat. There is suspense and there is some mystery along with a great heap of romance- You will not be disappointed by this book.My rating: 4.0 stars *******A gifted copy was provided by the author for my honest review****

Mandy M. Roth - Heated Holiday: Bureau of Paranormal Investigation—Great holiday novella about a woman named Cassie McGowan who rushed to where the supernaturals and humans are negotiating. Reason she rushes down is because her step father plans to kil all the supernaturals by blowing them up. She gets there and has a hard time getting thru the protestors but suddenly HE is there- Cambridge Sutton—he is a vampire with the Bureau of Paranormal Investigation and helping out with the peace talks. Cassie’s step father is causing all sorts of issues but Cambridge finds he is drawn to this young lady…there are twists and turns , especially when the all is found out about who her real father is. There is passion, action, some mystery and alittle suspense. The chemistry between the MC is off the charts and I definitely recommend this book.My rating : 4.4 stars *******A gifted copy was provided by author Mandy M Roth for my honest review****

This is such a emotional journey of a book; it is not all roses and sunshine. The author writes a story that gripes you inside and out. You will feel the pain of the heroine , Willow, and you want to grab her and just hug her tight. Her path has been one of nothing but one of pain and degradation—and all from her family. Isnt family supposed to love you Well, hers doesn’t and has never loved her, only her mom and she is dead and buried.  She is put down for her weight, she is put down for many of things but what gets me is how vicious they are toward her.Enter Kane Masters in her life. He is a movie star and he sees a woman that he knows he needs in his life immediately. They meet and Kane doesn’t see what Willow sees in the mirror. What he sees is a beautiful, lovely woman who is sexy inside and out. He can tell she is a spitfire waiting to happen. He treats her like the prize, the princess she is.  Willow thinks he is too good to be true but she falls deeper and deeper in love with himThere are a lot of twists and turns in this book- and one major moment that you are left going Omg, WTH?? But like all roller coaster rides, hang on to your seats, the ride will take you on an experience you do not want to miss. I enjoyed reading Willow story. My heart broke for her and I cried so much while reading this book. Angry tears, sad tears, happy tears, confused tears…back to happy tears… There is a lot of emotional drama in the story.  You would think that would overburden the story line but it doesn’t. It works for the plot and the ending is awesome. I cannot say enough good things about this story. She writes this book and shows how we are all unique and pretty in our own ways, and to realize that we our beautiful –This was such a terrific message and so brave for her to share her story. Kudos to her for doing this I hope the author will write stories for Kane’s brother and his female friend. I would like to see them get their own stories.My rating 5.0 stars ********A gifted copy was provided by TRSOR PR for my honest review****

All fun filled nights are usually without consequences, well except if you count the hangover part that you are always aware of will be there the next day. Bu the fun filled nights that always hold the most consequences are when we say " I will never ......." because then it always happens !In the latest read from Kandy Shepherd, we meet account Zoe Summer. A week in Bali was meant to be her dream vacation, the one vacation that is meant to replenish her energy and just generally give her back some zest in life. But when the tropical island paradise she's meant to be enjoying is hit by an earthquake, she's trapped. Reading about the heroine being trapped was very realistic and had me in tears. I mean can you image , here you are on a tropical holiday soaking up the sun and voila boom suddenly you're trapped with no escape in sight. Talk about dream jumping into nightmare mode!Anyways , being trapped is the least of her problems, because she his trapped alongside Mitch Bailey, sports star extraordinaire and also the blast from her past! Mitch is high on the thrill of survival, and when there is fear it's always the number one little " do not do" that let's couples end up in each other's arms.It 's meant to only be for the night, to simply just get through the rough patch life has dished out, but soon Zoe discovers she's pregnant. Now this adrenaline, fear induced one night only couple have to decide can they do forever and raise their child together, or will one of them start running for that non existent dream of no worries in life?When I stated this read, I did not look at the back blurb, because heck it's Kandy Shepherd 's name on the cover and anyone that knows me well knows I love her books, so why would I read the back?! So I was of course completely knocked for a six when what I thought was a lovely per chance vacation meeting, falling in love after the discovery of pregnancy romance read , got turned up side down into not only one of the most tear-jerkker reads ever but also one of the most exquisite  I have ever read.The tears come from the very realistic fear I experienced when reading about the earthquake, it sent me feeling desperate to climb into the book and save the characters. It's a small earthquake but it's powerfully written, so powerful that I felt every single part of it happening , and thanking my lucky stars that I don't live in a country that's known for shattering earthquakes.The character of Zoe is a very private person, she's not the type to go out and shout out anything and everything on her mind, whereas the character of Mitch lives pretty much smack bam right in the middle of the media. I found it fascinating watching these two try to get to know each other again, and keep it all together, and all the time I was thinking " Gosh, what happens if these two get dragged into a media circus, would they survive it?" .A stunning journey of love, self discovery and the beginning to a beautiful, remarkable, passionate love story. I cannot wait for the next Kandy Shepherd masterpiece to enter my life, I love this author's fun , flirty yet so heartfelt and emotionally overwhelming it sends me into fits of tears , writing style.5/5 star review" Vacation forecast : Sun and fun , with a chance of pregnancy!"** Copy received in exchange for a honest review

Love and surprises are found in all kinds of shapes and of course in the most unexpected of places. Much like everyone else in life GP Oliver James knows exactly what his " perfect bride" should be like - and vibrant, unconventional new locum Lula Chance is the total opposite of the image in his mind. But if there is one thing I have learned in life , it's that those little images of perfection we create in our minds are never what we expected them to be when they finally do emerge.And for the most part it of course has always left me thinking " Boy I did not see that coming !" and also " Really, that's what this picture is suppose to look like?"So course that is pretty much what Oliver ends up thinking when Lula and all her long list of imperfections she has that so does not fit in with his list , she intrigues him and there seems to not be a thing he can do about it, well except maybe go with the flow.The heartbreak in Lula's eyes are the clinger in this romance, it's what captures Oliver's attention and bounds him to her in such a tightly wrapped bubble of romance there really is no way he can get out of it.But Lula is determined not to be distracted by brooding Oliver, no matter how gorgeous he is or how caring he might seem to be. She's arrived in Atlee Wold hoping to find her mother and Oliver will for darn sure be the distraction from her quest that she cannot afford.  But us romance fans know that giving in to the inevitable is only a matter of time and it's then that the sparks for these two characters really start to light up the night sky. And who knows, just maybe Lula can fit into that perfect little image of perfect bride for Oliver, after-all.This read was one of those that simply shine from start to finish. It had the perfect heroine that 's quirky, different in all the ways real heroines in life are, that for the most part are sometimes completely lost in romance reads. You know the type I am talking about, the " Really, that's what she just did, which normal person does that?"  As for Oliver , I wanted to grab the nearest bedpan and hit the man over the head. Dreaming up an image of the perfect bride is just about one of the dumbest things in life anyone can do, but I totally enjoyed seeing him get knocked down by Lula and her definitely non-perfect-bride attitude. She puts him in his place and it was totally off the hook awesome!A truly wonderful, captivating read with a beautiful message of life not always being exactly the way we want it to be and of course that all things in life even our perfect images of love and success does not always quite look the way we dreamed them to be, but they are always for darn sure ten times better!5/5 star review" He sees her, she sees him. But will they see the real person inside ?"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Keeping out of the spotlight is never easy for any celebrity. It's and endless street of diving into odd little shops when you see anyone pull out a camera and dressing down to try and hide out. In this read from Amy Ruttan we meet senator's daughter Dr. Jennifer Mills, and for her it is just as hard to keep out of the spotlight as it is for Julia Roberts!  Especially after being jilted at the altar by her ex-fiance, guaranteed that's a front page head liner that no one will ever forget.So when arriving in Las Vegas, she's just hoping to blend in. Ha ha ha, everyone and anyone knows that 's never how it works in the city of flashing lights and big time spenders. She meets ER surgeon Nick Rousseau, the same man she spent an unforgettable night with three years earlier.Now returned from Afghanistan, ex army medic Nick is struggling to come to terms with his time on the front-line. Rekindling his romance with Jennifer reminds him that some things in life are still worth fighting for.This was a truly stunning story about two damaged people finding new hope after life has shown them the type of things that are sure to break even the strongest of hero's and heroines in the world.  The story was easy to read with a nice even flow and the nice little add on of a little twist here and there that sent the read from even flow to " Wow, did that just really happen?".The character of Jennifer was pretty much as damaged are heroine's can be, the tough life of trying to stay out of the spotlight and trying to get over the hurt and embarrassment of being jilted at the altar. But being damaged as much as other heroines are in these kind of reads did not make her ordinary or boring, in fact she was a breath of fresh air, fun and little too flirty for someone that has to stay out of the spotlight so that her senator father does not end up with more egg on his face then his plate.Nick was the tortured hero that I simply just wanted to hug and tell that everything will be okay as long as he does not give up. The author has once before shown her remarkable talent for showing the true hell and torture those that face war zones have to learn to live with. And oh my gosh he was sexy as hell! I could literately eat this man up! His back and forth battle with his troubled and clearly tortured soul shattered my heart and I cried my eyes out for this hero.I am taking away a message of life knocks you down, sometimes so hard that the ability to get back up seems like a lost cause. But is it really the end of the line? Just as life shows you the cruel hard stuff it will also show you how to get back up, all you need to do is be open to the light that filters through and never ever think staying in the dark and blocking out the sunshine is what you deserve.5/5 star review" She needs rescuing but what will happen when her hero is the one that needs the rescuing? Is she up for the challenge? "** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Every normal woman has dreams, even those who are already married to the wealthiest of men, yes even those have a little side line dream of something or someone that would make them happy.  In this absolutely beautifully crafted read from the multi talented Rachel Brimble we meet Monica Danes. She has always wanted more than what the village of Biddlestone had to offer. After a failed courtship to the man of her parent's choosing , she fled for the city of Bath and never looked back. Now she graces the stage and she's the undisputed queen of the theater , a very wealthy and independent woman. But when she is called home in the wake of tragedy, Monica returns but plans to leave again as soon as possible.Thomas Ashby has been a groom at the Danes estate since he was a boy, and has enamored with Monica for almost as long. He knows he isn't a suitable match for his master's daughter , despite the special bond he and Monica has always shared. Not to mention the undeniable attraction.  As Monica re-enters the world she left behind Thomas sees it as his final change prove himself as worthy. He will show Monica a life and love she won't want to give up.This read was filled with such exquisite opulence it was as if I was being transported back in time , a time when romance was pure elegance. Right from the start of the read my heart was pounding with excitement to the point where it would literally feel like it was about to burst of simply jump out of my chest. Yes, I kid you not the excitement was that powerful, this is after all a story written by one of the best romance authors in the world, so it was no surprise, just extremely unhealthy for my poor heart that had to try and keep up with the remarkable magical pace of this read.There was conflict and I do mean real, in your face, cannot be overlooked conflict, none of that dull this is so boring it;s not even real conflict stuff. No, this author brought her A -game when it came to the conflict. I was hanging onto each and every single word , and I literally wanted to be right there to get in on the action.The settings in this read were simply put, absolutely, freaking spectacular! I have always said I wish I lived in another time period, a time when romance had elegance and true meaning, a time when ballgowns where the start of your dreams coming true when looking in the mirror. The author dropped me right into the middle of it all. I could smell the elegance, I could touch the richness, I could hear the exquisite heartbeat of a world set in  a time that sadly has been lost.The characters, were mind blowing, I loved Monica. Her fighting spirit left me with a huge smile on my face and thinking " That's it, you go girl!" Thomas was my weakness, I fell hook, line and sinker for this hero, not because he is the absolute prefect example of a true gentleman but because of his feelings for Monica and the manner he uses to try and convince her that he is good enough for her. I wanted to tell him to keep pushing, to keep fighting , and to never let go, and of course I was over the moon with delight and squealed like a happy child on Christmas day when the man proves he is never and I mean never going to give up.From the remarkably crafted settings, being transported back into time, falling in love with the hero, rooting for the heroine,  till the absolutely prefect ending to an incredible read, this read had everything I could wish for when picking up a romance book. It's the romance read of the century !I highly recommend this read for all fans that wish to step back into time and travel on the journey of epic romantic proportions! Rachel , your talent is endless and I cannot wait for the next masterpiece to hit the shelves !5/5 star review" She's about to step into the performance of a lifetime, but will the ending be the one she's always desired?"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Auditioning for anything in life is the stuff nightmares are made of! If it's dancing you could fall and literally break a leg!
