If it's a movie audition heck you could end up saying the lines for the wrong movie, anything is possible when a person is nervous.In this read, which comes in at twenty chapters, which I will add were nice and short and not dragged out to the point where I wanted to pull my hair out and end up looking like some bad version of Miley Cyrus, the world of dance is brought to life.The read tells of Ashley and the journey she embarks on fulfilling her dream of becoming a world - class dancer. But as all dreamers know there is always something or someone that stands in the way, for Ashley it's Antonio Machiavelli, and his resounding " It's a no from me" is enough to send any wannabe straight into a fit of nightmares.But Ashley is not your everyday " Okay maybe next time" kind of wannabe, she fights back by challenging Antonio and takes her anger and rage and channels it into a a on the edge of your seat performance.  Antonio is more than just a little intrigued and very soon it becomes clear that keeping his distance from Ashley will not be as easy and step, step and turn ! And as for Ashley she knows her sole focus needs to be on fulfilling her dream of becoming a lead principal but love makes everything so much harder.I very much enjoyed this little read, I am not a major fan of books that involves dancing but occasionally I do come across one that has all the right moves.  This read is a wonderful journey of two souls meant to be together, and a lovely message of dreams not always being what we think they should be.People change and as they do their dreams have to adjust, of course everyone knows that when our dreams try to tell us it's time for a new kind of dream or for a little different version of our dream, it's not always easy for us to listen. We might have had our dream for so long that it seems impossible to alter it in anyway.The author very nicely showed how dreams can change and that our dreams can still come true but with a little more of a kick along the way than what we expected it to be.A very lovely and heartfelt read that's perfect for a little romantic escape.4.5 star review" She dances her way into his heart, but will he want her there?"

Every woman heck every man even , has a fantasy they dream about. It's usually in the dead of night when no one is around to hear you accidentally say the dream out loud or do something stupid like make a facial expression that borders on your 'sex face'.In the new Dani Collins read we meet Natalie Adams and we are taken straight into her fantasy when it becomes reality as she embarks on an affair in Paris with infamous billionaire Demitri Makricosta, reality surpasses her wildest dreams and it's a memory she will always treasure.But Demitri has other ideas, one night isn't enough and to quench his new found Natalie-diction he suggests she becomes his mistress. Natalie is course thrown off kilter but show me the woman that will say no to a hot billionaire when she has nothing to lose, but the closer Natalie get's to the emotions that Demtri has carefully locked away the more he distracts her with dazzling gifts and a life of luxury holidays to ensure that seduction is the only that remains between them. But can he really carry on with this little game of seduction only or is Natalie getting to his closed off heart ?The author wrote a very enjoyable read, I very much liked Natalie. She was the kind of heroine most woman think they can be when they get burned in life, but as all woman know, when the time comes it doesn't seem that you are able to really be the person you always told yourself you would be should you get burned. She had spunk but not the overwhelming large dose that some heroine's have, nope just enough to let me know that she will fight to have her little fantasy but she also won't let it shift her focus from her child to the point where she will be a ' it's all about my love life and not what's best for my child' kind of mother .Demitri was of course the typical bastard hero found in the HP line, but he he had a lot more depth than most. The author did a fantastic job of taking this tortured black heart hero with all his emotional closure and turning him into this remarkable man that no woman can resist, and the man certainly had me weak at the knees when he goes from tortured to saved! Loved it!!Strong characters, wonderfully crafted plot and a great ending to a beautiful journey of redemption, self discovery and best of all a stunning message of life being full of surprises and when reality comes knocking it's never what our fantasies were, it's always so much better !Recommended for all fans of Dani Collins books.4.5 star review"Fantasy becomes reality but it's not quite what they expected it to be"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

It starts with a young girl Ruby, she wakes up in a cold, dark cellar, with no recollection how she got there, and so her hellish nightmare begins. Beatings, being starved, shackled to the bed, the list goes on and on.All the while her captor is always one step ahead of DI Helen Grace, who along with her team is slowly gluing all the puzzle pieces together in order to try and bring to justice the monster who has done this kidnapping - killing game not once or even twice before, but three girls have all faced and lost the battle from hell at the hands of a crazed madman.Then as DI Grace and her team start closing in, time runs out for Ruby because her captor has just found his next victim and it's time to throw out the old and bring in the new, it's a deadly race against time for all involved.This was my first time reading this author, but I will be coming back for more. The Doll's house is one of those thrillers that have you looking behind you every few minutes of so and double checking out the people you think you know very well, just to make sure that there is not something hiding behind their smiles.This read has an extremely thrilling fast pace of events, not once does it slow down to a drizzle, nope this author really kept my attention all the way through to the end. And the guessing game in this read was absolutely phenomenal! So many suspects that fit the bill , and then suddenly all is lost and another suspect comes along looking perfect but no the author is not quite content on letting it come together that easily or that quickly, I loved it!Suspense, drama and a whole lot of psycho! Yes this as I said is a read filled with thoughts of really bad things running through your mind, I felt the fear and could taste the bitter disappointment of the police and I for darn sure got the creeps from a truly out of his ever loving mind killer, you know those chills that literally run down your spine and you don't know how to stop them except to stop reading but you can't because the book is that darn good!I highly recommend this read for all fans that love a fast paced, well thought out thriller. Intense and truly good old fashioned on the edge of your seat!*** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Reviewed by DesereThe words " Blame it on...."  have always been the response of most people when they realize they should have known better and there in actual fact is no real excuse, so you grasp at whatever you can.In this read from the very talented Kate Hardy is the champagne getting the blame. At a London salsa club ( sexy as all heck I will add) consultant Aaron Hughes catches sight of the most beautiful woman he has ever seen. He doesn't do relationships but one night of fun with a perfect stranger can't hurt, or can it?Registrar Joni Parker, dancing and sipping champagne is just what the Dr. ordered to remedy her what-would -have-been-wedding -night. Until she finds an even better cure, her very first ever fling! It's excitement overload! But what starts with no strings turns into one big old complication when Aaron walks into the hospital on Monday morning as the new consultant.This was an incredibly sexy read from start to finish I was hooked over and over by the absolutely brilliant chemistry between Aaron and Joni, talk about setting the pages alight! I adored Aaron to absolute bits, all I wanted to do was grab him and keep him to myself. The author gave him the perfect balance of non - committal but willing to try for the right reasons , I loved every minute!!And Joni, oh my gosh my heart shattered into a million pieces for this poor heroine, the author put me front and center for every single drop of emotion this heroine experienced, her heartache, the shame, the hope and the very real reality she had to face.This is one of those reads that if I dare to go on with my review I will without a doubt spoil it, because it's a book that I will ever stop talking about it was that good! So am going to only add that if there is only one medical romance you read this year, make it this one.Emotionally packed, drama filled, shocking revelation filled and a gorgeous romance that tells of hope and new beginnings.5/5 star review" No strings, just fun, until the Monday after !"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Ava Vaughan steps back into a world of glitz, glam and secrecy, a world where she knows she never belonged. But it's necessary if she wants to get her estranged husband to agree to a divorce. After living apart for the last six months the time has come to cut all ties and really start her life over. But she does not expect Cole to say No! Nor does she expect him to kiss her senseless and pretty much knock her off kilter all over again, just like old times.Cole is no where near ready to let his beloved wife walk away, he devises a plan to keep her around for just a little while, in the office, in the kitchen , in his bed and of course in his life, once he is ready to really let go, she can have her divorce but not before he's darn well and ready!Ava agrees to live with Cole again and work at his firm as the planner of a major event, once the event it done and dusted she can get back to her life and of course she will have the divorce. But as time passes old feelings rise to the surface, feelings of heartache and loss, of unbearable pain and despair, and feelings of the overwhelming never ending desire they both feel.  But as much as Ava has and still loves Cole he never has nor will he ever love her, so why stick around?Two hours was all it took to read this fabulous little read, yes two hours is all it took for me to fall hopelessly in love with these two lost souls that were so badly in need of guidance. And guide them the author did ,with spectacular fashion!The character of Cole is of course every romance reader's worse nightmare, a real ass, arrogant, demanding and always issuing orders to get his way, but let's be honest gals that's what us lovers of romance wants. We want a hero that will be pushed into a corner till they spill it all ! And spill he did, not the secrets about Freemasonry of course but definitely everything I wanted him to!  Btw Nicole the entire secrecy of Freemasonry , SUPER SEXY!The character of Ava was lost, and I mean really lost as in drowning in a sea of denial, sorrow and all I wanted to do was hug her, and tell her to get her ducks in a row, but as the read went on I was able to really understand why she's so lost and not willing to get anything in a row and rather head for the easier route of divorce.This being the prequel to the Freemasons series it was short but so very powerful. Fast paced, loaded with emotion and left quite the impact on me. A stunning read about two people who were never meant to be apart, slipping back into their comfort zone with the barriers from the past only half way in place and then the power of love knocking down each and every single one of those barriers. Passionate, heartfelt, remarkable and compelling are just some of the words that come to mind, the book is a whole lot more and simply one that is not to be missed.I am literally already going out of my mind crazy waiting for book two of this series and I only read this one a few hours ago! Nicole Flockton get your butt into gear and bring on the next one!5/5 star review" He'll have her again and again and then let her go, but that's not what The Victor is really about"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Everyone knows Christmas is a time for magic Be it magic of the romantic kind or just a little faith being born , no matter the magic is always there when those twinkling lights makes it way around in December.This read from the very talented Kate Hardy was the absolute perfect example of that Christmas magic sneaking it's way into the lives of two stunning characters.The story tells of reclusive Quinn O'Neil and when his new neighbor Carissa Wylde asks for his help with a Christmas charity project, Now he can't resist her vivacious energy and soon he's caught up in the work and the beautiful, fun loving woman running the show.But Carissa carries hurt and pain beneath her smiles and bright holiday cheer, can Quinn kiss it better when the twinkling lights start to shine ? Or will he kiss and run? Quinn has the battle of battles on his hand, proving to Carissa he's plans on sticking around forever and not just for the holidays, because his track record has always been kiss and run but this time he's found the one.I loved, loved LOVED the character of Quinn , he was kind and caring and had the perfect balance of sensitive but tough, just what every woman wants right?!  The stunning totally of the hook awesome character of Carissa really got to me, I felt so deeply heartbroken for her that I wept right along with her when the author starts to reveal the very real heartache she hides behind all her perfectly practiced smiles, of course I could not stop smiling either when those practiced smiles turned into very genuine smiles as Quinn dug his way into her heart.This is as I said a Christmas read, but can be read at any time of the year because the very real heartfelt emotion and breathtaking romance in this read will immediately sweep you off your feet and Christmas or not you will be whisk right into the magic of Christmas ! Simply beautifully done Kate!5/5 star review" Lights, kisses and homemade brownie leads to the best Christmas romance ever!"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Boston Detective,Jane Rizoli is on the case of a big game hunter found dead in his apartment, alone with the body of a beautiful snow leopard he had recently been commissioned to procure and stuff for a high-profile museum in the area.Medical examiner Maura Isles connects the case to a number of seemingly unrelated deaths where the victims have all been found hanging upside down, the hallmark of a leopard's kill.Rizzoli follows the puzzling mystery all the way to Botswana, where she uncovers the unsolved mystery of a deadly camping safari four years prior. When she realizes the two cases are connected Rizzoli must track down the sole survivor of the tragic trip to discover who, or what is behind these gruesome deaths. Getting the sole survivor to help trap the killer is a whole other scenario.From the blurb the book sounds intriguing and like a real page turner. It starts interestingly enough and grabbed my attention but very shortly after fell flat, it was like the author lost the plot somehow before picking it up again. Now of course this is my first time reading anything from this author and therefore am willing to freely admit that maybe it's just me and this could of course just be the author's writing style.When I got to chapter 5 it picked up momentum and the author recaptured my attention  and the read became really enthralling hence the four star review and the fact that after it picked up again I could not put it down and four hours later found it all done and dusted.The characters were intriguing and mysterious , just the way you would expect them to be in this category of reading and definitely gory enough to make even the most addicted of fans cringe with disgust.I recommend this read for fans that like a bit of legend connected in their mystery and thriller reads, sadly for me I solved the case too long before the end and would have liked if the read was a little less predictable.All in all a good afternoon pass-time for those looking to step foot into the world of mystery and murder for a few hours.4 star review" He tried to kill her once, will he fail again this time around?"** Copy provided by Penguin Random Houes Books South Africa** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Who doesn't love a Christmas wedding, and when written by one of today's best selling authors , it's total perfection!Single mom and Chef Lizzie Dumont is moving on, returning to Dolphin Bay to make a her new restaurant a success. And therefore has absolutely no time whatsoever for Mr Jaw-dropping handsome Jesse Morgan! But forgetting that incredible kiss they once shared, is not quite as easy.Jesse can't forget their kiss either but the betrayal in Lizzie's past has made her wary of him, and he hates that she cannot see past his reputation as a heart-breaker. So now he's on a mission, a mission to change her mind and get her to be the Christmas present he has always wanted.I love this author's books and this one arrived during a very stressful part of my life . Knowing that this author's work is always guaranteed to cheer me up , I dug in the second life allowed me to do so. And it completely worked, for four hours I was able to escape life and at the end of the read walk away from the read with a new found feeling of hope and knowing that everything happens for a reason and in the end there will always be a light somehow , somewhere all you need is to be able to look for the light while you're stuck in the darkness.I loved the vibrant characters and most especially their flaws , the author did a remarkable job at showing that these characters are just like the people we see , hear about and meet everyday. They are simply people who have made mistakes, taking the wrong turn and have to fight to find a way back to the point where their happiness starts.It's a story about leaning to move past the moment from the past that is holding you back, it's about learning how to look past what you hear about a person and rather trust yourself to see a person through your own eyes instead of the image the world has conjured up.I highly recommend this read for all fans who love romances reads that shines like a bright diamond during the darkest of hours. A heartwarming , sensual read.5/5 star review" Diamonds are forever, especially when received for Christmas !**** Copy received in exchange for a honest review

Mira Lyn Kelly is back and this time she proves that when playing the age old game of truth of dare, you always pick dare! That is unless you meet the love of your life, then all dares are off the table and the truth is what shall set you free.We meet Maggie Lawson, her one attempt at commitment has ended with the discovery that her fiance already has a wife and kid, and therefore she vows that the only people she'll ever love till death do us part are her friends.Unfortunately for Maggie this gives her best friend the perfect opportunity to rope her into a year long dating dare. It's as easy as score a new date each month or pay a penalty, no biggie. Until Maggie's date for the month stands her up, leaving her one option only, grab recently moved in upstairs Mr Hotter than hot Tyler beg him to take her on a date and voila , score for that month complete and penalty avoided.The only problem: Tyler and Maggie have had some serious arguments and cannot seem to stop fighting at all about everything! And then there's the fact that Tyler would rather focus on getting his selfish ex back in order to reclaim the child he once thought was his and he needs to keep the frustrating as all hell, but so much more tempting Maggie out of his bed and that is a challenge all on it's own because he wants her and he wants her bad!  Before you can say truth of dare these two reach a crossroad, it's time for a new kind of dare : real, forever love.Fabulously hot sexual tension , riveting emotion and kick ass conflict, this book had it all!  I adored the character of Tyler. A really honest to goodness nice guy always doing the right thing even when it hurts like hell. I fell hook line and sinker for this hero from the start go. Through his character the author showed it is always best to do the right thing, yes it hurts and afterwards you wish you never did it in the first place but somewhere along the line it's going to pay off. The trick is to be able to know when to hold out for that moment to arrive instead of simply just doing the opposite of what you know is right so that it does not hurt so bad.The character of Maggie was really fun, I liked her feisty spirit and get go attitude even though she had been let down in the past she still pushed for what she knew she had to have. Of course as we all know being hurt in the past does not make it a smooth ride at all and therefore I could identify with her insecurities. Through this character the author showed we all get moments of doubt but when you love someone that love is always stronger than the doubt and can be overcome.I am taking away a message of life has a way of daring us to get out there and take on the unexpected, it results in happiness and sadness in the end you either win or lose but either way you will know you tried and that is more than what other's ever do. Dare to believe !I highly recommend this off the charts hotter than hot, sharp and funky dialogue, excellent plot , delicious tension and passionate read for all fans of romance. It's a romance with quite the kick that you will never forget!5/5 star review" Truth: They want each other bad, Dare : How long can they resist each other?"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

For ten years Pip Martin has been pushing the limits pursuing a prestigious career in New York. Then she returns to Yorke Peninsula to say farewell to her dying grandmother. She doesn't want to linger, she wants to get into town unseen, say goodbye to her grandmother, say hi to her best friends and then get out and back to her perfect happy life in New York, which not only includes the perfect job but the perfect sexy hot friend Chad , that comes with all the right benefits a climb to the top of the corporate ladder girl like her needs.But life is never that simple and not only is the whole town aware of her arrival, but so is her childhood sweetheart, Luke Trenorden. He was her everything, until the night he betrayed her and tore their lives apart.Seeing Luke again awakens the feelings from the past, but it also brings back the memories of a long kept secret, a secret she has been trying to solve for far too long. Then the answer is revealed and Pip has to decide is she 's going to go back to being the corporate goal getting career woman she's become or if she's ready to be the woman she was meant to be, the one only Luke can see.This read was all about stunning emotion, that drew me in from the first page and held my attention right through to the end. I laughed and I cried my eyes out , and I got my heart broken over and over again, and then the author pieced me back together again with remarkable wonder.I adored the character of Luke, he's the kind of hero that deserves happiness but every time it is or has been in reach something happens to tear it away, and this completely broke my heart. I wanted to grab hold of this man and hug him tight, tell him it will all be okay he just needs to hang in there. But as we all know, saying the words never really means anything because they are just words. Through this character the author showed that when we believe that everything we do is wrong and happiness is not in the cards for us, it's one of the biggest mistakes we can make, because it 's not us but life's way of steering us to where we need to be or in the case of Luke keeping us where we are meant to be so that we are there for the one that needs us the most when the time comes.The character of Pip was at first the really, " Oh man a stuck up NY diva heroine". And I did not immediately like her at all. But as the read progressed and the author let me in on her past I could clearly start to see why she's so focused on her career instead of happiness. It broke my heart when the author revealed the hurt she had face in the past. Through this character the author showed how the hurt from the past is essential in life to teach us what we should be reaching for. We lose our way but when life offers up the right goals we should be chasing , the trick is to stop, listen and then act instead of ignoring the signs and simply sticking to the game of pushing for what we want instead of what we need.This book was filled with so many wonderful emotions, brought to life with vivid color by the author. It tells the journey of self discovery, romance rekindled, lessons learned, secrets and mystery keeping people apart and bringing forth a new life for all.I recommend this read for all fans of reading. Deep emotion that will bring you many tears of joy and sorrow, give you a new zest for life, have you believing in love, friendship, family and teach you that the past is simply that, what's in the past is not what will bring you the future you deserve, it's about letting go and chasing the dreams of your heart and not those bouncing around in your mind. This author knows how to climb deep into the very soul of life!4.5 star review" He breaks down the stone castles around her heart, but does she have what it takes to venture outside?"** Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

Travel journalist Finn Banning has bagged the honeymoon trip of  lifetime, three weeks, loads of expensive all stops pulled out experiences. It's just the deal he needs to make headlines in his travel - writing career. The problem? His fiancee has just walked out on him , and well showing up at the honeymoon destinations alone won't look all that good now will it?!By a twist of fate, he comes across the bubbly and total flirt Callie again, when he met her few months ago, he thought her sexy and trouble with a capital T , but he was happily engaged and left it as a flirt to pass the time experience.Seeing her again not only get's his hormones hitting the red lines of passion and attraction but also sparks an idea, she will be the perfect fake wife!Callie doesn't like the idea of playing fake wife to super sexy Finn, but the arrival of her painful past sends her grabbing hold of the opportunity with both hands! Enjoy the getaway and bonus have some fun between the sheets and get lost in the magical kisses of Finn. He doesn't want a relationship, neither does she, it's perfect, let lose,  have great sex and then cut loose. Easy right?I very much enjoyed this read, the little spark of conflict here and there was great entertainment. I adored the passionate attraction between Finn and Callie, it was like reading about firecrackers going up in the air, exploding and then suddenly re-exploding all over again, super hot!The character of Callie was really fun and made the read very lively. Her sparkling, go with the flow, make the best of every situation attitude had me in stitches the one minute but breaking my heart the next, because I knew it was only a form of defense against hurt.  I loved that the author showed how we all have different ways of coping, but that at some point no matter what form of coping mechanism we use it simply falls flat.The character of Finn, was awesome! I loved his free spirited persona. I really enjoyed him trying not to fester on the past and his relationship failure, and instead try to be more like Callie by just going with the flow and enjoying the moment. What really got to me was how the author let him push Callie to talk about her past, but still keep it light and simple enough to make it still sound all about sex and nothing more, not the perfect scenario for any woman, but it totally worked because it kept the read fun and added that certain level of sexiness with a twist all the while entertaining me as the author only here and there hinted into his past and what would ultimately get him to reveal all to Callie.The backdrop settings were described with exquisite detail and I could actually hear the lions roaring and felt the cool night air touch my skin.  I am taking away a message of when it comes to any relationship , one that's just for sexual fun or a very real this is us in it for the long haul one, you always need to lay out all your cards on the table, if you don't you will never win.  There will always be another winner, another game but if you don't give it all up, you will always walk away as the looser.I recommend this read for all fans that love a romance with a fun and crazy plot , terrific characters, great emotion and fabulous hot passion. Mrs Wood has once again proven her magical South African charm and wit deliverers a romance filled with sassy, sexy , very much romantic hanky-spanky fun!4 star review" Hot sex, wine and the night's stars, it's just a fake honeymoon, right? "** Ebook copy store bought

I have personally always been a major fan of daredevils, the pure thrill and excitement of these badboys is addictive. So of course I was thrilled when I learned that this read had such a hero, and my oh my what a hero he was!The read introduces us to Rafael Revaldi, he has always lived for the moment, then his whole life changes when he cheats death. This leads him to know exactly what he wants, and that is an heir. But to make it happen he has to focus all his attention on winning back the heart of his estranged wife Lottie.Lottie returns to the castle she once called home, but with her she brings a newfound strength , she's not the same woman she use to be and she 'll be darned if she goes down without a fight again, if only she can carry her strength to full.The intense sensual connection between her and Rafe is still there and it's hotter then ever, but the emotional scars from their marriage still lingers. Can she stand her ground and walk away from heartache and pain or will she once again lose her heart when if she fails to give them both the child they both so desperately want?I adored this read to pieces, the raw emotional hurt from the characters had me in tears for the best part of the book, which of course is always a definite sign that an author knows what she or he is doing! The characters of Rafe and Lottie both pulled my hearstrings to the point where  I honestly wished I could climb inside the book and just fix it all, the author let the hurt, anger and pain play out perfectly, it was truly as if I was right there watching the characters tear each other to pieces.Through both characters the author showed , that we all react differently when life fails us, some of us lash out, others simply go into a little cocoon of self defense. But at the end of the day which ever action we take hurts our changes of being able to really get back up again, stand our ground and let the world know we are stronger then what ever life trows at us.The cold hearted method taken by Rafe to inform Lottie of his decision was one written so well it sent chills down my spine, and of course I thought " What a bastard! " and then I wondered what really lurks behind the cold man of steel? And let me tell you when the author began digging into the past of these characters and the cold hearted methods they both take, I was an absolute mess, I bawled like a baby, I shouted in outrage and I yelled with frustration, so many various emotions ran through me and without a doubt this author got to my heart and soul!I am taking away a message of life can knock us down so badly it feels as if there is simply no way back up again. But the trick is to find the right balance to get back up again, you can pretend all is fine and make everyone believe you 're having a high old time, but when you are alone the darkness overcomes you.  There is a thin line between getting back up to the point where you are able to move on without regrets and accept life for what it is, and getting back up but still leaving a part of you on the ground begging for help. Never give up, always fight and most importantly communicate and tell the truth to those that matter, if you don't there simply is really no way you will ever fully get back up again and be able to face life.I highly recommend this read for all fans of romance reads with amazing twists and turns, pure raw emotional heartache , stunning passion and a wonderful message of love conquering all.A brilliant debut Andie!5/5 star review" Death tore them apart, can a new life will bring them together? "** Copy provided in exchange for  honest review

This is book number eight in the Mills and Boon The Chatsfield series, this time we meet the eldest of the Chatsfield's.Lucilla has always been the one to keep the family together, taken care of everything she could, which of course is a great responsibility and as we all know , with great responsibility comes great sacrifice.Lucilla has never really stopped to look for love, she is simply jut too busy trying to keep it all together, she faces each day head on and let's nothing stand in her way. That is until the force that is Christos Giatrakos. Not only has he been put in charge of the family business but also in charge of Lucilla.She's naturally outraged and vows to fight back with all she has. But Christos is not the kind to back down and simply roll over. Although returning back to a world he never wanted to step foot into again, he's prepared to do whatever it takes to reach his end goal.And right here is where this read shouts, clash of the titans, game on! I loved the conflict in this read, it was fun one minute and spicy the next. It did resemble other reads in the same line, because there is always conflict, but the author let it somehow play out with more passion and the conflict alone took on a life of it's own, making this read highly entertaining.The characters were both extremely well written, both determined and forceful in everything they do, and of course the heat building in between the bouts of anger was fabulous!Not wanting to spoil the read for anyone, I can't say too much more except that the ending of this read was as perfect as they come, and took my breath away.I am taking away a message of to walk away from problems is never the answer, yes it is the easy solution but can you really escape? The answer is definitely no, because somewhere alone the line the problems are going to break through the defenses you lined up and you will need to face it, so why run in the first place, deal with it instead the minute it arrives because if you walk away you are walking into a world far worse than the problems you had to face in the past.I highly recommend this read for all fans of romance reads, it was a roller coaster of conflict, passion, glitz and glam and sexy romance., and by far my favorite from the entire series.5/5 star review" The fight to gain control is on,but who will walk away as the winner?"** Copy store bought

I am sure everyone will agree with me when I say , when Christmas day has come and gone you still wish you could somehow get that warm, christmassy feeling back and keep it alive somehow.I for one wish all year around that I could somehow capture that magic feeling, keep it in a bottle and open it when ever the year starts to feel a little too much.  I am ecstatic to report I have found something even better!Snowbound Summer was Christmas magic wrapped up with a big old red bow ready to be unwrapped again and again , no matter the time of year.The read tells of Summer, reeling with regret over her failed business and the end of what seemed like the perfect relationship, she's back home and hiding out in her parents house. She wants nothing more than to consume as much chocolate and wine as possible and have some peace and quite.But fate intervenes in the form of the most adorable dog ever written. Cold, trapped in the shed and clearly injured, is where Summer finds the dog that will ultimately become the best thing that has ever happened to her. She calls in the help of the local vet, only when she discovers he's none other than he brother's best friend, Nick, and that he has to stay the night due to one heck of a snowstorm, does she start to see him a whole new, sexier light, only she's not ready to tell him the whole truth and nothing but the truth.As I said earlier this book was Christmas magic, from the miracle of saving furry friends lives to holiday romance blossoming and even Christmas day lunch giving way to a whole new meaning to" We really should be discussing this in private and not at the dinner table", it all came together beautifully.I could not put the read down, from the opening scene right through till the end the author delivered romance entertainment ! Through the character of Nick she showed that we all have hopes and dreams and sometimes the only way to find out if we can make them happen is to take action and hope for the best outcome.Through the character of Summer the author showed that we are all definitely human, we all make mistakes and we all get up and move on, yes it takes others longer to get over a mistake but eventually we get there. But more importantly there is no shame in failing, everyone does at some point and it's okay.I am taking away a message of everything in life happens for a reason , and at the right time. Of course we none of it makes sense whilst it is happening, I mean would you think rescuing a dog would bring you the love of your life? I for darn sure would not even begin to think it, I love animals but adding that to romance , not the first thing that comes to mind at all.But as with all life lessons it's afterwards the light always shines through and the meaning becomes clear, the trick is not to want to run and hide. It might be a natural instinct but it's the wrong approach try to see it for what it could be and not for the " This is so not what I need right now!".I recommend this read for all fans of romance reads, it's the perfect pick me up read for anytime of year and definitely perfect for the holidays . The read will be keeping my christmassy feeling alive and well for the year that lies ahead.A story about hope, love, understanding and acceptance.4.5 star review"A lonely dog, a sexy vet and a Michelin star chef find happiness under the Christmas tree"* Copy provided in exchange for a honest review

An absolutely amazing read about how one romance journey ending gives life to a new romance ready to blossom ! I loved the unexpected twist at the end of this read, I vaguely saw it coming but in the end it played out somewhat differently than I had expected. I adored the look into the war and how things had changed from that time period to now. Great read!*** Copy store bought

This was the very first book I read by this author, and after this absolutely brilliant romance it certainly will not be the last.The author created a stunning story of wanting to feel safe and protected against harm, feeling protected against love is a whole other story of course. When someone loves us you don't expect them to hurt you. The scenes where the physical abuse was described was hard to read, I simply could not imagine anyone doing such unspeakable things to another human being.But the long road she travels to bring the abuse to and end and become a stronger person, was amazing and made the tears I shed completely worth it!*** Store bought copy

Really tasty recipes! Great choice for the winter, if you are looking for nutritious, tasty, warm stews and soups (100% vegan), you will surely find this recipe book very helpful. With 100 recipes I will never get bored.

Reading this book was one of the best things I have done for myself in the last few months. Doctor Puff writes in an honest, direct style that is yet filled with joy, optimism and hope. I would say I am a pretty happy and positive person by nature, but I do have bad days from time to time. Everyone does. This is why I got this book, I wanted something nice to read for the weekend. I got this book a couple of days ago (I think it was Tuesday) but when I woke up this morning I decided to start reading it as a part of my morning ritual. I couldn't put it down and then read it again on my lunch break. To sum up- if you are interested in personal success and creating a happy life that works for you- this is the read for you.

Oliver's books are more addictive than drugs...There is something about this series that just really absorbed me and after reading the first part I felt compelled to get the second one straight away. In this book, Oliver describes his ups and downs in Florida. Really dark and realistic. OK- some people may not find it that realistic and it may be hard to believe what actually happens to this author, but hey, love is addictive as well. Personaly, I have met many addicts (I used to volonteer for a local organization  helping ex-addicts that were actually still addicts....) and I am familiar with the "patterns" that Oliver describes. And just like he says- we should not be judging. I totally agree. So yep- this is a book on sex and drugs but I wouldn't say it about having fun. It's dark. Really dark. And now I am gonna grab the 3rd part.

Very helpful information- the author guides you step by step. I am familiar with all the benefits of reiki as I am a reiki 2 level practitoner. However, I tend to get off track sometimes and this book has motivated me to get back to my reiki rituals for self-healing. I would recommend this book for beginners (mostly for beginners) but, if you are like me and need a "refresher" it can also help you.

I recently took interest in DIY marijuana spa products (yes, it's very therapeuetic and good for back pain) so even though I don't smoke joints, I took interest in this book as my idea is to go for a proper DIY and grow my own "healing herbs". It's legal where I live but I never thought I could learn it, not much of a gardening person. Luckilly for me, this book gave me enough info and confidence to get started. Will see how it goes!
Good information! I am a big fan of all kinds of tea and this short but informative guide has made me expand my " tea horizon".  The health benfits seem amazing, I can't wait to try it out!

Fantastic resource, really nicely organized. I would recommend it to everyone taking a Java course, it can also help you revise what you already know. I like the way it's formatted. Very neat and easy to navigate.***I received this product at a promotional discount price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review****
Good short book with a brief summary of the US history. It has a preview + short description of the most important dates. It served me to refresh some facts.

Awesome book! I couldn’t put it down. Seriously. I was going to have an early night yesterday and ended up reading this book from start to finish, till 3AM at night.I enjoyed this honest, realistic and direct style of writing. If you are looking for a nice and politically correct read, it may not be for you and your reality.The author offers a nice dose of German directness –something that I can cope with as I am originally from Poland- in fact I really enjoyed it and I will surely get more of his books.The story was very engaging. Real page turner. Sad but true. Alice’s story is not the only one…Again, good book. Sehr, sehr gut! Danke!

Fantastic resource full of simple yet effective advice (the best stuff is always the simplest) and many good recipes inspired by a clean,alkaline diet, but not hard to follow. I was familiar with this stuff and got the book mostly for the recipes- I can tell you I wasn't let down. Fantastic variety for different nutritional tastes and lifestyles!
Very tantalising read! I couldn't put it down...Some good romantic and erotic scenes, lots of forbidden passion+  and well-developed characters!

Great information and an easy, step-by-step layout. I was aware of all the benefits of fermented foods, but never took action to make some myself. It's time to change it! Great guide for beginners:) I am happy I have it in my health and wellness DIY collection.

Wow! Inspirational read with a powerful message. Live your life. Be grateful.  Trust the divine and embrace the divine in YOU. Have faith, focus and intention. Don't give up. I feel very peaceful now. I have had a stressful week and this book reminded me that I need to take action from the point of belief and confidence, not doubt or anger. Thank you for sharing your wisdom and inspiring generations of folks to LIVE with intention and purpose.

Great reminder. I have had a really stressful day today and reading this book put me on the right track. I am not new to mindfulness, but as all fragile human beings, I sometimes get off track and need something positive to help me focus on the here and now. No more stress. let's fight it. It was all in my head. I now feel more peaceful actually.Overall, good short read:)
Quick, easy and healthy!The salad recipes were really creative and full of taste. Really enjoyed them and will be trying out the rest of her recipes too. Great cookbook for all seasons:)

Great collection of smoothie recipes. I can never have enough of them! Will be trying them out this weekend before my workouts. Lots of taste, health and creativity in the recipes! The cover looks tempting and so do the recipes. Judge the book by its cover....Yes...

Fantastic! I love Beran's books!Her recipes are always full of taste and health. You can eat to your heart's content and stimulate weight loss naturally. Try it! This is not a fad diet but a healthy lifestyle that is not that hard to create really.I especially enjoyed fish/salad recipes. Yummy!

Short but to the point. I am really interested in a "sustainable lifestyle" and received lots of value from this book. The first step I am going to take is to start growing my veggies (doing it already but I need to be more committed). Other information was helpful too. Overall, good short read for beginners like me!

This was a very enlightening read. It made me feel safe and secure- like I know I should feel…The author gives you many ideas on how  to create a balanced, holistic lifestyle through mindful spiritual practices. Some of them I never heard of before, but I will try for sure. Thanks Jan for such a well-written and inspiring book.

Great NLP deal! I love the practical, no fluff approach. It's jam packed with useful information and step-by-step action plans. I can't wait to incorporate more NLP practices into my success rituals. I am particularly interested in visualization. Great buy!

I'm not terribly thrilled with this item. After reading the reviews I was able to get a size larger than I normally would wear, so at least mine fit. It runs at least a size small. It is also very short, so waits to just above my belly button, covering only the small part of my back. The material it is made out of is fairly thick as well. So if you hope to wear it under clothing it will not be unnoticeable. And more of an issue for me is that it doesn't seem to do anything for me. It makes no difference in my back pain. It may work for someone, but my experience wasn't much less than stellar.

My experience with anything OtterBox has been great and this is no exception. That said I don't tend to use phone cases, mostly because of the bulk. I never understood buying a thinner and easier carry to phone and then putting a huge case on it. And that is why I like the Symmetry series. It adds very little bulk at all and I barely notice it when it comes to pocketing my phone. But it does add some piece of mind for minor bumps or drops. With the S6 he back side of the case bring it about even with the camera, meaning you can now law you phone flat without the camera causing it to kickstand. It also give better purchase in your hand than the factory phone which I like. There is no screen protector, which is something to note. I don't like built in screen protectors and use replaceable ones, but it may be a deal breaker for some.

This pants are good considering the price. The waist has elastic in it allowing it to fit a bit better if you are slighter larger/smaller. That said for the 34 inch waist I found the legs to feel a bit to tight in the thighs, it isn't terrible but I would prefer a little more space. The waist and length for mine (34x34) was accurate. I often find that inseams tend to run short on dress pants but these were spot on. The material is thin, but has held up find so far. That said I don't see them having a very long life span, which is fair considering the price. They are also easy to wash and iron without issue.

This is a very solid, bare bones, gaming mouse. There aren't a bunch of customization buttons or options on it. Think of it as a gaming mouse stripped down to the bare performance necessities. If you are okay without a bunch of extra buttons on your mouse, this may be for you. The mouse is textured with several rubbery type coatings. The buttons and mouse wheel all have firm tactile feel and feedback to them. The cord is think and braided and didn't want to lose the winded shape from package it had. It has three different DPI profile options and the tracking is spot on (310 gaming grade IR-LED optical sensor), from shooters to strategy games. The software is encompassing, maybe too much so for most people (me included). The only down side is the price is a bit high for the amount of customization on this mouse if you are serious about setting up your equipment just to your liking. For me it isn't an issue, I am no where near a pro gamer, but it is something to be aware of when you are dropping your cash.

This are interesting. They are sweet and then shift to a slightly cola flavor just as promised. That said the cola flavor is also kind of sour and I didn't find it that pleasant. Not that I find warm cola flavor tasty in anything. But if you do, and like cherry things that change into cola things and want them to fit in your pocket, these are for.

I picked this up at the same time as the Dell USB 3.0 Dual Display Universal Dock for the same purpose. Running multiple monitors on my Alienware Alpha console which I use as a desktop. And I much prefer the TRENDnet. The set up was much easier. While I had to go digging through forums for the Dell, the TRENDnet was almost just plug and play. I ran an HDMI cable to one monitor and a DVI converted to HDMI to the other and had no issues with set up and getting this rolling (Running Windows 8.1). The lack of sound from the converted DVI was a not issue since I run external speaks powered by the USB. Which brings up another thing I love about the TREND, the thing is almost covered in USBs, 2 USB3 ports and 4 USB2 ports. I was able to drop my 3 USB port dongle since everything I have (keyboard/mouse/speakers/Xbox remote) have their own ports now.The only downside for me and my use, which is not typical since I am not docking a laptop, is that the TREND is a much high profile piece of equipment compared to the DELL. The ease of use for me more than make up for that. And I guess if you are running multiple monitors it is not much of an issue.As with all docking stations if used with a laptop though you may suffer lag and poor video performance in certain apps and most games so keep that in mind. I only play fair low graphic/video demanding games on mine like Pillar of Eternity, Shadowrun, etc and have had no issues.

I am rather happy with this dock, but it gave me some headaches to get it to do what I wanted. I used it with an AlienWare Alpha Console and not a laptop. That said the outputs on the Alpha are very similar to that of a laptop, since it was made to run on just one TV. I used to dock to be able to run dual monitors, which is something I couldn't do on my console without setting up daisy chaining of some sort. This way I was able to connect directly to two separate monitors using the HDMI ports. But after that I had to do some digging, since the dock itself doesn't make the monitors work. I had to use a forum to figure out how to set up my monitors using native windows applications in Windows 8. Not the most user friendly thing to do and the cause of some frustration. Once done though it was worked wonderfully. I don't play any top end shooters or the like so I haven't noticed any frame rate issues or lap in the monitors. I have read reviews saying that is an issue if you use MST/daisy chained monitors, so something to be aware of. I am rather happy. I am not super IT savvy but was able to get everything figure out that to google. But it certainly wasn't plug and play for my application

This is one of the harder reviews for me, since there are so many variables to it. Granted I have a black thumb when it comes to plant life, not a green one. So any help is wonderful. I also live in Hawaii, a place full of green, but also fairly hot during the summer months since it is near the equator. I hate to report I had no more luck growing a lawn with this product as I did with the generic grass seed from the local box store. That said it did make a valiant effort and even sprouted in places, due to it's heat tolerance I would guess/hope. But it was not to be. Does that make this a good or bad product? It is very hard for me to honestly answer. I am going to try again without the false confidence that the 'heat tolerant, water absorbing' label gives and report back. That said if the price is similar I'd lean towards this brand compared to just a standard grass seed, since I did see at least some sprouting.

I thought KT Tape was just another gimmick. But after seeing some very high profile Crossfitters and firearm instructors making use of it I though 'why not give it a tray?'. And I am glad I did. This stuff is amazing. As I've gotten older my workouts seem to take more of a toll on me, I am sore and stiff longer than I use to be and it impacts my following workouts, It is hard to get a really good bike ride in if your shoulders are still screaming from the workout the day before, or you calves and quads are singing from the previous day's beach run. I've been applying the KT Tape and it has significantly improved my recovery time. Is it witchcraft? Magic? All in my head? Maybe, but it is working for me. I initially tried it on just one shoulder when both were equally sore to see if I could tell the difference, and the next day the taped should felt much fresh, loser and less sore. Again maybe it is all mental, but still worth it to me. One recommendation I'd make is to watch the youtube videos on how to apply it correctly, it makes a world of difference. I am also fond of this big roll since I can just cut it to the length I need for whatever I happen to be taping. That saves me from using/wasting more than what I need.

This seems to be a good flea and tick treatment. I used it on my smaller dog, all of 15 pounds of him, and he is flea and tick free. Which isn't always easy, living in Hawaii we have the little monsters year round. So it works well.My only grip is the price seems high and it doesn't work any better or worse than my standard Advantix (in my experience and with my sample size of two dogs and a cat). Two months of my other brand costs about $10 less than a single treatment of Bio Spot Active. I also didn't see the need for the applicator. It made it handier to put on, but seemed like a waste of packaging and effort to me. I'd have rather just gotten the treatment itself and put it on by hand.That said everyone has their preference and some treatments seems to work better in different location and for different dogs. As for myself I don't see me using this particular brand again, but if I did I do trust that it works.

Having a jack on your boat, horse trailer or other light trailer is a great idea. It means you don't have to carry something extra in your truck and means you will have it with you when you need it. They did a good job at including everything you will need, though the jack's size means lighter trailers and RVs/campers only. The box has a latch for a lock, but would not keep a motivated thief out. It is also open on the end, meaning weather, road salt and the like is going to get into and on the tools. So it is not just a mount and forget, you will need to take them tools out to clean them every so often. Or otherwise weather proof the items. I've considered a weatherproofed bag along with a light coating of oil, but we will see if that works. My experience has been that horse and motorcycle trailer tires are magnets for nails, so this is worth it to me. But at the $100 price tag everyone will have to consider the cost for piece of mind and usefulness. It is cheaper and easier than getting a flat in the middle of nowhere though.

OtterBox pretty much owns the heavy duty phone protector case market and this one is no exception. It fits very well onto the phone and is one heck of a beefy case. The buttons are all accessible through the case and tactile. The case allowed me to use my think screen protector without issue or tearing up the edges. That might vary depending on your brand. The case is dense and while I've not tested it to destruction it has survived several table top drops with no issue. The only downside, which to be fair isn't the cases fault, is the size. The case increases the size of the phone all around included a slight edge on the screen's side. The S6 is a large, though somewhat svelte phone, but you trade that ability to tuck into most pockets for protection with the Defender.

This is a nice, medium weight cotton blanket. I was surprised at the weight when the box containing it arrived. The blanket is more white than ivory and doesn't appear thickly woven, but it seems denser than it looks. It holds heat well for a cotton blanket. It is great for a blanket to use on the couch or chair while watching TV or reading. Or as a lighter bed blanket for the warmer months. There is nothing about the blanket that really 'wows' me and I question the $45 price point. We will see if it hold up longer and better than a similar but cheaper blanket from the local box store.

I did not find this at all useful. It didn't stick to the wall or desk very well. And the other side didn't really stick to pens, or anything else that well. I'm not sure what good it actually it. One thing it not only sticks to, but seems to magically attract, is pet hair. So if you have a pet you will have a nice rectangular fur spot where ever you attach this, until if falls off.

Tango Down hit a home-run with this cover. The one real complaint to be made on the amazing Aimpoint T1/H1 optic is no way to mount flip lens covers. You could put bikini covers on but they are not idea. So TD found a solution. Even better they offer them in more camo colors than black so you don't need to paint your optics. And then they sell it for a fair price. If you are running a T1 you should have this on it. It works, it is fairly priced and its your only real option.

This is nothing special and exactly what it says. A dummy WW2 style MK2 pineapple grenade. It has a blue spoon (making me think this was a training grenade) and a hole drilled through the bottom. It looks cool sitting on a desk but the only damage it could do is from its weight. That said be careful where you keep it, since people are quick to scare in today's world.

I've used these for years on two different pairs of military earpro. When they were first recommended to me I balked a bit at the price. But they do make a night and day difference when you wear them for hours or days on end. There comes a point where you will pay about anything to make the discomfort go away, so if you can avoid it to begin with they are more than worth it. They have given me no issues in frozen conditions and several deserts.

These may be the most comfortable full sized headphones I've ever used. There is no adjustment you need to make, the inner headband adjusts automatically. It is held in place with elastic cord which isn't so strong as to cause pressure, but enough to keep it in place. I wonder if this is going to wear out eventually, but if it does it is an easy enough fix to replace it.The cable/cord is long. The sound is also great. As another reviewer noted though, it kills the battery life on the PS4 controller. If you are playing casually its not a big deal. But if you want to spend a couple hours on CoD or Destiny then you are going to have to switch out controllers.As I mentioned the sound is good, and for the $100 price tag it should be. The microphone is good and doesn't cause feedback issues. The mute button is a sliding switch and easy to use and more so easy to know if it is muted or not based on position. Even better the mic tucks out of the way when not in use. Which is good because these headphone are good for other headphone stuff like listening to music. Even better it comes with a cable extension, so you have plenty of space when gaming and no need to deal with tons of extra cable if listening to music on your phone.Honestly if it weren't for the battery life issues these would be five stars to me. Pretty happy.

Despite whatever name is stamped on it I am sure these were made in the same slave labor factory in SE Asia as most other cheap undies. The stenciled logo wore very quickly and the seams in the crotch gave out first. They last maybe three months of rotating wear. Save you money and look for something else unless you just want the name Armani on your butt.

I've been using this set for about six months now and am very happy with it. The wireless USB adapter is very small and unobtrusive. The battery in my mouse has lasted about twice as long as that in my old Logitech mouses(still have changed the batteries in the keyboard). There is no lag what so ever between the keyboard or mouse. The feedback from the keys is good, standard Microsoft. Considering the price it is a great set up for the casual/everyday computer user. It is worth it just to get rid of any cables. Installed drivers instantly and automatically on my AlienWare computer.

Super unhappy with these. They were not very bright at all, easy to break, didn't hang well and required three AA batteries to run. There are a lot better options out there for as good or better prices. Even at half the price I don't think this would have been worth it.

Pretty simple conversion systems for plug ins. Keep in mind this is just a plug conversion, not a power converter. Bit of you have a European or Japanese style plug and you need to charge it in a US plug this is the way to go. And it stores neatly too.

These are well made, accurate and well priced. I've used them in both air powered and CO2 powered guns and they work great. Very happy with them, even more so considering the price they are usually found at.

I recently started going to Spin classes and planned to use my road race shoes, no dice. Apparently all the Kaiser bikes used by the military use Shimino SH51 type peddles, which are an offroad petal that uses a two hole mounting system. So while looking for various conversions I ran across these, which not only convert to the three hole pattern but have the SH51 cleats built into them. So instead of buying two things, one sets of adapters does it all, and at a very good price. I've been using them for several weeks now and they work great. I am very happy with them. Easy to install, comes with all the needed hardware and well made.

Super easy to use, almost plug and play. Directions are printed on the device, which is a great idea. Charges car and motorcycle batteries and tenders them. Easy to set up and understand, changes in a reasonable amount of time. It is very light and that makes it feel 'cheap' but it works well in my experience. Only real downside is the cord is very short, so you will probably need an extension cord. It also builds up some heat so keep in mind where you place it.

This isn't a bad hydration pouch, but there are better. Growing up on Camelbak I guess I am somewhat spoiled. The hose attachment method and the bite valve I both found to be subpar. It is very easy to clean though and fairly easy to fill. For light duty hiking or biking I guess it would serve. I think there are much better options for a large 1.5-2 liter bladder than this one.

There are much better vises out there for serious work. I bought this for my garage and general work, nothing hardcore of fancy. It is very firmly mounted to my workbench and has served well. I've torqued items up to 170 foot pounds mounted in this vice with no issues. It is not a huge vise and the quality is what you'd expect for the price. But depending on what you plan to use it for it is great. I'm very happy with it and it does everything I need it to. IF you are working on larger items and doing serious work this may not be for you. All that said it is actually better than I expected for the price. The fact that it pivots on the base I find to be its weakest link. It is hard to tighten to the degree I'd like so be aware of that. It does make it easy to mount because you can rotate the vice though.

These batteries are good and well made. They have a good life span, and never had any corrosion or other issues. That said I've found I could get the bulk Sony batteries for a much better price. So if you may need more than a few batteries it may be worth looking at bulk. If you only ever expect to use the three you get in this package it is a fair price.

These work as well as any CR2032 batteries and last as long in any low draw item. And are very well made and cheap along with carrying the Sony name on them. With all that going for them I don't think you can go wrong. Don't put unknown/offbrand batteries in your fancy electronics and they will thank you for it, but not breaking, dying or catching on fire. I've used dozens of these over the years and never had an issue with corrosion.

Use these for my three year old German Shepherd and she loves them. She thinks they are a treat and I don't need to 'convince' her to take one. She is heartworm free on her regular vet visits. Living in Hawaii, heartworms are a fact of like, and treatment at best can be expensive. At worse and untreated it will kill the animal. My dogs are not only my best friends, but family, so I buy them what works and I've happy with this product. Not as happy as my dog, but that is to be expected. `

I give this every month to my small Shih Tzu/Samoyad mix dog. He doesn't have heartworms during his check ups and I'm happy. They also taste fairly good judging from his reaction, he goes after them like a treat. That is a win win in my opinion.

I bought this to replace a wooden flag staff that just could not handle the wind in Hawaii. After it (the old one) broke for the third time I new it was time to move on. And what is stronger than hard wood? Steel of course, and that is what I went in search for. Turns out steel is heavy but expensive, and this flag pole had gotten good reviews. So I thought I'd give it a go. And it is well made and sturdy, I'm not sure quite what mix of metals it is made out of, but it holds up very well so far. No breaking, no bending. Just stands up tall and proud hold my heavy, all cotton, old school flags. Attachment method is simple, though you will need some type of slider/mount for the bottom of the flag. Very happy and wish I'd gotten this the first time and saved the cash I spend on the wooden one. But you live and learn.

It cuts and doesn't pinch or poke too much. But while it is fairly gently on the skin, it also doesn't work that great. I've used it both wet and dry and it takes many passes to get all the hair in a spot, and even then its not at all the smoothest of shaves.Now that might not be all bad. As a swimmer I used to shave pretty much all my body hair, but I didn't want to shave is razor smooth. So for something like that this would be great. But I am going out on a limb and guess most people want this to make shaving their various spots to be a faster, easier and painless process. If so that is not what you get with the WR5100 in my experience. If you are in a hurry, then this isn't the answer either. Too bad, for the price I expected a lot more from it.

This is a tough review. And that is because this thing is super expensive, far too expensive I think for what it is and does. I wanted to say that first as to get it out of the way so as not to keep bring it up during the review.Now if you don't consider the price the fan itself is amazing. It is small, takes up little room, moves vertically and horizontally, has no blades, is far more quiet than a bladed fan, has a very well thought out remote and just looks amazing. It is very futuristic looking in to my eye, like a fan you'd find on a SciFi space ship. So it doesn't look tacky or out of place in a well furnished office. The fan itself works well giving you the option of a wide or narrow path of air. And as a fan I think it is amazing.What I find less amazing though is the heating option. It just doesn't really do much. It does heat air and gently blows is, but the farther way you are the less warm air reaches you. It feels like someone holding a hair dryer across the room from you and gently fanning it back and forth. Pleasant to be sure, but probably pointless. Not that it bothers me much since this is going to probably live its life as a replacement for a standard fan in my office. Maybe I'll find a use for the heating option I've not discovered yet. But as a fan, this thing is awesome.

This is a great bench, if you use it for what it is made, which is a general workout bench. If you are throwing up 250 pound benches this isn't ideal and its not really made for that, and thus not as sturdy as needed. But for lighter workouts with free weights and any body weight exercises and the like it is great. It is sturdy and darn heavy, though the mounting system would worry me if you really started to stack weight. It goes together with twelves bolts and two pass through nuts with bolts at the end. It is super easy to assemble and doesn't feel cheap or wobbly. It has a good footprint and so doesn't tip or move around. The bench itself is firm, but not hard. For my garage gym where I use body weight and kettle bells for my weight it is perfect. It isn't a weight bench though and won't replace one.

I rather like these. There is just a bit of heat to it that compliments the sweetness. It compares to the chili chocolate bars, but with more milk chocolate where the bars are typically darker chocolate. It is still very much a sweet treat/snake, but variety is the spice of life.

Living in Hawaii, ran is a constant. I've found wipers that work just as well as the Bosch brand, but none of them are as durable or last as long. If the price is close at all, I go with Bosch. It is very easy to install, works well, lasts a long time, and wears gradually. Meaning you have a fair amount of warning when it needs replacing. That last bit really sets is apart from the less quality option that seems to go from working to trashed in an instant. Which means with the Bosch you get enough warning from wear to get a replacement before it gives up the ghost.

I live in Hawaii and the beach along with snorkeling is practically a state past time. So I get a good deal of use out of this. You can spend a lot more on equipment, but most people don't need to. This kit comes with a good pair of adjustable fins, which can be worn with barefeet or swim shoes without much trouble. The goggles are good, fit and seal well and have good clear lenses. The snorkel, the second most important part of your gear, is well made. It has a splash guard and blow valve. Both of which make snorkeling a lot more fun and a lot easier when introducing new people to it.My only real complaint, if you can call it that, is that the snorkel valve will eventually wear out with use and allow water to seep in. In this price range I rather expect that. And it can be delayed for a good deal of time as long as you take proper care of your gear and don't just throw it back in the bag and leave it to dry out. The goggle lenses also benefit from a good cleaning with toothpaste or similar to remove the silicon on the inside. That will help with fogging. Then if you smear a little bit of baby shampoo on the inside of the lens you can essentially go snorkeling and be worry free when it comes to fogging.

Fairly standard chair. Not bad, but not great either. The back and seat are very firm with a very level seat. Assembly was super easy taking all of maybe ten minutes. That said the back attaches to the chair with four bolts and through the arm rests. And the arm rests attach to the base/seat with four more bolts. It doesn't seem like a design that would hold up to a lot of use/wear. Though since I've only had it a few weeks there is no way to know that yet. It feels sturdy enough at this point and with five legs is very grounded as well. So for an inexpensive office chair I think it will serve just fine. As to its potential life span, that remains to be seen and I will update my review when I have more time on the seat.

I wasn't really sure what to expect from this. I have an older mattress, that was fairly expensive when I bought it, but it has seen better days. And this top has really revitalized it. The foam is great, and really makes a difference despite its short height compared to the mattress. Memory foam turns out to be pretty awesome stuff. It firms up my bed, and gives a good deal of support despite being very 'squishy' to the touch.It ships rolled up in a much smaller box than one would expect. Though it is heavy. It also comes with a sheet/covering that the foam actually goes into and then attaches to the bed like a normal sheet. The only downside is that it does increase the height of my bed several inches. It also needs a day or so after you unpack it to 'grow' into its full size. All that is more than offset but the good night sleeps I've been able to get since using it. And at a much cheaper price than a new mattress.

I was in the mood for some urban fantasy and thought I'd take a chance on this based on reviews on Amazon. And I am glad I did. Its not a ground breaking book and some some cliche's to it, but it works very well and is a page turner. The author starts out with something unique, which is he gives us a competent female lead. In too many books with female leads they characters tend to start naive and make bad choices, the main character here, Amber, is competent and collected. She deals with some wild changes but doesn't seem to make too man off the wall choices.The world building is also well done, familiar enough to think you know it, but with enough uniqueness to make it interesting. A number of super natural beings are introduces, some of which would be considered 'traditional' but without a huge amount of explanation. Instead of being annoying this leaves you wanting more and looking forward to more detail in the following books. The pace seems good though I do feel the end was slightly rushed, but not badly. The ending also clearly leads into a new books, which since this is listed as 'book 1' is to be expected. But I would have like a little but of closure as I wait for the following book.If I were to complain it would that the author uses Amber's military background too much. I wish he would have chosen a more realistic military background for her and then used it a little more sparingly. I like the weapon depictions in the book, which are mostly accurate. While wildly not practical I liked seeing the HK MK23 used in a book like this. All and all I was happy with it and look forward to the next book. I hope it gets better, second books can usually go either way. But I look forward to seeing more of this world and it's characters.

Mine arrived without instructions and with all the shelves and struts bent. It looked like someone had parked a truck on the box and just flattened everything as much as possible. The missing instructions isn't that bad, its not a hard thing to figure out how to assemble it. But since it had been squashed, none of the holes lined up. Worse every shelf had to be bent to assemble, as did the struts. This means assembly took a long time and required extra tools.But I strove on and at the end of it I had a crooked, bent, ugly, shelf system that I wouldn't trust to stand up under its own weight let alone 700 pounds of tools. This isn't the type of item I give a second chance, if its this bad there is no way I trust another to be better. Save your money, or just throw you money away instead of buying it. That way you are at worse out the cash, but don't have to deal with the frustration of assembly.

Everyone should wash their hair. Not everyone conditions, it would be great if they made a product that does both. And apparently they do. I don't usually use a conditioner and I'll be honest and say I can't really notice a difference between this and just using shampoo. I have short hair and its fairly thin, so maybe its just me. The bottle is large and well priced (shipping isn't depending on how you order it). It lasts a good deal of time for me which is nice.Ultimately I only want something that works, I don't really care about much else. I like Old Spice and I think this smells nice without being overpowered like some other (cough AXE cough). That said I don't recommend this more than most anything else I've used over the years, I sure don't see it as a game changer. But if you like old spice, want to get your shampoo and conditioning in with just one step, this might be the ticket for you.

I like most men and Americans spend a good deal of time on the toilet, its where I get most of my reading done. I also lived in Japan for several years and they have elevated the toilet to a new form, USB, heat, cooling, music, wifi, just amazing stuff. This seat isn't nearly that fancy, but its not meant to be.My downstairs bathroom is in a very small room with no ventalation for some reason. And its right at the entrace to the house, so avoiding any stink for both the sake of our family and possible embarressment of our guests made this worth a try.Install is super easy, though removal of your old seat depends on the level of rust that might have built up around your old bolts. The mounting hardware is all included and easy. The seat mounts to a bracket which replaces your old connection. There is a spring loaded catch that allows quick and easy removal of the seat. I was worried about the firmness of the seat since the mounting bracket is small and plastic, but so far no issues.The filter seems to work fairly well and the fan is not at all loud. The little smell dispenser seems gimmicky and seemed somewhat over powered to me. Maybe the filter is working better than expected and thus the scents are just easier to pick up. The seat runs on two DD batteries which I have no idea how long they will last. But I'd imagine you get a good deal of life out of them. In fact the DD seems a bit overkill for the small fan but I'm not electronic engineer. The fan/battery compartment doesn't really add too much bulk or look out of place.All and all I am somewhat impressed with the seat, which is something I didn't ever think I'd type in a review or even think.
