Is this a must buy? Well considering the bathroom placement I used it in, it was for me. For other is may vary, but I don't see a downside to it other than price.

Pretty simple install. Goes on much easier if you have an application spray. You can also use soapy water (my phone is an S4 Active) or Windex. Then pretty out the water once you have the position perfect. It is clear and doesn't cause issues with the touch screen. Some protectors have caused issues for me around the edges but not on this one. Give it a good wipe down with the included wipe then go to town. You can avoid finger prints with the same soapy water/windex trick.I removed a star because it didn't come with a proper squeegee or spray. The protector is also very easy to scratch. Granted it is made to be a sacrificial lens, but there is a happy balance. I have to replace these more often just because of how easy the shield is to scratch.

I am by now means and IT like person. Asking the Oracle (google) I can get through most of my tech issues. That said this was by far the easiest router I've ever set up in my life. You screw on the antennas, plug in the power, plug into the modem, connect to the network on wireless (using the supplied network name and password) and gun through the wizard to customize it as much as you want. I went through the installed using my Samsung Tablet/laptop running Windows 8.1 and a wireless connection. I did not have to download drivers or anything outside of the wizard set up. It does come with a install disc but I have no computer with a CD drive to try it on.I live in a house full of wireless devices, tablets for streaming and multiple consoles for gaming. There was a noticeable difference in speed when switching to this new router (a good one). The Wizard that Linksys uses is very intuitive. It allows you to really dig into the systems, bands, devices, block list, duplicate MACs, etc with a super easy interface. You can set passwords for all three networks. The guest network on this devices works easier than my last Netgear was, and can of course be turned on or off without issue.Connecting my wired printer and my 4TB storage device to the modem was just plug and play. I've not had any issues with the network dropping and my speed has almost doubled on some devices. It is also much easier to prioritize data on this router than my last couple, thus making Vonage/Skype much easier to use. This is the first time I have set up a router without having to look anything up, get mad or frustrated or even reset the modem.

I've been using this with my two year old daughter and this is my third time potty training a child. The first two were tried and trued old school methods and both kids were completely different in what worked and didn't.My youngest is partially potty trained now, and usually goes to the bathroom during the day when she is up. I know from experience that is much harder for them to know at night when they need to go. So my hope was this would give her a little bit of a helping hand. And only being a month into it I'd say it is effective, though I don't know if its the new best thing. It does let her know its time to go and she will usually get to the toilet, but not always. She also moves sometimes and dislodges the cable. The attachment method seems to be pretty good and I don't see a work around to the issue. If your child tosses and turns then I don't think this would be the best option. I wish they would make a blutooth model. I can also see an issue with the device for kids who just won't accept something being attached to them at bed time.All that said I think its effective and I think it will speed up the hardest part of potty training for my daughter. The tones are good and increase in volume, so they don't start off loud and scary. I was worried about her getting caught up in the cable but its really not long enough to be a concern once I got the device in hand.

Overall works as advertised, easy to setup, and accurate readings.-I like the temperature range feature, and alarm.-The LCD on the iGrill is useless in daylight hours, even in the shade. Red LEDs on a white background don't have the right contrast. At night its fine.-The Bluetooth range is noticeably limited. i lose connection by walking into the house. The app works fine on Android or iOS. (there were a few complaints that it was broken, guess they fixed it) but they take location data for some map.

I am a huge fan of blutooth headphones, but have killed the batteries on them too many times during weekend game sessions. So I went looking for something with good sound quality but plug in instead of wireless. That search let me to these and I am quite happy with them. The sound quality is very good, probably the best quality headphones I've used that aren't sound cancelling. With the PS specific apps I've found the sound quality to be better if you are willing to play with it a little. But the reality is I was quite happy with a plug and play. The 7.1 is a big selling point though and it works well. While no 'supported' as well for a PC there are apps/drivers you can download to make them work. So I've also used these on my PC and my Alien Alpha console with Windows 8.1. Set up wasn't difficult at all, though to be fair I just went online instead of bothering with the included instructions.My only complaint would be price, at $39 I'd give it five stars. At the $80 price I've seen it at times I think it overpriced. All in all I'm quite happy with them if you are searching for something that plugs in.

I've had a hard time comping up with an actual review for this item, since its so different. But it seems perfectly made to my tastes. I consider myself a gamer, but I stopped playing computer games many years ago and focused on consoles. In part because I never needed to update drivers or hardware on a console. But there are many games I've missed out on over the years because of it. Now I can play them, and not only that but on my TV just like my consoles.The Alpha is some form of computer/consoles synthesis. Its not a console that plays computer games, but more of a computer set up to act like a console. It comes with Windows 8 for example and will do most anything a desk top would be asked for. But you never even need use the computer mode. In fact when you start up initially only console mode is available. But it gives you access to the vast number of games on the Steam site (around 3700) last I checked. And while its expensive compared to a PS4/XBOXONE the games are generally much better priced, down to just a couple dollars each for some games.Because it allows you to play computer games it also benefits from a keyboard and mouse. Some of the games on Steam only work with that combo and no the console, so its a good addition. Besides that if you don't have accounts already you will do a lot of set up that is much easier with a keyboard. Graphics are great and to my untrained eye seems every bit as good and often better than my new gen consoles. I've had no connection issues or streaming problems at this point which was one of my fears. Games download fast and I've had no issues with freezes or lock up yet either. It is also whisper quiet which is nice compared to PCs I've used in the past.As of this review there are still apps missing. For example I can't currently stream music or video, connect to Netflix in app mode or the like. But I hope those things are in the works.

While the series was obviously campy and a little goofy it had good characters and decent action that it kept you entertained throughout its sadly one and only season.Think a little less budgeted 90's Batman movie super hero for t.v. and you'll have the Flash. The episodes were a mix of funny,over the top,and ultimately enjoyable as you saw the Flash take down both regular criminals and his more iconic though wacky multiple nemesis in the series and kudos to Mark Hamill for his portrayal of the trickster though most nowadays will familiarize his laughter with his more iconic role as the Joker.  The video and audio have been done well in the set with not graininess or distortions to complain about though again the dress style will obviously confuse the current generation many who grew up during this time will most likely have feelings of a nostalgia.So for fans of the Smallville,Arrow and the current Flash series this is good addition to check out and for the price a great deal too.

This set brings the finale to a very entertaining series and while you have the sets from a few years ago Viz Media did a fantastic job restoring the video and audio quality of the series to be a vastly superior ones to the ones from a few years ago. I can tell you that you will definitely see and hear better quality from these new sets then the ones from before as you won't have the lines on the top and bottom when the picture changes scenes and no glitchy scratchy sounds coming form time to time when the characters talk. While you obviously aren't given a finale from the series  it still gives a good conclusion to the anime series that fits it nicely.For those possibly concerned no worries as Viz hasn't done any re-dubbing so the original English cast are still heard voicing their character roles and of course you have the talented Japanese voice cast for the sub as well. So fans of the series I say these new sets are definitely worth looking into and for new fans of the series or just anime fans looking for an entertaining anime these sets are well worth taking a look at to add to your anime dvd collection.

The series still continues to give excitement and entertainment for most of the season and I'm glad to see that there will be a couple of more seasons of this enjoyable series to watch. The season gives us a ice mingle of drama as Sam tries to reclaim his beloved brother Dean from the fate that befell him at the end of the last season though it's going to be a strong battle of wills going against Dean as now he can openly indulge his darker desires without no regrets. The season episodes were 95% entertaining to watch with the exception of about two that were a little lackluster but still entertaining Regardless fans rejoice as now the 10th season is upon us to enjoy and savior to our hearts content.

Like with the previous fours seasons the fifth starts out wit ha bang as well as introducing Five-0's newest member as a series regular.You'll have a decent mix of action/drama/romance and thrills from the writers and while there are about five episodes that are lackluster the rest do a good job of keeping you entertained throughout the end of the episode. For the price it was a great deal to add this season to the other four I already have which is somewhat surprising as I wasn't much of a fan the first season but the series did grow on me. So for fans of five-o we have another entertaining season to enjoy until the start of season six.

The game shows the power of the Gen8 console with the vast free exploration so far of the game world and the graphics/sound quality from the lightning storms to the background shouting of bandits trying to catch up to you and do some bad things you don't want to know.  The combat does feel more then a little similar to two other games I've played Batman:Arkham series and Shadow Of Mordor from the counters to the various take downs. Of course you'll have the usual upgrade ability tree for Max and his car and also again like with SOM the health bad doesn't regenerate with time but pretty much with what amounts to health packs which is both appreciated and sometimes annoying depending on the situation. Also like with TR:DE you have to collect and  use scrap and certain other materials to upgrade your equipment which means a lot of time you're going to be searching the wastelands for as mush scrap as possible to boost up your car and such.I've been having a great time with the game so far and if you like the previous mentioned games you're sure to enjoy this game as well.Update 09-17-15After playing the game for awhile I'm still enjoying it but sadly a few glitches have toned down some of the enjoyment. First is the option screen when you have to either upgrade your car,skills and the like the menu will switch back and forth sometimes without you pushing a button or moving the controller stick which in turn makes you have to go back to the screen you were previously at and sometimes redo your actions like if you were doing an upgrade and such. Another problem is during the gameplay when you're walking around Max will sometimes spontaneously jump or roll without you using the button to do that action luckily though this doesn't happen as far as I've experienced when you're in a fight. Hopefully they'll release a patch soon to fix these problems as somewhat minute they are still annoying.

While the SW:Clone Wars series was an action filled and entertaining series showing us the adventures of Obi-wan,Anakin and his padawan apprentice Asohka during their time in the clone wars this feels more reminiscent of what made us fans of the Star Wars universe as it starts off during the early years before Episode 4. The characters are all entertaining as you have Kanan Jarrus a former jedi knight now living as a smuggler along with his comrades/family Hera Syndulla a strong willed female twi'lek who is the talented pilot of the groups ship The Ghost as well as the moral compass and the rugged lasat former honor guard Zeb Orrelios who is the muscle of the group and the last two being Sabine Wren a a young female mandalorian who at one time was being trained at the imperial military academy before realizing what the empire was really about and finally Ezra Bridger a young kind-hearted thief who finds out his strong connection to the force when meeting the group and starts training under Kanan to learn the ways of the force and become a jedi.The CGI animation is pretty much the same as with the SW:Clone wars series so if you weren't a fan of that animation you won't really care for this series animation either. Of course the group will get into trouble as well as running into dark force users along the way and trying to figure out their ultimate plan and what they want to do against the empire and how to do it.  The voice cast was picked very well and kudos to James Earl Jones for re voicing his iconic performance as Darth Vader in the second season first episode which makes us fans excited that the second season is close upon us. So if you already have the collection of the Clone wars series then this one is obviously a must have and now the only thing to do is wait for the start of the second season for us to enjoy.

Looking for a good quality game sound bar without having to pay an arm and a leg is frustrating as you're trying to find a good deal and also a good sound bar but after much searching this one turned out to be a good choice. The set up is pretty easy just connect the red/white audio cables into your t.v.(sadly no optical connection with this sound bar) plug it into a power socket and you're done. Like with most sound bars you have a mini remote that gives you the multiple sound feature options like movie/music/games audio settings and a good bass support.I can't say how this equals to some of the other ones at the same price(RCA/Vizio,etc) but after trying a few games out the sound was amazing as you get more sound audio and bass when playing even some sounds you didn't hear with some of the good quality headsets you might use when gaming. Case in point I tried out Tomb Raider:Definitive Edition with the sound bar and was stunned at hearing some of the new noises I didn't and couldn't hear when playing while using my headset or the speakers on my t.v. like birds chirping in the background and the like. The built in subwoofer works as stated giving deep bass when you're playing combat/action games. There is no wall bar to support the sound bar only two screws to put into your entertainment stand(which I did) if you wish or through the wall(which I can't since I'm renting an apartment) but it's lightweight so the two screws are all you really need to support it.So if you're a gamer who is looking for an affordable sound bar without having to pay too much for one this is a pretty good choice for you.

While you don't expect a deep serious in-depth story it's not a memorable one either just more a watch and forget but hardly a horrible or good movie to have. The CGI effects were good and the action was decent but nothing really kept you in your seat to watch the movie all the way through as opposed to getting snacks and checking your email from time to time. The actors and actresses were also pretty good so there really isn't any fault for them on this bland movie just that the movie turned out to be a bland vampire action movie. For $5 the dvd is worth adding to your collection but if you don't feel like getting it you're not really missing out on much either check a few clips if possible online to make your choice.

While I do like the Egg Mcmuffins you get from some fast food places the price and time waiting was an inconvenience at times with this little helper no longer do I have to wait for my Mcmuffins but just get up ten minutes earlier and tada! It's pretty easy to use and cooks the ingredients pretty well and evenly whether you prefer a sausage or bacon mcmuffin and want to add a little bit of personally preferred cheese as well. Cleaning and maintaining this is also pretty easy as long as you don't abuse it and it takes up very little space on the counter or table.For the price and for those who can't wait for a breakfast that takes an hour this is a real help both on the wallet and time.

While the material and quality of the protective skin is decent it has a few major flaws that at the end really don't make this an ideal thing to have. First is that the resistance you get with the controller sticks as you get more resistance when you move them around which is annoying to say the least. When you move the controller sticks around the rubberized skin actually pushes back against the motion and thus you have to use a little more force then usual when making the movement not much but still it's a little annoying.If you don't mind having that resistance when you use the controller then this is an alright product for you but if you find it annoying to use more force on your controller sticks like I did then pass this over.

If you like the Clamp manga anime franchise series like Tsubasa RESERVoir CHRoNiCLE,X/Clamp 1999 and the like you'll find this series to be very enjoyable but the plot to be a mix of alright to bland. It takes some parts of the series Blood+ but not too much of it and intermixes it with this series of a young tormented female vampire trying to find her way with both her cursed life and the life she wants but unknown to her she's just a piece in a game that seeks to use her for some at this time unknown and nefarious plot. The animation and soundtrack are very reminiscent of the series Tsubasa RESERVoir CHRoNiCLE and XXX/Holic so if you didn't care for that kind of animation then sadly this is one series you won't want to get.  There are also some pretty gory and bloody scenes especially at the end so obviously not meant for the younger audiences either but if you're a fan of the series Hellsing and the like then you'll get a kick out of this series too.  The voice cast for the English dub and Japanese subbed did a terrific job voicing their character roles and Funimation give us a decent combo pack again with the standard dvd's and blu-rays. So if you into vampire or the darker undertone animes this is a pretty decent one to check out.

While I am having fun with DA:Inquisition and also feels a little bit stifling in some of its gameplay control mechanics where as this one feels more like it's given the gamer more freedom with controlling the actions and abilities of the game character. Many have compared this with the Dark souls games and after playing DS2 I also feel a sense of deja vu but not in a bad way as both have a somewhat different take on certain points in their individual games. The graphics look great though I still feel they could have just as easily released the game on the PS3/Xbox 360 with no problems either. One point that should be made that a few naysayers have complained about is the difficulty of certain bosses and creatures,you can grind your character up with abilities and equipment and that's somewhat the point as you can't just expect a level 3 fighter to take on a dragon lord and expect to win right off the bat. So explore and level up but don't feel rushed to try and finish the game so take your time.If you liked Skyrim,Darksiders 2,DA then you're sure to have fun with this game.

An entertaining sci-fi CGI anime film that gives the viewer what you want action,drama,effects,good voice acting and a good though somewhat standard story line. Obviously this is more meant for fans of the Captain Harlock franchise though while I haven't watched any of them for awhile I was entertained nonetheless.  The animation is done well pretty much equal to the Final Fantasy Advent Children/Tekken:BV/Resident Evil CGI movies and the Japanese and English voice cast did a terrific job with their character roles. For the price and if you have any of the previously mentioned CGI movies this is definitely worth adding to your anime collection.

While the graphics,effects,sound and character design look great the single player mode felt a little short overall and the story while interesting felt like a standard t.v. drama episode but overall still entertaining. If you played any of the previous BF games then no worries as the overall controls are still the same except the stealth take downs where instead of killing your enemies you'll usually do a arrest take down or knock them out.  Also you'll have a spot here and these with what almost feels like Splinter Cell levels to a small point thought not much of it.  Since I don't play online really anymore I can't tell you any qualities on that aspect of the game sorry to say but a friend has said he's been having fun so at most the standard usual online gameplay.  Since here's really no major difference in price between the PS4/XBO version and the PS3/Xbox 360 one I'd say go with the Gen8 version if you have a PS4/XBO more for the graphics as opposed to gameplay quality.

While the game is an overall FPS there's just something about that makes it different from standard FPS like COD or BF and not just with it's difference in game controls. The graphics,sound,effects are astounding showing that great care was done in the making of the game and like with Dying Light the enemy a.i. is significantly better then the usual enemies we gamers fought against before.The story is good though never having played any of the Wolfenstein games I'm not up to par on if this story interconnects with the series story or is a totally different and original one for this game only,regardless it's still a good one. For the price I definitely say go for the PS4/XBO versions as the game is worth getting for either of these game consoles.

Think a mix of Sekirei/Shuffle/Baka&Test and you'll have a good handle on what to expect from this anime. The series has a very good mixture of fantasy/action/humor/romance/drama/suspense/fan-service and is done well enough where none of the episodes or overall story feels cheap.  The animation is nicely done similar a little to Shuffle and A Certain Magical Index and the voice cast for the English dub and Japanese Subbed did a great job voicing their character roles. While the ending is left somewhat open it's not annoying or bothersome as most of the overall questions and such are answered. So if you like A certain Magical Index,Shuffle,Haganai and the like then this is another series well worth adding to the collection.

Similar a little to other fantasy animes like Sands Of Destruction,Sacred Blacksmith and the like this anime has three mystical female mages each with a powerful elemental ability(water/fire/earth) though the series for the most part keeps the drama to a more lighter tone for the most part a little like Slayers. While for half the series you see the three mages along with a magical though sarcastic and gluttonous fairy meet and learn how to work together and form a close friendship along the way. The animation and soundtrack fit nicely and the English dub cast do a pretty good job for their character roles but obviously the original Japanese voice cast sound better in the character roles.So if you're an anime fan of fantasy series like Slayer,Fairy Tail,Rune Soldiers and the like then this set is worth adding to your anime collection.

While the graphics,sound,music,story and characters make the game incredibly fun to play the ending leaves more then a question mark as while some questions are answered a lot of unfinished actions and questions are left in limbo.  Still for the price and the entertainment I had with the game I can let this go and hopefully we'll see a third LOS coming out for the PS4/XBO someday.

While I had already owned the Xbox 360 version of the game it came on two discs which was a little annoying thus the single blu-ray dvd saves me that inconvenience. While we are at the PS4/XBO generation of gameplay in no way are the PS3/Xbox 360 games any lesser in game quality enjoyment and the graphics still look outstanding for any PS3/Xbox 360 game.

The second season of Aquarion was an alright one and had a decent finale but not one you might feel like watching again anytime soon as the characters and story were somewhat bland and standard generic overall. The story tries to get you into what is happening to the characters and tries to be dramatic but you can't help but think how the plot has been soo over played in other animes with better quality in them. The characters while somewhat entertaining are hardly original and barely endear themselves to you and the situations they go through so most times you really don't care what happens to them which in itself is tragic. The animation and soundtrack for the series are done well and a funny is while you would think they would have the standard fan service there's really hardly any here and the parts that are shown are pretty toned down. Appreciated though once again is that Funimation has released the two part set of the series with both standard dvd's and blu-ray dvd's though the extras are pretty bare bone just the usual trailers and a commentary.If you can get the both parts of the series for $50 or under it's a good deal but any more and you should check out a few episodes online if possible to see if you're willing to pay the amount for the series.

Author Cathleen Armstrong has written another great book to her "A Place to Call Home Series", called "Last Chance Hero"In this novel we find a man who was a young star in high school when he played football, being asked to come back and coach the high school kids. The town loves football and everything about it. Dr. Jessica MacLeod has decided to start her practice here. But, she hates football. The sparks start to fly when Jessica starts to like Andy and he starts to like her. Will anything happen if they both are so different? Will an argument ruin any chance of a future? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing Company and all opinions are mine.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/09/last-chance-hero-by-cathleen-armstrong_30.html#sthash.d3spUrNj.dpuf

General Seamus Ogilvy has finally made it home. He is back with his young son who he had leave because of the war. Now, he is back but, his wife has died so he has to raise his on alone. Sophie Menzies is very happy that he has come home, Sophie is without money and does not have any idea what to do so she says that she will marry Seamus and help with his daughter. Then a horrible woman returns and their arrangement might not even by legal. What will happen to Sophie if she is made to leave? I liked this book and the characters. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing and all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/09/the-mistress-of-tall-acre-by-laura.html#sthash.LFrBuHpN.dpuf

I liked that this book talked about how we can each find our own charismatic personality. There are great examples of how to create, enhance and learn charisma. Then the author explains what can be combined with your charisma. Some examples are God, being able to choose your own destiny, and of course how it relates to your heart and love. These examples made me think a lot about how I am myself, and I have everything I need to be successful. The author then describes ways you can use your charisma and uniqueness to improve your future. Your job included. This is definitely a great book for anyone that wants to improve their interactions with others! I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/08/discovering-it-factor-within-you.html#sthash.rDPtH4jC.dpuf

The author of this wonderful book believes that the first 18 months of every person's life is the most important health wise. He writes about changes in a child's brain and talks about how a child develops. He talks about safety around the child, whether at home, in the car or elsewhere. It is a great book for any parent, caregiver or grandparent to read and keep nearby for reference when needed. A very easy to read and helpful book. I give this book a 5/5. I was given this book for a review and all opinions are my own.

We had a horrible event take place in the United States. That is one event that we will never forget, nor will we ever forget those who lost their lives. This is the story about one of those children that we lost on 9/11. Asia was a beautiful young girl who was minding her own business, who had never hurt anyone but was killed because the plane she was in was hijacked. This is the story of how her parents lived through the unthinkable. The hope that their story would be able to help others with grief. I really think that this book is something that anyone who is suffering through a loss should read. I give this book a 5/5. I was given this book for  a review and  all opinions are mine. Freedom is not free.

"Where Christ is Present" by authors  John Warwick Montgomery & Gene Edward Veith is a group of essays that speak about reforms in the church of many years ago that  are still needed in our own time. These are very well written and explained to the reader. The authors are hoping that these will touch some lives. There are some people right now who really need to see what is happening in the church today that will benefit by these .  I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a review and all opinions are my own.

The story of three women called "When Dreams Touch" is the kind of book that grabs your interest from the very first page. The author shares with the reader some of the horrible conditions in Haiti some of which you will not find easy to forget.  It is a very uplifting story of sacrifice and hope. I felt I was right there with the characters in this book. I give this book a 5/5I received this book to review through Beck Valley Books Book Tours, all the opinions above are 100% my own.

This is a very moving story. Two sisters that want to do everything together have gotten married and both want to start a family. They do not have things work out the way that they wanted to. I really enjoyed this story and I loved the way that the author wrote about their feelings. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a review and these are all my opinions .

Sometimes things are not always what they seem to be. Other times they are real but are still unbelievable. Kevin has always had feelings for Lydia but tries to make himself believe that she is not the one for him. Lydia has been making all of the wrong decisions in her life.  Still Lydia after all she has done hopes that there is someone that will be able to still want and love her. Will they ever find their way to each other ?  I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a review and these are all my opinions.

Great journal to have and keep with you. In your car, or in your bedroom. Whenever you need to escape from the grind of everyday life and remember what you are grateful for. There are great pictures and great tidbits from the author. I am giving this book a 5/5. I was given a copy to review. however all opinions are my own.
The last volume that I got to review left me with a very positive outlook. I loved the poetry and all the questions. The set is on my nightstand
This is a great resource for someone that wants to reflect before they go to bed, or after they get up.
questions made me think about my lie in a different way
great reflections
very helpful, eased my mind.

I liked that the author was honest and is spreading awareness. There are so many people waking up every day and dealing with the same issues that the author did. Now they know that they are not alone. I liked the drawings in the books as well, and the format that the book was written in. Journal entries and letters are shared throughout the book. Unconditional love is an amazing thing to have. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This is a great book and I found myself asking what if? I have often thought that winning the lottery would make my life better. However this author made me think about how greedy I would be and if I would really do what was best. This book also has some very interesting characters. There are a lot of people returning from Jimmy's past. They all want a cut of his winnings. Some will stop at nothing to get what they want.  This is part of a series and I would love to read more investigations. I am giving this book a 3/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

I just finished reading "The Stolen Dragon of Quanx" by author Becca Mann. This was a really interesting book. It is the first novel in The Eyes Trilogy and I am sure that any young person that reads this will be excited to read the next book. Kale has got to steal  a dragon egg or there will be big problems. She has to rely on herself to get the job done . Will she be able to do it? Or will it be an impossible task? A great story by a young author. I was given this book for a review and all opinions are mine. I am giving this book a 4/5.

"Irish Meadows" was written about 2 young women who are living in Long Island, New York in the year 1911. Colleen and Brianna O'Leary know what they are expected to do. They are supposed to be good Irish girls and listen to their father. He is making them think that they must marry who he picks for them or they will be putting the horse farm called, Irish Meadows", that their family owns in jeopardy.  Brianna does not want to get married but wants to further her education. Colleen has different ideas. As the time slips away they are getting closer to losing the farm. Both women have to be strong enough to pick their own futures. Will they be strong enough to fight for their own futures? I give this book a 4/5. I was  given this book to review. These opinions are mine.

I love books that include mystery, history and of course love. This book had all of that and so much more. The mystery of who killed Rolland's mother kept me guessing. It was fun and interesting. The historical facts in this book reminded me of all the greats of the past. I would love to be able to meet Jesse James. Jesse James is just one of the many historical figures in this book. The love was there, however it was a sub plot. The best part of this book however is the fantasy aspect. Time travel at it's best. Meeting famous people from the past, changing the future, and Eden really made for a great story. The author has a great style of writing and I was kept hooked until the end. What I also liked was that there was a warning at the beginning that had my mind going, even before I started reading. The author picked a great name for Rolland (reminded me of Stephen King's Roland from The Gunslinger series) and he definitely lives up to my expectations.  I can not wait to read more from this author. I am giving this book a 5/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own

I love Jane Austen, so I knew that I would really like this book. The characters are stubborn and some are so mean that I still dislike them. The wedding plot was good. One last fling is never forgotten. Greg realizes this two years later. I loved the surprise and really thought that this was their happily ever after. However the author threw in a mystery and I could not believe their luck. I related to Greg and Elise because I can relate to bad luck. The ending was good and I was glad that I got three of her books to read. Greg and Elise are in book two as well. I am giving this book a 5/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

Sally Miller is finally in  a better place in her life. She has started to teach and is happy. She has been able to meet with her sister and has met her daughter. Then her world is shattered when she learns that her sister has been killed. The awful thing is that it is just like when her parents were killed years before. Deputy Sheriff Paul Gleason has been trying to help her find out who did this horrible thing. They are at a loss to figure out what has happened. Maybe they can figure out who the murderer is before someone else gets hurt. I really liked this book and I give it a 4/5. I was given this book for a review and all opinions are mine.

Mittie's favorite thing has always been her love of horses. When she is given the chance to ride in an airplane she cannot believe how much she loved it. But, she ahs to help on her family's horse farm. Ames the pilot starts to like Mittie. Then someone else wants to teach her to be a pilot. Then it happens another young woman sets her sights on the man Mittie loves and she has to decide whether to follow her heart or not. Can she have it all?  Anyone who loves adventure both with horses and or flying will like this novel. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a review and these are all my opinions.

I have tried so many times to do a menu plan on my blog, but I always end up fixing something quick and easy, I like that this mom homeschools and knows what it is like to have a house full all day long, while trying to prepare dinner. This book definitely packs a punch at 173 pages. The author starts by describing what food is real and what is not. She then discusses organic foods. I never really thought about local versus organic. I always thought that they were similar. However that is not the case. I also found the quick reference really helpful for when I had questions. There are helpful resources, web links, measurements and conversions. I can not wait to try the recipes! The quotes were also fun to read. The junk food list in pictures was scary and I think that it should be posted everywhere! I am giving this book a 5/5. I was given a copy to review from The Book Club Network Inc, however all opinions are my own.

The author refers to his writing as movel.  A mixture between movie and novel. I must say as I read through this book, I could definitely see this as a movie. At times I felt like a narrator was telling me about the scenes. There is also a mystery. Who is the mystery woman? Does the judge get caught? Or does he pay hush money for the rest of his life? Will P.I Jake Turner solve the case and escape the Latino Kingpin? I enjoyed this book and would love to read more Jake Turner novels! I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This is a very strange book. That is in a good way. The idea of two people writing a story is not knew. However how the authors wrote this story is. They wrote on the spur of the moment and it does not show. The words flow and made a great fantasy book. I would love to read more about this world and more characters from it. I also liked that there were mushroom men and goblins! I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This reminds me of the fact that you can always go home. However when you do your past will be there waiting. I liked that the sisters were all unique and how they were when they were together. Rose's future mother in law is a jerk and I would much rather have her hook up with the guy she met at Starbucks. Rose's mom getting amnesia was interesting too, because it reminded me that she too was once like her daughters. Young and trying to succeed. I can not wait to find out more about the other sisters ! I liked that they were all flowers and I loved that they had a garden to remember their father. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

I liked that this book had a lot of references to different monsters. I also liked the names and puns. It is great for children and adults alike. I was entertained and am eagerly awaiting the next book. The author did a great job of making a fun and exciting world. There is a great quest and the book is a fast read. The author also did a great job with descriptions. For example on page 199  "the darting reapers began to explode in puffs metallic green, like cheap fireworks lighting the fourth of July.". I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are  my own.

"No Poverty Between the Sheets" is a story that shows how much love there can be in  a family with ten children, even if they are poor. It will make you laugh and cry at the same time. The reader  will wish that they  had known this family,  they must have been wonderful to be around.  The author made every page interesting and makes the reader want to keep reading and reading and not want the story to end. I really loved this book and the characters are great. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a  review and these are my opinions.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/08/no-poverty-between-sheets-review.html#sthash.3tV8J4I7.dpuf

Michael Hunter is trying to get his life back on track and he really does not want to get close to anyone. Tracy Campbell is back to her home again where she was a young child. She has come home to be alone with her secret and does not want to share it with anyone. I have read a lot of books by author Irene Hannon and I have liked them. You start to think that you really know these characters and how they act. I liked this story and kind of wished for a little different ending. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing and all opinions are mine.

I have read the first 2 books in the series by Sally Ann Melia. This book is called "Exile". I was very happy to read this book because I wanted to see what had happened to both Guy Erma and  Teodor. These boys are both 13 years old but that is just about the only way that they are alike. One has been  trying to get home, the other has left because he wanted to. Now they are both afraid of the future and what could happen. Are they really friends or just pretending to be ? They are about to have a time in their lives that they will never forget. What are they looking for and what can do if they find it? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a  review all opinions are mine.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/07/exile-by-sally-ann-melia-review.html#sthash.9E4BRjYT.dpuf

"Crazy Little Thing Called Love" is a romance novel that asks a question of the reader that has been asked by others before. "What if what you thought was your biggest mistake was actually your right choice". Author Beth K. Vogt has written a wonderful story about love and romance.  Vanessa Hollister is about to marry one man when she happens to once again meet her high school love who was actually her first husband. The moment that she and Logan see each other after 8 years they are again filled with feelings that they thought were long over. Why is this happening?  Is this what was supposed to happen? Will they end up together? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a review and all opinions are my own.

I just finished reading "From the Start" by Melissa Tagg.  Kate Walker writes  screenplays for made-for-TV movies. Her own love life has been horrible but, she always thought that happy ever after was true. She decides to go home to Maple Valley and try something different.  Colton Greene used to be a NFL quarterback until he was injured. He is staying in Maple Valley with a  friend.  Colton does everything in a big way and Kate is slower. They start to work together and try to do things in a new way. Can this be the beginning they both need? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a review and all opinions are mine.

This is a hard book for me to review. I really liked the idea and plot. It was hard to think about  fetal alcohol effects though, So many children are born into situations that are not their doing. I am really glad that the author is spreading awareness for  fetal alcohol effects. The characters were so likable that I wanted them to end up happy. Dr. Ryan is a good father. I love his sink or swim list! Carly and Ryan definitely belong together. However Carly is refusing to let go of her past and Ryan is focusing on his children. Is their relationship going to sink or swim? I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This is an interesting story about a woman that was a mail order bride. However that falls through and she becomes a teacher. What else could a woman do in 1885? I liked that there were men fighting to be Anthony's dad. Most stories the kids are looking for parents. I liked that Kate was wiling to also help Anthony. Who will end up his parents? will he have a mom and dad that love each other? This was a really nice story. I loved the ending and I can not wait to read more from this author. I am giving this book a 5/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

Marisa is an enemy with a child in her arms. She is trying to protect the baby from Deidre, her enemy. Deidre gets ready and aims, she wants to shoot Marisa and she knows she can and not hurt the child. 25 years have passed and Deidre's mother the High Priestess has been abducted. Her father is gone and Deidre has come back to fight with her sisters. Deidre must work fast to find and save her father before anyone else gets killed. Will she be able to change her  feelings? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a review and these are my opinions.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/07/promise-of-mercy-by-kurt-d-springs.html#sthash.dSuSrEHo.dpuf

I just finished reading a beautiful book by author Cynthia Ruchti called "Tattered and Mended". The book is a self help book that gives the reader examples of how we can make ourselves happy again ever after it seems almost impossible. She goes on to give us heartfelt stories of others and what trials they have gone through in their lives. It is a very nice story of hope and faith. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Litfuse Publicity Company. All opinions a re my own.

"Gone Without a Trace" by Patricia Bradley is the third book in the series called Logan Point by her. I have read the other two and I have loved them all. Livy Reynolds is a homicide detective in Logan Point. She has been wondering about her cousin who has been gone for over two years. Everyone else thinks that Robyn just went away. Now Alex Jennings a investigator from Dallas wants to talk about another missing person who was last seen on Logan Point. This person happens to be a senator's granddaughter and no one can find her either.  Livy is hoping that there is not a connection to the two . When she first meets Alex Jennings she doesn't even like him. But they have to find out what happened so maybe she will have to try to work together. This is a great novel of suspense. I give this book a 4/5. Revell Publishing Group gave me this book for a review. All opinions are mine.

This is a story about all the drama of high school and the drama that is life. The author gives an honest look at mental ailments, college searches and of course young love. Sometimes the only way to get through life is to have a best friend that you can lean on. It helps if that person is your love. I also lived that the book was written in the form of a journal. I liked to see how much time had passed between entries. E.V. also gives an intro at the beginning and a recap at the end. This is a great summer read. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review. however all opinions are my own.

This is a very interesting book that was written before its time. It takes readers to the 70's and the writer has a different background then other writers of this time.It was definitely interesting to read about drug lords and Detroit at that time. I also liked that the characters talked as if they were talking in real life. Rather than "big words" to make a point. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

"Her Sister's Shoes" by Ashley Farley is the story of 3 young women who are sisters that are trying to cope with each other's problems and disappointments in their lives. While one is dealing with a cheating husband, one is dealing with a husband who likes to hurt her, the last is having a horrible time trying to help her son deal with an accident that has left him in a wheelchair. Their mother Lovie seems to be losing it, and she has problems of her own. I really liked the story line and I liked their characters and how they acted with each other. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for a review. All of these are my opinions.

This story has a lot of nice story lines that all meet at the end. I felt bad that Liam was orphaned, and had to live with foster parents. However I liked that he found out who was responsible for it and he wants to make them pay. Add in a great alien world created by the author, and a mysterious and a deadly person in power.  The writer blends them with military members. The end was good and I thought that it was a good fit for Liam. I am looking forward to the next installment. I hope there will be more mentions of Shakespeare, and his works. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

I just finished reading "Beyond the Ashes"  by author Karen Barnett and I really enjoyed it. I liked the storyline and the characters were great. This is a nice story of love, faith and the strong belief that everything will be okay. Ruby Marshall finds herself without a husband when he is killed. She moves to another place where her brother is to start over. While there she meets someone that she begins to like. Will they have a future? I was given this book by Litfuse Publicity Group and opinions are 100% my own. I give this book a 4/5.

I just finished "Nature's Confession" by JL Morin and it was a different kind of book than I usually read. A young man wonders why everyone is not paid more for more important work.  He starts on a unbelievable part of his life. Can anyone help his planet that is full of pollution? He, along with his girlfriend invent computers that are alive. These 2 young people are going to try to save everyone. How can they fight the big groups? Will they find a way to fix everything? Will they begin to care for each other? I give this book s 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a  review and all opinions a re mine.

This was a great book about how to give a better impression about yourself. I liked that the author included a list of resources so I could read further into key points in the book. For instance time management and communication etc. I never really thought about the non-verbal cues before. It was very informative to read about different cues and ethics. There is also a 30 day challenge at the end and I think that it is great to try out, What I liked most was that even though the book is for people starting new jobs, first impressions happen all the time. This is definitely a book that anyone can use. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

"In Firefly Valley" by Amanda Cabot is a truly wonderful novel. Marisa St. George is out of a job so she has to go back where she started. When she meets Blake Kendall she really begins to fall hard for him. But, who is he really? This is part of her Texas Crossroads Series. The characters are the kind that you would like to meet and be friends with. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing and all opinions are my own.

Author Deborah Raney has written another great story.  "Two Roads Home", is the story of two couples. Jessie Pennington and his wife Corinne are doing well because of Jesse's career. They have three  daughters who may be in trouble because of a coworker's false harassment charges. Their marriage is also in trouble. Grant and Audrey Whitman are Corinne's parents who are trying to start a business. Are both couples going to be okay? Will they ever have their former lives back? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of  review and all opinions are my own.

"Desperate Measures" by Sandra Orchard is the ending to the Port Aster Series by her. This is Book 3 in the wonderful series. Kate Adams has been trying to find out what happened to her family a long time ago. The most important question to her is why her father left. She wants so desperately to solve this that she puts herself in danger. Will anyone be able to help her? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing Company for the purpose of a  review and these  are 100% my opinions.

Author Jerome Charyn has written a collection of very interesting stories about people and how they react to different things in their lives. All of the people who the stories are about are unique. The author has a great way of sharing some of his thought with the reader so that they will not want to stop but want to continue reading until the last page. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a  review and all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/06/bitter-bronx-by-jerome-charyn-blog-tour.html#sthash.XwmOVtpP.dpuf

I just finished reading  "Chance Meetings" by author Madhu Bazaz Wangu which is a very nice and thoughtful story collection. Each story will make the reader stop and think about it before they move onto the next one in the book. All of the stories are different. I really enjoyed this collection and I give it a 4/5.I received this book to review through Beck Valley Books Book Tours, all the opinions above are 100% my own.

Anna Gordon is not at all where she wants be in her life. She has found herself being the manager of a small lodge where she has always lived. She finally gets the chance to be someone that she has always wanted to be. She goes to New York City to apply for a better job. But, when she gets there she finds that there is more going on in the big city than she ever even thought of. What will she really find in New York City? Will it be a  future? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a review and all opinions are my own.

Poor Don has to change his ways and can only be with one woman. That is what I thought when I read the info for this book. However it is so much more. The murderer might get away with it if Don takes the fall, There is the nightclub, and of course there is an undercover agent. The book was definitely unique, especially with people hiding in dishwashers and the author's take on certain adult establishments (floating for example). I like the author's style of writing, he has a certain way of making his characters very quirky. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This was a nice story about a mother's love. Andy was a mom that worried, especially when her daughter was a skier that wanted to beat the competition. Hayden pushes herself, and does not always land on her feet. A chance encounter brings Andy and Paul together, however are either ready for a relationship? Paul has his own problems, and Andy is way too busy juggling her job and being a mom. However there may be a way that these three people can find a way to work it all out. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own,

This book made me think about how different countries can be so different, and yet also similar. I liked the mystery of Brenda and her husband. Especially when their granddaughter goes back to where they met. It was very interesting to read about the different ways of life and their beliefs. I also liked how the author described Africa through the years. She has been to Africa, and she used her knowledge in this book. I am giving this book a 4/5.I received this book to review through Beck Valley Books Book Tours, all the opinions above are 100% my own.

I just finished reading "Outlaw Trigger" by Lee Stephen and I really enjoyed this novel. I also read "Dawn of Destiny" by him and I also liked that novel. This is part of the Epic series. The book contained action and suspense that gripped your imagination. I was unable to put it down until I got to the last page. I cannot wait to get another book from this author. Will Scott Remington find out what kind of man he is? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a review and all opinions a re my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/06/outlaw-trigger-by-lee-stephen-giveaway.html#sthash.oAXrseHc.dpuf

This is definitely an epic fantasy novel. Not only was I transported to another place. I also felt like I could not leave until things were set right. This is only book one, and it has a lot to take in and learn about. There were sentences that seemed a little too wordy for me. I felt as though the author took everday words and used a thesaurus to make his sentences. I found myself stopping to understand the context of the writing, and I even had to look some words up. This would not normally bother me, however the author also had special names for the realm he created and the things in it. There was a map and two glossaries. I am giving this book a 3/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/06/at-sharp-end-of-lightning-by-nl-bates.html#sthash.GCBeFxRH.dpuf

This is such a good book. I loved the ending and can not wait for a sequel. The idea that angels are among us is very easy for me to believe. I have lost my dad, and feel as though he is always around me. I like the idea of soul mates always being together, for eternity. However I agree with the story that life gets in the way. How does Ceri know that she is helping in the right way? Would it be easier to ignore her gift and to just focus on now? This is the type of book that left me wondering about Ceri long after I was done reading. Alex is also a character that stayed with me. What was he trying to tell Sheena? I am giving this book a 5/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

Elizabeth Benjamin goes home and tries to be the kind of person her parents wanted her to be. But, now that her mother has died nothing is going right . No one listens to her and her brother doesn't even want her around. Her father is even hiding secrets of his own. This is a novel of family loyalty, and whether or not a young girl must be content to live a very plain life or a wonderful life. What will Elizabeth decide to do? This is a great story of young love and big decisions. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing Company and all opinions are my own.

"Halfa Moon" is the kind of book that you find hard to put down until you have finished reading it. The story line captures your interest from the very first page. It is full of action and suspense and family drama. Meg has tried to keep going despite everything that has happened to her when she was just a young child. She is very lucky that she meets some people that are both willing and able to help her. I felt both happy and sad for her at the same time. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a  review and all opinions are my own.I was given a copy to review from CWA, however all opinions are my own.

Author Suzanne Woods Fisher has given us a collection of short stories about Amish people and how they deal with forgiveness and peacemaking in their everyday life. The Amish have no trouble forgiving others or helping soothe anger from others. These short stories talk about how and why they live this way. It is a very heartwarming collection that you will want to read more than once and share with others. I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing and all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/05/the-heart-of-amish-by-suzanne-woods.html#sthash.qyFzZMBQ.dpuf

This was a nice sequel. It gave me more information on the characters and the world they live in. I really liked how the author describes the dome and the role of the citizens. There was a cliffhanger at the end, but I knew that before I started reading. I loved the appendix of people and places, it helped me to keep everything straight in my head. It was also interesting to me that the author included the pictures in the list of contents. It was fun to be able to go to a certain picture as you were reading about it. This is definitely true for the characters. I can not wait to find out if they get out, and how. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.  - See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/05/hunter-part-two-of-guy-erma-by-sally.html#sthash.wxX9v4o5.dpuf

This is the second book in the "Finders Keepers" Trilogy by Russ Colchamiro. In this volume we follow Jason and Theo across the United States to where all humans and the planet are in deep peril. This book is not only fun but it is also a great story. I really liked the storyline and the characters are great. They will have to stop Milo and then save everyone. I cannot wait for volume 3.  I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a  review and all opinions a re my own.

This book reminds me that so many people get judged for how they look or where they are from. America is a melting pot of all different people and you would think that it is true especially in New York. The author really made me think about how things change over time, and yet some things always remain the same. I really liked that the author focused on the characters and their love for their children. The ending was good as well. There were some words that I had to look up meanings for, however I loved when the author used Latin. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This is a great collection of short stories that correspond to the 9 circles of hell. I liked that some were horror, some had natural disasters and some got in your head and were mentally disturbing. I loved the pictures that were throughout the book and it made the settings stories seem more realistic. 7 of the stories started from actual events and the authors tells you these events at the end of the book. I am a horror fan and some of these freaked me out. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/04/hellfire-damnation-iii-by-connie.html#sthash.ymM70PgO.dpuf

I just finished reading  "Watch the Shadows" and I found it to be an interesting story. I liked the storyline and I liked the characters. I liked the character Nicole and I liked her actions. Things are disappearing more and more and Nicole seems to be on her own. While she is trying to figure out what is happening she has to convince the others in her small tow. I give this book s 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a review and all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/04/watch-shadows-by-robin-winter-book-tour.html#sthash.yeZyEnxl.dpuf

"Revenge in Paradise" is part of The "Paradise Series" of books by author Deborah Brown. This is another great addition to these series of novels. This time Madison has to help a girl who is abused prove that she did not kill her boyfriend. Someone has killed him with the tools that Madison uses in her yard. This is a mystery with a great story line, great characters, action and even some romance. How does she always get into trouble? Will she be able to find the real killer in time? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book for the purpose of a  review and all opinions are my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/05/revenge-in-paradise-by-deborah-brown.html#sthash.qowlKx8w.dpuf

This was a very colorful and imaginative book. I loved that there were so many colors and that there was a lot to talk about while reading with a child. I do not think that this would be a good book for children with sensory input issues. However I also enjoyed that I was able to travel to another world and loved how Nalah was treated by the mice. My favorite part of the story was how there was a sense of family and togetherness. I am giving this book a 3/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This was a great thriller through the streets of America's capitol. Trent was one of those characters that I never knew what he was going to do next. He had so many people looking for him, that I felt like they were always closely behind. A lot of things can happen in DC and I would not want to be in as deep as Trent is. I also thought that Tabitha was a nice addition to the plot. Her past is not perfect, and she definitely has some decisions to make. The ending was good and I especially liked how Trent tells the reader what his plans are for the future. I would love to read a sequel and find out what happens to him and Tabitha. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are my own.

This was a really good introduction to this series. The author created a great world, and I was lost in her imagination. I liked that the science fiction aspect of a dome is easy to believe. However the author added great characters, a feeling of doing whats right, and of course some bad guys. I was really glad that there was a list at the end of the book with names and meanings. The end was a cliffhanger and I am glad that I can dive right into part two. Teodor and Guy are so different that it is interesting to read how they each think and act. I am giving this book a 4/5. I was given a copy to review, however all opinions are all my own.- See more at: http://dealsharingaunt.blogspot.com/2015/05/kidnap-part-one-of-guy-erma-son-of.html#sthash.4PYdnMvY.dpuf

I just finished reading the last page of the novel called "As Love Blooms" by Lorna Seilstad and I really enjoyed reading it.  The way that that the author portrays and writes about the characters made me think that I am right there. Tessa Gregory is starting a new project when Reese King comes into her life. The question is, Is he good for her future?  Are they destined to be together? What does their future hold? I give this book a 4/5. I was given this book by Revell Publishing and all opinions are my own.

At this price point I expect a lot and came away with a good impression; however, there are a few kinks to be worked out before I'd give this 5 stars.To make this short and sweet, I'll just list the good points first:*  Perfect finish without a flaw anywhere. No blemishes in the finish, the lens area was not only tight but perfectly clean and there were no rough edges anywhere.*  This sucker has heft.  With batteries installed I'd guess this puppy weighs a good couple pounds.  You won't notice it underwater but on ground this could double as a secondary personal defense weapon.*  Perfect magnetic switch with no audible clicks, just a smooth push operation.  This torch comes with 3 brightness settings and a slight push of the switch will cycle you right through them.*  Top brightness is blinding on land and lit up my 1,600 square foot home brighter than turning on the lamps. On high power it's so bright that people will turn away.  The lowest level is what you'd expect from a high end standard flashlight.  Yep, it's that bright.Now on the the not-so-great points and why I dinged it a star:*  Should be a fluorescent color, not black.  Impossible to see in dark water or in any absence of light.*  O rings at the battery insertion point bunch up when screwing the head back on.  It got so bad and frustrating I removed the top O ring just to get the head to go back on.  So far the other 2 have kept water from going in but that was at a depth of 10 feet -- who knows what'll happen at deeper levels.*  Instructions?  What instructions?  Guess they assume you'll figure it out.  Obviously made in China since they only note was attached to the lanyard cord and it stated (in cryptic English) not to put this on sand or cast iron.*  Batteries as some generic brand and, in fact, they are completely unbranded as to markings.  Ditto for the charger.Overall, this is a very bright and competent underwater light if you can get past the lack of instructions and frustrating O ring system.  These latter two items need to be worked on, especially given this price point.

First, let me state this is great soap; however, I find the use of "large" or "extra large" to be somewhat misleading.  At best, this is roughly the size of a medium size bar of standard soap although this one is a rectangular block with no curved corners.Other than size, this is one dense bar of soap with a scent that is so prominent it's possible to just use this as a room freshener by just removed it from the wrapper.Lather is rich and luxurious and the scent seems to hang around on the body for an hour or so after use.  So much so, I'd definitely call this a woman's soap, as sexist as that may seem.My only major gripe is the price, which I find to be a bit much for just one bar.

Okay, I’m a guy and there isn’t much to get excited about when it comes to frying pans, but I do the majority of cooking in my household and anything that’ll help in that process is welcome.If first appearances to count, this one wins the game.  The look is definitely retro and in a sea of black and gray pans, this stands out with a hard-to-ignore turquoise finish reminiscent of the 1960s.  Even the handle is color coordinated and that adds to the flair.For those who really care, just the outer area is turquoise with the pan’s center being an off-white or cream with a silver ring along the edge.  What you see in the pictures is what you get.I would call the build quality near top drawer with hardly a mark, blemish or imperfection anywhere.  The non-stick finish was flawless in this respect, a rarity in store-bought pans that often have abrasions from shipping or mass handlings.  I did find the outer surface a little rough, but I’ve been finding this on all of the aluminum pans I’ve looked at so it must be a by-product of the material and not a defect in manufacturing.As for weight, I’d have to state it’s a middle weight.  Not too heavy but not so light it becomes questionable as to longevity among the brutes I have.  It’s aluminum so I expected as much.And now on to the real test -- can this thing cook without sticking or having to use gobs of who-knows-what to keep things from sticking?For my experiment I chose dad’s favorite - eggs.  Keeping to instructions, I used a small dab of something claiming to be “near” butter and keep the heat to a medium setting.  Within a couple of minutes the yellow eyed buggers were cooked and slid out like you-know-what through a goose.  Although it’s hard to tell exactly, it did seem the pan didn’t take as long to cook those eggs as my old Teflon standby.Quite impressive.I also noticed that this pan heats up quickly, much more so than my standard non-aluminum pans.  Just about as quickly as I turned the heat on the butter was starting to melt.So, if I’m so enamored with this pan why did I ding it a star?The restrictions, mainly.For example:#  Low to medium heat only.  What if I want to cook those eggs faster?  Will it cause problems?  I did try it on the second batch of eggs and the increased heat caused the butter to pop and spatter much more than normal.  Guess high heat is a problem here.#  Hand washing is recommended over dishwashers.  On a pan this large I normally hand wash anyway, but dishwashers are not recommended.  This could be a problem for some.#  Butter or certain oils, but not extra virgin olive oil?  That means my girlfriend, who cooks her eggs in that type of oil, can’t use this pan.  Apparently these oil types lead to carbonization, a fancy term for burning and sticking.#  It doesn’t play nicely with other pans in the pantry.  It has to be shielded with paper towels or some other buffer to act as interference so other materials don’t scratch the surface.  I’m generally not that picky when it comes to setting my pans up but I guess this one goes on top of the stack.  To be fair, a lot of pans come with this warning now.Some may also see the utensil restrictions as a hindrance, but I don’t. This one comes with dire warnings about using another other than plastic, silicone or wood utensils but I’ve always used non-metal tools with my pans anyway.Not a bad pan to have in your kitchen and as long as you can live with the restrictions, a worthwhile investment.

Nice necklace with a couple amethyst stones said to resemble a cat (some said it also resembled either a dog or rat). Decent size with a sturdy 18 inch necklace. My only complaint would possibly be the boxing in which he came which is just cheap cardboard with a felt padding and a prominent "Made in China" sticker.As for pricing, it's difficult to assess at this time since Amazon is not published any prices on the website.

If there is one thing to be said for these it's that they are the smoothest writing pens I've ever come across -- ballpoint, roller-ball and all.  I have never seen a ballpoint glide so effortlessly.  In fact, as a test I wrote on the cushioned packaging Amazon sent it in just to see if the point would pierce the outer shell (which is usually the case) and it didn't do anything but glide and leave a perfect line of ink.Bravo, Paper Mate!As for the stylus, it does the job effectively, too; however, there really isn't much to get excited about in the stylus arena.  This isn't to ding the product in that respect, but once you've seen a stylus you've pretty much seen them all.The one design flaw here is the cap -- it's removable.  This pen would have been better served with a click mechanism or a twist barrel.  Making a handwritten note while using your tablet requires you remove the top and then find a place to put it.  Yes, you could just put it on the stylus end but then you've got no stylus.  In addition, the cap makes this one long pen/stylus combo.Still, for the price you can't lose here.  For what you pay for 4 here is what you'd pay for 1 anywhere else.

This is a tough product to review for a couple reasons.  First, it makes a claim of lasting up to 6 hours and, second, it costs substantially more than other air fresheners (although most don’t make any longevity claims).Does this product last 6 hours?I tested this by spraying it in two rooms, the first being 400 square feet and the other being 120.  Both are active bedrooms with the larger having a master bath.While the inhabitants were out for a few hours I sprayed both and left them without any disturbance.My girlfriend caught a whiff of “something” when she came back but my father couldn’t smell anything in his larger room.  Give or take, this was roughly 3 hours after I sprayed.Of course, the bottle states “Up To…” so that can be anywhere from 1 minute up to 5.99 hours, but I’d have to call this one pretty much gone after half the maximum.As for the scent, I’d call it lightly floral but not too overwhelming once the spray settles.  It’s pleasant without being in your face.Now on to the cost.  It’s high to say the least -- way too high.Unfortunately, due to the high cost and somewhat limited longevity of the scent, I’d have to list this as a purchase you might make if you’re having last minute guests that don’t plan on hanging around too long and you need to cover up last night’s liver and onions dinner.Otherwise, it’s an expensive way to add a temporary scent.

High quality hand cream that is perfectly balanced to the point it leaves a satin-like finish after you rub it in.  For the uninitiated, just a little will do the trick so even this small container will last you quite a while (as it should for the price).Also has a pleasant scent that doesn't hang around annoyingly like some other creams I've tried that seem to try impressing others by smelling up the immediate area for an extended period of time (you know who you are).

In the window treatment arena, in my opinion, you have functional, upscale and bohemian designs.While the first two are self-explanatory and may overlap to some degree, the third entry is sort of hard to explain.  They may be functional, but the bohemian designs lack the quality and finish of the upscale offerings.This set is definitely bohemian, i.e., 1960s hippie “hey dude” chic.The pattern is nice with small flowers on a lace type design but the overall cut and finish are somewhat off-putting in comparison. While these curtains did have design, the effort was somewhat questionable.  Instead of straight lines on the sides and bottom, these come with scalloped edges with an occasional straight line here and there.  There are threads sticking out in various areas and so many of these existed I thought it might be part of design until I realized there is no rhyme or reason to their existence (they weren’t every other scallop but were obviously random). Either the machine doing the cutting didn’t have a sharp blade and left some strands or it is part of the design (I did find it odd that every, and I do mean every, one of these strands was exactly the same length).In addition, the top rod pocket isn’t exactly the most even I’ve ever seen.  It seems to go from wide to narrow in various areas and this becomes more evident as you place these on a rod (tight in some areas, loose in others).  The curtains did fit on my standard rod but the combination of loose and tight made movement on the rod difficult.As for weight, let’s just state that if they were any lighter they’d float.  No need to worry if that old rod will support these.  And what of light filtering?  Notice they are called window “treatments” which is another way of saying these aren’t curtains more than a way to cover uglier curtains already up.So, how do these hang?
