Alfredo and I looked in each other's eyes, remembering the dinners in Mazatlan with Marcos.I saw Ricardo in the inky twilight at the Poet's house, Pin and his thick eyeglasses, Arnoldo's smile as he left my house, Camilo talking to me about Woodstock..."But life in Nicaragua remains difficult as the USA supports the expelled Somoza regime, and the Sandinista leaders begin arguing among themselves and losing their revolutionary ideals.Very interesting and highly readable work.

I broke my vibrator the other day.Well, actually my husband broke it.No, that’s not true either. The guy who came to put the new carpet in broke it.He found it under the bed and got the wire caught and somehow broke the wire pulling on it. (At least that’s how we think it happened).But then the next time somebody used it they got a shock and when I went out to the kitchen it was on the counter all taken apart, it’s little guts splayed open and it’s wires spread all around.“What’s “Fred” doing on the kitchen counter?” I asked, or rather, shouted at my husband at the sight of seeing my little guy all opened up like that.“I’m going to fix him.” he said.“But, David, it’ll take you days and days to fix him.”“No it won’t. I promise.”“Yes, it will. I don’t want to wait.”“Well you don’t have a lot of options,” he said. “That’s a very special vibrator.”(Gotta love a guy who has respect for his wife’s vibrator).“I know it is. I’m going to order a new one from Amazon. They have everything.”I’d had Fred for almost 20 years, having bought him in a “women’s specialty shop” in Berkeley, California where a lesbian girlfriend of mine had suggested I go—adding that a then almost 60 year old woman like me wouldn’t be embarrassed to buy her first vibrator there.“They’ll understand,” she’d said, ever so patronizingly.When I went in, I told the guy behind the counter with the stocking cap, goatee, and pierced eyebrows that I was looking for a vibrator, that I’d never had one and what could he tell me about the ones they carried.Turned out he was a really well-informed employee as he definitely asked all the right questions.“Rechargeable battery?” (“Nice option.”)“For you to use alone or with someone else?” (“Both.”)“Underwater?”  (“Underwater? Really?”)“Large wand or small hand held?” (“Show me.”)I picked out the biggest, strongest, most expensive vibrator in the store. The stocking-cap-guy rang it up and I nonchalantly handed him my credit-card as if it meant nothing to me that there was a pair of crotchless panties in the display stand right next to the cash register.He put my new purchase into a nice pink bag and as I carried it outside to where I was parked, I swear, it came alive in my hand. I made a u-turn and immediately headed back to my hotel to try it out.They say you always remember your first love.I had no idea what a wonderful thing a real vibrator could be. I’d been using something else for years without realizing exactly how limiting it was.Don’t get me wrong. It was pretty innovative of me to have even thought of using the flat side of an electric toothbrush to begin with, not to mention brave of me to have tried such a small pointy thing on such a small not-so-pointy part of my anatomy and it was a big step for me to accept that my orgasms were worth $68.00,“A true sign of self-love and sexual self-esteem.” It said so right in the brochure.Today, I still love my big, sleek, shiny, vibrator with its soft/firm rubber knob on the end that moves and twirls and well—vibrates. It never gets tired or stops too soon, doesn’t sit in bars making jokes about the way I smell and doesn’t compare its size to other vibrators. It doesn’t even pretend to understand the words “blow” and “job,” is always ready when I am, and always stays awake.What’s not to love?“I need to introduce you to somebody,” I said to David the first time he got into my bed and, reaching around behind me pulled Fred out from between the pillows.“Well, hello Fred,” my incredibly game husband said. “I think we’re all going to have a really good time together!”Back in the kitchen where my now broken Fred was so sadly laying on the counter, I ran over to the computer and found that in fact Amazon did have an exact replacement.“Look at that, David. They have it”!  And, it could be delivered within two days.“How much is it?” he said.“Who the hell cares,” I said.“Order it,” he said.And I did.Epilogue: When the new vibrator came, David said that we’d have to change its name. I told him no, we didn’t have to change its name.  It was like the Kings of England. “Oh,” he said, “Like Fred the 1st and Fred the 2nd?”“Yes.” I said. “Just like that. He’s Fred the 2nd.”(This review was published on http://www.elephantjournal.com/ in exactly the same form - it was not solicited by me.  It is a true story).

We have used this product (with wonderful success!) for several years and I wouldn't change. In use it lasts - doesn't get sticky, doesn't leave a yucky residue, and pretty much performs exactly like I/we would want it to.  HOWEVER, the bottle I had been getting it in leaked and for travel, it was always a mess.  So, I tried this bottle and voila!  No leaking all over the suitcase.  Wonderful!  This is now the product/package  for me.  BTW, I particularly like that the product itself is odorless.  (to each his own, huh?)

Charming.  Charming.  Charming.  Wonderful book on aging without ever actually mentioning "aging" per se.  Good, slow read.  Great before bed.  Like a glass of warm tea with honey.  Highly recommend it - especially if you are in the autumn of your years.

This is my go to cookbook for vegan/Indian cooking.  Delicious recipes.  Clear explanation of ingredients.  Friendly and helpful narrative.  Inspiring pictures.  The curries are to die for good!  If you like to cook (I do!) and - even if you aren't vegan - these are some of the best Indian recipes you can find.  I recommend this book without reservation.

I just used the last drop of my bottle and I am not going to order another bottle.  I don't know what all the fuss is about this product.  It didn't do a THING for me.  Not a thing.  Forget reducing the wrinkles.  It didn't even make my skin feel or look moist.  I do NOT recommend it.

This product was made by very very small people who then put sizes on them according to what they wear themselves.  Trust me - these are NOT PLUS SIZE TIGHTS!!!  I weight 200 pounds.  Wear size 16 and I could BARELY get the 1X on.  They are also made out of a fabric that is probably not really "fabric" at all and lord only knows how long it will last.  Luckily I only needed them for one outfit I wore on Halloween.  Other than that - they are in my drawer.  They're just too hard to pull up for me to wear them for any other occasion.

I am very, very happy with this product and I use it every chance I get.  It is a "slightly" sweet - not so in your face - subtle sweetner.  It is great in vinaigrettes, stir fries, home made granola, etc., anywhere you want a sweetness that is full but not harsh.  My husband and I are vegan and lots of recipes call for date syrup.  I particularly like this one because of the packaging and keep a backup on hand.

I HATE to wash my hair.  I mean, I hate it.  I have a lot of very fine hair.  Very thick and wavy, but fine.  It takes about 45 minutes to dry it and because it is so fine and (did I mention) dry (oh, and how about damaged from coloring) it gets frizzy frizzy frizzy.  This is of course not helped by the fact that I live in Arizona where the air itself is dry and frizzy!  Anyways - all that has changed since I used this wonderful product.  I had read a review in the NY Times about co-shampoos in general and thought maybe I would like them.  Then I came on here and checked out the reviews and after reading quite a few on quite a few different brands bought this one.  Look!  Five stars!  After only ONE shampoo (co-shampoo?) everything I hated about washing my hair changed.  I could tell the minute I started drying it that there was a difference.  First of all - it took less than half the time to dry!  I figure all that time I spent before was spent on drying the detergent that was in my hair - not on drying my actual hair.  Second of all, this product actually enhanced my waves - making them luscious and almost even curly -- soooo easy to style.  Just shake and bake!  Also it left my hair very, very shiny.  And NO FRIZZ.  I was concerned that the softness that people mentioned in their reviews meant "lank" - but it doesn't.  My hair is actually soft AND thick AND wavy/curly AND shiny AND not frizzy AND I LOVE IT!!!  Boy am I sold.  I am also very impressed with the price on this particular product as compared to others.  Yes.  It does have a coconut smell coming out of the jar - but I didn't notice it once I put a towel around my head.  And yes, I did have to use about three "handfuls" of product - (I used enough to make my hair feel like I could run my fingers through it - and remember, I have a LOT of long fine hair - so I maybe had to use more than somebody else) and I thought I might need another jar every 3-4 washes - but I don't care.  It is so totally worth the money!  This is definitely a keeper for me.  I am thrilled.  Lauren Bacall, here I come!  (Does anybody on Amazon even remember Lauren Bacall??!!!)  LOL!!

I am a 100% Italian/American woman.  That means, over the course of my 70+ years I have used a lot of garlic.  I have never had a garlic "press" and decided to get one because, frankly, I was sick of peeling, smashing, and chopping garlic - not to mention having my hands smelling like garlic forever, having to be sure to wash the chopping block so the apples didn't taste like garlic, etc. etc. etc.  Anyways - when I recently made a recipe (African stew, not Italian) that called for 9 cloves of garlic, I gave up and decided to order a garlic press.  I went to Amazon and -- long story short, after reading all the positive reviews ordered the "Propresser Garlic Press."Long story short.  I don't like it.  :(  But let me tell you why.1)  Once I have placed a garlic clove inside the press, the grip becomes too wide for me to comfortably depress it.  I can do it.  But it's definitely not easy. 2)  I notice that upon first depressing the handles on the press, what emits from the tiny holes is basically garlic juice.  Uh-oh, I says to myself.  "I'm losing flavor from the garlic."  I know, it's going right into the food that I want to have garlic flavor in the first place, yes.  But, I find that it is when cooking the garlic that its true flavors are released and when this garlic "juice" hits the pan, it evaporates.  So, in fact, I DO lose flavor. 3)  Then, in order to get the little garlic "noodles" that are squeezed from the press to fall into the pan I am trying to cook in, I have to scrape them off of the press with a knife blade.  In other words, they do not fall off of the press of their own accord into the pan.  Another awkward and uncomfortable procedure, holding the garlic press over a hot pan with one hand while scraping garlic "noodles" off the press with a knife with the other. 4)  Then, upon opening the press, and examining it's contents to be sure I have entirely pressed the garlic clove, I find that about 10-20% of the pressed garlic remains stuck to the sides, bottom, corners of the press itself.  Uh-oh.  Loss of more garlic flavor. 5)  What I have cooked thus far using the garlic press tastes like it is missing "something" and - to be honest, I think it is the taste of the good old fashioned peeled/smashed/shopped garlic cloves that I can drop into the pan and watch sizzle a little bit before adding other ingredients -instead of evaporating in their own juices.  This means, that to get the full flavor of 3-4 garlic cloves with the garlic press, you need to "press" 5-6 garlic cloves.6)  We do not have a dishwasher.  Have YOU ever tried to wash this garlic press in soapy dishwater?  Even after it has been soaked for an hour or so?  Well, I'm telling you - you cannot get the garlic "gunk" out of it.  (All of which I look at and think how it should have been not in the garlic press but in my pot!)  And that little brush that comes with it?  Nice thought, but totally useless.Need I say more?Actually, I wonder what restaurants really use. Because I know enough to know it is NOT this garlic press.  I had high hopes - but I am greatly disappointed.  Basically this what-could-be-a-wonderful little kitchen tool misses the mark as far as I am concerned.  After all is said and done, I think were I to find a garlic press at Goodwill it would do as good (or as bad) a job as this.  I mean, certainly this falls into the "better mousetrap category."  And in this case, it ain't better than the one that my husband's FIRST wife of 50 years used all during their marriage!All of that being said, because there is a 100% satisfaction guarantee on this product, I returned it.  Granted, there were no questions asked.  And I do mean none. And I was instructed to print a return label.  Bottom line however, I think that the product is itself so cheap to manufacture, it is easier for the distributor to give 100% guarantees than to actually manufactures a garlic press that works.  If there is such a thing.

Yucky!  You put a scoopful in a glass of water (just like it says) and it sits there, floating on top of the water like some kind of insoluable flotsum.  You stir and stir and stir and finally, some of it goes down into the glass and seems to dissolve.  You decide to drink it down in one go because floating around the top of the water are little tiny globules of the stuff and you think you won't notice them if you drink fast.  But, you do notice them!  This is not to mention that it smells -- well, not good.  I am going back to the pills, which I have taken for years.  I only changed because I was sick of taking so many pills.  They worked and they didn't tase or smell bad.  I cannot recommend this product.  I have taken many dissoluable products over the years, this is the worst I have ever tasted or tried to use.  Again, yucky!

I absolutely LOVE this cookbook.  I LOVE the recipies in it.  I LOVE how it introduced me to a plant based way of life AND gave me delicious food to eat while getting acquainted.  I particularly like the way spices are used to flavor food (instead of meat and fat being what is used to flavor food).  I find the spice combinations in this cookbook to be - well, exquisite, if that's not too strong a word to use.  You can actually taste the different layers of flavors in the spice combinations used for Indian, Ethiopian, Mexican, South American, Asian, foods.  Your plate practically lights up.  Wow!  The only thing I would like better would be if the pictures were actually next to the recipies instead of glomped together in the middle of the book.  But - to tell you the honest truth, the book is so full of so many delicious recipies that once I started using them I didn't really care all that much.  I won't go into the whole weight loss thing - suffice to say that part is working too.  I am a devoted home cook.  I have been cooking all my life (and I am 7+ decades old).  I have dozens and dozens of cookbooks.  THIS is the one that helped me to understand what all the fuss is about when it comes to Vegan/plant based cooking.  I only wish there was a second one already in print.  Is there??? And I don't know about it???  :)

It's gory.  But then, it seems that nobody is able to write a book these days without there being some gore in it.  (Amazing how I went through my entire early years reading about the French Revolution without a single specific description of exactly what happens when someone's head is chopped off)!  It's also linguistically "thick" - that is, I felt sometimes like I was having to push aside a jungle of words.  But - it's a fairly good story about a particular POW situation during WWII.  Great descriptions of women (I won't worry about being politically correct here) and how mesmerizing they can be to men - which I, being a woman, liked reading.  Would I read it again?  No.  Will I remember it?  It will probably fade into the all the other books on the shelf in the back of my mind.  If, however, you are a person who, like me, likes first person/memoir type stories, you will probably like this.

If you own a gas station with a Men's and Women's room I definitely recommend this toilet paper - 'cause that's the only place I have ever found such thin, scratchy, basically very cheap stuff.  Call me a princess-and-the-pea(pee?)-type - but I like VERY soft toilet paper and this ain't it.  Don't buy it.

Well written.  Concise.  Nothing linguistically fancy - just plain (gentle, understanding) talk from a doctor who doesn't "sound like a doctor" about death, dying, aging and medicine.  Terrific use of story and examples to narrate situations, a style I found to be compelling and even quite moving.  I am 72 years old.  I asked my daughter to please read/listen to this as I thought it would be helpful to us both if she knew the points and suggestions he makes.  As for the publication of the CD itself?  It would be helpful if the reader announced what CD he was beginning as well as announcing the end of the CD he just finished.  As it is, the CD's open and end with silence, kind of leaving you wondering.

I don't think there is anything particularly "wrong" with this little kitchen tool - so much that I just don't get what all the fuss is about.  It seems to work just fine but had I known how much what it does looks like what I used to do with my good ol potato masher, I would have returned it before I threw out the box.  In particular, I don't like it that you have to plug it in to use it.  Do YOU have an extra plug near the stove?  (Note, the picture does not show a plug/wire).

If we're not eating granola made from these oats, we are eating muselli made from them or - who woulda' thought, oatmeal made from them.  What I particularly like about them is they are a nice chewy, nutty oat.  They hold up no matter what I want to do with them (including mixing them with black beans to make "hamburgers").  I have them on my subscribe and save I like them so much.

I got very sick from this product.  I have micotoxic mold poisoning and I bought this without reading the ingredients, one of which is aspergillus - duh!  aspergillus comes from mold.  I couldn't tell you if it works at all - I can tell you it gave me TERRIBLE stomach cramps, back and leg cramps, indigestion, you name it - all the stuff I've been trying to treat and get rid of for two years.  Too bad I didn't think to READ THE INGREDIENTS before I took it.  I now take Pro-15 -- with no problem and great results.

I bought this product for a new recipe.  Who woulda' thought you could get something in a bottle that actually tastes like smoke!  Delicious little addition to my pantry.  I used it to sprinkle on "baked" French fries -- I am sure I will use it again and again.

I eat a "no oil" plant based diet.  I LOVE having these sliced olives on hand to add to my Mexican dishes.  Adds fat in a full food form.  The olives are al dente (that is, they have a little bit of bite to the teeth) and not soggy.  They are also not too salty and I appreciate the convenience of them being already sliced.  Wouldn't go without having them in my pantry.  I have them on subscribe and save I used them so much.
Note these are CAPLETS.  I ordered them by mistake and OMG, I can't take caplets.  These in particular are toooo big for me.  Ugh.  I am going back to the capsules.

I bought these pads so that I could use assign a different color to each one of my clients.  What can I say - they're legal pads.  They work.  They do just what they're supposed to do.  They're exactly what I expected and I expect they will be for you too - especially if you want different colors for different folks (or projects).
Overrated, nothing new, predictable, if you bought it you're into this kind of stuff and you already know what's inside.  I wouldn't recommend it at all.

How do you "review" a dust pan?  I mean, really.  But here I am - telling you that, hey, this dust pan works really great.  It picks up dust and everything.  (LOL)!  Nice color too.  I just couldn't bring myself to give it five stars - after all, it IS a dust pan.

First of all I did not get this product free or as a gift or anything of the sort.  I actually bought and paid for it.  (That being said, I seem to be the only one who did that - practically every review I read thus far is from someone who did NOT pay for it - what's up with that???)  Anyways, it's no matter I suppose because I found this juicer to be exactly as the manufacturer claims - "Commercial Grade" (i.e., it is definitely heavy duty).  Second of all, it is simple to use you don't even have to have any instructions.  You can figure it all out just by looking at it.  Third of all, it squeezes ALL of the juice out of the lemons and limes I tried it with and; Fourth of all - if the lemon was too big for my grasp (because it opened the handles wider than I was comfortable with) I cut the lemon in thirds and the Bitpsy STILL squeezed out all the juice.  Sufice to say - I love adding this wonderful tool to my kitchen.  Almost every recipe I make calls for either fresh lemon or fresh lime juice.  I am going to look up the manufacturer and see what ELSE they have to offer!  (Maybe a garlic press???)  :)  I gave this product Five stars with no problem and no questions asked.  If you are a home cook - you could not hope for anything better in it's category!  I hope this helps.  It's fairly enthusiastic (LOL) - but I am not exaggerating!

I am not "educated" about pro-biotics - but I know what I have been through.  So this will be a testimonial to this Pro-15 pro-biotics given in the context of my personal experience.  I have been dealing with effects of tricothecine poisoning (from long term exposure to black mold) for almost five years.  I was correctly diagnosed two and a half years ago (with many "interesting" and "creative" diagnoses along the way).  Without going into detail - let me say that I had horrible, horrible indigestion to include all of the symptoms so many others here have mentioned.  Six weeks ago, I saw a doctor who believes that "all problems start with the gut" (Including the symptoms from mold poisoning.  Imagine that!).  Of course his Food Coach recommended probiotics and soon after finding the RIGHT probiotics (Pro-15) ALL of my problems dissipated.  Not right away though.  It took about 3-4 weeks and about 4 pills a day but today, as I write this, I can say that I feel better in my digestion than I have felt in 5 years.  An incredible side effect of taking Pro-15 is that as it began to "clear out my gut" my back and leg pain went away!  Yep.  No lie.  My sick gut caused me intractible, chronic back and leg pain to the extent I thought I was going to have to walk with a cane.  I did have a terrible set back early on that I want to mention.  Because I did not know exactly which pro-biotic to take, I simply came to Amazon and ordered a "Best Selling" product, "Digestive Advantage."  Thinking that all probiotics are made the same, I am sad to say that it was not until I got sicker and sicker and sicker with more and more pain that I decided to READ THE INGREDIENTS.  Amazingly, several of the ingredients in "Digestive Advantage" were from "Aspergillus."  Not good for a person like me already suffering from mold poisoning.  So, Pro-15 had to not only help me with my old sick gut - but it had to fight against the my newly sickened gut from the aspergillus I had taken in "Digestive Advantage."  Along the way, I had e-mail conversations with the supplier of Pro-15 who helped me enormously.  Being a pro-biotic virgin (if I may) I had lots of questions pertaining to the fact that I take loads of charcoal on a daily basis (to "suck up" the tricothecine), etc. etc. I had fast, prompt and extremly informative responses from the Pro-15 representative which only served to enhance my appreciation for the quality of Pro-15.  So as not to have to take 4 pills a day (that being said, they are little round pills, a lot like the little black ones that most Chinese Medicine pills look like and they are very easy to swallow) I am next going to order the Advanced/extra strength pills.  Finally, I also want to add that I would never have found Pro-15 in the first place were it not for all the extremely helpful reviews on this cite.  Thank you all for your thoughtful and informed comments.  For the first time since I have been fighting this poisoning I feel like I am winning the battle.  No yucky acid reflux.  No waking up at night with a hard as rock stomach.  No horrible (ending up in the E/R) pain in the gut.  No cramps and spasms in the lower back and legs (for which I was told I needed back surgery).  No episodes of chest tightness/shortness of breath/weakness in the arms (yes, indigestion can mimic a heart attack), No being able to stand up straight because your gut feel like it is tied in knots.  etc. etc. etc.  You know the drill.  Thank you all again and thank you Pro-15 for your wonderful product.  (Given all the charcoal/etc. pills I take to inhibit the mold poisoning - I am eternally grateful for the time release aspect of your little wonder pills!)  BTW, I am a 72 year old woman.  Never too late to clear out your gut with Pro-15!!!  If you are this far into my post I want to thank you for taking the time to read the entire thing!  I hope it has been of help to you.

I live in Southern Arizona.  Through the years I literally had to stop eating outside in our beautiful summer evenings because of the mosquitos.  I guess that would include not being able to eat breakfast outside either.  Geez - I couldn't even BE outside in the mornings or in the evenings because of the mosquitos.  They literally drove me inside!  THEN I FOUND MOSQUITO BITS.  Within 24 hours of my husband applying it we noticed a difference.  Almost NO mosquitos.  Somewhere, either on the bottle itself or in reviews here, I read that it is not only good to spread the Bits in standing water - but also in flower beds where there is damp and wet soil and I am convinced that THERIN lies the cure!!!  That and applying it REGULARLY as well, like once every 6-7 days.  (I wish I could underline on this page - but I can't, so I use caps and it ends up looking like I am shouting -- Oh, well, I guess I could shout about this product).  It was surprising just how much damp and wet soil we had surrounding our little patio (such as in the tree wells, in the potted plants, etc.)  We had always applied mosquito control products in standing water only, not knowing enough to apply it in damp and wet soil as well.  All of that being said, while I understand this is a review for this product in particular-- I ALSO use an all-natural mosquito fogger that I got here on Amazon.com.  So, my husband and I have what we call a "two-layered" approach.  Not being a biologist in any sense of the word - I tell myself that what the Mosquito Bits doesn't get the mosquito fogger does.  I can't tell you how much we have enjoyed sitting outside on our patio -- even at sunset!  Do I still get bit by mosquitos?  Of course.  But just a little teensie bit.  Compared to having to run in the house scratching and not being able to sit outside at all.  Besides, it beats having to put all yucky lotion all over myself - which is an alternative I just do not like to use.  So?  Bottom line.  I definitely recommend this product -- it is at the very least worth a try.

I am a legal transcriptionist.  I work from home doing verbatim transcription of various legal interviews, courtroom recordings, etc.  Long story short - I am in front of my computer, typing, non-stop at least 6 hours a day.  (Throw in my e-mails, FB responses, etc. and it's probably more like 8 hours a day).  About 5 years ago I began having wrist stiffness and finger numbness.  Uh-oh, I says to myself.  Carpal tunnel.  Yikes!  I bought two wrist stabilizers and a so-called "ergonomic" keyboard.  No change.  Then, a sales person recommended the Microsoft 4000 -- within 3 days my wrist pain and finger numbness disappeared, never to return again.  Even given that the space bar is hard to depress, the number keys are hard to reach, the letters wear off the keys fairly quickly, and you can't really switch back and forth from this keyboard to standard keyboards (meaning, I can't go in and use my husband's computer unless I bring my 4000 with me!) for the reason that it does in fact allow my hands and wrists to operate in a more "natural" way while typing -- I have given it 5 stars.  If you are looking for what I was looking for, that is, a keyboard that will allow you to type all day (and I do mean all day) without causing pain/stiffness and numbness, then from my experience, I can recommend this keyboard.  In fact, I have two - one I use and one I keep as a back up so that I won't miss out on work if I spill anything on the one in use (which has happened many times).  (As an aside, the keyboard is "quiet" enough to not interfere with my sometimes very hard to hear audio recordings - and it's at least as fast as all of the other keyboards I have used.  That may be of course, because my hands and fingers just don't get tired using this keyboard.)

I noticed a difference in my skin immediately.  I am 72 years old.  In good health and in fact, while I have my share of wrinkles, I have fairly good skin.  (I wish I had taken "before" pictures to share here, but I didn't).  Over the years I have used a variety of treatments but felt that my skin was looking "tired" and, well -- old and I found that, after only TWO nights of use, I actually noticed a difference in my appearance.  I would call that an "immediate improvement."  I have been using it for three weeks now.  Have my wrinkles "disappeared?"  Of course not. But the overall appearance of my skin has been markedly improved.  It looks more "moist" and "dewy" and "alive."  My husband noticed it without my even mentioning it.  So - for me this is a terrific product and, while a little pricey, worth it.  BUT -- notice that I have said "FOR ME" this is a terrific product.  It is my thinking that just like medicine, exercise, diet, (and even bathing suits), etc., when it comes to skin care products -- ONE SIZE DOES NOT FIT ALL.  That is - what "fits" me does not necessarily "fit" you.  No matter what the manufacturer tells you.  YOU HAVE TO KEEP LOOKING AND TRYING AND TESTING UNTIL YOU FIND THE PRODUCT THAT WORKS FOR YOU!!!  My skin is not exactly like yours -- or yours - or yours - I don't care what the tests in the laboratories have "proven" -- The bottom line is I am saying that based on the results I personally had, I gave it 5 stars and I think this product is worth you giving it a try.  It may fit/work for you -- on the other hand, it may not.  It is possible, just possible, that you are someone who DOES happen to have skin like mine and that you will benefit virtually overnight from it's use.  If you do not - well, as Bob Dylan says, keep what you like and leave the rest.  In other words, move on to find another product that will do for you what this one did for me.  At its worst it won't "hurt" you - and if you are thinking about this product, you are probably someone who is not horrified at the thought of spending this kind of money for face cream in the first place! (LOL)!  (BTW, I buy it from Amazon because I can use my points - which reduces the cash outlay considerably).It is now December and am back here after almost six months to give an update on this product.  The bottom line is last week I gave away my last half bottle to a friend who had been approached by a distributer.  Yep.  I gave it to her and told her to try it first and not spend her money on it.  Yes.  I did get a noticeable difference within the first few days.  But after that - NOTHING.  And wrinkles??? Are you kidding???  It did absolutely nothing after almost 6 months of consistent, regular use.  Maybe it works for people with younger skin than mine. Who knows.  I can no longer recommend it at all.

I bought this product solely on the reviews, which is a system that usually works just fine for me.  In this case however, what I read in the reviews and what I tasted in this "Pure" extract powder did not match.  I found this stevia to be bitter with a strong aftertaste.  I used it in yoghurt (without telling my husband) and he noticed the taste right away.  It tasted so "funny" that I threw it out.  I have used the little Stevia packets for years - maybe I'm just used to the taste of that product and couldn't adjust.  Who cares?  I only use it to sweeten yoghurt a few times a week.  By the way - the little "scoop" that was supposed to be inside the jar of Kal Pure Extract wasn't there.

I bought it to clean my nebulizer, which is portable and uses soundwaves to force the medication through the breathing tube.  The directions that came with the nebulizer specifically instructed that it be sprayed with water and dried with "gauze" after every use.  (Gauze leaves no lint).  My husband went to the store right away and bought some gauze (Kirkland) and it worked okay.  I then went on Amazon and found this brand to be a better buy.  When I opened one of the little packages I was surprised to find that the pads actually amount to a smaller amount of gauze.  That is, while they were 2" x 2" - the fabric was not as "hefty" as what my husband had brought back from the store.  I expected them to absorb less but I was wrong.  I actually found these little gauze pads to be highly absorbant for their size and weight.  In fact, they were better than the Kirkland pads.  It led me to think that if I were in fact buying them for wound care, these pads would be highly absorbant.  Mind you, I am using them to absorb distilled water and so this is an "experiment" of one - but still, I thought I would share my experience in case it is helpful to someone who is wondering whether to buy this product.  I gave it five stars for the way it behaves for my purposes.

My heading says it all. I use these at home on an open shelf to hold CD's.  I turn the risers upside down and slide the CD's inside -- I space the risers out a few inches and put CD's between them as well.  They hold the CD's perfectly and they look great!  While that's not the reason I bought the risers -- I bought them to raise various objects up off of shelf level on a large bookcase I have -- I suddenly had the idea to put CD's in them and I am so happy with how they look I just now ordered another set of three!  BTW the risers are well made if bright clear acrylic plastic, exactly what I was looking for when I first thought to buy them.  If you are looking for a nice looking riser on which to display any kind of (small, these are smallish -- look at the dimensions) object, they will display them quite nicely.

Nothing like looking down and watching your weight go down (or up) in such beautiful blue letters.  Somehow - it's not as threatening as any other scale I've used.  (LOL!)  Besides that, I really like the look of it.  Doesn't take up a lot of visual space in the bathroom and doesn't scream "she's trying to lose weight" like so many other scales do!  (LOL).  Is quite flat and fits closely to the floor.  Doesn't wobble when you stand on it, giving you the feeling that it's weight is accurate and not a "guessing game."  I highly recommend it -- (BTW, when I went to my doctor last - guess what scale HE was using! - yep.  This one!)

Yep.  I am "computer" illiterate - and (I could hardly believe it) this little puppy came without even an instruction booklet -- PERFECT for dummies like me.  I just turned it on and figured it out!  I bought it to play solitaire on and to read my books on.  Turns out I REALLY love reading on it.  Especially because I can enlarge the type!!!  What a concept!  I have now moved on to adding the New York Times app and an app for my E-mail -- who knows what's next!?!!  (BTW, what pushed me finally into buying it was the "monthly payment" plan Amazon ran last month.  Thank you Amazon!)

I swear I could grind up my car in this little thing!  (LOL!) I LOVE it.  I use it at least twice a day for fresh tomato juice in the morning and fruit smoothies in the afternoon.  I went to the Market-on-the-Move and bought 60 pounds of tomatoes and ground them all up in the Bullet and cooked them into tomato sauce -- that little Bullet just kept on grinding away untill all 60 pounds of those tomatoes were gone.  I keep it out on the counter for easy access.  And speaking of easy, it is easy to use and EASY to clean.  AND WAY EASIER than my mini-food processer for making small sauces, salad dressings, moles, etc.  Be careful about filling it up beyond the level on the container else it will leak (mine did a couple of times) but I had read the reviews warning against this and against filling it too much and paid heed and reigned myself in.  I am thinking of giving one to each of my daughters next Christmas.  Very, very happy with this product.  FINALLLY something that does what the manufacturer says it will do.

Of course I suppose it depends on what kind of pain you are having - but in my case, I might as well have used Crisco.  Just didn't do a thing.  Am using it to give my husband back rubs just to use it up.  Might work for other - in fact, based on the reviews, I am sure it has, but it didn't work for me.

Looks a little like a mechanic's stool but hey - what's not to like?  It works AND it folds up - so it's right handy.  Believe it or not, I had a little trouble figuring out how to exactly unfold it - but my husband helped me.  (LOL)! and now - I keep it folded up right by that top shelf in my kitchen that I can't reach.  The stool is just the uplift I need.  Nice and sturdy and I can put both feet on it at the same time.  Woo Hoo!

You could "almost" throw away your toothbrush - that's how clean this product leaves your mouth feeling.  My teeth even feel smooth afterwards.  Have used other brands but nothing compares to the "fresh" clean taste AND after taste of this one.  I have it on my subscribe and save - Highly recommend it.

Snappy.  Cruncy.  Alive with almond flavor.  No "papery" taste.  Fresh.  I toss them with olive oil and tamari sauce and salt and slow roast them (225 degrees) in the oven until they are golden brown and OMG!!!!  We eat so many of them I have them on my subscribe and save.  They are simply the freshest and most delicious raw almonds I have ever bought and when I first got them and tated them I said to myself "so THIS is what raw almonds are supposed to taste like!" I recommend them 100%.

I can't say enough about this WONDERFUL "pasta" -- you really can't tell it's not semolina -- especially if you are gluten reduced or gluten free.  I have used this Penne in marinara sauce, in oil and galic and anchovie sauce, pasta fa joile (sp?) and in meat sauce -- I have added it to soups and to tuna salad.  All with perfect results.  When I ordered it, based on the reviews I read here, I went ahead and got a case of it - I was so excited to be able to eat "pasta" again - and I'm not sorry I did.  It has replaced the product I was using entirely.  The only thing about it - which is small enough for me to still give it a five star rating but -- big enough for me to mention - is that it doesn't reheat well.  Breaks apart.  Softens too much.  This is an easy enough matter to deal with - just cook one serving at a time and don't plan on reheating it.  Other than that, Mangia!

I had noticed my husband's continued bad breath after a "cold" he had several months ago.  Finally, it occurred to me that he was having some kind of residual sinus involvement and that that was what as causing the odor.  Because I have been familiar with grapefruit seed as a "natural antibiotic" I had some of this on hand.  When he used that up - I found a replacement on Amazon (gotta' LOVE Amazon).  Anyways - after about 4-5 days, bad breath gone.  He said he noticed right away that he could breathe better.  (He is still using it and will continue to use it for a total of 30 days). Good product.  Reliable.  And like all natural products - doesn't cause effects other than the ones you would hope for.  I highly recommend it - in fact, I would recommned that someone keep it on hand in their medicine chest.

*I received this item in exchange for an honest review*I liked the idea of this. My problem, is the keys are so close together that I kept having issues typing fast. I found it hard to really get into this book. It was an interesting theory of the Bermuda Triangle. The explanation, when we finally get around to it, is intriguing. I've always had an interest in this topic and was excited to have a fictional novel about it. The story starts out with a bang. The first 20% was highly interesting. The problem being, it took so long for explanations and they were long winded, I found myself setting this book aside for days at a time, fighting to finish it. I wanted to know if those trapped on this island, made it out, so I kept with it. If you're into sci-fi, and not much action, this is going to be a great read for you. I wanted to see more action. Less explaining, more doing. The author has a great way of creating a scene. Making sure you know what everything looks like. The descriptions were fluid and in depth. I think what it lacked, besides action, was an emotional connection. Yes, they try to create a romance between two of the characters, but they are so quickly separated that it's a fleeting moment. In all this is a well written sci fi story, I just feel that for me, and my taste, it wasn't a knock out, five star read.

Well worth reading.
