But for me, meshing the two genres just didn't work.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*So, I've read Summer's Angel by this author and I have to say this book is a step up. I feel the author grew in their writing. This book was more interesting, easier to follow and actually held my interest. There were a few editing errors, but nothing drastic. I loved the story and plot line. I wasn't a fan of the BDSM talk/sex. I felt the story was so much better without it. (It's not an overtly erotic book) it ust didn't feel right. The story would have been 5 stars for me without it. I was into the sweet romance aspect. I feel the sex ruined it. I look forward to more from this author as they grow and learn. The cliffhanger ending is not one that will make you angry you read the book, maybe. It does hold your interest and I'm certainly looking forward to the next book.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*This was a twisting, turning, emotional ride. I feel like that characters had so much going on, not only with each other but with those in their lives. Hit men, on each others lists, do they take each other out or not? At times I felt a little confused, but in all it certainly was an interesting story.

*I received this item in exchange for an honest review*I didn't see any brightening in my skin. I really don't have any wrinkles to see how well it plumped them up, so I can't review based on that. This serum is thick but rubs on easily and soaks into your skin quickly. There's no oily residue but my face feels sticky afterwards. So I only use it before bed. And I have to wash my pillow cases a lot. But, my skin is softer from using it. I would suggest you wash your face in the morning.

I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased feedbackThis was actually a nice cream. In the summer my neck and face gets very dry. My skin flakes and it's quite annoying. Unlike most creams, this wasn't oily. It went on smooth and after a few days I noticed the dry areas on my neck and face were smooth. They weren't flaky anymore. I didn't not any brightening to my skin, but it certainly helped mositurize my skin.

I received this in exchange for an honest reviewI have no clue how to start a fire, I'm pretty sure that if I was stranded in the woods by myself that I would never be able to save myself. But, it's nice to know that if I really really tried, I could use this bracelet to possibly start a fire and not freeze to death. Now, just to remember to put it on when I'm in the woods. Pulling this apart doesn't look easy. But hey, who knows what you can do when you're lost and need to survive. Maybe you could use the paracord to trip up some zombies in the apocalypse, or light a fire to cook (if you can figure out how to light a fire with this thing) because I'm still confused on that.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*This is a great bundle. Two stories in one. Both about sexy spankings.In First Time by Jennifer Lynne, we have a couple trying to save their marriage, and what a sexy way to try, huh? Can it help? Oh, such an erotic tale.Then we have Domestic Discipline from Roz Lee. Of course you need to get all your secrets out before you marry someone. Otherwise you spend your life together unhappy. So, this sexy story certainly helps finish you off in the erotic set.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*I love this series. These books have some strong, passionate, alpha men with opinions and ideas that get in the way of their hearts! Pair them with some strong women and the stories just explode. Cain and Violet are no exception to this. You get that horrible teenage love triangle with them and their best friend Jeremy. But with Jeremy out of the picture, you have two people who can't admit that they love each other. Their romance was phenomenal. Heart breaking, romantic and full blown sexy. The only downfall is that I wish there was more fighting! That's one of my favorite parts of this series. The fights, the sweat, the blood! There's something about a man beating on another man that just amps up the sexy factor in this series. In all, the books are stand alone, so it doesn't matter that this is #4 in the series, you can start here and work your way back if you want. They are all amazing books!

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*Though this was an interesting romance, it was long, drawn out and I feel that it dragged way too slow. There were periods of slow moving scenes, the intermittion movie script parts, I feel took away from keeping me into the story. If it had flowed better, it would have been a 4 or 5 star romance. I loved Ivy and Logan. They were great together. Again, this story was just a great romance, it just needed some trimming down.The animosity between the stars of the movie was well done. The way the story played out turned it into a beautiful romance. I loved each character and the ending certianly shocked me, but was great. It was a great book. Truly, it was. I just hate slow moving stories that are held back by things that aren't necessary to the romance.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*Wow, that's the first word that comes to mind after reading this book. I was highly impressed and am so looking forward to reading more by this author! The story was captivating, sexy, romantic and had some great action in it."Ye're a strong wee thing. I've half a mind to let ye toss a few cabers at the next games."I love the Scottish accent and if you're anything like me, when you read books like this, you hear that accent in your mind as you read the words. Kieran and Mariel are just amazing characters. I felt connected to them in a way that sucked me into their story. I enjoy Highland books, but this really is just a wonderfully written story. Some historicals get slow and drag down in pace, and are too long. This book was just perfect. The pace was kept smooth and flowy, the story had no gaps and I read the last page with a big, bright smile on my face. I look forward to more from this author.

I have to say, I've always been a sucker for a good action book. Nelson Demille was my favorite author until I got my kindle and found so many other books to read. Weekly I'd be at the book story buying another paperback. So, needless to say, when I tell you I'm in love with these books, I mean it.This author knows how to write a suspenseful novel. Jack Noble is my new favorite action character. The suspense is so well written. The action is almost non-stop. I do feel bad that he has no luck with the ladies, but Noble doesn't need it. He's smart, strong and brings you one of the most amazing action novels out there. I'm dying to read more by this author, and about this character. You won't be disappointed in reading this box set!

So, I've read all of the Dare books by this author. I've started going back to read the "Classics". This was actually a great book. I loved the interactions between Chelsie and Griff. Wow. Anger, Passion, Betrayal, Love, Fireworks. It was hot, sexy and certainly tear-worthy. There were spots that just had me tearing up. But it also warms your heart! If you want a good romance, good like they used to be, where you steal a book from your grandmother and hide it in your bedroom good...... grab this book! It certainly was nostalgic and just wonderfully romantic.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*I am an avid Historical Romance reader. I love the historicals. They are always sexy and interesting, action and more. This book, though a cute premise and wonderful characters, it was so long and dragged on and on, that I got bored. I wanted to know what happened, but the in between parts were just way to long in between and I wanted to stop reading.Of course, I didn't, I finished the book. How could I not? I needed to know what happened. Beyond getting bored by how long the story felt, I thought the girls were fun. The games they played, trying to set Jane and Garrett up together were adorable. I felt they were silly and fun characters. Jane, well she was independent, head strong and wonderful. I feel if I lived in that area, she so would be me! Garrett, well damn. The man couldn't figure out what he wanted, but he was so hot it didn't matter. I fell in love with this man.The drama was great. It flowed well without being over the top. I've read some where the drama is so far fatched and too much that I end up rolling my eyes instead of enjoying it. That's not this book. The plot was just wonderful, I only feel it could have been trimmed down a bit to flow the whole story better! If you enjoy historicals, I certainly suggest this author.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*I love these two. This was a sweet romance that gripped me in it's tale. Jess runs from her past and Cole just wants her. I loved the characters. The drama wasn't over the top. It was perfect for the story. The plot was a wonderful read. Horses, ranch life, small town, this book has it all and it's truly a wonderful read. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that it dragged on a little in some places, but the most part, it was a wonderful flow.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*I really loved the first book in this series. This one wasn't bad. It was just, over done for me. The Outlaws and the Belles. Hate each other, fall in love. Blah Blah. Over and over, I feel like this book is identical to the other one basically. Yes, the story line slightly shifts and changes. It was Cameron who's wild, Saint who's in love but won't act on it.I just feel like other than the names, these stories were the same as the other girl. It was too similar for me to really enjoy it. I suppose that's the way with some series. The books are all so alike that it's just over done and I feel that's how it was with this one. But, if you haven't read the series yet, you could certainly start here. It's a funny romantic comedy.Cameron and Saint get themselves into some trouble. Mayor Judy is always sticking her nose in everyone's business and leading the Sheriff around by his nose. There are some great parts to this book. Like I said, it was too redundant.

*I received these in exchange for an honest review*These bottles are great. Perfect for traveling with my shampoo and conditioner in my suitcase. They close and seal well, they are thin material so that you can squeeze them and get every last drop. These are worth picking up if you travel a lot.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*I found this to be an exciting sexy book. A God of Sex and Love, a passionate story about friends who don't realize they love each other. This book had me fanning myself, squirming in my seat and hot damn, what an amazing read. I'm going back to find the first two books in this series.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review.*The beginning dragged on for me. I had to put it aside for a few days and come back. I just felt that it was so 'this is this and this is that' matter of a fact, that it didn't feel like a story. And there was so much, it just didn't feel right. But, as the story moves on, I got more into it. Antoine ended up being a great character and I'm looking forward to more.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*I was so enraptured by this book, I couldn't put it down. It was one of those feel good romances. It was more romantic than worrying about sex. It left me smiling!Talk about a McCoy and Hatfield feud. The two families of Bitter Creek: The Flynn's and the Grayhawks have a long running feud. When Eve and Connor finally put their differences aside to help each other and his kids after he gets custody of them, sparks fly and more! I loved this whole story. Their past, their present, there's no way you can read this book and not be grinning like a love sick idiot when you're done! I loved it!

Well, it was interesting but it was super short and I hate the way the cliffhanger fell! It left a bad distaste in the story for me. I'm not even interested enough to go read more. It was barely a story, more a tease to an actual story.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*Wow, this was the first Step-brother romance I've read. I mean, I see it's a thing now, there's lots of them, but this is the first I've ventured in to and holy heck! This was one super sexy story that had me panting, fanning myself and running for my nightstand!So we have Cage, he's bad, he's a fighter, had a rough life. Pretty much an independent, do what he wants type.Then there's Abby, the chubby pretty rich girl that lives with his long lost father. She tries to be nice to people but they think they can walk all over her because they pay attention to her. Not cool at all! In comes Cage and holy sexiness commences!!!! This is one sexy book, without being gross. I mean, stepbrother, if you're adults and it's a new marriage, it's not like you've grown up together you're whole life. It's ok to be attracted to them, and damn, this author has turned that into one burning page after another of a story!Check it out!

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*So, Dani and Rand. Not your typical, from the wrong side of the tracks romance. Dani is actually a con artist, a theif, and more. But, she has some morals. Of course she helps when 'little bro' comes calling. And here's Rand, who's from the rich family, perfect life, or so you think. We quickly find out that's not the truth. From there, the relationship builds. Dani gets Rand to do things she would have never thought a man like him could do. Rand gets Dani to give up control. This was actually a fun, sexy romance. It will keep you on your toes page by page. The characters are likeable, the plot was decent, and not completely over done, so it's certainly a sexy way to spend your day.

*I received this product in exchange for an honest review*I was happy with this when I first got it. Oh man, I have a habit of going out for the night, using my phone for tons of photos, and then it's dead before it's time to go home. This was a lifesaver I could keep in my purse to remedy that. But, once it was dead, I let it recharge all day, so I could take it with me that night and it hasn't worked since. It won't charge anything else at all. So I was happy with it when it worked but now I'm very unhappy with it. Maybe I got a defective one, I'm not sure.

For a package that should be a mix of coffees and teas and whatever else, I had 3 coffee's out of the whole package!!! The rest was teas, hot cocoa's, caps, I was expecting more coffee than hot ciders and everything I got, I was not satisfied with the assortment I got.

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*Ok, let's keep it simple.1. I love this series.2. I love dragons.3. I love Gerri!4. Why are you not reading this series? I mean seriously, they are short, quick, fun, sexy, burn your panties and use a mop reading! You could quite possibly read book 1-8 in 1 day, and still have time to go use your BOB in between each one! They are all stand alone and you should be running to get them all now!

*I received this book in exchange for an honest review*This was a good book. I still like Garrett more, but it was good. I love Hockey, and by that, I mean, I live in Buffalo where we eat, sleep and breathe hockey. So I love a good sexy hockey romance! The first thing I thought when reading this book, was that Zack was angry. And I mean, angry. He was a dick. But as the story goes on, we know why, we get it, understand it and see him change. Kate, well, Kate was an ugly duckling, which was awesome. For once, she wasn't an impossible to believe super sexy beautiful woman. She was real. Baggy clothes, no makeup. I loved her. She felt real, normal. This is a book about finding yourself after a great loss. The characters are very enjoyable and there's no way you can't love this series!

*I received this book free in exchange for an honest review*I loved this story. This is one of those feel good sweet tomances that Harlequin is known for. The boss and the assistant. The over seas trip. Beautiful countryside. This was just a sweet romantic tale. I loved it. Throw in planning a royal wedding and damn.With sweet things like:"You can't keep yourself locked away from love because you're afraid. Some things are worth the risk." This was a book that would leave you smiling when you're done! If you want a beautiful story that makes you smile, isn't overtly erotic, but just sweet and full of love? Read this!

This was a funny story. I loved the exchange of heartbreak. Sam and Zoe have some horror stories to tell. The story is a fun, laugh at their horror type read. It keeps you engaged and interested. The characters are likable and realistic. I'm actually interested to see what happens to the next couple..The only reasons I didn't rate it a 5 was the format and editing. I got this copy off of Amazon, paid for it. Yet it read like a bad PDF. There were paragraphs and pages that ended and repeated on the next page. It happened throughout the whole book. The editing could use some work. There were spots of than instead of then. Correctly spelled, but wrong word, or missing words in sentences. A quick pass through from an experienced editor would make this a much better story.

I'm a health food nut, so Nutpods were destined to be in my life.....truthfully, I had given up ever finding a creamer that was A) Healthy and B) actually compared in richness to the old coffee creamers I used back in the day when I still thought I could eat healthy without reading labels. But hope springs eternal, and I decided to try one more. Glad I did. This adds just the right touch to my decaf, organic coffee in the mornings. I was already adding collagen powder, colostrum, gelatin powder, coconut oil, and Ghee. Yes, my life is pretty much an ongoing science experiment, but it's great when my potions taste great as well. I will buy this again. At first sip, I thought the Hazelnut might be a tad too strong, but it mellows out, and I'm pretty much into this flavor.

I research every product I use to the nth degree, and this is one of the top 3 colostrum powders. I've tried all 3, and I'll probably stay with this one as the price and quality are there for me. I've gone through 2 years of serious digestion problems, and I won't go into all that I've done for it, but it has been a struggle as I don't use OTC or prescription meds. Not even an aspirin. I'm a healthy senior who eats organic, walks, and does yoga. Despite all this, I couldn't seem to find the answer, having spent hundreds, even thousands, on supplements I had read about. When I found colostrum, my body had begun healing and was ready for something to take me into maintenance. I take one scoop (they're quite small) each morning in my organic decaf coffee and stir it in with a little frother, or two if I'm feeling the tummy acting up again, but at this point, I'm eating whatever I want, any time of day, and feeling "normal".  Such a relief! I expect to use Synertek Colostrum for the rest of my life.

I have a jewelry box full of nice earrings of every description, but mostly I don't wear them. These are just what I was looking for, to leave in all the time, earrings that are comfortable enough to sleep in. They are quite small but substantial enough, look like quality hoops, and add a little sparkle to my face, even when I look into the mirror for the first time in the morning :) They are hard to get in but only because the place where the wire is supposed to click back into the tube is so hard to see. So, once I figured out how to get the wires through the holes in my ears, I took my time, even resting in between, and finally got that little "click". I would not use them if I were planning to take them off very often, but they are perfect for my needs. I got the rose gold, which I love, and may order some white gold or yellow eventually.

I bought this as body cream. It's early fall now, still humid and hot here, and the stuff is just too sticky, heavy, and greasy and has a cloying chemical scent. I'm hoping that with less humidity and cooler temps I can use it up, possibly combining it with my organic hyacinth lotion. Will not repurchase.

We've bought expensive grill covers and cheap ones, like this one. They all split in a few months, usually just after the return date. This is has a split all the way down the end. From our experience, buy as cheaply as you can so there's less remorse when they die.

I bought these to add my my kombucha tea fermentation for added vitamin C. The rose hips I had bought in the past were already crushed, and I had a little learning curve with these. The whole rose hips float in my hot tea brew, and I doubt much nutrition gets added. So now I crush them with a rolling pin, and they work just fine. I strain them out, along with 4 kinds of organic tea leaves and hibiscus flower before adding the tea to my ferment vat with 2 kinds of organic sugar, local spring water and my SCOBY........ I will buy these again. I prefer dealing with whole products even when it's a little more work.

My dog eats these, but I'm giving them 3 stars for inconsistency. The first bag I bought, the sticks were dry and hard as a rock, literally. They could not be broken up, and I could barely cut them into with kitchen shears. I thought that's how they were supposed to be, but the second bag is soft, somewhat greasy feeling, and I keep smelling them to be sure they're not rancid or moldy. He eats these as well. I'm confused. Are they supposed to be hard and dry or soft and greasy? On a positive note, my Shih Tzu is super finicky, and it's good to find a treat he'll eat. I'm not sure if I'll buy them again.

Over the years, since I was a teen, my hair has been my own private science project, sometimes with great results, sometimes not so much. Good thing about hair, it will always grow off....So here I am, 75% grey in front, graduating to 75% brunette in back, and it's not a pretty grey. It just makes me look tired....I've wished for the platinum tresses in magazines, and I found an excellent tutorial on how to achieve such platinum-ness. But even using all the high dollar fillers, toners, etc., my hair would not remain platinum and always settled after a few days into a very pretty, believable light blonde, which was fun but really made my skin tones look washed out. And I decided I did not want to go into these autumnal years having to bleach roots and redo the whole process every 4-6 weeks. So, I began looking around for alternatives, and I have my plans laid for low-lighting my way back into an eventually more natural color, somewhere betwixt brunette and soft grey, but I ordered this just to see what it would do in the meantime, and it changed my hair (almost) back to its natural brunette with all the shade variations! I've got about an inch of regrowth, and it softens the line somewhat, so I've got more time to decide how I want to handle this. It comes off on my pillow if I perspire at all at night, but for the time being I'm happy with it. I have very fine, porous hair, and lots of it. Fanciful Temporary Hair Color also gives me a bit of volumizing. It raises some concerns on the EWG Skin Deep site where it got an overall 5 but as high as 7 on specific toxicology, so worth a read, and I don't plan on using it for very long. Natural is better, but I think this will help me get there.

Glycine helps me sleep more soundly, something I've been having trouble with the past few years. It only takes a small amount for me, 1/8 tsp at night, which I put under my tongue and let dissolve, or I stir it into a cup of herbal tea like Nighty-Night or Easy Now because it's sweet. I'm very sensitive to any supplements, though, and I have to find the right amount. One night I had the bright idea of taking it both ways, thus a whopping 1/4 tsp in all, and I was up most of the night, feeling buzzed, so too much has the exact opposite effect on me. I'm happy with the company. I put some bulk powders in capsules, but there's no need with glycine.

I've been using Source Naturals Melatonin for at least 20 years, and this is my favorite formula. I've run out occasionally and tried other brands that I could find locally, but they don't do the job. They're on my Subscribe & Save list. When I find something that works, I'm always afraid they'll stop making it, so I stock up a bit. Sleep is a delicate and personal subject for some of us, especially later in life. I take no prescription or OTC drugs. Period. So it's awesome to have something natural that works for me. If it doesn't work for you, don't give up and go to a medication. Research, research, and try different combinations till something does it for you.

Like all Willow Tree figures that I own, this one spoke to me. I see myself as a young girl, and I have her sitting here at the PC to remind me to embrace that childlike hope. I ordered the darker skin and hair because I'm a brunette, and back in the day I liked a tan. I don't really "collect" the figurines, but when I see one that touches my heart, I'd best go ahead and order because that one belongs with me.

These work fine. I ordered 2 of them for the guest bedroom and wasn't surprised that they're made for much deeper mattresses than my older ones in there, but we wrestled them on and tucked the excess under the mattresses, and they look okay. They do seem sort of fragile, especially around the zipper, and I thought I'd ripped one zipper out but then found it was folded back on itself, so all's well. They're air tight, so I had to unzip to get all the air out, which I would say is a plus. I would most likely purchase them again.

Ginger is said to treat everything from cancer to joint pain and digestive problems.  I've had some pretty serious digestion issues, and these are part of my protocol that keeps things moving. I have tried a lot of ginger candies, and I keep coming back to these. I ordered from another seller, and all the candies were stuck so tightly to their wrappers that I returned them. I haven't had that problem from these. The evening meal is all that bothers me, so I take Swedish Bitters and digestive enzymes (one that contains HCL) before the meal and then afterwards I have a Planetary Herbals chewable DGL and 2 of these. I don't care for the licorice, but I look forward to my Ginger Chews.

I have a sizable library of exercise DVDs, and I simply can't get into this one. I bought it because I have stiff muscles and sore spots, thinking that it would "unlock muscles in your core", as it says.  It's more like synchronized flailing than stretching. It will get your pulse rate up, but it's so fast I can't feel any stretching or relaxing of muscles. Back to yoga.

I thought I had reviewed this hair color, but I can't find it. Anyway, I narrowly escaped major disaster when I used one of the two boxes I received. My first instinct was, well, it's all natural; what damage can it do? It will probably wash out quickly if I don't like the color. And I almost put it all over my hair, but at the last moment I stopped and just did one rather large strand of hair on the left of my forehead. Thank all the gods there be that I didn't do my whole head! The color could only be described as bright copper on my 75% grey hair...... it literally GLOWED. Not to worry, it will wash out in a few shampoos, but it never washed out, for months, until I frosted my hair and bleached it out. I'm 60+, and it looked like some of the teenage color experiments I see online, not quite my style ^,,^ The second box is in the back of the cabinet along with my collection other bath and beauty products that will never be used......I wish there were a collective where we could all try each others' throw-aways.I'm glad it works so well for some. My advice would be if you have predominantly grey or very light hair (mine is also quite porous), do a test strand somewhere that it won't show first.

I bought 2 of these to put over my fig bushes to keep birds from eating the fruit. They're working out fine, providing just a little shade from our blazing hot southern sun, and the birds and squirrels haven't figured out yet how to get underneath. The fabric seems to be holding up, so I plan to take it down (stapled to the fence) at the end of the season and save it.

This is a nice dish. I used it as the bottom of an orchid terrarium in which I placed a glass cloche, on gravels so there's a little breathing room between glass and dish. The dish doesn't look cheap like some Terra Cotta pieces.....Just what I wanted. My orchid is actually living. We'll see if it blooms :)

I just keep ordering these. I've got at least one in every color except speckled white. I love cropped tops, and I love the way the V-neck lays on my shoulders. I'm 5'2" and on the lean side, but I have learned that with today's styles I need a "large" because they give me the loose, flowing fit I'm looking for, but these do have some shape so I don't look like I'm wearing a tent. They look especially cute with a matching or contrasting cami so that bits and pieces peek out now and then. When I find a piece of clothing I really like, I stock up. I've worn the black one most, and it's starting to fuzz up a bit, so I plan to start washing them in a garment bag. You'll need some velvet hangers because they will slip right off even nice plastic hangers and disappear to the bottom of the closet. I don't think anybody has ever noticed there's a tiny crystal in back, but I like the little added touch.

If you are short and don't plan to wear high heels with these, look elsewhere. I should have paid attention to the chart that clearly shows that the inseam is exactly the same whether you're buying XXX-Large or Small. I'm 5'2" tall and bought 2 pairs in Small, both of which were at least 4 inches dragging on the floor with my sandals on. Returned both, had to pay shipping on one. Lesson learned.

I have an older printing of this book, and to tell you the truth when I first looked into it, I thought it's just too much mumbo-jumbo from another culture for me to wrap my brain around. So it sat there for years. Last week, I took it out again, and this time, I can't put it down. The Tao says when the student is ready the teacher will appear. I guess I was finally ready. It's well planned, with two indexes. If you happen to look into the last one, you may think it's doesn't give much help, but that one's only about the herbs mentioned. Chapters and sections are logical and give you time to absorb one concept before going on to the next.....Yes, I still have much to learn, and I've marked and written in this book till I might have to buy a second one just to have a clean copy. I also have my iPad beside me, and I refer to it when I'm not clear on something. This is a teaching/reference book for someone who's not well versed in Ayurvedic healing but would like to be. I've run the gamut of healing modalities and diets in American culture. With this book, I feel I'm going to the well spring where ancient answers lie. I'm planning to get other David Frawley books. I do love a new journey. Don't you?
I just received 2 pairs of these, and they're way nicer looking than expected, tightly twisted, hefty ropes to hold back the curtains on my pergola......really hoping they hold up well.

This stuff makes Hubby happy, and me as well. He wants our yard to look like a golf course.....city boy. I grew up in the country where yards have some weeds, and  I hate for me and my Shih Tzu (built low to the ground) to walk through a sea of toxic chemicals. So he and I came to an uneasy truce. He still has the front and side yards professionally sprayed, but the big fenced-in backyard is not.....which drove him nuts. At first he tried the Pinterest sure-fire natural weed killers like vinegar, salt & Dawn. They did nothing but waste time and kitchen products. So, I began shopping for something "less toxic" than the professional sprays, and when he tried this one, he was elated. It kills weeds. I've just ordered the third jug of it for this spring, somewhat pricey if he's going to pour it out like water, but hey, as long as peace reigns in the compound it's all good. I haven't done any deep research (yet) to find out just how much healthier Avenger Organic Weed Killer is, but for the moment I feel better about playing with my dog in the backyard. I've read that it takes 7 years for all the toxic chemicals to leach from the soil and grass, and we're only on our third year......

This would be handy for people on the go, maybe a quickie, pre-fab type of smoothie to carry to work. I gave it an extra star because my bad for not thinking through the size of its largest mixing cup. In the photos, it shows it jam packed with produce. In actuality, the MAX fill line is at 3 cups, and if you go beyond, you've got a mess on your hands. You're not going to end up with 3 cups of smoothie, but that's as high as you can go with ingredients. Put in a quartered apple and a few celery sticks, and you're done. So, it all boils down to how you like to make your smoothies. I'm more the mad scientist type, making a different smoothie every time, tossing in fruits, veggies, protein powders, sprouts, fresh herbs, chia, hemp and flax seeds, supplements, ice cubes, etc. usually along with coconut milk, everything organic, and I'll end up with a normal size blender jar half full of smoothie that I sip on for an hour or two as I go about my morning at home. My Walmart Osterizer blends smoothies reasonably well, but they're rough in texture, and I hate big ol' strawberry seeds in my smoothie, thought this one might pulverize berry seeds. It does not. I've kept it too long to return, but I will likely end up choosing between Blendtec & Vitamix, which is where I'd started before I read all the reviews and thought this was a great, cheaper alternative. Not for me.

This case looks like I wanted it to, not all Road Warrior like some others. I got the clear one, and nothing has discolored as they have for some, but I'm getting another case today because I can't stay with this one. The protective screen doesn't lie flush against the face of the phone, so I'll touch several times to get something done, and typing is a real chore. I have to remember to push down to make contact with the phone, rather than just a touch. I'd thought about trying to cut out the protective screen and just replace with a film like I've always used, but I think it would look hacked up. Nice looking case but not for me.

The ingredients are good, but for me, one scoop of this powder is way too strong. I'll begin by saying I'm sensitive to all supplements and have to go by trial and error, not by recommended dosages, but this time I tried it like 3-4 mornings, and couldn't sleep at night, totally revved up. I'm having a severe flare-up of IBS, and even this mega dosage (5000 mg of L-Glutamine, which would be suitable for a body builder) didn't have any discernible effect in that short time. So, as they are good ingredients, and I often mix my own remedies and place the mixtures into capsules, I won't waste the Intestinew, but will combine it with other good ingredients for IBS & IBD, like Slippery Elm Bark, powdered aloe vera, peppermint leaf, charcoal, comfrey root, licorice root & Melissa, all of which I've already bought in bulk here on Amazon.

I wouldn't call it velvet at all but more like a tough velour suede. I bought a black piece and a burgundy piece planning to use them in my crazy quilt along with satins and laces, but this is a utilitarian, stiff fabric. I'll give it to my husband. He'll probably use it to line cedar boxes he builds in his shop. Two stars because it does say it's for upholstery, though I even think of velvet upholstery as more lush than this. It also arrived more quickly than stated. Lesson learned. I buy almost everything online these days, but in some cases I need to hold the item in my hands first.

I'm on the Autoimmune Paleo Protocol and was browsing in Whole Foods for a snack. I chose between these salty ones and sweet ones by the same company. I think they're tastier, more satisfying than any kind of chips I've had, including potato chips and corn chips. They're not cheap, but these days nothing healthy is. I ordered some and also put them on my monthly shipment from Amazon. It's a good size package that can easily make two afternoon snacks. Giving up sugar, grains, dairy, and deadly nightshades, we don't have to feel deprived, but it does take some diligence to ferret out the healthy stuff that actually tastes good enough to eat. I make my own kombucha, and I've just discovered Kevita drinks which are pretty good in some flavors.Thanks, Amazon, as always..........My husband says I can now become a hermit and live in the woods as long as there's a path to my door for my Amazon deliveries.

I would complain more, but Norpro refunded my money without a hassle. I bought the mat because my counter tops are tile and very rough. I wanted a smooth surface for pastry. This arrived folded in a small envelope. I immediately thought this was much too thin and flimsy, no more support than spreading a kitchen towel on the counter. But when I removed it from the envelope and tried to unfold it, two sides were melted together, and when I tried, ever so gently, to separate them, it tore. I returned it, and the company immediately issued a refund. Good company, not a product I would recommend.

I like this pretty well, maybe not as much as the essential oil, toothpaste, shampoo & conditioner, because it's very thin, but I've been doing okay with it. I deducted one star and would have deducted more if Amazon hadn't stood behind it even after the return date had passed. This is why I buy so much here.The scent of this soap is okay, (I use Neem oil in the garden, yard, and kitchen as well) and I've been using it as shower soap, but I'm the only one using it, so here it is 2 months later, and I've still got a lot. left; yesterday I squeezed some out on my shower mitt and immediately noticed the smell was different. It smelled rancid, exactly like old cooking oil. I've never had a bath product go bad that way, so I contacted Amazon today. Thank God for Amazon.Anyway, I would suggest if you're going to have this for a while, you may want to put half of it in a separate container and refrigerate it.

A shiny, clean toilet bowl was never an issue until we moved to our current rural home. I always just swished bowl cleaner around with a brush once a week, and it stayed looking new. Then we moved here to a new house and over 12 years time, all 3 bowls began to get a crusty built-up ring at the waterline; also the upper portion of the bowls became grayish and rough. It has to be chemicals or minerals in the local water supply. (We filter drinking and shower water.) I've even had water dept. guys come out and test the water. They acted as if they'd never heard such a complaint and that nobody else ever had that problem!I've tried every cleanser I could find, tried chipping away at the mess with razor blade and pumice, and still when we had guests, I felt the need to say that the toilet bowl wasn't dirty, just bad water. I don't know how long these pads have been on the market, but I wish I'd discovered them a heckuva lot sooner.I didn't even have much hope when I spied them on Amazon, but the positive reviews won me over.They worked perfectly! That's not to say they're magic, and you only have to wave them over the bowl. I rubbed and scrubbed and sweated 12 years of crud off for about 15 minutes per bowl. I called hubby in to see the transformation. He wasn't as impressed as I was, (he who has even considered using muriatic acid to clean the bowls) but never mind.My toilet bowls look "normal" again, and I'm back to order another pack or two. It took both pads to clean my bowls, but I expect that now I can keep up with the crud formation, and it won't require prolonged scrubbing.

I looked at these for years, would love to have a built-in bidet, but it's just not going to happen. I also figured these were a total hassle to install, so I just waited. I'm glad I finally purchased this one. Installation instructions are clear and easy to follow, but my grown son only glanced at the sheet, tossed it aside, and installed it in less than 15 minutes; he's good at anything mechanical. This was over 5 months ago.It has worked perfectly from the beginning. I'm the only one who uses it in my bathroom. I had thought that the cold water might be a problem. It isn't. It just feels cool and refreshing. There's a slight learning curve in finding the ultimate water angle/pressure adjustment, but it has a lot of settings around the dial, so not a problem in finding the happy medium. You want one that's direct but not so forceful that it gives you an enema. I wash back and forth, front and back a few times, and there's hardly any paperwork to be done. Just blot dry.I had had some itching and burning issues for years. I'd tried so many things, gentle wet wipes, handheld bottle bidet, etc., but the Luxe Bidet Neo 180 has solved all that, and I seriously wouldn't want to be without it.There's hardly any cleaning of the unit itself. When I'm washing the toilet bowl I splash a little water on the front panel with the brush. That's it.Everyone should have a bidet of some sort. It's just so much cleaner and fresher.

I'm a Jake Gyllenhaal fan, but I'm not a fan of this movie. I was also a literature and psychology major, so deep, elusive symbolism excites me.... this tale offers nothing but dark, uninteresting, disjointed segments with a few oddball, meaningless "symbols" thrown in to keep us thinking we're onto something if we just stay with it long enough. Not. I had to pause it about halfway through to make dinner, and afterwards realized I didn't care enough about how it came out to resume. There are just too many flaws in the plot to entice me to go along with it. I kept thinking that if I discovered someone who was my exact double, I'd be freaking out but in a good way, and I'd be telling family and friends, but these guys immediately panic and go all covert and secretive as if disaster has befallen them.......Why? Jake couldn't do much beyond the script he was given.

This little warmer sits on my home computer desk, and almost every morning I drink herbal tea with local honey in my clear glass teapot and teacup. One votive candle lasts for 3 uses, keeps my tea at just the right temp and doesn't over-steep it, even though I'm a pretty slow tea sipper. I begin with hot water poured over the tea and then set it on the warmer....There's no smoke; I've had it for several months, and it still doesn't need washing....It draws plenty of air to keep the candle burning. I thought the metal tray was looking a little scuffed and then realized it has a protective plastic film stuck to it, so I pulled it off, and now it's new again. I would recommend it to a friend.

I'm very happy with these tablets. It's not that easy to live healthy these days. I have water filters for drinking and shower water, but I take 2 or 3 warm detox baths a week, and I worried about the chlorine in the water. I toss in one of these, 4 scoops of epsom salts, 4 scoops of bicarbonate of soda, and whatever other bath salts, essential oils or herbs I happen to be into this week, set a big bottle of mineral water or cup of herbal detox tea on the side, put my iPad on the tub tray and relax for an hour. (In the past, I have put vitamin C crystals in the water, but these are much easier.) They just fizz and melt away....and with such a large pack, they'll last a long time....Thanks Vitabath and Amazon.

I'm having to rethink this purchase....I use pink Himalayan salt for cooking and I have 3 salt lamps....Guess you could say I really like the stuff. I've used crystal deodorant for many years, and I was hoping these could be used in the bath as a full body deodorant, so typical me, I ordered 4 instead of 1....As someone else mentioned, the surface becomes very rough as soon as you use it. I've got sensitive skin, so this is like making tiny cuts all over my body (yes, it hurts) and then rubbing salt into the wound. I had to shower it all off, and then I itched and burned for what seemed like forever. I'm a waste not, want not kinda gal, so I'll think of something to do with them, but I'm afraid it won't be in my shower.

I've owned this book for a few years, and in my ongoing quest for natural, healthy remedies, I keep stumbling across references to it, think maybe I didn't give it enough of a chance, browse through it for 15 minutes and place it back on the shelf. It's just a rambling, badly organized collection of claims but mainly a 600+ page advertisement for the author's products. I might not even mind that, but when I go to reviews for the products, which are very pricey, they hardly have any reviews, so I'm guessing not many people are trying them after reading the book.Another problem for me is that most everything else in the book is about medical procedures, done by your doctor. I gave up on doctors decades ago and have done myself far more good than they ever did, but if you're a believer in Big Pharma, and see your doctor regularly, then this might be a gem for you. Maybe in some areas of the country there are physicians who would gladly implement the procedures, but in my little corner of the world, I'm quite sure they'd be like what kind of idiocy has she come up with now?One small segment in the book tells how to self-administer food grade peroxide "for the Less Advantaged". Okay, I'm not really Less Advantaged, but it feels as if he's talking down to people who prefer to take responsibility for their health into their own hands. I'm 60+, healthier than anybody I know even close to my age, but I'm human and get some health challenges, aches, and pains from time to time. I trusted the reviews, but obviously didn't read enough, and thought this was another great reference book. It's not.I just now downloaded "Hydrogen Peroxide and Aloe Vera Plus Other Home Remedies" on my Kindle (free to Prime customers). I haven't read it yet, but the preview looked like down-to-earth remedies a person could try for himself/herself. I've got "The One-Minute Cure: The Secret to Healing Virtually All Diseases" on hold at my local library. It also got mixed reviews, but I figure if I come away from each title with one or two believable remedies to try, I'm ahead of the game. Wishing you blessings on your own search for health.

We have a Biozone air cleaner and a Winix WAC5500, both of which are quietly perfect, and I wanted a third one for the kitchen side of the house but was trying to go a little less expensive. Out of the box, you have to turn it on its side, open the bottom and install the filter, which isn't a big deal, but the other two I just opened them, plugged them in, and they were ready. Next, this thing is enormous, isn't all that attractive, and it says to set it 3 feet from the wall. I might have managed to find it a place to live if it weren't so loud. Maybe in loud homes with lots of kids, pets and commotion, it wouldn't be such an issue, but in ours, people sitting in the same room would be straining to talk and hear over it, on low. The other two speeds, forget about it. As someone said in another review, it sounds like a jet engine warming up. I bought it from Walmart and will be returning it tomorrow. I've run it a little, but I have no idea whether it cleans air well or not. When hubby came home he asked me to turn it off so he could hear his TV.

I wanted to fill in some bare spots in the backyard, also areas around tree trunks and flower beds. I roughed up the earth a bit and scattered topsoil mixed with manure, then sowed the seeds fairly heavily. I kept them lightly watered, and within a couple of days tiny clover sprouts began popping up. Now the first patches I sowed are thick and lush. I found my first 4-leaf clover yesterday, brings back childhood memories. I'm back to order another pound of seed. I love having them on hand and so glad to find them here.

I've been using Prelief for about 3 months, taking 2 with meals. I began taking it for Interstitial Cystitis, and it has helped with that, but something I hadn't expected is that I'm getting fewer migraines.....like almost non-existent. No, I'm not imagining it. I'm a lifelong migraine sufferer, have spent a king's ransom and have never gotten a moment's relief from any prescription meds; I've done far more good with my own healthy diet plan and supplements. So I'm doubly happy to be reordering these. I can't promise anyone else will have the same results. We're all so different, but I've been reading in my constant research that a lot of people with chronic kidney problems also get migraines. Who knew?Wishing you all the best with your wellness journey.

I have found that alternating my bedtime teas helps. This is my latest of 4 that I use, and it immediately became my favorite. The scent is rich and reminds me of Tiramisu. As it's cooling, I sit and breathe it in. The taste is the same and sweet enough, but sometimes I add a teaspoon of local honey.It helps me fall asleep easier. I also alternate several different forms of Melatonin (patch, liposomal, compound and sublingual) and some other natural supplements along with the teas. All in all, they're not perfect, but they make my nights restful, even if I don't sleep like a log straight through. I've done all the recommended things for getting restful sleep, including dark room, sleeping away from electrical outlets, early supper, and I don't drink coffee, tea or use refined sugars or gluten. So yes, I'm trying, and this tea makes it all a little easier. I'm at a stage in my life where I have to accept that my nights of falling into bed, going out like a light and sleeping 8 or 9 hours are past. I've read a few books on insomnia, and it helps to know that our ideal sleep schedule is a modern invention. People used to go to bed when the sun went down, sleep for 3 or 4 hours, get up and putter around, maybe even visit neighbors, then go back to bed and sleep till sunrise. It helps is you don't think of periodic wakefulness as a handicap. On the nights when I simply can't lie in bed, I get up, accompanied by my shih tzu, and pile up on the sofa with my iPad or watch TV for a couple of hours, then go back to bed when I'm sleepy.Thank you, Yogi, for your healthy, soothing teas. I use a lot of them.

I've tried several of the healthy-type polish removers and been not impressed. They're mostly just oily, and if I sit and rub long enough, part of the polish comes off but never all of it. So, I didn't expect too much from this one but bought it based on positive reviews, and now I'm impressed! It smells like tea tree oil, and takes off any polish faster than the old acetone ones. Thank you for a product that does what it claims to do. Satisfied customer.

I've known for years I should be wearing white cotton panties, but the stretchy ones felt so good. I expected cotton to feel confining and to ride up with every move or bend, but I order 3 pairs of these and changed my mind. They feel great, stay put, and I generally feel cleaner and dryer. I ordered 6 more pairs, and now I'm ordering 6 more. That might seem silly, but I've found that styles change and about the time I might be ready for more, they're not to be found, so I guess I'm hoarding white cotton panties. It could be worse....

I've got so many art interests, watercolor being one, that I sort of wander hither and yon. Well, in November of 2012, I received this book, was disappointed as I paged through it because the format and illustrations do seem small. I stuck it in my big ol' art library, though, and went on to something else. Lately, though, I've cycled back to watercolors, particularly the loose, imaginative variety of Ms. Trevena, and I was thrilled to find I still had her book! So, I spent the better part of a day reading closely, cover to cover, digesting all the techniques, and I must say, it's a book worth having. Her directions are easy to follow, and illustrations are clear enough to give a good grasp of her points.She does one complete painting, in depth, from inception to final stroke, broken into segments that make perfect sense and are interspersed with additional techniques. This isn't a book where the artist gives a specific color palette and brushes, but I actually like this better. She suggests types of brushes and color harmonies along with creative tools you might not have considered. It's a book that might be confusing for beginners, but even they can pick up some excellent pointers and keep the book for later reference. Of her 3 books I know about, this one seems to be the best for technique. Glad I finally read it!

I make a lot of apple pies, using the small, using organic red and yellow delicious apples. At first I thought that the imperfect peeling was because the apples were so small, so I bought larger apples and got the same results. Maybe my apples are shaped wrong, but I've yet to get a wide, perfect peel like that shown. It skips around, leaving ridges of peel in between, sometimes stops and won't proceed till I either crank the blade back around or switch the position of the apple, but the end result is that, along with the corer/slicer, it's a heckuva lot easier and faster than preparing them all by hand. I just have to take a knife and clean them up before slicing and coring. Maybe I'll happen onto those perfectly shaped apples that give perfect peeling results someday :)Edit: I took away more stars because just after the return date, the red gears inside the peeler's housing began breaking off, and now it's completely useless. I can't imagine anyone being more gentle with the gadget than I've been for the apple pies I've baked. I contacted the seller, and I can't even get a reply, so I'm glad I didn't pay a lot for the peeler, but it should have lasted longer than 3 months.

I'm in menopause, but I'm one of the lucky ones who has never had much problem with hot flashes, etc. I was on prescription bio-identical hormones off and on over the years, could never tell a difference one way or the other, but now I've decided that I don't need all that, and I'd like to find an OTC progesterone cream to use. I haven't noticed any effects, pro or con, but the smell is like something rancid and outdated, even though the date stamped on it says otherwise. The scent in any body product is about 50% of its value to me. I've been putting a drop of Essential Oil in with it to camouflage the odor and will likely use the rest of the bottle, but this is a one-time purchase.

I try to keep a supply of these. I'm very persnickety about my writing tools, and some of the most expensive ones don't make my cut, but I've gotten along with these for years. They must not be very well known, because I always have one in my purse, and when I start to write, someone invariably wants to know what kind of pen it is and where I got it. They flow freely but not enough to pool or soak through the paper, and the points aren't scratchy. The colors are nice and bright, but they're not why I buy Pilot Varsity disposable fountain pens. It's just a good feeling pen.

This oil has a light, velvety feel to it. I put it on first thing in the morning to rehydrate my winter dry facial skin, adding a drop or two of Helichrysum oil, and it absorbs right into my skin. The smell is nice but not really noticeable. I'm hypersensitive to smells, don't wear any perfume except for a few favorite Essential Oils, and I get along nicely with this one. The dropper didn't work well, even after I tried opening it up with a straight pin, but I just popped it out, and I carefully pour a small pool into the palm of my hand. The price is right, and I will be reordering.

I'm no stone expert, but as I was stringing these, I noticed white areas around some of the holes where it looked as if the teal coating had broken away, leaving a chalky white stone underneath. Curious, I took a small, chipped one and broke it into many pieces with my pliers, and sure enough, it's just a glossy, enamel-like coating over white powdery stone. Wouldn't real turquoise be turquoise through and through? I'm very disappointed, as I bought these for their healing qualities, and I don't believe in them anymore. If someone can explain the error in my thinking, I'll gladly change my star rating.

This is a 16 oz bag of spicy sunflower seeds with an occasional pumpkin seed and even fewer almonds thrown in, tasty enough but way over-priced for what I got. I don't eat cereal, as another reviewer suggested sprinkling them on top. I wanted them as a snack beside my computer. The seller seems to be nice, included a sample packet of magnesium and a copy of a handwritten Thank You note. The seeds seem fresh, so I'll keep them, but I won't reorder. I'm thinking food like this is best bought in a store, so I can pick them up and see what I'm getting.February 3, 2014. I had thought I would keep this trail mix and eat it, even though it's so overpriced, but I'm a little farther down in the bag, and there's the most awful chemical taste I've ever tasted! (I found one of those elusive almonds.) I went to return it and found out that it cannot be returned, for any reason. I wish I could take away the one star I gave it. I'm a longtime Amazon Prime customer, always have subscribe and save lists waiting and have smiling boxes coming to my home almost everyday, and I rarely return anything, but there ought not to be a blanket rule forbidding the return of any item that is unacceptable, including food products.

What should have been a sweet, touching story decides to become improbable, coarse and profane instead. With no point of reference, I imagine that lesbians are no more profane in their speech and habits than the rest of the planet. I'm no prude, but this one made me cringe throughout. The trailer looks fun, and I laughed out loud, but that's all the movie has to offer. Good actors, adequate acting, but a storyline that wanders around trying to locate the next cheap joke, a waste of time and money.

My 3 year old Shih Tzu isn't a good eater, and for most of his life I've been cleaning up barf a few times a week, whether he's eaten a lot or nothing. The vet just says he's eaten grass in the backyard, but that's not true, so I've kept searching for something to help with his super sensitive tummy. I tried the chewable enzymes, and the only way he'll eat them is if I hide them in peanut butter, but he catches on pretty fast. I got this powder, hoping I could dissolve it in his drinking water, but didn't have much hope because his sense of smell is amazing. Well, it dissolves just fine, and he doesn't seem to notice it; he still drinks a lot of water. I've been using it for a few months, and he has still vomited a few times but not as frequently as before. I'm going to use the whole jar (it will last a long time) and then decide whether to reorder, but I'm hopeful.

but I think it's the cutest thing ever. He just hates wearing anything, including his halter when we walk, but he settles down once they're on. This little sweater fits him perfectly, but he actually runs out of one arm when he's chasing his ball in the backyard. I'm not sure how because it couldn't fit any better. He's 3 years old and weighs 12 pounds. Anyway, we're having a colder winter than usual here, and I feel better when he goes outside to slip something warm on him. It's exactly the color shown, and construction seems to be good. I haven't had to wash it yet. I was afraid he'd tinkle on the front of it, but so far, so good.

For me, this one's a winner. I've been avoiding gluten for nearly a year, and I've pretty much lost my "Wheat Belly", but even with the explosion of gluten free products, it's always hit or miss on the flavor, even within brands. The first time I made these, I just made them plain, and they actually tasted a bit too sweet (I also avoid as much sugar as possible). So, the second time I put a couple of handfuls of chopped pecans in them, and they're just about perfect. I like a light, crisp cookie, so I bake them a few minutes longer than directed. They're so good with my morning coffee. My husband calls me the cookie monster, so yes, I know my cookies. I'm going to order more here because the price is right, and it's a 40 minute drive to the stores where I can purchase them. I'm going to put dried fruit in the next ones I bake.

I love these. I've been having digestive problems after I eat, so I use ginger to help. These taste hot and spicy, not too sugary, more gingery than some, and I just munch on a few of them, and the heartburn doesn't happen. I subtracted one star because I'm used to getting better prices on Amazon than I can in the stores, but I buy these at our local Drug Emporium for $6.92 a package (plus taxes of course), so this price ($36.97 for 4)  is pretty high by comparison.

I'm a lifelong migraine sufferer, and I avoid taking medications because they only seem to rebound on me and prolong the migraine, but I've discovered relief from spraying CryoDerm on the side of my face/head where the migraine is pounding, as well as on the back of my neck and on my shoulder. It's very soothing and seems to relax and open up the vessels that are pounding, if that makes any sense. It actually doesn't seem to do much for sore muscles or joints, but I'm glad to keep it in my "migraine box" with the herbal remedies I've come to depend on.

Even if it hadn't been broken, I would never have used the ugly thing! It's a shell, packed in a very large box. You'd think it would be fairly easy to ship safely, but I saw the minute I started to unwrap it that it was broken in half. And then I saw that it looks nothing like the lovely blue, lustrous shell in the illustration. It's crusty and rough inside and out and has big black splotches everywhere. So yes, the company says they'll refund my money, and I'll repackage it and drive across town to the UPS store to return it, but an apology and immediate shipment of a new shell would have been nice. Obviously, I won't be ordering another one.

I thought I had reviewed this flag, so if I have please forgive the repeat. I bought the first one exactly 2 years ago, and it stays on my front porch a lot, not all the time. We have almost constant winds, especially in winter, so the hem has taken a beating and is frayed, but over all it's holding up pretty well. I'm back to buy a replacement flag and looked at the $35 one with sewn stripes. That would be beautiful for display where it would be seen up close, but I'm actually happy with the light, gauzy fabric of this one, and you can't beat the price. A neighbor walking by asked where I got it. Maybe I'll buy a couple.

I'm an Anuschka fan, and I so enjoy having accessories to match my handbag, but for some reason I'd never ordered a matching check-book cover. I simply love this one! The design is very pretty, and it's the first cover I've had with a window for my drivers license on the back. How handy! I just flip it over for the cashier to see without having to remove it. As with all their products, it seems durable and will last a long time.
Pretty and delicate, just what I wanted. I wear it full time on a thin gold chain, along with my son's baby ring.

I'm glad I bought one box at Whole Foods before ordering a case of this stuff. Most Annie's products I've tried are good, but my husband (who LOVES mac & cheese) took one bite and said, "Cardboard," and wouldn't eat anymore. I'm the health food nut in the family, and I thought I would at least be able to eat it, but there's no taste at all, especially no cheese, so why bother? I guess I could have added enough cheese to give it a flavor, but that's not why I bought it. I can't imagine why so many people say they love it.

It was better than I expected.  Seems like every time you thought it couldn't get worse for the the folks in the movie, they kicked it up a notch.  As you watch you're like "damn!" then a few seconds later you're like "DAAAYAAAM!"
Really dig the UA cap offerings. For the folks with oversized brains and therefore the corresponding nogging size, this model of UA cap is one of the few that come in XL/XXL. Hope this helps!
Really dig the UA cap offerings.  For the folks with oversized brains and therefore the corresponding nogging size, this model of UA cap is one of the few that come in XXL.  Hope this helps!
Wife sure got a kick out of putting these all over her kitchen thingamabobers.  I like the antique look and the smile it put on my wife's face.

I really like this walking stick.  It was my constant companion trekking up and down the mountains of Hawaii.  I appreciated that it came with various tips, is height adjustable, and is easily folded for transport.  Make sure you set the height to your liking and adjust the wrist strap as these two adjustments will make the most difference in the comfort when used.  Hope this helps!

As written by my lovely wife:I'm very impressed with this makeup brush.  It's well made and feels like a quality brush.  The bristles are soft and applies makeup evenly and to top it off it's easy to clean.  Thumbs way up!

Works great, okay price.<BEGIN RANT> Seems like plumbing component quality has gone downhill over the years.  Back in the days stuff would last for decades.  Nowadays, we're lucky if things last past 5 years and that's only if you don't buy generic.  Generic lasts even less. <END RANT>

I have a wide face, which means sunglass hunting sucks.  Either you have to buy metal frame sunglasses that flex at the hinge or you wear sporty styled sunglasses that look like you're ready to tackle the Tour de France.  Out of all the other contemporary styled Oakleys, these are the only ones that didn't feel like my head was in a vise.  Luckily I liked the style and ended up picking up a pair.  Hope this helps!
So far so good.  They've worked fine for me.
So far so good.  They've worked fine for me.

This is an excellent floating hand grip for my GoPro.  It's very lightweight and when you get it in your hand you can tell it's a quality product.  I have used a few others in the past, but once I got this those have been collecting dust.  Great little gadget!

Here's my impressions:-The gift box it was packaged in was really nice.  Quite impressed.-Flash light battery was DOA. :(-The knife wouldn't cut paper out of the box, but since it's 420 stainless, I knew it would be easy to sharpen.  About 10 minutes on my KME sharpening system and this guy was push cutting telephone paper.  After extensive cardboard cutting, a couple of strokes on my strop and it was back to shaving sharp.  The thing with 420 is, it's easy to sharpen, but it loses it's edge fairly quickly.-I like the design and style of the knife.  The wood handles are very nice as well.  I wear a large sized glove so the handle was about half an inch too short for me.  Folks with big paws should be forewarned.I'm a knife nut.  I have high end production knives to low cost Moras.  To me what keeps this knife from being 5 stars is the cost.  For what you get this is about a $40 knife.  Lose the flashlight, lose the fero rod, extend the handle just a bit, use a higher quality stainless, and charge $40.  That would sell like hotcakes.  Hope this helps.*I was provided a sample in exchange for my honest feedbck.
Simple device, worked as advertised.

My son absolutely loved it.  My son and I had a blast putting it together.  If you hate putting IKEA furniture together this set it not for you.  The instructions are pretty bad and the machining is a little off.  If you and your little one are mechanical and can put stuff together based on pictures alone, pick up a set, it'll be fun.

Excellent travel wallet.  The elastic is easy to adjust, the buckle is easy to operate, and the overall construction is on point.  What I like best about this travel wallet is the soft feel and the moisture wicking mesh backing.  You'll forget you're wearing it even after extended use.  This is an easy product to recommend.  Hope this helps!

This is my work knife as I like a shorter blade (3.6") for utility tasks.  The steel is easy to sharpen to a wicked edge and holds the edge well.  The handle is nice and grippy, fills my hands (large sized gloves), and there are no hot spots with extended use.  Coincidentally, if you look at the Morakniv site, you'll notice that they have it listed under Construction / Allround / Professional.  I'd definitely agree with this categorization as it has worked excellently in this role for me.For the Bushcrafters looking at this knife, if you're hardcore and know the various knife grips, the rear bolster will dig into your palm and annoy you.  In my opinion the Mora Bushcraft and Mora Companion are better suited for this role.For backpackers, there is no rattle in the sheath and the retention is adequate, but I would not risk inverted carry.For folks who may use this for food prep, there is a slight gap where the blade meets the handle.  You'll have to be careful washing the knife as stuff will invariably find its way into the gap.Hope this helps!

My boys live in sandals.  We've tried cheaper brands but Keen's makes a high quality product that can withstand the hurricanes I call my sons.  They prefer their Tevas, but if we're going to do a lot of walking I have them wear these and they provide more cushioning.  Hope this helps!

I found the interface to be a little confusing and not as intuitive, but my 5 year old son has now claimed this as his personal player and he has no problems using it.  That either says my son's a genius or his old man is... lets go with my son's a genius :)
I used these as hooks on cubicle walls and they work great.  They are sturdy and are constructed very well.
My kids love Tevas, but they prefer the ones with the neoprene lining.  These are still very good value tevas, but my kids say they feel "scratchy".  Hope this helps!

I've been living with an old school desk lamp for years.  Using this lamp is like going from a Model T to a Tesla.  The fit and finish are excellent and it has a nice modern look.  The touch controls are nice and sensitive and I really dig the different color temperatures and brightness adjustments.  I wanted the brightest LED model available and 11W was the highest at the time.  At the rated 700 lumens it's roughly as bright as my 60 watt incandescent (I just looked it up, a 60 watt incandescent is approximately 800 luments so that makes sense).  All in all I'm very happy with the lamp.  Whodathunk lamps could be so fancy?  Hope this helps.

So if you're looking into a compression wrist wrap you're probably wanting a little extra support in your wrist for the heavy lifts.  Now it comes down to price and quality.  For $9.99 I wasn't expecting a whole heck of a lot.  I opened them up tried them on and was pleasantly surprised.  The elastic is nice, thick and wide.  The velcro is durable and strong.  It's a high quality product, way better and less expensive than the stuff you can get at your local stores.  This product is easy for me to recommend.  Hope this helps!  Go get your swole on!

For some strange reason, I haven't been able to buy this locally so I've resorted to Amazon.  I've tried a lot of different brands, but I always end up coming back to the tried and true Chapstick Spearmint.  It works and I like the scent.  For a manly man (as manly as you can get while applying lip balm) your options are limited.  Either you can use the medicine scents or the spearmint.  My nieces say I should try the strawberry and cherry scents, but alas I'm too insecure.  Chapstick!

This is a great EDC.  It rides light and small in pocket and the fit and finish are excellent.  This is a very low key knife, what sets it apart though is that there's no other brand name knife on the market that weights this little, uses CPM S35VN steel, made in the USA and costs $75.  If you're looking for a lightweight, high quality, high end steel, user knife at an affordable price, this is it.A few things to note about this knife for prospective buyers:-This knife has a shorter handle which makes it easier to carry in pocket.  The trade off is if you have large size hands, using the handle alone you'll probably only get a 3 1/2 finger grip.  I prefer using the forward choil, which gives me more control of the blade and plenty of room for a 4 finger grip.  If you have large hands and don't like using the forward choil, this may be an issue for you.-This uses a strong lockback.  The deployment requires a good amount of force if you want to be able to flick this knife open quickly.  Most folks end up doing a slow, controlled deployment with their thumb.-The Spydie hole is a love it or hate it feature.  The hole is, by design, machined fairly sharp.  Not enough to cut you, but you'll definitely feel it.  If you're not use to it, give it time before you make up your mind.-The handle is made up of FRN to save on weight.  This is also a love it or hate it feature.  I prefer FRN because of the weight savings, others hate it because they think it looks and feels cheap.Good luck on your knife purchase, hope this helps!
My wife said for the price, it's a good value.  She normally wears a small, but she said it was a bit loose on her.  If you're looking for a looser fitting capri, these are probably it.
My wife didn't use this as a supplement during maternity, but rather just a probiotic for digestive support.  She says it worked well.
Works very well and quality is excellent.

This is a very good screen protector.  It's very durable and doesn't interfere with the touch screen.  An FYI though, this screen protector only covers the viewing area of the screen and not the entire screen so there's little room for error when applying the protector.
Kids had a good time assembling this product.  One star off due to the costs though.

I bought this Like New for $12.99.  Well worth the money for the convenience.  Instead of spending my time plugging and unplugging things, I just snap it in and go.  If you've never used a docking station before, it's a huge time saver.  For the price I paid, it's a no brainer.
If you haven't watched this movie yet, you are not a true movie buff.  This movie is regarded as one of the best movies of all time, and justifiably so.
One of the best movies of all time, even if you don't like Westerns!

Not a huge fan of these gloves.  The knuckle protection is good, but since the underside is all mesh the wrist support is lacking.  There are so many other gloves that are better at this price range, so I'd take a pass on these.  Heavy bag work is probably the most brutal on your hands and body over the long haul, so I've always been one to buy the best bag gloves within your budget.  Hope this helps!

These are excellent sparring gloves.  The foam is just the right density out of the box for sparring, no need to break them in.  The innovative velcro closure system gives you a secure fit with excellent wrist support.  The lining has been updated since last year so it's nice and soft instead of the abrasive mesh that was used previously.  I have Winning and Reyes gloves, but these are still one of my favorites, both to wear and to get hit with.If you can find these gloves for around $100, don't think twice, just buy them.  At $100 they're 5 stars, at $120+ they're 4 stars.  Hope this helps!

The hardware is on point, the software is easy to use, and it's quick.  I've gone through a number of scanners over the years and this one rocks.  Nowadays to find something that just does what it's supposed to do without having me pull out all of my hair just to get it to work is rare.  Easily a 5 star product.  You'll need to have your computer on for the scanner to work, so be aware of that before you purchase it.  Hope this helps!

The sound quality of these guys are ridiculous.  I have a ton of headphones, these are the best I've ever used.  They are a bargain at the current price.  These are super comfortable, but for people with big ears, the cup may pinch the outer portions of your ears.  My only wish was that the cord was replaceable.  My wife likes to use these when she works out, so a shorter cord would have been ideal for those times.  Hope this helps!

While other door anchors work just as well, this one is just better made than most.  The material is better as well as the construction.  It doesn't feel cheap compared to some other door anchors that come included with most resistance band sets.  Hope this helps!

For the price, these straps can't be beat.  The straps are nice and thick which make it easier to wrap around the bars.  The neoprene padded wrist strap does exactly what they're advertise to do, eliminate the pain from the straps digging into your hands/wrist.  I've used thinner straps without the wrist padding and when you start going heavy it really does dig into your hands/wrist.  The only negative thing I see with these straps are that the length of the wrist padding is a little long making these straps more comfortable for people with bigger wrist.  I had my wife try these on and because her wrist are smaller, she wasn't able to get a tight loop around her wrist.  The smaller the loop around the wrist, the easier it is to get a nice tight lockup on the bars.  For people who have never used straps, you want to make sure that when you put them on, the direction of the strap is between your thumb and index finger and not pointing towards your pinkie.  Secondly, when wrapping them around the bars, the bar goes between the straps and your hands.  So when you loop the strap around the bar its: strap, bar, hands, and not: bar, strap, hands.  I'll post some pictures of this when I get a chance, Hope this helps!

If you're an audiophile, you'll be sorely disappointed.  The sound quality is okay at best.  That being said, this product is easy to use and in all honesty my little boys love to use it when they take a bath.  Hope this helps!

Let's face it, if you're looking into packing cubes you're a little bit OCD and an organizational freak.
