Maybe that's what he means by the cosmic force of Crazy Horse.My favorite songs are Twisted Road, For the Love of Man, and Walk Like A Giant. Twisted Road is a tribute to DylanLike Hank Williams chewing bubble gum,Asking me, "How does it feel?". In The Love of Man, Neil sings poignantly for his son Ben;For the love of manWho could understand what goes onWhat is right and what is wrongWhy the angels cry, and the heavens sighWhen a child is born to liveBut not like you or I.And Walk Like a Giant, a defiant affirmation of life even in the face of crumbling and disintegration;I used to walk like a giant on the landNow I feel like a leaf floating in a streamI want to walk like a giantI want to walk like a giant on the land.It ends with four minutes of single drum beats synched with jagged, distorted guitar chords. Is is a giant walking? Is it a heart beating?Whatever it is, it's like nothing you've heard before. Those who say they'll fast forward through this part miss the point.Five stars.

I kind of doubt it.The marketing concept of the Portable Genius series is the idea that a book can replace the Genius Bar at your local Apple store, or in effect make one available if you live in an area that doesn't have one. As stated in the introduction, "This book is like a mini Genius Bar all wrapped up in an easy-to-use, easy-to-access, and eminently portable format".Does it deliver? Not really.Anybody who can perform a Google search can access this kind of information in an even more portable and comprehensive fashion. You hit the Apple store for thornier problems that you yourself can't figure out. It's hard to imagine that this book will help in such situations.The hardware specific packaging (there's a MacBook Pro version if that's what you happen to own) implies that there's lots of specific and focused content. In fact this isn't really the case. Much of the book deals with general aspects of OSX that will be identical regardless of what kind of Mac you happen to own. Those sections that differentiate the Air from say the Pro, deal with subjects such as replacing the hard drive. Again, it's very difficult to imagine that anybody who buys a basic book like this will be inclined to get under the hood to swap out essential hardware components.My sense is that this book may be worthwhile for those who mourn the passing of product specific paper instruction manuals. Otherwise you can skip it.

Is this a good thing?Absolutely.Clackety, clackety, clackety, clack. It's the sound of productivity. As I'm typing, I visualize old time pool secretaries, fingers flying over the Selectric keys, clackety, clackety, clackety, clack.Does this have a place in today's world?Totally.The positive, crisp and precise feedback of the mechanical keys minimizes mistakes, at least that's how it seems to me.Everything about the DAS Keyboard is solid, bomb proof and professional. Two included USB ports on the right hand side are a convenient feature. And it looks great sitting in front of my 27" iMac.So why four stars and not five?For hard to explain reasons, the Fn key has been relocated from its usual position to an odd location three keys to the right of the space bar. This is a real nuisance, and needlessly compromises an otherwise excellent product.

Read the packaging for these sardines and you can't help but feel you're saving Mother Earth as you chomp on your sandwich. But digging down beneath the surface, there's not so much to be excited about. Unless of course BPA free packaging is your primary purchase criterion. If so, buy em now and don't read any further.If not there are some issues to be aware of...I understand that Wild Planet is the brand. But what about the "wild" sardines? I'm not aware that the sardine has been domesticated, and the lowly pilchards that swarm the seas in massive schools sometimes visible from outer space are not amenable to aquaculture.On the other hand, qualifying these sardines as wild, notwithstanding the fact that there's no other kind, does confer a seemingly significant though clearly misplaced credibility. No doubt this will boost sales to a gullible buying public.Then there's the matter of what happens to these fish after they're "sustainably caught along the California coast". The small print provides a clue in that these bad boys are "processed in Viet Nam". So what's really going on is that our diminutive sardines take on a heavy carbon footprint, travelling as they do from the west coast to the far east and back again, presumably to harvest the otherwise mutually exclusive benefits of buy-local chic and low labor costs. Nonetheless, we read that, "These sardines are considered a `Best Choice for Sustainability' by a consensus of environmental organizations".There are other issues as well.The health benefits of chowing down on this product are highly touted. For instance, "Ounce for ounce, Wild Planet sardines provide 3 times more calcium and phosphorus than milk...". OK, fair enough. But is this, as implied, unique to the Wild Planet variety only, or is it once again a characteristic of all sardines? Unfortunately, it's the latter.We also learn that these "delicious meaty portions" are "cleaned and scaled". Buyer beware: this is quite different from "skinless and boneless". "Cleaned" in this context must mean something other that what is commonly expected by the use of this word in conjunction with fish. Be prepared to either eat the vertebral column and various entrails, or to remove (clean) them yourself.How do they taste?Not bad, if you're into schmaltz herring. The lemon juice in which they're packed adds a bit of zip, but these babies are smoked and have a characteristic smoky, salty taste.But don't worry. It's not just any smoke, but "aqueous natural smoke" that they're treated with...

This book is Neil Young schmoozing about this and that, in no particular sequence, sharing what happens to be on his mind in the moment, sharing it with the reader as if he's right there in the room with you. Some people seem to like this style of writing, others not so much. I did.While the fact that this is not a typical sex, drugs and rock and roll expose may disappoint some, I found it refreshing and endlessly interesting. Waging Heavy Peace is a window into the mind of a deep, complex and multifaceted person. What's actually revealed is very rich, goes far beyond the music alone, and in so doing provides a context for better understanding Young's remarkable creativity.So apart from the music, the life, and the relationships, we learn about the author's passion for old cars, model trains, the environment and appropriate energy sources, ultra high quality sound, the archiving of this and that and various permutations and combinations of all of the above rolled together into one. It's fascinating.To get a feel for what this is like, here's a snippet on Neil's work with Lionel, the iconic model train brand:"During the development of what is now Lionel's system for control of action and sound on a model railroad, I became obsessed. There are so many ways to model the actions and sounds of a machine like a locomotive, it is endless - and the complexity is like a drug. For instance, every action has a sound, and every sound has variables. Every sound variable needs an algorithm based on an action, and every action needs a variable control mechanism and a sensor to monitor its position or at least predict its position, possibly based on the positions of other related moving parts of the machine's systems. To me this is a stimulant. I am fascinated by it, by all of the possibilities. Every sound needs to be recorded in such a way that it is variable by an algorithm based on the mechanical action of by the controller. You can see how I get hung up.The end result is music."Indeed.

Stillwater trout are tough.In a lake or pond they'll move around in search of food; you search for them in different places under different conditions. These environments provide wide menu options for our favorite fish - fly selection can be a daunting challenge. And water that doesn't move allows the trout plenty of time to study and critique your presentation. If it isn't dead spot on, nothing doing.On the other hand, these same conditions allow trout to grow larger in stillwater than they ever would in a stream. If you're after a trophy, mastering the challenges of lakes and ponds is a must.This little Orvis book will help you do it. It's loaded with practical advice, how to tips, and tactics that will at least give you a fighting chance. While at 117 small pages it's a quick read, I find myself going back to it again and again.Carefully studying its content will help to level the playing field.Like I said, stillwater trout are tough...

An unidentified enemy darkens the sunny and idyllic world of our favorite Upper East Side crocodile.The book begins with a quick inventory of those who do love Lyle. There seemingly are no exceptions; this section ends with a picture of Lyle in the park, looking somewhat like Saint Francis of Assisi, birds perching on his head, kittens nestling up against him as butterflies flit about and a happy squirrel approaches. The caption reads, "And in return Lyle loved the whole, wide, wonderful world. He didn't have one single enemy in it... or so he thought".I must digress to talk about Waber's exceptional illustrations. The expressions of abject adoration that he manages impart to the drawings of Lyle's admirers are simply astonishing. Forty years after its creation, his art has a vintage feel, but is so expressive and loaded with detail, that it will hold the attention of readers of all ages.Anyway, getting back to the story, the love fest is interrupted by a note signed, "Your enemy" and stating, "I hate you".In the next section of the book Lyle confronts the pain of rejection, while the Primm family, with whom he lives, tries to discover the identity of the hate monger. All the while the nasty notes keep coming. Mrs. Primm and Lyle even come across the scrawled graffiti, "Down With Crocodiles".Eventually, the sleuthing pays off and the enemy is identified as Clover Sue Hipple, a little girl whose family has recently moved into the neighborhood. All of Clover Sue's friends love Lyle and play with him, but Mrs. Hipple won't let CS join in the fun. Hence the animosity.Another digression, this one dealing with the genius of Waber's choice of names. A little girl, new in the neighborhood and named Clover Sue Hipple? This is rich, and contributes to the bizarre atmosphere that ascribes normalcy to the clearly abnormal condition of a highly civilized reptilian, at home on the streets of Manhattan. The better known William Steig later carried this tradition of zany names to a much wider audience.Anyway, in the end all is well. Redemption reigns and enmity is overcome. Lovable Lyle indeed...

Tempest is a violent album. There's a lot of fighting going on, and a lot of dying too. It's bleak, stark, and kind of scary...It's also quite remarkable. Dylan never ceases to amaze, setting off in unexpected new directions even at age 71.In Scarlet town you fight your father's foesUp on the hill a chilly wind blowsYou fight em on high and you fight em down inYou fight em with whiskey, morphine and ginWhat's going on here?Dylan in 2012, talking to Rolling Stone about Tempest: "I wanted to make something more religious. I just didn't have enough [religious songs]".Dylan in 1965 talking to reporters at a press conference: "I'm not on drugs. I just have a nervous disorder".Hmmm...Anyway, this time around Bob goes on to comment that it's an album, "where anything goes and you just gotta believe it will make sense".So it is, and yeah, so you do.Much has been written about the darkness that shrouds the songs of Tempest. And yes, dark it is indeed, as may befit the times. Dylan's always been adept at pointing out which way the wind is blowing and sometimes it ain't pretty. The times they are a changin', but not necessarily for the better.And so it starts with Duquesne Whistle,Listen to that Duquesne whistle blowingBlowing like it's gonna sweep my world away...Can't you hear that Duquesne whistle blowingBlowing like the sky's gonna blow apartListen to that Duquesne whistle blowingBlowing like it's gonna kill me dead...And so, only a few verses into Tempest, death makes its entrance, and stays there pretty much to the end.The sound of all this is taut - like something's going to snap at any moment. It's blues / rock with banjo, violin and accordion woven in, and over it all Dylan's voice; broken, tattered, tortured and torn, perfect for expressing the shadows that seem to grip the songwriter's soul in his seventy first year.Next up is Soon After Midnight, which on the surface sounds like a light hearted ditty. But listen closer:My heart is cheerful it's never fearfulI've been down on the killing floorsI'm in no great hurryI'm not afraid of your furyI've faced stronger walls than yoursIn Narrow Way things get a bit gruesome...Ever since the British burned the White House downThere's a bleeding mood in the heart of townI saw you drinking from an empty cupI saw you buried and I saw you dug upIt's a long road; it's a long and narrow waySure is.Look at what's going on in Long and Wasted Years:My enemy crashed into the dustStopped dead in his tracks and he lost his lustHe was run down hard and he broke apartHe died in shame, he had an iron heartI wear dark glasses to cover my eyesThere are secrets in `em that I can't disguiseNo doubt.Pay in Blood takes us to an even bleaker place.Night after nightDay after dayThey strip your uselessHopes awayThe more I takeThe more I giveThe more I dieThe more I live.And then the eerie and hypnotic Scarlet Town. Sounding a bit like Man in Long Black Coat comingled with Senor (Tales of Yankee Power), Dylan takes us through the haunted streets:In Scarlet Town in the hot noon hoursThere's palm leaf shadows and scattered flowersBeggars crouching at the gateHelp comes, but it comes too lateBy marble slabs and in fields of stoneYou make your humble wishes knownI touched the garment but the hem was tornIn Scarlet Town where I was bornDid Bob really say that he didn't have enough religious songs? Or is he just sprinkling in the imagery for the fun of it?The mayhem continues in Early Roman Kings.I can strip you of lifeStrip you of breathShip you on downTo the house of deathThe next song, Tin Angel is a sinister and urgent telling of a tale of a love triangle that ends in blood. Here's how Dylan sets up the arrival of the avenger:Well he threw down his helmetAnd his cross handled swordHe renounced his faithHe denied his lordHe crawled on his bellyPut his ear to the wallOne way or another gonna end it all.And then the final two songs - Tempest, about the sinking of the Titanic and Roll on John, about the murder of John Lennon.So.Bob sets out to write a bunch of religious songs and comes up with darkness, death, murder and mayhem. I guess you just have to take him at his word when he says "...you just gotta believe it will make sense".Along the way it'll give you a lot to think about. And it'll grab a hold of you too.

OKI have this recipe for Moldovan borscht. It specifies, among other things, that the beets (six of them) are cut into pieces 1/4" x 1/4" x 3/4". Actually doing this was an endless nightmare, and then there were the carrots, potatoes, parsnips, and all manner of other veggies to deal with. It was brutal.Then my wife bought me the Chop Wizard.All the schvitz is now a matter of the past. This thing is simple, inexpensive, and really works. I can't imagine how I lived without it.Not only does the work go faster, but the results are also superior; sharply cut, uniform morsels that improve any and every meal.What are you waiting for?Buy it!

Contrary to many commemorative editions, this tribute to the life of Steve Jobs from the pages of Fortune Magazine is truly valuable.It's an instructive and enjoyable read that includes 17 Fortune articles dating all the way back to 1983. These are organized into five chapters: What Made Steve Tick, The Early Years, The Return to Apple, The "i" Years, and Epilogue.The result is a riveting amalgam of history and analysis that Apple aficionados will not want to be without.It's a stylish presentation with great illustrations - one that Steve himself would likely have approved of.Were that the case it would be a high recommendation indeed.

The only reason I own a pair of these is because I sometimes fish in Vermont.In their wisdom, the authorities in that greenest of states have decided to ban the use of felt sole wading boots.Wear 'em and you're in line for a fine.This regulation is presumably in the interest of preventing the spread of rock snot and other nasty invasive species. An admirable goal, no doubt about it.But, what about foreign hitch hikers on the laces, threads, tucked in crannies, on various seams and other areas of waders, etc. etc. etc.? Felt is far from the only place for these critters to hide. As a result, a primitive ban such as implemented by Vermont won't effectively reduce the spread of invasives, while it will certainly put fishermen at risk of dangerous falls.I speak from experience. Notwithstanding the "sticky" soles I've landed on my keister every time I've worn these things. And I'm not talking about challenging wading situations; when wearing these any wet rock you encounter becomes a dangerous hazard.I also own two pairs of the otherwise identical felt soled Riverwalkers - they're my favorite boots. Comfortable, light, and grippy.These? Comfortable, light and slippery.Use at your own risk.Perhaps Vermont will be successful in reducing the rock snot when people stop fishing in the state as a result of rules such as this one.

Lyle Walks the Dogs is identified as "a counting book".Here's what I count:In the original series, both written and illustrated by Bernard Waber, Lyle has three fingers (claws?) on each hand and three toes on each foot.In Lyle Walks the Dogs, with text by Waber but illustrations by his now grown up daughter Paulis (to whom The House On 88th Street was dedicated), he has five of each on each.This creates a dissonance in me that results in a four rather than a five star recommendation.Count 'em.Otherwise the book continues the zany excellence appreciated by loyal Lyle aficionados (me included). A glimpse of this is provided by the names of the respective pooches, listed here from one to ten -1) Gwendolyn.2) Morris.3) Pokey.4) Frisky.5) Rosie.6) Snappy.7) Tulip.8) Scrappy.9) Rufus.10) Sniffy.Enjoy!

These are my favorite wading boots. They're comfortable, very light, and provide great grip on slippery rocks.Hence the characterization as delightful.On the other hand, after one season of use they are falling apart. Apparently the flip side of their light weight is that they are in fact lightweight, almost to the point of being flimsy.Therefore the reference to their being diaphanous.In my book, however, delight trumps diaphanousness (this really is a word, I looked it up).I just bought a new pair to use while the originals are being repaired. This way I can keep fishing even when the shoes are in the shop.On this basis, four stars. If you prize durability, buy something else.

What did?Lyle the upper East Side crocodile, "flashing his sweetest, most toothsome smile...to show how really friendly he was".And who is "the distrustful animal"?It's Loretta, the pampered cat of New York neighbor Mr. Grumps.These are the major players in the timeless children's classic by Bernard Waber.The madcap genius injects a large reptile onto the streets of Manhattan. Nobody has a problem with what would ordinarily be a jarring juxtaposition. But this is not a tale of the ordinary - it's about the bizarre, sometimes rising to the level of surreal.The only person who takes issue with Lyle on the loose in the city is that paragon of conformist normalcy, Mr. Grumps.  And of course, his sidekick Loretta (the distrustful animal).Things spin out of control until a point of climax unfolds in in a downtown department store..."Madam," he (Mr. Grumps) gasped, "we do not permit crocodiles in this store you know. Remove him at once"!!There follows an emotional roller coaster ride that ends with peace and reconciliation all around.Kids love this story and will guffaw again and again each time it's read. And it's clever and elegant enough to engage the enjoyment of parents who will inevitably be asked to read it over and over again.

This book resonates with ethereal and otherworldly beauty while delivering an important message.It begins, "There was once a boy who could weave cloth from the clouds. He had a spinning wheel and a loom on top of a hill. As the clouds p[assed, with a whir of the wheel, he would spin them into thread; gold in the morning with the rising sun, white in the afternoon,and crimson in the evening".The boy, taught well by his mother, "Enough is enough and not one stitch more", is a paragon of quiet wisdom. In this timeless tale he encounters a vain and boastful king whose greed disrupts the balance of everything. The intervention of a brave, resourceful princess rescues the kingdom from impending disaster.She does so by asking the urgent question, "Is it too late to undo what has been done?"Masterful illustration by Alison Jay complements the text in weaving this magical modern parable.

Of what?A literary form that I refer to as "Grandiloquent Piscatorial Musing". Key elements of this genre of fishing book include the use of esoteric vocabulary, outrageous similes, and long and complex sentences. Until I read The Longest Silence, I considered James R. Babb the unchallenged master of this field. Now, I'd have to say he has a strong contender in the form of Thomas McGuane. Here are some examples from The Longest Silence: - At an ancient monastery outside Dublin accessed by a stone causeway over fast water, pierced by a circular opening for the angling convenience of the friars, I imagined that they sought the trout and salmon with the down-winged, bright fly that was born in early times on the spate rivers of the Celtic world, in Wales, Scotland, Ireland, and perhaps Cornwall. - Each year, Jim Harrison came down for a long stay and lowered already abysmal standards of decency wherein the awful polarity of our nightlife and daytime striving on the sea places us all within easy reach of professional custodians. - Yet, when the serious angler insinuates himself into the luminous, subaqueous universe of the bonefish and catches one without the benefit of accident, he has, in effect, visited another world, one whose precise cycles and conditions appear so serene that the addled twentieth-century angler begins to be consoled for all he has done to afford the trip in the first place.What is it about fishing that inspires people to write like this?Who knows? Who cares? It's all good...

I bought this book for my nephew's kids (ages 5 and 2 respectively) but am first going to lend it to my wife.After 28 years of blissful marriage, snoring (mine) has reared its ugly head as a major marital problem. The Mouse That Snored, a great book by Bernard Waber, the author of the classic Lyle the Crocodile series, deals with similarly troublesome snoring but has a happy ending (which I won't disclose) and provides a possible solution to the problem.The story takes place in the home of a very quiet family. Here's how the author sets the context:Once there was a quiet manas quiet as a mouse.He lived in the countryin a very quiet house.The quiet man's quiet wifepadded about in slippers.She never made the faintest soundnot even while zipping zippers.They had a catnamed Mose,who went abouton tippy toes.And a parrotnamed Will,Whose only words were"Hush! Be still!"These four characters go about their lives placing a premium on maintaining silence at all costs. So for instance,The quiet man, the quiet woman,the quiet cat and bird,ate their dinner, sipped their drink,and never spoke a word.Nor would they dare eat noisy foodlike crunchy celery, munchy radishesor a snappy carrot,- not even the parrot.They ate instead,stewed tomatoes,mashed potatoes,and puddings made of bread.So you can imagine the mayhem which follows when a city mouse with an ear splitting snore invades the peaceful scene...But in the end all is well.Not only is this beautifully illustrated book lots of fun to read, but it also conveys valuable themes about diversity, compassion, forgiveness, and openness to change.Important messages, not only for kids, but also for sixty something year old married couples.

Croc actually.In the bath tub.Unbeknownst to the Primm family, "Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. Primm and their young son Joshua", to be exact.But not to Hector P. Valenti, "Star of stage and screen", who delivers a mysterious note identifying the reptile as Lyle, (the crocodile), and noting that he will eat only Turkish caviar (Lyle that is, not Hector P. Valenti).So this vintage, utterly bizarre and absolutely delightful tale gets underway.There's something about all this that anticipates the work of William Steig, but without its sometime darkness.Lyle is lovable, endearing, and will delight kids in the 21st century just as he did in the one that went before.Parents too...

We learn from the bio on the back flap that author Chris Santella is also a marketing consultant.It shows, as his "Fifty Places" series has grown to include Hike, Play Golf, Dive, Go Birding, Sail, and others. Now along comes the beginning of the Fifty More franchise with Fifty More Places to Fly Fish Before You Die as well as Fifty More Places to Play Golf Before You Die.At this rate we'll never die...Anyway, the formula works, even though it's more of the same.These destinations are exotic, clearly off the beaten track, and fun to read about on cold winter evenings when the real thing seems very far away.
absurd pricing - this is $28.50 at BARNEYS!

Sadly, I had to return these.They actually fir well and as expected and the leather is beautiful and the style is slimming and sleek….BUTThe pair I received have either been drying out in a dirty warehouse or have been used and returned multiple times.they are dried out and scratched up badly. The also have discolorment all around the front half of foot.IF these had been up to NEW non-defective and non-damaged Fluevog standard, they would have been beautifulAs for fitting - they fit as expected but to walk in them feels a bit odd in the heel area like it slides up a bit when walking (even when fitting properly).As for holding up (If they had been in new condition)…I wouldnt expect them to hold up long at all. The leather wraps all around to underside of sole and scratches easily. The light stitches are no where near enough to hold it together with much use. And the 1st time you wear these in bad weather or accidentally step in anything at all, they are ruined.Sadly, these fall into that "put on a shelf as art" category and arent good for actual wear more than a time or two.

These are shown as standard height waist in the pics but they are not. They are the low rise hip hugger height.They are 5" shorter rise in back than the sellers chart states.If you are under 5'5", they will be really long on you as well.Disappointed - would never have ordered the low rise style.

These are absolutely beautiful to look at and the quality is excellent like all Miz Mooz shoes.Sadly, they arent as expected based on pics…The top/toe area doesnt come up over foot as much as it looks like in pics--its doesnt show toe cleavage but it is just barely enough not to…that, coupled with the sides being much more shallow and loose fitting than the pics make it look, make for very poor structure and support.If you have wide feet, likely the sides will be welcome as wide as they are but the footbed is still narrow like most Miz Mooz shoes are so the fit really isnt great for narrow or wide feet, sadly.  I own nearly a dozen Miz Mooz shoes and these are the only ones I've had to return…and it is sad because they are really beautiful -- just not functionally comfy or supportive.You can tie the tops tight but that didnt help the issue for me with the sides being so loose, low riding and too wide.

Very disappointed.  I got the "check blue" dress because it looks like a navy blue with some brown - it is different than the picture.The large squares in pic are blue and small ones brown but mine is the opposite so it is PRIMARILY BROWN and also much darker than the picture - there was clearly some picture editing done to sell this.The material is a soft, thin flannel with a NON-cotton--maybe poly lining.Mine also has seams that are poorly done and/or undone.In addition, I checked with the seller prior to purchasing to clarify the sizing since they list one chart in the pics and a different chart in the description and was assured the one in the description below was the correct one, but NEITHER are correct. Mine (XL) is 3-4 inch difference in bust than they told me!I bought this dress in 2 other colors/designs and they all fit differently and they are all different materials.

beautiful shoe - would be better if leather, rather than suede leather since everything sticks to suede and it gets ruined so easily, but still they are beautiful.The heel is 4" stilletto so expect to have pain for the beauty.Padding is minimal, could be better for the heel height.These are beautiful, wear short term heels, unless you are 20 and can handle the pain ;-)Bottom of shoes wear quickly but again, you probably will only wear these for an hour or 2 at a time.The fringe is both pretty and flattering to the foot.Small complaint in design is that the angle wrap part is inconsistent - tight on one shoe and loose on the other (I have small, narrow feet).My low stars is based on Price vs Look, design, quality, comfort, materials, and durability.I got them in both black and tan (black shows every spec of dust and dirt that is within a mile of you (just fyi).

these are beautiful but I give the low stars for a few reasons - mainly because the crystals come off extremely easily and many were off when they arrived before ever wearing.they run apx  size small and are very high so they are quite hard on your feet.The inner soles are a nice quality leather though but the little padding there is stops before reaching your toe area where all your weight rests.they look like the pics but maybe slightly more pinkish than purplish.Very pretty - come apart easily and straps are worn away from poor buckle construction. Not comfy.Great to put on a shelf as art - not useful as wearable shoes more than a few mins.I have numerous Steve Madden shoes and heels and love all of them, so this was disappointing.

For those who says it fits busty people - they clearly don't know what "busty" means.  The largest size offered, XXL has a maximum bust of 36" - which is the average "C" cup bra size…so full C's - it'll be really tight and above a "C" - its way too small.Other than that - it looks just like the picture. It is really pretty.There are numerous places where the stitching on the mesh could have been done better but not tragic.If you are small busted, for this price ($21.00), it is a great buy!!

I ordered this after getting another brand of the same product and loving the instant improvement - this brand got good reviews so I ordered it but I have actually seen my skin get worse while on this brand.  Im going back to the other one.

Great Dresses!I found the 1 star ratings to be inaccurate as they deal with people who are either upset about the overseas delivery time or didnt scroll down to where the seller lists exact measurements for each size. These comments go under seller ratings, not item ratings people.My order was delivered in 14 Business days.I was pleasantly surprised. Normally, things from overseas are small and of less quality but this isnt the case with these.I got 2 of these dresses and both were exactly as pictured and described and maybe even a bit nicer quality in person.I have a large bust and smaller waist so I ordered up and with the belt can accommodate my smaller waist area (in comparison to bust).Check their measurements - they are correct for the 2 dresses I received.Material is a nice cotton. The weight of the material is heavy enough that you do not need a slip but not so heavy that it makes it hot.  The inner lining on top half (that you can see a bit of in the pic) is a soft feel as well.  I was concerned it may be itchy but it is not at all.I am 5'3" and the dresses go down apx ½ way between knees and ankles…perfect!Very happy and will buy in more colors!

Great Dresses!I found the 1 star ratings to be inaccurate as they deal with people who are either upset about the overseas delivery time or didnt scroll down to where the seller lists exact measurements for each size. The inner lining on top half (that you can see a bit of in the pic) is a soft feel as well. these are cute and well made - good for the price.Fit seems true to size - long but I'm only 5'3" and expect it.they are a thicker material than I expected - like warm ups so not good for a texas summer but will be great later in the year.

Sizing seems true to me - Very long as I always expect since I'm only 5'3" but find since they are elastic at bottom.Material is my favorite and the reason I bought them…thin, soft, looks expensive and feels yummy!I would recommend these.

United Nude are the only shoes I'll pay full (ridiculously high) price for because they are totally worth it!!They do not disappoint!I am a true size 7 in shoes and usually get a 7.5 in boots so I can wear socks.I got these in a size 8, knowing UN shoes run small and its good that I did. They definitely run a full size small.The 8 fits me tightly with socks but without or with thinner hose/socks fit perfectly.They are narrow even on my slightly narrow foot…but again, fine with thinner socks.The stretchy upper material is great and comfy - the rest is leather and looks stunning!They make your feet look narrow and sexy as ever!HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE!!!

3.5-4 star rating.I only paid $84.97 though so wait for them to go down…They are super, super, super cute!!!!!The comfort isn't great but not horrible either…good for a night out for sure!!The fit is small and tight. I have a slightly narrow, true size 7 foot and I always order up ½ a size in boots to wear thin socks….I gotthese in 7.5 initially and they were super tight, so I returned and got them in the size 8 and am happily keeping them.  They fit fine in the length and are a bit tight but will stretch around since pink part is patent leather.They look phenomenal on and go well to dress up or even to wear with shorts and jeans!I love them even though the comfort is just mediocre….I wouldnt recommend at price above what I paid but am happy at that price!***If you go up a full size above your normal boot size, you could add an insert to footbed to make more comfy ;-)

I just needed something quick and cheap so its fine for that (I ordered 2).I don't believe the fill is what they say it is though - it looks, sounds and feels as though there are a few feathers with a bunch of shredded or waded up paper pieces.  Not full but not super flat either…not comfy for use and flattens out instantly when any pressure is put on them, but fine for display only/decorative pillows.

this is very pretty to look at but not very comfortable or well made.the stitching etc is all made very well but the seating material/construction is very weak and I cant see it holding up with much use.Putting it in the guest room since it wont get used very much there and it looks pretty.

I got the orange - it is a much brighter orange than in the pic - not a neon but closer to neon than what is pictured.It looks like very cheap plastic. I would NOT use it to sit on, for a small table only.Mine also has defects/discoloration like bleached spots and scratches.WAYYYY over-priced for the quality. Should be a $10-$20 item at most.

In true Trina Turk style, these are absolutely gorgeous shoes and they are extremely well crafted.They are narrow and not for people with chubby feet as the middle strap is very small. I have slightly narrow feet and they are a bit tight on me.If you are good with heels/stilettos, you'll love these beauties but if you have issues walking in stilettos, they will be a challenge.I cannot say enough about their beauty though! Sleek, thinning and sexy/classy!

These are very pretty to look at but they are extremely havy shoes - they weight like 7 lbs. Other issue…the space from the inner sole to the top of the shoe inside is very short. I have thin feet and the width is no issue but if you like to wear socks as I do, these leave no room for it unless you remove the inner soles, in which case they become very uncomfortable. Other than above fit issue, I'd say the length and width run pretty true to size.

It's poorly plated--not solid silver or gold, and poorly done...and not a diamond, not even a rhinestone...just a cheap, ugly, stonewith scratches.This is NOT "FINE" jewelry and is absurdly over-priced and looks it.This is a $10 costume necklace trying to be sold as fine jewelry!

This not an 18" cover.  It measures 16.5" x 17" so it wont fit standard pillows properly...will either be too tight or too loose...you can see in the pics its kinda loose. It may just be inconsistent where some are worse or better than others.  Mine has standard 18" insert and it is too tight to zip closed so I'm guessing one in pics has a 16" insert. Since it comes from overseas, they may have different standard pillow sizes than in the U.S.Also, the zipper only opens up 12" so it's difficult to get pillow in without ripping zipper seams.The printing and material quality is very nice though.
love it - tightens skins and helps give it a smoother complexion.
lays very oddly, not like picture shows at all. I have a small head and its still a bit small for how the style shows it is supposed to lay on your head.quality matches price…ehh.

does what it says….vibrates very lightly. No heat and the zipper where the battery pack goes is very poor and extremely difficult to get in and out of and you get little white beads that spill out when you open it.
this works great and the taste isnt bad at all.

These shoes are perfection! I wear a size 7M in flats so I got the bluish/green ones in the 7/7.5 size listed in drop down menu.They fit amazingly well and are incredibly comfortable. I wanted to hate them so I could send them back because money is tight but they are so perfect, I had to keep them!!  Color and materials, craftsmanship, etc. are all superior!  The toe bed is plenty wide and high to fit anyone who doesn't have unusually large or deformed foot issues. The velcro strap is easy to adjust to create a perfect fit. The short heel is nice and isnt felt at all….just feels like walking in padded flats.  They go with many different styles too - dressing them up or down is easy and looks great.The inner lining is a soft, great quality leather and foot bed is nicely cushioned. I cannot think of anything about these that isnt perfection!HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
Looks like a factory defect item - look at how seams dont line up and it ruins the design - also different from the matching top in same pattern.

I ordered on Jan 11th and it was delivered on Jan 23rd - fairly quick from overseas!The cover is beautiful!Great design and the quality of the design and the entire cover construction and material is excellent!The zipper is smooth also.Gorgeous linen material!!

Gorgeous!I got the "sultry temptress" one (blue and silver).  It is slightly lighter colored in person but is even more beautiful than the picture. Hard to picture sequins because of glare.The ring part is apx the same as a size 8-ish ring and you gently tilt it forward to unlatch the purse. For this price, you wont find anything nicer - I love it!!!I ordered on Jan 15th and received it on Jan 26th via air mail.Extremely happy with my purchase. packaged so that there are no scratches too!!  LOVE IT!

I got the mint with sequins.  I have a fairly narrow foot.These were too small - -to-full size but problem is that sizing up wont fix issue for me.they are small in height (from inner sole to top of foot) - very thin or flat.Also, they do not look like the picture - the pic is shiny and nice but these are a dull, green rubber material with plastic sequins that do not have a shine to them. even the laces are a weird cheap material.

I got the black floral.I wear a 7 so I got these in 8 as other said they run small.they run very small - full size to size & a half small. but worst part is they are small from sole to top of foot.I have a fairly narrow foot and they were tight. Might be becaues they have this cheap rubber that is apx an inch or so wide that runs around the inner edge that wads up on your foot.  they also came with loose stitching on the elastic part and glue marks on the upper outer soles.
pretty design.craftsmanship is good but material quality is just ok.the cotton isnt a soft cotton, its a stiff type of cotton.

It is an Iron on and came with the iron on crinkled and already crumbling off.Cute design but awful quality.UPDATE:  SELLER IS GIVING ME THE RUN AROUND STATING THAT A NEW PRODUCT CANNOT BE DAMAGED!  ABSURD!THEY ALSO SAID I'D HAVE TO PAY A RESTOCKING FEE FOR THIS DAMAGED MERCHANDISE!!IT IS AN IRON ON THAT HAS A HUGE CREASE DOWN ONE SIDE OF THE DESIGN THAT IS CREASED AND CRACKING/CRUMBLING!!!

I normally love TT clothes!  These fit me very well - aren't tight at all but they ride up something fiercewhen I walk - and my body shape isn't causing it - poorly designed which is highly unusual for TT :-(
apparently they have no quality control department.mine has the image & writing reversed on it like a mirror image.useless.

I paid $10.00 for it and that is a steal!!Incredibly well packaged - wish all sellers did this!Looks like pic - I got the one in gunmetal color.Doesnt seem to scratch easily but it will scratch. Fingerprints too….But it is stunning - like carrying a piece of art!Great purchase - I'm really glad I got it!
Beautiful - looks as pictured and is as described. Nice material - lays nicely - good long length - Recommended.
Recommended.  Just as pictured and described. Great material - lays nicely and good long length.
Just as pictured and described - great material - lays nicely - good long length. Recommended.

Listing says 100% Rayon - It is NOT RAYON.  It says right on the label 100% Cotton and it is a very stiff and slightly itchy cotton. Otherwise, its pretty. Green is a bit darker than picture too.  And the black on it is a fuzzy raised material.

pretty enough...the material could be a bit nicer but it's not bad. I got the blue - its navy and the other blue in it is almost an indigo (but more blue).it runs just a little on the small size and has no give. I don't care for the cut as much as most in this style….it's too straight cut to suit me. I'm returning but if you are skinny, not at all picky, and dont mind the stiff material, you'll like it.

they look like the picture.  The material is okay…could be a bit softer and sturdier.They stretch a LOT in waist area so you can order just about any size and they'll fit.They are SUPER LONG though. I'm 5'3" and I had to cut 7" off to wear with heels!You can cut the material fine but when cutting that much, you are cutting off the flaired legs.

adorable! cool material that vents - stetchy and super soft in back. front design is precious! light elastic waist is flattering and still very comfy and hides and slight pooch area below waist. Love the frayed edging and the swirled flowers.  This dresses up or down easily and is all-day confy to wear…with or without jacket (I use a bolero in evenings). Made well! Sizing is standard.
Really beautiful - looks like picture. detail of overlay fabric really adds a classy upscale look but it also makes it snag more easily.I love this dress!!

The large isnt made to fit like it says. These are for stick figure legs. I do NOT have thick legs and these are way too tight.The socks I got in size large have an UN-stretched circumference of apx 6.25" and when they are FULLY stretched to their max, the circumference is apx of 10".The material is slightly on the itchy side. The color and pattern look like the pic here but just a slightly darker brown.BIGGEST COMPLAINT about them though is:  The insides have that loose thick fabric from the underside of the pattern that your toes and toenails will snag constantly putting them on and taking them off…plus it makes it a bit tighter and less comfortable as well as the itch factor.
Looks and fits as expected. Realy cute style.Fabric could be a little softer but that will change with washing.Excellent value for the price!

Beautiful fabric as Trina Turk always is!I'd say the sizing is just slightly smaller than average.It is stretchy so just depends if you want it to fit more form fitted or loosely.Beautiful print and design.
sturdy strength top with really cute design!Not nearly as stretchy as most tank tops.fits true to size - I got the large.not the softest fabric but it'll soften up with washing.

I wear a true 7 in shoes and order a 7.5 in boots to accommodate socks.I got the Leopard boots in a 7.5.Mine had a few glue marks on the hair on the boots & heel but even said, theseare truly stunning just to look at.I'm returning (in part for glue marks but also) for the following reasons:They run small - at least ½ size and the pull tag is too little to actually use.They are a little hard to get on and harder to take off.They arent made too well-the gold plate around front of toe area ispartly coming off on one side and you can see that it is cheap and will bend, scratch,and come off easily if bumped. Also, the heel is poorly constructed (pieces stacked, not solid)that chip off and break easily.When shoes are on, the top sides buckle out and make your feet look like duck feet.The soles are extremely hard and there is no room for padding as the fit is so tight...not only in length but in the sole to top of foot height. I have thin, slightly narrow feet andthe width is fine but the height is too tight even with only thin hose. And the ankle fitis too loose and stretches out when taking them on and off so it looks & feels odd.The hair/leather comes all the way down to floor so it will be impossible to keep them clean.Bottom line - not made as well as I'd like, VERY uncomfortable and hard, tight fit around footand loose fit around ankle and glue marks are reasoning I'm returning them.

These run a full size small.I wear a true 7 in shoes and 7.5 in boots (yo accommodate socks).I ordered these (greenish ones) in a size 7.5They are extremely tight but not just how you might think.I have narrow feet and they are fine in the width but the height from bottom to top of foot is tight.Also, the length runs short.That said, I'm letting them stretch.They have NO padding and the foot bed is hard as a rock.All of the above said, I am keeping them. I usually only keep expensive shoes if they fit superbly but these are the most beautiful shoes/boots I have seen in ages!They are so pretty I didn't want to take them off at bed time - ha!The snake leather is high quality and the coloring is superb!The stitching is well done.The soles are beautiful but may wear quickly as they are wood but I'm going to put several acrylic coats on them to make them last longer - if you do this every few months, it helps them last!If they fit better or had softer soles,I'd give 10 stars ;-)

This is NOT THE CREAM!I'm 45, white, female….Its not the cream so its mislabeled - but it does works great as a face mask. It gets rid of blemishes instantly after one application and it works great on my age spots. If I get hives, pimple, anything, I can use this and in one application (I just leave it on apx 10-30 mins depending) and it make smy skin smoother, age spots lighten a lot and I get very clear soft complexion!
looks like pic - good quality - fits as expected - if you are in between, go up but if you are not, order your regular size.
painted on color - worthless - wont last past 1st wash.

Heads up - this is coming from the UK and it is a 6 week delivery window....However, I got mine in under 2 weeks.I got the cross shirt in the plum/purple color.It is beautiful material - thin and stretchy and it totally clings to your body!The sleeves are little shorter than ¾ and do not un-roll - the tab is for design only.The studs are pretty but look more like stick on's than regular stud so not sure it they will stay on long.All said, I give 3 stars because I like the material and fit (slimmer on top and wider around bottom) and the softness of the shirt, but no more because it is over-priced for the quality.Happy enough to keep it but would not order more of them in the other colors.

I gave only 1 star because they aren't wearable.They are ok looking, MUCH MUCH more shiny and cheap looking in person.But the worst thing is the design flaw.I have a true size 7 foot and narrow. I ordered up to a 7.5 per other reviews.It took literally 4 minutes to get a foot in them - could only get in one, and just barely and then almost couldnt get it off.Aside from the stiff zippers that stick, even with the zipper all the way open, it doesnt open the boot up much.The problem in design and getting into them is caused by the rounded area around the sides and back part of the heel. It is stiff and the fabric above is soft. There is no pull tab and the opening isn't large enough to get your foot in without the heel folding under your foot.I think you would need to be 2 sizes larger to get the heel in but then you'd have too much room in the front of the boot as the front part only, seems to be a true size/fit.The bottom/soles have felt. In the pics, they look classy but in person they look like an old couch your great-grandma might have.Only thing positive I can say about them is the material is fairly soft to the touch (which of course will make it wear and stain more easily though).

Does the job as described - adjustable. AT first I was putting the tabs in wrong but once I corrected that, they fit very well.They could be a bit cheaper but not too bad. Only complaint really is that the perforation for tearing them apart/puttng them together, could have been better - you have to tear carefully -- but if you do, they are good.

Its cute but I've bought many less expensive ones that didnt look as cheap as this one does. The material isn't nice at all. Some faux patent bags look nice and some look like cheap plastic, this one looks like cheap plastic. The shape is odd as well, perhaps from them folding it to store and mail but it won't reshape. The inside pocket looks like a white zip lock baggie…really, really, cheap, thin, plastic that tears easily. There is no lining inside. The seams are stitched fairly well but due to the rigidity of the material, they look as though they'll crack and pull apart easily.The outer bow has unnderseams (glued, not stitched) that were already coming apart when I got mine. I could see using this to take something to the post office on a rainy day but to use it with a decent outfit to go anywhere would look awful. Extremely down dressed quality.

They are definitely huge as described. I took pics next to a normal size pair, but it wont let me upload customer images.I gave 1 star because they are broken. If they had arrived in good condition, I would give them 2 stars.I bought them for color therapy glasses which they are NOT good for. They appear very purple from the outside but looking through them, they barely have any colored hue at all.The plastic is that thick, rigid, type that you find with most cheap glasses. It has no give and breaks off extremely easily.They sent me a pair without scratches on the lenses so that was good -- but they mailed them in a plastic bag!They do use small bubble wrap to protect the lenses from getting scratched - however, it did nothing to protect mine from breaking and cracking from being in a plastic bag, as well as the framing getting scratched.  They should be mailed in a box!I can't deal with the hassles of a return - too difficult for me to get to post office during business hours etc…so I am just out the money for these cheap, easily breakable, not purple when you look through them, broken glasses I received.
lists platform height but not heel height - high heel that is uncomfortable to walk it and fits poorly.

So sad, I have to return them. I said they fit as expected meaning true to size but they are different than normal Donald Pliners. Normally, Donald Pliners always run a size small so I ordered a size 8 for my size 7 feet. They are too big. I have many Pliners but none that are the "Lisa" by pliner, so I've learned they fit differently apparently. Since they are out of 7 or 7.5 I just have to return them. I am so sad because they are fabulous. I have so much trouble finding flats I like due to poor design but these are so well designed and made. They are heavy, sturdy, thick wall construction and good support - all while actually being comfortable.  They are stunning to look at and very versatile as for being able to dress them up or down and the graphite color goes with a lot of things.
I have these in the purple. Most comfortable shoes ever!!!!!
These are fine but not great. A bit pricey in my opinion. Nothing wrong with them buit the material isn't great quality - its a thin, not soft, texture. They are okay though - keeping for errands.

Mine fit well because I am familiar with Pliner shoes and know to order up. I am a true size 7 and I got these in a 7.5 and they are a perfect fit.I got them in the blue and it looks just like the pics - they are beautiful and super comfortable! I havent been this pleased with a shoe order in a long time!  I wish there were more colors!Pliners are not made for people with wide feet…I have slightly narrow feet and they fit very well.Structure, support and comfort are all great!

I got these in the leopard print. Knowing & loving Donald Pliner shoes, I know they run small so I ordered up.I wear a true 7. I order a 7.5 usually in boots to be able to accommodate wearing socks with them. In this, I ordered the size 8 knowing how Pliners run small. It was good I did, also with the pointed toe. They fit well in the 8 with thin socks. I also have a slightly narrow foot (which is good considering Pliners are always narrow).These are pretty for sure but I didnt think they looked quite as nice in person (which is the opposite reaction I normally have with Pliners).The leopard print is painted on and had a couple minor flaws that looked a bit on the tacky side.Otherwise, they look nice-they went on and off easily/nicely. Smooth zipper action, etc.******I am RETURNING them - here is why:I'm not great with high heels and 3.5 is my absolute max heel height if there is no platform to help.These are listed as having a 3.5 inch heel, but it is actually just barely under 4" tall (apx. 3 ⅞").With that angle, it makes the ball of the foot feet really hard when walking and it hurt just taking a couple steps (for me).In addition, the boot comes up just a little too high for that high of an angle/heel, making it cut into the back of your leg a bit…not horribly, but enough to be uncomfortable after just a min. or two.All this said, if you are good with high heels, have narrow feet, and don't mind a slight discomfort in the name of fashion, then you'd probably be happy with these.For me, any shoe near or over $100 must be incredible to look at and incredibly comfortable for me to justify the price.

Like the other reviewer said - I took a chance even after reading the review (because I have a narrow, small foot and thought it was worth a chance because they are cute).  I am a true size 7 with a narrow foot. I ordered an 8 in the hopes of avioding the issue about getting into the boot. NO LUCK....I couldnt get my foot into the boot!The opening neck of the boot fabric was cut to small and isnt flexible at all.These are defective in design - not an issue with ordering different sizes.There was clearly no quality control done by the manufacturer.Returning.

I got the black and white and they are so pretty. They fit true to size. The reason for my low rating is the construction/style.The sides are really low and flatten out when on/walking. No side support at all. They feel like you are just walking on the floor with something covering part of your toes.They are very pretty and feminine to look at - the toe cleavage is very low. The soles are very thin and when the slick wear off they likely wont hold up long.Sad because they are so pretty but I find them unwearable.

These are beautiful shoes! The reason for my low rating is the style and sizing. They run apx  size small but sizing up (even if it were available-which it isnt) wont help because the flap on top is very loose and if the shoe fit normally, the foot would slip out of shoe when walking. The flap needed to be stitched a bit further down to prevent this. But they are gorgeous to look at - just cant wear them. In addition, the soles are hard with no padding and extremely slippery. I know with wearing, the slick wears off but because the soles are also very thin, I'm afraid that when scuffed, they will wear away quickly and get holes in the bottom. For an expensive shoe, they should be made much better. Sad because they are so pretty.

I have 9 pair of United Nude shoes made with this elastic material and they all run consistent in being just a little tight/smaller than normal.That said, I am a solid size 7 and I have a slightly narrow foot, but ordered a size 8 in this shoe to accommodate UN sizing.I could barely even squeeze into them. These run a FULL 2 sizes too small.I don't think ordering up another size will help as the way they are constructed is odd and in areas they fold when you walk - hard to put into words. Certain areas are bulky while other areas are too small.As for the 1 star rating: I love the fabric (that is why I have 9 pair in other styles with it), but the way the rubber sides come up over the top looks ugly and adds to the heavy and bulky nature of this particular style. That combined with not being able to get a size that will fit is the reason for my low rating. I love United Nude shoes but this one is a no-way for me and I cannot recommend it.
Are the "Blue" pic and the "Navy" pic switched?  The bright blue says navy and the muted navy one says Blue. I'm confused but want the bright one…HELP??

I love these Kinivo adapters! They work great, with one caveat. If you are listening to music and you initiate a call, the music won't seem to play again after the call is over. To get it working again, hold the big button on the unit, then cancel the voice command on phone (iPhone) then it will start playing again. Took a while to figure out this work around, but it works!
Fit my 2004 E55 AMG. Pay attention to the direction of install. You should show ONE black line when installed in the cap, NOT TWO. If you show 2, flip it over.
This stuff is very cool! It's very durable, bright and overall really a great product! Would buy for any kid or any purpose really.

My husband and I use this. It works great. It doesn't dry up and is not sticky. It's the only lube we use. It's made of vegetable products and whatnot, and it doesn't irritate me, as I am very sensitive. It's really great lube. I am pretty much disappointed with every other lubricant I've ever bought and I have been buying this for a long time. Also comes in a pump, which is easier to use bc it is somewhat thick. Also, great customer service, should you need to contact the company! I totally recommend this lube for all your sex lube needs. FYI, It's not just for anal.
This fit my 2004 E55 Mercedes perfectly. OEM quality. Great product.
Fit was right for my application, the quality is great, the price was right.
This scale is the quality that you'd expect from Feedback, it's very very well made and easy to use. It is exactly what I needed. It works as advertised. Perfect for all you weight weenies!
This rope is beautiful, soft and generally lovely. It is as described. The best part is that it said it would take a month or six weeks to arrive. It got there in roughly 10 days. It's great rope.

The only thing good about these is the size. I'm 5'9" and 135 pounds. They fit. That's the only good thing.1. They are super cheaply made and had pulls in them right out of the package. The weave is wide, they are cheap cheap.2. The back seam goes from the top down but stops about 3" above my heel. WTF? The seem is supposed to extend all the way under the heel. It just stops? That looks stupid.It's not worth returning them. I just won't ever buy them again and I recommend everyone avoid them as well. Try Trasparenze. That brand is well made and actually has quality control.For what it's worth, I did get 2 pairs in the order. Too bad I won't use either of them.

These stockings are considered 'one size' but only buy them if you play for the WNBA.I am 5'9 and 135 pounds with a 34" inseam and I could have pulled these up to my boobs. They are also enormous in girth. After messing around with these for a bit, I decided to see how big they really were, so I stuck BOTH legs in one stocking, they looked about right, and I could LITERALLY pull the top over my 38" hips without running or destroying them. Seriously, these are built for the giant amazons in science fiction novels.Also, the stocking is not smooth, it has a relatively widely spaced (cheap) weave.TL;DR: These things suck donkey a$$ and you shouldn't buy them. (no offense to donkies.)
This is not a MB item as previously noted. This thing is a waste of money. DO NOT BUY. It is unusable for MB cars. I'm not sure what it is good for.

Birthday gift for my 2 year old.  Having the building plate really opens up the options for the scope of what is built.  Even though we only have about 30 or so Duplo blocks right now, with the base plate, we can build a small building or other larger structure, instead of just constantly building towers.  He loves it, it's well made, it's very useful.  Summed up, it gets 5 stars from us!

It's all these thing! It's wonderful. It's just what I wanted. It looks brilliant amazing and it works like no other. I have several garters, this one is my favorite. The garters are strong, they adjust short to long, and the clasps are high quality metal and rubber.Sizing: I measure as follows waist 28, hips 37 and I ordered a small/26 based on what other reviewers said. It fits perfectly and it's very comfortable. It's worth the money.
This device is an extremely efficient way to induce a male O. I mean, it's industrial strength. Works and feels great.
Had it framed to remind me to wear hot lingerie for my husband and stuck it in the bathroom. It's a great piece of history and it's super sexy.

Go to a hobby shop, spend some hard earned money, get something decent. This seemed cool for a very short time, then it quit accepting a charge.  This is our fourth attempt at cheap helos.  I'm done.  And fwiw, two separate friends got this same model at Christmas and both of their quit as well.  Not DOA, not crashed.  Just quit working.

Makes a nice loud popping sound, hurts a good bit, but not too much so that it's not fun. One of our favorite toys. I would recommend this for either beginners or advanced users. This product is not for use on pets, llamas, children, chickens and will scratch the paint on most, if not all, cars and trucks. It is not for canoes or kayaks either as it is not long enough for that use.

...he's a big bored dog. He also chews stuff like door frames, cardboard and all the kids toys he can find. The fact that he likes this doesn't make it a good product. However, the fact that it's intact after more than a month? That makes it a good product!

I am 5'9", with a long inseam and these are quite short. I love the quality, but I am not sure these are for tall, leggy girls. The picture is misleading, or the model in the photo is 5' tall. I might go back and get the larges, but we shall see. I can't attest to the durability bc I pushed my long japanesy finger nails through them on the first night, totally my drunken fault, not the quality.Update: I loved the quality of these stockings so I wasn't going to just write them off bc there are so many other crappy stockings on here, and I have yet to find a decent one, so I ordered them in a Large as I said above. They fit perfectly, maybe a teensy bit long, but I am NOT complaining. They are beautiful, soft, high quality and sexy. This is now my preferred stocking brand and I have more from this company on order.Don't buy them small. If you're on the edge, size up! These are well worth the cost.

This is adorable when laid out on the bed.  As a garment, it's worthless. I am 5'9" and 135lbs. I ordered a large as the others reviewers have recommended and it fits, but is nearly too large.  My hips are 38" and my waist is 29". The garter elastics are very long and the small adjuster won't stay up, so I stitched mine. They are almost short enough on the SHORTEST adjustment and my inseam is 34". I am very leggy and I think this would be way too long for a shorter person, or a tall person with normal proportions, so be ready to alter it.The clips are plastic. It is very hard to get them fastened over stockings in the first place, and they often pop loose. It's a cute piece, but its bedroom only.  This is absolutely not serviceable out in public.  It's not worth the effort and cost to attach metal garter clips.  For all these reasons, it barelly garners two stars from me.

I am a parent to 9 year old boy who is dyslexic.  We are non-religious homeschoolers who spend quite a lot of time out at museum and other classes and co-ops.  My son has never experienced any bullying in regards to dyslexia or otherwise.  He has also never experienced the nasty behavior described in the friendships in this book.  Had he already been part of that, I think this would be a fine book that he could relate to.  However, I did not end up reading it to him because I think it would introduce neagative thoughts that he currently doesn't worry about.For a child who has experienced the common public school issues addressed in this book, I think it is well written and on target.  It ends very upbeat and practical.  But, I cannot recommend it to a child who has not experienced these negatives.

Great protection pack.  We bought these for rollerblading for my 5 yr old daughter who is average height and very slim.  They also fit on my slim, athletic 9 yr old son.  Well made, durable, effective.  There isn't too much to say for these beyond that.  They might not be a good fit for a heavy set child, however.

This dress is absolutely lovely.  It's well made, high quality cotton.  The pattern is gorgeous, the colors vivid.  The medium fits true to their sizing chart.  I am 5'9", 34C-28-36.The lining of the bust area is a stretchy, thin material.  It was cut a bit smaller than the outer cotton and thus on my 34C chest, the cotton wouldn't quite lay right.  A larger bust would stretch the lining and make it lay perfectly, as evidenced when I stuck a couple breast pads in my bra cups to see what would happen.  That said, I'm not interested in bigger boobs, so I took the dress to the tailor and had it altered.  The job was $15 and now it lays absolutely perfectly on my un-enhanced chest.The dress was perfect for a Mad Men theme potluck, and is also lovely for date nights, summer weddings, etc.  I have several Lindy Bop dresses and while I love them all, this might just be my favorite.

Average width, a little too wide for my slightly narrow feet.  I kept them, but they fit looser in girth than I would like.  The length is as expected from my size 9 foot.  The lining pattern is very 2013-trendy.  I wish it was plain so that the shoes wouldn't look dated.  Other than that, they are nice, made well enough for the price, are stylish, and do the job.

Good quality temporary tattoos.  I got this as a little gift to go along with our Story of the World lessons.  The kids, 5 and 9, love it.  I also got some for their buddies, 4 and 10 yr olds.  They stuck a couple on me, too, next to my real ink.  :)  Everyone was happy and it was a fun, cheap little accessory to their lessons that helped make the lessons come alive.
I got this as a little gift to go along with our Story of the World lessons.  The kids, 5 and 9, love it.  They took it in the car, used it in restaurants, etc.  Lots of fun!
We've been using this charger consistently for several months now and have no issues with it.  It charges, it hasn't failed, it doesn't overheat.  What more could I want from this?  :)

Overall, the ingredients are much safer than your usual lotions.  The shimmer is nice; it's noticeable but not over the top.  I wouldn't use it as a daily lotion, but is great for night events.  It's pricey, admittedly, but google didn't uncover anything lower priced that was similar to this.I'm not personally a huge fan of the blueberry scent.  It's not candy-ish, though, just "accurately blueberry."  On the other hand, my husband LOVES it on me.  It's clearly just a matter of preference.

I bought this for homeschooling.  Particularly, we use it for All About Spelling and All About Reading, which require the magnetic feature.  It is exactly what we needed and works great for us.  We also use it as a dry erase board for those curriculums and for other tasks, as well.  It cleans nicely, works as expected.  I am very happy with this board.

They really shouldn't have used the "stretch to fit" option when they printed the Bettie Page sticker.  While she isn't outrageously out of proportion, it is noticeable when you're sober and in normal lighting conditions.  As a homeschooling mom of three kids, I don't frequently have use for a flask.  When I do use it, however, it's in dark venues and everyone is already partaking.  So, under those circumstances, the flask looks GREAT and commands many compliments.  It has saved us lots of money on over priced drinks at the burlesque shows we enjoy.  All in all, it's great.  But that image is driving me nuts.

The car is very cool, no doubt. I bought 2 of these so my kids can race them, but my 5 year old doesn't drive hers a lot. But, I have a 9 year old who runs the car a considerable amount and the differential gears were skipping within 3 days. I took it apart and put ball bearings in it and it seems to work better. The nylon bushings that come with the car just aren't sufficient and soon they will allow a lot of 'slop' in the mechanisms. The wheels bushings were worn, and pretty much worn out within 24 hours. The thing is, when you have a powerful R/C car, you really need to have metal internals. I imagine this car will be fun for a long time, but I will be fixing and upgrading it...alot.There are plenty of parts and kits online and at my local shop to upgrade this car into a useable R/C car that will last and be fun, but it's not going to last out of the box.Remember that you get what you pay for, so anything in this price range is going to be sketchy and basically the same.My son has been into R/C cars for quite some time and knows how to drive it, does not crash it into things, etc. There is no misuse going on here.Traxxas needs to pull this product, do a quick redesign on the gears and bushings and then it will be worth the money. Until then, pass on this one, unless you know what you're getting.

This box destroys data. For me, there is one bay position that destroys drive indexing files. I am now on my second data recovery regime. This box is to blame. DO NOT BUY THIS.I am a very experience (IT Professional) user and this hardware issue is absolutely the worst I've ever seen. If you enjoy non-corrupt data, look elsewhere.

I bought this for my nine year old son, who constantly had dirty nails.  He likes it, and thus is much cleaner now, but I think it's quite good myself.  I borrow it from him regularly.  Good quality, nice edges, well made.  It's a simple, effective tool.

Our son is way into Legos, and this book was great! It's also a fantastic coffee table book and gives all my atheist friends a laugh. It highlights the best parts of the bible! Of course, that's the human sacrifice, incest, genital mutilation and what have you. It's perfect for all you heathens and heathenesses. Buy for your kids and you can have a laugh too. Don't be put off by the reviews, it's a bunch of religious people giving it one star for just the reasons I gave above. Yep, it's true to the Old Testament, in all the right ways. Love it!

These are sexy legging with a cool pattern. They work with my image having multi-colored hair and all. But, one size my butt! I am not large by any means. I wear a size 6 dress and am 5'8" tall, I do have a long inseam, but these should fit yes? Kinda. They are very tight in the thighs and too short. They still look great, but they are not comfortable. I was hoping they would be more comfortable. So, I am giving them 3 stars.

There isn't much to say about these, but it's a box of 1,000 non-splintery wood sticks.  Great for crafts.  Box is flimsy, so you might have to put them in something else if your kids get crazy with the package.

We have had three of these over the years...great beach and backyard toys....if your back yard is big enough!  We lost one and broke one.  You do have to be careful to keep these from landing on concrete, as it makes the leading edge very rough.  Other than that one precaution, we love it.  My husband has a little trouble throwing it well, but our 8 yr old and I love it and can send it really really far.  We can get it nearly all the way across our square three acre yard, for example.
We use this with our Chauvet bubble maker.  It produces excellent colorful bubbles that last really well in the breeze.

We try to keep the plastic to a bare minimum in our home, but we have tile floors, counters, and a pool...plus three kids.  A lot of times, glasses just aren't practical.  These pint cups are well made, don't take up much space and wash easily.  They are durable and attractive.  We love them and will be buying more.

It weighs stuff accurately. Please remember there is a tare button for something such as a tray b/c the weighing surface area is very small. It's portable and has a nice LCD screen that is back lit and is simple to use.

They rust, so clear coat or paint them before you install them. Otherwise, they are FAR superior to the two otheer options, which is either no master link (not really recommended) and the clip type. It just works well. They should be Ti (gold) coated to address the rust issue.
This is the lightest, and I think it's the best made headset on the market. It is really great quality. Lighter than the Chris King at less than 1/2 the cost. It's a no brainer.
These are the lightest pads on the market. They aren't cheap but buying light, is never cheap. They work well!
These are NOT plastic with carbon fiber stickers. These are the real deal and very nice. You won't be disappointed.

I bought these to replace an aluminum collar on a lightweight application, specifically b/c I thought the nylon would be lighter. Well, it is about 3 times and heavy. It's a good collar though, if you aren't looking for lightweight.
ACS Crossfire makes the nicest and most beefy and reliable flip flop freewheel (meaning 15T or under) on the market. They last and they have pretty great engagement points.

We used these on a ladies BMX pro cruiser and ladies pro xl class bike. This kit includes the BB and (3) 2.5mm shims. You will need to install the shims (2) for the 68mm bottom bracket and adjust the freewheel or cassette gear out 2mm or you get an offset chain line which is noisy, causes chain wear and could cause a chain to derail. You can buy a pack of 1mm spacers on Amazon that work just right. I consider this crank a very good crank, but I would limit the rider weight to 150lbs or so (only for BMX use.) Not that they would break, just to limit flex. However, they flex less then 90% of the cranks out there with no weight limit. These are not quite as beefy as the Saints but are lighter and great for a light rider. I think these are a really under utilized product. Like all Shimano products, they are well built, nicely packaged and look good. I really DON'T like the finish on these, though. It's a dark gray textured paint. They would look even better polished. The finish is powder coat, so it's tough and polishing would take some time.These are an excellent and cost effective alternative over Shimano DXR cranks ($450) for any lighter BMX rider. I would install them and use them for any light rider without a second thought. They are really nice.

These don't have pilot dude germs all over them. They don't have old bits of catering on them. Buy extras and consider them consumables. We share headsets and we just chuck the muffs when one of the pilots has the sniffles. These worked well.

This unit produces excellent stream of bubbles and is pretty decently made. It really burns the bubble juice, so get extra. Now, I knocked it down a star b/c it gave me a small shock when I was trying to turn it off. Come on, ground this thing!
We have lots of Plan City pieces, along with Brio and Thomas trains.  This set added some extra road pieces that we were lacking.  Nice little set by itself, or as extras.

Meter means measure, the story of the metric system  by Carl S. HirschInteresting book about the start of the meter. Lots of controversy over the years as to when to adopt this measurement in the US.So much easier to use not only in manufacturing but overseas.  Hope US jumps on this soon, so much more accurate when measuring knitting also, not just food and liquids.Liked the part about when the coal miners would weigh the coal brought up vs the weight they bought at the store-2 totally different measurements.I received this book from National Library Service for my BARD (Braille Audio Reading Device).

Driftwood summer  by  Patti Henry CallahanBook starts out with Riley, raising her son above the bookstore. We learn of how the store got to be where it's located.Alternating chapters from the 3 sisters as the story unfolds.200th year anniversary week long party is planned, something for everybody.  She learns when her mother falls down the stairs that she also has cancer in her bone that will be treated after the party.Her sisters are to come also to visit, which they are not to be told about the cancer. She also has broken bones...Maisey had run away years ago from Georgia to CA, working as an interior designer. The boss can do without her for a bit.Adeline goes to college but enjoys the years partying her life away. She's coming home early to help with the bookstore as it's failing.Ladies have long time sorrows and joys, some they are able to work through as others who visit the summer town return for the summer...I received this book from National Library Service for my BARD (Braille Audio Reading Device).

The invention of clouds, how an amateur meteorologist forged the language of the skies by Richard HamblynTalks a bit about the 4 different cloud formations but more about the amateur meteorologist and his life.I received this book from National Library Service for my BARD (Braille Audio Reading Device).

Picture day perfection  by Deborah DiesenAudio children's book about a day at school where they take pictures.You dress up and have the cleaning face with a big smile.
