Cooking this in our InstaPot Pressure Cooker is awesome!Great for any oriental cuisine and for any hearty meal that calls for or you want to add rice to.
My 13 year old Collie loves these.  She can be picky, so I was a little concerned at first when I saw some reviews here about their dogs not eating them.Thankfully, ours can't seem to get enough.

I definitely liked the idea of having one less gadget on my desk so I thought I'd give this a try and replace my existing modem and router with this all in one solution.Like the others have noted here for Xfinity, although this would connect to the activate section of their website, I was unable to activate this modem online.  Even after waiting the recommended 15 minutes so that all things would be in "sync".So I called the Xfinity number (HUGE Kudos to TP LINK for including that phone number in the documentation) and within 5 minutes the modem was up and running...then something weird happened.After I renamed the SSID's and changed the time zone, everything stopped working, even though the modem and router showed all lights/connections were as they should be...I could not reach the internet.  I did reboots, and power downs to no avail.  So I called Xfinity again and sure enough they could see I was having problems, but this time they told me the signal was weak and to check the cable in the back.  Of course, nothing was wrong as I had tightened it as much as possible.After 20 minutes of being on the phone, I defaulted to doing a complete modem reset to factory defaults.  After doing that, it has been working great.Unfortunately, my AIO desktop upstairs now only gets 1 bar signal strength whereas from my previous set up, I was at full bars.  So this doesn't appear to have the range that my other setup had.Also, TPLINK needs an IOS App to control this device.  Having to login to it from the web is old school.  Their "tether" app indicates this not yet a supported device...although the Archer C7 is...Another frustrating note is that most of my previous routers had the inlaid option to check for firmware updates within the device settings...not yet on this one.Although it works, and is a little light on the range compared to my old setup, I'm leaving it hooked up for now.  The last thing I want to do is call Xfinity again and go through the activation of my old modem (yes, they actually have to re-load a previous device that was being used).

This is the second piece of jewelry from the Amazon collection I've received and just like the 1st one I have, I'm very impressed.  Even without jewels, the piece is high quality.  It has weight, without being heavy and looks great.The chain was cheapo, but easily swapped it out with another piece.I would buy this piece of jewelry.

This is a nice, convenient way to carry and have on hand a source to releve headaches.  I was able to test it out with a real headache...not a migraine mind you, but a headache nonetheless and am happy to report this did seem to kick in faster than popping a pill.Liked the flavor, tart but also had some aftertaste.

I have installed my fair share of similar cameras/systems.  Dropcam, and the others worked with no problems.  They all had similar if not identical procedures:  Turn on device, download app, connect to the devices wifi, then the device and your router talk...and viola, its connected and you are good to go.Not with Guardzilla.  Not only has thing failed to connect, half of the times it wouldnt even list my network to connect to.  My neighbors were there, but mine weren't.  Of course I get out of the app, and my iPhone promptly connects to my network.It really seems like a hit or miss with this device.  I know what I'm doing on my end is right.I'm wondering if it has something to do with dual-band routers as this device will only see my 2.4ghz band...could be.  Either way, it is useless to me.EDIT:  8/31/15I really don't like things getting the best of me, so I tackled it again and was finally able to get it to connect...albeit slowly.  I have to say, in the end, the video quality is subpar...even on the highest setting.  The motion detection system is spotty...even after changing settings.  The pet setting doesn't work for me.  The images it catches when armed wouldn't let you finger a criminal in a court room if needed.  Not to mention the god-awful clicking noise this thing makes when you trip the motion sensor.For $50 more, do yourself a favor and get a DropCam.

Very nice and sturdy pan.  Perfect for enchiladas and even smothered burritos.  The pan seems to distribute the heat evenly on the bottom and throughout, melted cheese wasn't a problem coming out of the pan.This is a heavy pan and actually looks nice enough that it could easily sit out on your stove top without making that area look junkyHave yet to try it for lasagna but I'm not expecting any issues.

Good basic plastic cups.  Durability is strong and also reminds me of the red plastic ones.  Not sure they would survive a run through dishwasher with a heated dry cycle, but easily can be re-used throughout day/week which is what I'm looking for.

A decent kids toy if they are into dinosaurs...or just love the Jurassic Park Movies.This is definitely one of the larger dinosaur toys I've seen, and the toy itself is all plastic.  The body and legs are the hard plastic you would expect, but to allow for movement the neck and tail has more of a consistency of a latex.It's a dinosaur that makes noise and moves a little.  It should entertain your kid(s) for a while, but I think it is more impressive just having sit on your desk.

This is a nice addition to any kitchen.  Several options of measurement:  g, ml, lb/oz and fluid oz.  My only issue is that I wish in the gram setting it did 10th's...so there is  no 0.5 gram...its a whole number or nothing.

Overall this is a nice set that comes with a lot of color variety.  The instructions seem a little difficult at first, but in no time, my daughter was making her bracelets.  I have request a Blue and Orange one for the upcoming Bronco's season.  Of course, she is a Patriots fan, so I'm not holding my breath that I will see my bracelet any time soon.

Of all of the fitness trackers I have owned and currently own, this is the worst of the lot.  For a little background here is what I've used so far:  Fitbit, Withings, Misfit, Basis, Tushi Fitness, Moov, Pebble and even a no-name device, this iHealth is utterly useless.Amazingly, this device arrives in a very nice, sleek package which makes you think it is going to be nice.  Reality soon sets in however as you pull out the miniature instruction booklet that is about 40 pages thick and out of all of that, you get 4 pages of colorful icons telling you how to set it up.  It goes something like this:  Get Charged, Get the App, Get Connected, Displays, Mode and Personalize.  I've still yet to see the sleep mode screen, workout screen and airplane mode screen...I have no idea how to get to those because nothing tells you!Step tracking is a joke.  I got up this morning to write this review and walked about 45 steps to get some coffee and sit at the computer.  I'm up to 191 steps already.  I've walked 1/10th of a mile and have burned 715 calories already.  I mean, this is so bad, it should be recalled.The only positive experience I've had is the device had no problem connecting to the app on my iPhone 5S.  However, the app itself is useless as even when it syncs, the dashboard layout reads no data for sleep, activity etc...when clearly there is some.  Only when you maximize each section do you see any type of chart of your data.This has the silent alarm, which worked great for waking me up, but the "get up and move" alarm that went off during the night on several occasions almost had me throwing this against the wall.  My settings clearly tell the device to only track between certain times, and yet it was telling me at 11pm that I had been idle for too long.  Yah, duh.  I'm trying to sleep.I'm pretty sure firmware updates can't save this product from imploding in the already crowded fitness/activity tracker market.

Overall, these coffee's are just OK in my opinion.  For whatever reason, they all based very weak to me...even on the lowest ounce brew setting on my Keurig.  Da Bomb, which is supposed to have double caffeine didn't do much for me from a pick-me up standpoint.I've also come to like SF Bay coffee's as they are darker, richer and remarkably cheaper that sit in a mesh pod...not a plastic one like these and others.

I still prefer the rolls over pre-cut bags.  The one benefit is the moisture absorbtion at the top of the bag.  In the old days, I used to fold a paper towel at the top of the bag to catch the juice.That being said, I still prefer the rolls.

These 11 x 16 bag rolls are the way to go if you have a FoodSaver machine.  Yes, the precut bags are nice and convenient, however the rolls let you customize down to exactly what you need...with very little waste.  A perfect example of this would be block cheese.  I can start out with a large cut leaving room for me to continue to open it, get the amount of cheese I need then seal up again using the same bag.I just wish they were a little less expensive, but when you look at the cost of food savings, if you are using these appropriately, it is worth it.

This little Micro SDHC card worked well in all of my devices:  tablet, camera, card reader PC, and dashcam.  The speed was fine an no devices showed any negative effects.For $18, this is worth adding to your inventory

When it comes to convenience and on the go nutrition, many companies have tried to enter the market.  In my opinion, these fall short...way short in relation to current offerings.For 100 calories, you get 10g of protein, 25 vitamins and minerals and 2g of sugar in their little 4oz shot glass.Premier Protein on the other hand has a much better product in this category.For 160 calories you get 30g of protein, 24 vitamins and minerals and 1g of sugar in their 11oz milk carton.I'll stick with Premier Protein for now.

As far as chargers go, there isn't much to them.  The unique 90 degree angle of this particular one can come in handy in certain situations, but I've really not been able to find a absolute need to take advantage of that.  4' is a nice length, especially for the car so you can secure it without it rolling around the vehicle.A little expensive for an extra charger, but by the same token, how much is running out of juice worth to you.Also of note, with the 90 degree angle, your case may prohibit you from being able to use this.  My current Slim Armour case for the 5S is a perfect example of this as the charge port is narrow enough that only a straight in connector works.
Once again, I can not tell a difference between these GameSaver bags and the already pre-cut bags that don't have the GameSaver tag.  Go with the cheaper of the 2.
No noticeable difference with my V2840 Foodsaver product over basic bags.  It seemed like the expansion just allowed for air to get in more crevices than before.
I have the Foodsaver V2840 and I can't say that these bags are any different than the standard bags I've been using.  So, I will stick with their basic bags.

For any fan of any of these games, it is a no brainer even if you only like 1 game.  However, there are so many gems in here, there is no reason not to purchase this.  For $30, this is the steal of a lifetime.I've already played Perfect Dark, Kameo and several others and have to say, I love it!The coolest part is the old school way you get achievements...yes, your notifications are the old 360 style!Also, be aware that every game requires an update of at least 500mb, so I'm really thinking this disc is nothing more than an unlock tool to download the games.

Overall a very nice bag.  The feel and look of the bag is high-end, plush leather.  As soon as I opened the box and removed the plastic, the room filled with that lovely leather smell.The bag itself does border slightly on the feminine side.  My wife initially thought it was for her...ha!...it may be in the end. :)Compared to my other work bag, this doesn't have as many zipper compartments on the outside and this bags overall size is smaller, giving it more of a "purse" appearance.

As others have noted, this comes with nothing but the molds and squeeze tubes.  The rest is up to you.  So while it may be fun for awhile, trips back and forth to the grocery store for chocolate and candy to make your own bar makes you realize, it's just cheaper and easier to purchase a candy bar that is already done.
Great gift set!  Very moisturizing for someone who is prone to dry skin and has a pleasant but not overbearing scent.
These are great!  Easy to swallow, manufactured by a reputable company, non-GMO, and pesticide free.  What else can you ask for.

These bags have an excellent, very secure seal, and are of a useful size to store everything from food to even clothing if going on a camping trip or something. They don't puncture easily and don't smell like some bags do of awful plastic.

I have really sensitive skin and can say for certain that this helps me remove make-up and other grime off of my face without any irritation or breakouts or redness of any kind.  I'm really happy with this product.

I've only been using this for a few days and I can already see the difference.  The dark spots have been reduced, slightly, but reduced.  I'm hopeful that if I use this for a few weeks/months, they will be barely visible.

So far so good.  I've been taking CoQ10 supplements for a while and can't say these make me feel any different than the rest.  Most importantly, they're easy to swallow, as sometimes manufacturers make these supplements way too big.
These are super delicious and fill you up!  I use them just as regular snacks or as something of a power-up before and after workouts to give me an extra boost.
These are delicious as a little snack on the go when you don't have time for lunch or something at work.  But they are kind of pricey as a snack as you don't get much per pack.
The dog, a very picky eater, absolutely gobbled these up.  No signs of a mess (vomit or diarrhea) either!

So far so good.  I'm still only on week one of actually using this stuff and based on what I've read it can take anywhere from 3 weeks to 3 months to really see any results.  However, it tastes good and I'm hopeful (I'll update in a bit).  If you want instant results, this isn't it, though.  Additionally, I have no idea why it says you're getting 10 lbs of this stuff but I got 11 oz of it instead.  Maybe a typo in the headline?

The dog loves these!  Unlike other bones he seems to either ignore completely (he's kind of picky) or throws up after 30-60 minutes later (you know what I'm talking about) he chews these right up and it doesn't seem to bother his stomach.  5 stars!
Awesome stuff!  I've used this after every single work out.  It has a great taste and mixes really well even with cold water.  I combine it with whey protein for a nice post-workout recovery!

The cat just chews this stuff right up!  Usually, he's not much of a dry cat food kind of guy but he definitely likes this holistic food.  Also, helps keep his coat nice as he's usually allergic to a lot of ingredients in other cat food.

I thought I was going insane...until I realized it was Listerine who is not taking my health seriously.  Horrific company.I decided to use this product because I hate the horrific feeling of my mouth burning from the alcohol-based version of this product.  Not to mention, there may be a slight risk of increased oral cancer (after a long period of use) from any alcohol based rinses due to the intrinsic inflammation such rinses cause inside the mouth.And so, every morning and night, exactly as per the label's instructions Of Listerine Zero, I would rinse my mouth with this product.I noticed that after I'd wake up every morning, the inside of my mouth (mainly the gums and cheeks) would slough off (shed) massive amounts of dead tissue.  It was disgusting to say the least and highly alarming as well.  Others online have called this shedding "white slime", but having a medical background I know it's dead and decaying mucous membranes (the lining of the inside of your mouth).  On top of that, I experience redness, significant pain, and ulceration inside the mouth.At first, I wasn't sure this was due to the Listerine.  I thought I may be having a reaction to another product.  Maybe it was the new toothpaste.  Maybe it was some sort of food.  After carefully whittling away the other possibilities, I was 100% sure it was due to the Listerine Zero.To make sure I wasn't the only one and that this wasn't some isolated incident, I did an online search and notice MASSIVE amounts of people reporting the same problem, including on Listerine's own website!Listerine KNOWS this is NOT an uncommon reaction to their product despite saying on their website when someone complains: "This is not a reaction we'd expect while using this product" on their own website, however their OWN WEBSITE has a ton of the same complaints as do other websites online.  You can google "listerine zero" and see similar reviews on their website.Since Listerine, being such a "caring company", didn't mention the possibility or warning of this horrific reaction anywhere on their product as a good company would, nor why it was occurring to me,  I decided to research it for myself.The answer for most people?  Most likely it is a reaction to an ingredient called sodium lauryl sulfate.  What is it?  A DETERGENT used in cleaning products known to science and medicine to cause taste alteration, irritation, and ulceration in people.  You know what else?  SLS has been shown to actually DECREASE the effectiveness of fluoride at preventing tooth decay.  The same fluoride found in your toothpaste and in Listerine's product.Yep, good old Listerine put in a known, irritating, detergent inside of its product that causes the tissues inside of your mouth to die.  And it put in the same ingredient to counteract the effects of its fluoride ingredient.  Commece slow, sarcastic, clap in Listerine's direction and probably a class action lawsuit in the future.
So far so good.  These are easy to take compared to other larger pills ive tried and seem to work.

Wow!  Does the cat love this stuff or what!?  He chows it down like nobody's business and meows and purrs for it as if he just got out of prison or something.  I'm no expert, so I can't attest to ingredients or anything like that but I can certainly tell you the cat approves of this stuff and he tends to be on the picky side, too!
Excellent and delicious rice.  Cooks quickly, doesn't stick, and very fluffy.  Great texture and nutritional quality too!
The cable works extremely well and is easy to bend/manipulate.

I bought this and NEVER used it.  It sat in my closet for about a month and I noticed that it started to come apart at the "seams" on its own, with the white inner parts protruding out of one end of the rope.  Horrific.  How is this a good product if it starts falling apart in a climate controlled closet without ever being used?

Amazingly fast transfer!  Somehow this is faster at copying the same files (the same amount) than my rated 128MB/sec USB drive.  Can't be happier and for the amount of storage space you get and how tiny it is, you really can't beat this!

Well, I've bought this product before and the reason I got this additive is because I'm going to be putting my car in long term storage really soon.  I've already used it for long-term storage of other cars in the family household and this product has worked well in the past.  I can't comment on using this continuously throughout the year, I'm not sure why you'd really need to as it may be overkill, but if you're thinking of storing your car for a long time (at the very least 3 months without driving) then you need to get this to make sure that when you come back everything starts back up as it should!

I have very similar (in principal function) headphones but without a doubt these work way better at cancelling noise and letting in the human voice.  Now, I still always wear earplugs underneath to give it just a tad more noise reduction, but that doesn't in any way hinder the performance of these earmuffs.  So far these have been tried out at an indoor gun range (no rifles/shotguns) but when I go hunting, I'll try these out in nature alongside rifles and shotguns in just a bit.Another family member used these and mentioned:The Peltor Sport Rangegaurd Hearing Protector is a very nice ear protection product. I have used Walker Game Ears for years and have to say the Peltor Rangeguard are much more comfortable and user friendly than the Walker units.  I haven’t used them in the woods hunting as of yet, but the folding ability will make them easier to carry with my hunting gear. “So far so good”

Wow!  Having just returned two sleeping bags for various reasons, this was like a light at the end of a tunnel!My prior issues with sleeping bags have mainly been:  improper temperature ratings (cold to sleep in even though the weather is in their supposed comfort range), horrific zippers that make it impossible to zip yourself up, large size (weight and/or compressibility of the bag).Suffice it to say, this bag swats away the competition I've dealt with so far.  For a bag rated, temperature-wise, relatively this low, it is very small and easily fits into any straps on a 40-60L bag I'm aware of.  It's feather light, no pun in tended.  I meant this thing is really, truly very light and does wonders for those hiking for days on end like myself.  Finally, the zipper is seamless.  Nothing gets stuck, it's easy to maneuver from inside the bag too.  The bag is also very comfortable to sleep in.Kudos to the company for making serious note of temperature differences between men and women.  Women do tend to sleep colder than men as I have found out on more than one occasion.  This bag is thus rated a comfort 32F for women and 21F for men.I have already tested it in 30F weather with two layers of dry clothing, no wind, in a one man tent, with no additional liner, and slept very warmly.Easy to roll back up into the sac when you're done too.  Brownie points for that as many bags are not so easily fit back in.Overall, this is a superb sleeping bag and I highly recommend it.

This pet feeder fulfills three of my most important criteria when it comes to elevated feeders:1.  Stainless steel bowls which help prevent certain kinds of skin allergies dogs get from plastic bowls2.  Adjustable elevation, good enough for medium/large sized breeds (not enough for giant breeds or toy breeds for various reasons)3.  Easy to set-up/adjust and doesn't wobble on the floorThe dog loves this and got used to it almost instantly.  Now, aesthetically, this isn't the most pleasant unit and feels kinda cheap but for those that look and feel solid you have to shell out extra $$$, so this gets 5 stars for doing what it's supposed to!

At least for dry, light-duty cleaning of the car this is a great vacuum.  It picks up all the small debris and all of the dog hair off of the upholstery, not to mention the dust.The unit itself is relatively light-weight, and very easy to maneuver, empty, and clean.

I LOVE these amazing cleaning towels.  I have never come across microfiber towels this good and for such a very reasonable price too!These do an amazing job at everything I've put them to use for: dusting inside the car or home, mopping up dirty floors, and cleaning the kitchen/bathroom.  They're easily cleaned and clean easily!I highly recommend them, I doubt you will regret buying them.

Look, for the price of the tent, currently $75, you're probably not going to get something better.I returned mine, but not because of the price.  It's because this is meant for very light camping.  Very soft, even ground.  If you're going to be camping anywhere that doesn't fit this description, it's not really for you.PROS:1.  Very light for a tent this size.  One of the lightest out there2.  Easy to learn how to set-up3.  Roomy for one person and a full 60L bag.  You can, if you squeeze in, fit two people inside in sleeping bags (with no extra gear though)4.  Very warm.  I mean, this thing really help keep the heat in on a cold night, much better than other tents I've had.CONS:1.  Very hard to get in/out of.  You have to crawl into a tunnel basically2.  Not for the claustrophobic as the tent doesn't sit far above your head3.  The stakes and rods are of poor quality design and can bend/snap easily4.  May rip easily in rocky terrain or if you're not carefuly placing gear inside there.  I recommend a footprint on the bottom of it and a padded liner inside.Overall, this is a good tent for the price, no doubt.  I have returned mine in search of a better/more complete one, even if I have to pay more.

Well, I'll be honest, I personally don't like the look and feel of this bed.  Way too artificial to the touch and doesn't look/feel all that comfortable.  The filling in the bedding is pretty cheap but the exterior cover is definitely high quality in terms of worksmanship against spots/stains and even nails.Nevertheless, I don't have the final say here.  The dog loved this thing so much, he actually stopped sleeping on the couch completely!  He always goes right to this bed instead even though he's welcome on the couch.  So, the dog gave this 5 stars, end of story.One little note:  this bed is a large bed and I personally think any dog larger than a Labrador in size will find it too small as it's on the edge of being a tad small for a lab as it is.
Really delicious and high quality berries.  Eat them or, better yet, put them in a smoothie, and they really spruce things up!

Man...about 5 years ago I bought a 1 TB WD storage unit for the same price, one that is about 5 times bigger!This thing is smaller than my receipt-filled wallet, lighter than my smartphone (in its protective otterbox), and much more portable than the clunker of the 1TB storage device I used before.I plugged this int the USB of my Windows 8 and Windows 7 laptops and it started working without a hitch.BUT:  One warning.  If you plug this into your first computer and set-up hardware encryption and then plug it into another computer that doesn't have the software/driver installed, it won't open up.  At least it didn't for me!  I'm still trying to figure out how this is done.  However, since this drive is reserved solely for my use on my computer, I'm not too worried but some of you may have an issue.Another thing:  the transfer speed aren't that great.  I averaged about 25 MB/S with a USB 3.0 drive.  Not sure why

Modern design, soft, stain resistant, can move, washableI like this!  It's got a great modern design, is very soft to the touch, washable, and stain resistant.  The only very slight downside is that it's not really non-slip and can slide on my tile floor but it's not a big deal for me.

Update:  I have long hair.  The frame of these glasses constantly catches on my hair and tries to rip it out.  So if you have long hair don't buy these, otherwise, read below:I'm very happy with these sunglasses and what you get for $20 is truly incredible.Firstly, these fit very comfortably on my face (average sized male face/nose).  They look super stylish, like $100 Oakleys.  The case itself is worth $15 alone as it can not only fit the sunglasses, but all the other lenses, as well as all the accessories in a very secure package that isn't overly big!The sunglasses not only fit comfortably but really do a great job blocking out the light as they wrap around the sides of my eyes.  The interchangeable lenses are really easily snapped in/out.  However, you should disregard the package instructions on how to remove them or else you'll have great difficulty.  Start by pulling on the  middle section first when detaching the lens and pushing up on the middle section first when replacing with the new lens.I only take 1 star off because only 1 of the lenses (the black lens that's not attached originally) is polarized.  I personally don't like non-polarized lenses.Otherwise, for $20 I'm very happy that I can simply buy replacement lenses from now on as I see fit (when they inevitably get scratched).  It'll save me even more money in the long run!  And the great variety of lenses for different conditions is truly astonishing, anything you can imagine: snow, rain, night, cloudy, sun, etc...

This is a superb floor cleaner.Very easy to setup and very easy to use.Honestly, I'm a bit lazy when it comes to cleaning so I didn't even bother sweeping the floor prior to its use.  Well, I got it for free to test out so I might as well test it out under "difficult" conditions since I have nothing to lose.Anyways, setting this thing up for the first use was a breeze and the control and movement of the cleaner was even simpler.  I'll boil everything down to this: it got every spot, every hair, and every crumb.  Granted, I took my time, but not all cleaners can do that.I can now happily say I don't live in a dusty cave and my home is guest-ready now!

This is a great little lap desk for my tablet.  It's very comfortable and makes it easy for me to use the tablet in my bed or on my sofa without having to hold it.  There's a little space to put a keyboard down in front of it but I honestly just use it to place little office items or sometimes a piece of food!  I only fish that this was better compatible with Microsoft Surface tablet, in the sense that I have to detach the keyboard to even get it to fit, but otherwise I still recommend this as a very simple lap desk.

Well, everything about this kettle is superb in terms of quality, looks, and speed of boiling water.  But, as with every other electric kettle I've come across it is for some absolutely unknown reason full of plastic inside.  Can any company just make a good electric teat kettle with no plastic parts inside?  Is it that hard?Another review states you can remove the plastic filter.  Yeah, and?  What do you do with the plastic base where the filter goes solidly attached to the kettle?  Break it off?  I'm not willing to risk it.  You may remove the plastic filter but not the base so it's no good.If leeching plastic isn't a big concern for you with respect to the tea kettles this is a great electric kettle, though.  I'm sticking within my 100% stainless steel (inside and out with no plastic anywhere) stove top kettle for now.

I can't speak for the energy saving quality of this as I think it's probably minimal.  However, it does block out about 80-90% of the light coming from the outside after I've closed the blinds.It's definitely not able to block everything out and on a bright day you'll see through the fabric if you stand close but believe me it's not that bad and you'll get some much needed zzz's nonetheless, so I'm giving this 5 stars.

This cream is very light and keeps my sensitive skin well moisturized.  It's also a good base for make up and it decreases the appearance of fine lines.  However, I think it's a bit pricy for what amounts to be a good moisturizer for sensitive skin and, at best, a fine line reducer.

I have very sensitive and thin skin around my eyes.  This cream is very light and doesn't make my eyes look puffy after application.  You really don't need much of this cream, just the size of a rice grain is enough for daily application.  Therefore, I think its priced very reasonably as the jar will last for a year for me.I have been using it for 3 week.  My wrinkles haven't disappeared but the skin around my eyes looks healthier and it's also easy to apply the eye concealer to cover dark circles after using this cream.Overall, I recommend this cream!

The good things with this powder:  great taste and dissolve in water pretty well.  Those are obviously two important factors for anyone who uses protein powder.The bad things with this powder: it's definitely not the (lightest) of all powders in terms of calories/g proteins.  But it is towards the leaner end, that's for sure.  The other bad things is the designer price.  This is definitely one of the more expensive powders out in the market but not by a ton compared to other quality alternatives.

I've used these when running and hiking and they stay on great and sound great as well.  Very lightweight, very comfortable, and overall feel well-made.  If you're looking for something to wear during active sports, this is the thing to get!
You know what's great?  When you buy an $80 product and the CD doesn't work.  Then you waste several hours waiting to get the problem resolved by Turbotax.Waste of time.  Terrible Product.

Let's face it, you're buying a $100 guitar, not a $1,000 flamenco guitar or a custom made one.  With that in mind:Sound:  The resonance is ok, not that great but not that bad either.Build:  Overall built well.  The only problem is the action is a bit on the low side.  This is good for barre chords but bad because you inevitably get undue vibration in the top strings, mainly.  The neck is wide.  This is bad for any of you with short fingers.  It's quite a bit wider than a steel string, great for picking individual strings, bad for short fingers.Strings:  Average nylon.  Nothing fancy.  They are already on when you get the guitar, you just have to tune them and then tune them again, over and over, that's what happens with nylon strings as you break them in.For the price, it's a good guitar.

Superb!  We've been using this for our cat and its a great kitty litter.  First of all, we've noticed a great reduction in the amount of litter our cat drags around the house.  Before, it seemed like we were walking on sand because he would inevitably drag a bunch out with his feet.Secondly, this has a scent but one that's not overbearing.  It's just enough to control the odor but not so much that you smell it all over the home or even in the same room (unless it's in the bathroom with the door closed).Thirdly, the clumping action on this is also great for easy cleaning.Finally, our cat most definitely prefers this kitty litter over much bigger brand names.  We ordered more as a result online because we couldn't find any in a local store.Overall, great kitty littler we'll definitely be buying again and again!

This is a solid, heavy duty, and excellent hole punch.  Cuts right through with minimal force!  If all you're looking to hole punch is a standard three holes for 8.5"x11" sheets, then this is for you.If you need a custom number of holes or differently sized sheets, this isn't for that.  It's not adjustable.

Well, first things first.  I got a professional to install this because by no means do I have the skills to do it and the documentation itself mentioned the need for this if I remember correctly.From the get-go, if you have gas going to your house, I can tell you that most likely using a gas heater is more economical than an electric one, including this one.But having no other choice, this so far seems more economical for a house of 2 people, 2 bathrooms, a dishwasher/washing machine, and a constant cook.Based on our average daily usage, we'll be saving money with this unit and so far we've always had enough hot water for our daily needs (even when both showers are on).However, it will take a long time for us to recoup the cost of installing this unit.  So long as it lasts a very long time without fail, we will.Overall, it works well for a medium sized home with two people (maybe one guest) when multiple hot water sources are running and it is economical (compared to our previous heater).  But I would definitely suggest consulting with an electrician and plumber in your area first to see how much they'd charge to install this for you and go from there.

This was a coffee maker that took some time getting used to in terms of learning its ins and outs and settings.  After playing around with it for a bit, I can definitely say that it makes some great coffee.  It's also very easy to clean and MUCH quieter than our previous machine.  I'm also really pleased about the stainless steel aspect of this brewer as our previous glass ones have either been broken or get noticeably yellow to the point of not being cleanable (not good for the guests to see).What I do not like about this brewer, although I didn't take anything off  because I can't find a good alternative, is that it has so many different plastic parts where the hot coffee  does touch.  I really dislike the notion of that happening but quite frankly I don't  know of any alternative.

I have no idea if these work or not and the good stuff survives their manufacturing process or not.  What I can say for sure is that this is a major choking hazard.  These pills are absolutely humongous and I've choked on them, very unpleasant, very painful, luckily they came out.This company MUST make the pills smaller.

I like the scent and the fact that it fills the bathroom up with the scent quite quickly to cover up any smells.  However, the actual warmer is quite big, honestly.  It's the size of a 16 oz soda can bottle!  So, you won't be able to place this anywhere discretely or in any outlets too close to cabinets on any one side.  Because of its bulk it also blocks off the second outlet in the wall!

Excellent!  Works exactly as advertised.  This thing is VERY loud, you can't miss it no matter how deeply you sleep.  This door stop alarm does have an anti-skid pad, however, if you use this on carpeting, you can push the door open if you really try.  So, this should be used solely as an alarm only, not as a way to stop someone from entering if it's placed on carpeting.
Great, tasty milk chocolate.  Everyone in the family loved it.  We'll be checking out their line of chocolate from now on.

This is an easy to use and most importantly comfortable trimmer.  I use  it on my beard and whereas other trimmers sometimes cause nicks/scratches, this one (especially when using the body shaver when you have stubble) doesn't cause the typical irritation I experience with other trimmers.

Wow!  This thing is just massive and weighted perfectly for easy use, it feels very natural in my hand.  It's also full-tang, which is exactly what you want for maximum control and safety (the last thing you need is the handle coming off of one of these if it's not full tang).It's sharpened on arrival, so be very careful.  I've used it and it does a fine job.  And yes, it is actually dishwasher safe.  I ran i through a couple of time already and unlike other wooden handle instruments, this one showed no signs of damage from a normal wash cycle.

Well, when the cat became extra nice and extra excited, even before a can of this food was ever opened, you knew it was going to be a hit, and it was.  Funny enough, he doesn't really like fish but this one he lapped like he hadn't eaten in ages.

I cried when I got this.  I cried because I would not longer have to cry chopping onions by hand.  And I cried after I used it because I was so happy I wasn't crying any longer.Seriously, this thing is really great. I really didn't cry after chopping the onions with it.  I was just as happy  when it sliced potatoes and carrots with great ease, cutting my cutting time by more than half (I always did it old school, by knife before).My one and only slightly gripe is that when you want to slice something really thinly, you'll almost always have a slice that doesn't go into the holding tray underneath, so you'll have to take it from the top and put it in yourself.  No big deal, really.

I love this concept and product.  I've taken it hiking several times now and clipped it to my backpack so it gets some light while I'm moving about.  It doesn't charge up all that much in my experience during such hikes, unless the sun is always at your back, but it'll definitely give you more than an emergency boost to your device if you need it in just a few hours of charging.  It also feels rugged and solid so I have no problems hiking around with it.  I have another lipstick USB charger, but that one only travels with me on business as it's break otherwise.

These blades work just fine for rain but are HORRIBLE during snow conditions.  They will become caked/encrusted with snow and ice very quickly and easily, leaving massive opaque smears everywhere on your windshield, causing bad driving conditions to become extremely dangerous. You'll have to stop and clean them every 20 minutes to get all the snow/ice off and this isn't even during severe storm conditions either.

If you think that it's ok for a printer to take 20 seconds to turn on and another TWO MINUTES to warm-up after you press print.  This is the printer for you.  This is one of the slowest printers I have EVER encountered.Oh wait, it's actually funny.  I think the company knew this is the case because when you turn it off, it says "this may take a while"...no kidding either, because it can take two minutes to shut off as well.  And don't you dare pull the plug on it or else the printer will chastise you when you turn it back on for doing so and take even longer to boot up as a result.Finally, get this: if you remove the paper tray when the printer is off in order to put more paper in it, the printer will take even longer to boot up because "you're not supposed to do that" when the printer is off.  What kind of printer has problems with stocking it with paper when it's off?!?!?!?  Who designed this thing?Piece of junk.The only reason I gave it two stars is because everything else seems to work well.  Slowly, very slowly, but well.

I absolutely LOVE this program.  This is coming from a person who has absolutely no video editing/training whatsoever, by the way.So, if you're like me, and you want to edit some home movies, mix in some music, edit out some videos, edit out some audio, put in some pictures, and mix and mash it together to make a pretty good video, then get this software.Believe me, I have tried other video editing programs and they have a very steep learning curve compared to this one or have a very odd interface.Actually, this disk comes with no instruction on how to use this program.  You'd think you'd go crazy trying to figure out what to do and how to do it.  However, I can tell you for a fact that once I started using this, it took me no more than an hour to figure out, on my own (no help files), how to edit videos, mix them around, edit out audio, add in photos, etc.  It was that easy. The people who made this did a really great job of making an intuitive software program.I'm really happy and will be using this program for years editing all my home videos.

UPDATE:After 5 months of daily use this product snapped in three places.  Since it's pretty cheap and served its purpose I'm not marking it down.  But I did want you to let it know it won't last forever!---This is really an amazing product.  I have resistance  bands that I use and need to hook up by color (resistance amount).  Those bands are great, provide a lot of length, and are great for your feet.However, this band, when it comes to your hands/chest, is far more convenient and quicker to use than having to set the bands up individually.Here, the principle is you grip at the edges for minimum resistance upon stretch and grab closer to the center for maximum resistance.Therefore, this thing provides a very wide range of resistance, mimicking the individual bands, but all in one compact and easy to use band (no assembly/dissasembly of other stuff)There is one downside:  hair/crumbs and other stuff on the floor stick to this thing really easily.

I bought the lotion and cream version of this.  Both state they are fragrance free and both state they are non-greasy.This is NOT fragrance free.  I can't figure out what smell it has but it's certainly very much evident.This is NOT non-greasy.  It goes on greasy and stays greasy even if you only add a little bit.I only gave it 2 stars because it does actually moisturize.

This coffeemaker is really stylish in person, more so than in the pictures, and will fit into any modern kitchen design.The on-screen display and menus/buttons are very easy and intuitive to navigate to choose a HUGE amount of settings (timers, how to grind the beans, etc...).And, as you'd expect from any modern coffeemaker, there is no need to buy disposable filters, which is a big plus for me (although I know not all people like this).Most importantly for me: it makes great coffee and is very easy to clean.In short, I could not have asked for a better coffee maker.Since I use it every single morning, I'll post back here in a few months to ensure that it actually lasts, since we all know that even the great machines can go a bit haywire quickly.  I'll post an update then.

I've never owned a George Foreman grill, although I did buy an imitation one many years ago I was quite unhappy with.For two people, this grill is just right.  However, I should add that if you're going to be cooking a lot for 4 or more people, you'll definitely have to use this thing more than once.  Don't think you'll be able to grill four big pieces of steak on this thing.Nevertheless, it cooks food quickly enough, isn't messy like the imitation one I bought, and is very easy to clean so long as you do it when it's warm.

I've used McAfee for a long time.  And I've used a lot of AV over the years...Kaspersky, Trend Micro, Symantec, AVG, you name it...Anyways, what I can say is that unlike Kaspersky and Norton, McAfee doesn't slow down your computer nearly as much!But it provides way more protection and options than AVG and Trend-Micro as well.If you're looking for a middle ground, solid, and fast security system for your PC, you can't go wrong with McAfee.  If you want a lot of protection, but also a lot of headaches, then maybe Kasperky and Norton are your thing.

Being a vegetarian, and sometimes struggling to cook tasty stuff that also looks good, this was definitely an awesome kitchen gadget!  I think I now know what restaurants use to create my favorite vegetarian dishes with a lot of style!Anyways, setting this thing up and using it is VERY easy.  It's a matter of just popping some thing into place, putting your vegetable in, and voila!If that wasn't enough, this is very easy to put together and take apart.  Meaning, I don't have things getting "stuck" all the time nor do I feel like I'm forcing things in.  They clearly thought this out.  Cleaning is also a breeze.Basically, if you're looking to create some very stylish home-cooked veggie stuff, this is definitely a must and you won't regret it.
2 stars for the convenience and strength of the floss.  -3 stars for making my gums bleed/hurt after my dentist even said everything looked good, so I know it's not my gums that are the problem.

This is a great printer for anyone looking for an all-in-one for school or basic home office type stuff.  There's nothing fancy about it, for today's age it's pretty bare bones but the price for all of the features is right where it should be.* This thing prints very quickly (I use the draft version to use less ink and it spits out the page in less than a couple seconds with pretty good resolution nonetheless).  Auto-double sided printing is very fast and importantly doesn't tilt.  Some printers, when they flip the page automatically, will for some reason tilt the text of the page relative to the page itself, making the margins completely skewed.  This hasn't happened yet with this printer.* Has a very basic but still intuitive touchpad.  I honestly don't use it much and control most everything from the computer.* Receives and send faxes without a problem.* Scans ok.  The scan quality is great, no doubt, but it's not the fastest scanner by any means and will take you a good solid 2-3 minutes for something like 1200 dpi (from start to finish, including saving the file).* Has not jammed yet!  I've had more than one Epson before and can attest that after many years they very very rarely jam!* Wi-Fi is ok.  I say ok because for some reason it glitches every now and then maybe once every twenty prints or so).  What happens is, I'll push print via wi-fi from a PC or mobile device and it will either not print the entire document or will print very very slowly, as if the signal is not getting through.  I tried adjusting soft and hard firewall setting but nothing seemed to help.  This is by far my biggest gripe with the printer so far...I'm still trying to find a solution.Overall though, this is a good little printer for most home/school office type situations.

I LOVE this toaster oven.  I live in an apartment where it's just plain silly to heat up a huge stove to make a small pizza or some little snacks for myself.  This consumes WAY less energy (and my bill went down a bit as a result) and is very easy and quick to use (something in the middle of a microwave and stove).First of all, it gets to the right temperature pretty quickly, faster than the oven (makes sense since it's so much smaller).Second of all, it cooks thoroughly and evenly.  My oven for some reason leaves the center far less cooked than the edges of whatever I put in it.Thirdly, it's been easy to clean to so far with a simple wet towel/rag.Overall, this is perfect for you if you want a really handy little toaster over for yourself or to quickly heat up/reheat things if you're not a big fan of the stuff microwaves do to your food.  I love it.

This is top quality stuff!  Everything looks and feels solid.  Sturdy handles, a cover that fits very well, and overall construction that clearly says it's made well.It's pretty light for a skillet this size and thus easy to move around when it's full of food.  It heats up pretty quickly and heats everything evenly on my stove.After everything was said and done, in terms of cooking, it was easy to clean.  My one worry over time is that its white surface will be prone to the inevitable staining, but if cosmetics like that aren't a concern for you, then this is a good buy.

These skillets look and feel nice  and sturdy and under low heat and do a nice job of serving up little things like breakfast. They're as importantly easy to clean (by hand) and easy to use.  My one gripe is that the photos above make it seem like they come with a lid.  There is no lid for these and that's a big minus for me since I use vegetable oils a lot.

This thing is awesome!  I had a lipstick battery pack recharger but it was never heavy duty enough for my hiking expeditions and this is exactly what I needed.  It's  been through dirt, rain, and still works perfectly.  It recharges my phone pretty quickly but I wouldn't use it for bigger things, or else it will take a long time.  Since I don't carry large electronics on hiking expeditions, this is exactly what I need for quick charges of small devices anyways.

I've ordered this 5-6 times over the past 3 years and it has been consistently good. Shipping has been fast and the box has always arrived in excellent condition. Has a good amount of filling, not too skimpy and not too much. The only reason I am giving this 4 stars rather than 5 is that, to my taste, it could be a little moister. I think it could use a little more honey. But it is still very good baklava. Almost comparable to what you could get in a Greek restaurant or in a good bakery.

Good flavor and easy to chew and swallow. No artificial colors or flavors or preservatives, which is very nice to see. I'm only giving 4 stars rather than 5 because considering that you take 2 of these rather than 1 you don't get a very high percentage of vitamins across the board. However, if you have a halfway decent diet these are more than enough to supplement what you are getting from food. Also, even though you have to take 2 a day the price is still very reasonable for a 2 1/2 month supply.

Used these all last year and I was very happy with them. Got good distance on my drives and fairway shots (don't know if I hit the ball further, but certainly didn't notice any decrease!) Had good feel around the greens for pitches, chips and putts. Love the color as easy to follow my ball flight and the balls are easy to spot in the grass. They held up well...no damage to any of them. I have ordered more for this year and will be using them again.

Bought this because the "New Roku Lost Replacement Remote Control" I had bought last week didn't work right out of the box, and I didn't want to take another chance on one of those. This RCA unit is $5 cheaper and seems much sturdier, plus it will control the TV as well as the Roku. I've read some of the negative reviews for this item and, frankly, I can't understand some of them. The RCA was very easy to program. It took me a total of 10-15 minutes to digest the relevant part of the instructions and to program the unit to control both the TV and the Roku. It is true that the instruction sheet goes on-and-on, but if you have ever programmed a remote control unit before you sort of know the basics and you can skip to the parts that are relevant for you. Not a big deal, actually. One person wrote that there is no button to control the source code. That is not true. There is an input button right under the number "9" button. I tried it and it works perfectly. As this is not specifically made just for "Roku", you do have to play around a little bit to find the buttons that will do the same things a "Roku" remote will do. For example, the little "up arrow" above the OK performs the same "back" function as the "left arrow" on the "Roku" remote. The red button above the "up arrow" performs the same function as the "home button" that is at the top right of a "Roku" remote. Takes a little getting used to, but again no big deal. All-in-all, I am very happy with this RCA unit. It works beautifully and is great value for the money.

This didn't work, right out of the box. (Well, I did put the batteries in first!) We have a Roku 2 and a Roku 3 and it wouldn't work with either one. I did notice this had a lot of good reviews, but also a few bad ones where people experienced the same problem that I had. I guess it is the luck of the draw? It is very cheap looking and feeling, and it doesn't have the little Roku tab and it doesn't say "Roku" in the battery compartment, so I'm wondering if this is some kind of a knockoff that fell off the back of a truck! Anyway, fool me once, shame on you...so I wasn't going to go for twice. I did a little research and found out that there are universal remotes that will work Roku units. I opted for the RCA RCR314WR 3-Device Big Button Dual Navigation Remote. We are very happy with that. (Please cross-refer to my review of that item.) I am in the process of returning the "New Roku Lost Replacement Remote" to Amazon for a refund. By the way, the RCA unit is cheaper and seems better made!
Excellent. High quality. Fresh. Big walnuts with very few broken pieces. No BHA or BHT added (unlike the Diamond walnuts you can buy at the market.)

These are wonderful. Sooooo comfortable, and easy to put on and take off. I like the non-skid bottoms, and with the lining they are nice and warm. As far as fit goes, I wear a size 11 and I bought an 11 in these and they fit perfectly. I would say if you don't wear socks or wear regular "summer" socks the fit will be perfect. If you prefer to wear heavy-duty winter socks you might want to go a size up. Very happy with my purchase and I would definitely buy these again.

For a supposedly "healthy food", this is way too sweet. The clusters are too big. It's like chomping down on boulders! Not very pleasing when consumed as a cereal with milk. Not much banana flavor either. Disappointing, all around!

Really excellent. A lot of bang for the buck as it has a lot of Omega-3. Does not give me the "fishy burps". Safely sourced and free of contaminants. I was using Nordic Naturals, which is also good and has a nice lemon flavor and no "fishy burps". However, one Nutri Gold has more Omega-3 than two of the Nordic Naturals. Even if you take two of these, it is not a bad price for a three month supply. These are slightly larger than the Nordic Naturals, but I still don't have a problem getting these down. I will be switching to this brand as I feel it is a better value and I don't see any downside as far as quality.

I like a dark roast that is complex and has a lot of flavor. I felt this was very bland. I used it in my french press and ground the beans finely...not a coarse grind. I used a little more than a full scoop for an 8 oz. cup of coffee. There was nothing distinctive or tasty about this blend and I won't be buying it again. I much prefer Ola's Super Premium Organic Uganda. I find that to be far superior.

On the "pro" side, I like that these are organic and I like the ingredients. However, the capsules are large but you still need to take 3 a day. So, a bottle of 90 capsules is only good for a month, which makes these very expensive for a multivitamin. The capsules also have an unpleasant, medicinal smell. I will not continue to take these.

I don't have trouble with larger sized pills, usually, but these sometimes get stuck in my throat. The capsule itself also has a slightly unpleasant taste. On the plus side, I like that these are organic and food-based. Because of the "cons", I won't be taking these on a regular basis.

Bought these for my wife as she has trouble swallowing regular sized vitamins. Even though these are very small, she found that she can chew them and they do not have a bad flavor. So, that is a bonus as they are not advertised as "chewable vitamins". I am happy I found these as there are many foods that my wife cannot eat and I was worried that she wasn't getting enough vitamins and minerals in her diet.

Rich, dark, complex and syrupy. Everything that I could ask for in a dark roast. FYI, even though this is already ground I use it in my french press and it works fine. I use 1 level coffee scoop with 8 oz. of water and, for me, that makes a perfect cup.

I like a rich, dark, syrupy complex brew. This coffee didn't deliver any of that. When you open the bag the beans look great and smell great, but that's where the good news ends. I adjusted the amount of coffee I used and the amount of water but the coffee still had no body and very little flavor. I will be going back to what I had before, which I feel is much better. (I do like to experiment once in awhile for variety. The experiment didn't work out in this case!) The other coffee is: Ola's Super Premium Organic Uganda Bugisu. The Ola's is about $17 for just 1 lb., so it costs quite a bit more than the Black Knight. However, I would rather spend the extra money and get what I feel is a much better cup of coffee. I don't like throwing $20 worth of Dark Knight in the trash, but I'm not going to drink this stuff for the next couple of months and be unhappy. Life is too short for that!

This book tackles a subject that is usually only briefly mentioned in biographies of George Washington and histories of The American Revolution. I was interested in a more in-depth analysis of the topic, and that is what "Swords In Their Hands" delivers. My 4 star rating is meant to "straddle the fence", as I think if you are mostly interested in a scholarly study, you would most likely find this a 4.5 star book. If you are more interested in a popular history you might only give it 3.5 stars. The first half of the book goes into great detail concerning the financing (or lack thereof) of the revolution. This provides the foundation so that we can understand why the officers took the radical step of fomenting The Newburgh Conspiracy. Their grievances were longstanding and were not being addressed at any level of government. As another reviewer has mentioned, this section of the book could have been much shorter with no damage done to what Mr. Richards was trying to get across to the reader. The second half of the book deals more with the events leading up to the conspiracy and the meeting attended by General Washington where he managed, by both logical and emotional arguments, to effectively put an end to the conspiracy. The author is especially convincing when he argues that Washington's speech to the assembled officers was a carefully worked out "performance", steeped in classical references that would be understood by educated men, as well as an emotional appeal that relied on the good will that Washington himself had built up after years of personal sacrifice and loyalty to his men. The book has some brief biographical studies of the key players in the saga, as well as some very nice illustrations. The only reader who would be  disappointed in this book, to my way of thinking, is the reader who is looking for an "action packed" adventure story, with lots of derring-do. This is not that kind of a book. Other than that caveat, I think the book is well-written and adds something new to the vast body of work on Washington and The American Revolution, and is definitely worth your time.

I got tired of having to always pull down my "beanie" over my ears to keep them warm, and I don't like wearing a scarf when I have to shovel snow...so I sprung for one of these, and I am really pleased. It fits well and I love the fact that the material extends all the way down and does a great job of covering my neck. I tested this out shoveling snow on a day where it was 2 degrees. Granted, it was sunny and it wasn't windy...but 2 degrees is 2 degrees! I felt like I was sitting in the house in front of the fireplace. My face, head, ears and neck all felt toasty. Love the color, too, as it goes well with my L.L.Bean jacket. Granted, I can't wear my glasses with this, but my vision is good enough that I can shovel my walkway and driveway without putting myself in any danger! One thing people might like to know is that it has to be REALLY cold if you are going to wear this. If the temperature is above 20 degrees and you are going to be shoveling for any length of time your head is going to get sweaty. But in that situation, just elect to wear something different. For the really nasty days, it's nice to have this baby in your arsenal !

Berry, berry? Quite the contrary! This doesn't smell like blackberries and it doesn't smell like pears. I've been using this for a week now and I'm still trying to figure out the scent. I guess you could say it smells sort of spicy, with a bit of a mineral smell thrown in. (Must be those Dead Sea minerals!) The smell is okay. Not unpleasant at all, just not what I was expecting. From a functional standpoint, it's a nice bar of soap. It lathers up nicely and feels great on my skin. It's a big bar and so far it looks like it will last a good long while....maybe 3-4 weeks. But there are a lot of good soaps out there, and I bought this because I was looking for a nice blackberry-pear smell. I assume anybody else who looks at this webpage is looking for the same thing. That's why I'm giving this 3 stars even though the quality of the soap itself is good.

My wife and I have had the Echo for just over a week, and we love it. We use it almost exclusively to play music. It is also useful for getting the current temperature and a quick weather forecast. Alexa always wakes up when we say her name and she almost always understands our requests and responds immediately. Once in awhile she will not hear us correctly and we will have to state the request again or re-phrase it in such a way that it makes sense to her. You have to experiment and see what works best. For example, sometimes if you ask for music from an artist you will get something different if you ask for "music from prime" rather than just making a "blanket" request (which you might assume would give you everything by that artist). If you ask for something that you don't own and is not in prime, she will play a sample. One time she asked if we wanted to buy the song (which we did), and she confirmed the request before going ahead with the purchase. (But she doesn't always ask if you want to buy a song, which I guess is a glitch. Haven't tried it yet since it's only been a week, but I imagine if you ask her outright without being prompted she will buy the song for you anyway.) You can ask Alexa to lower or raise volume and you can also ask her to pause playing music and then to resume. Amazon programmers had some fun with Echo. If you thank Alexa, she will say "no problem" or "you're welcome". If you say goodnight, Alexa will reply "goodnight" or "sleep tight" or "don't let the bedbugs bite". Kids and "kids at heart" (like my wife and I), will enjoy this feature. As other reviewers have mentioned, I am curious to see what features Amazon adds once they and we have some experience with the Echo. Not because I want or need more. I am just curious! I went into this expecting a cool new device that plays music with a voice request, and I liked theidea that Alexa can talk. I am not an "audio freak" and am not an electronics expert, but within the limits of playing music via a short cylinder I am quite happy with the sound quality of the Echo. To sum up, I think if you are mainly looking for a fun device to play your music "at the drop of a hat", without you having the bother of doing the legwork to find the song or album, the Echo is for you. If you want a lot more than that, you may be disappointed....at least at this point.

Very nice orange smell. Felt like I was squeezing fresh oranges over myself! Made the bathroom, and me, smell really nice, too. The bar is small enough that it is easy to handle. (I also like Mistral's and Pre de Provence, but they are a bit bulky the first week or so until you whittle them "down to size"!) The soap is not harsh and feels nice on my skin. Lathers up nicely. One bar lasts one person two weeks. You get "more bang for the buck" with the brands I mentioned above as they last just about a month. But after a couple of weeks I am ready for a change so I didn't mind the "Santa Monica" not lasting as long. Really liked this a lot and I will buy it again.

This is an amazingly good book for anyone to have written, let alone a first time author. It is tremendously inventive and wickedly funny, with wonderful dialogue and interesting characters. One thing I loved about the book, oddly enough, is that it is all over the place. There are political references that might be obscure to a twentysomething (Cambodia/Pol Pot) as well as numerous popular culture references (movies by Mel Brooks;Francis Ford Coppola;Steven Spielberg, etc.). Do you enjoy yin-yang juxtaposition? Check out this bit: "A Rastafarian singing the Cornell alma mater song in a perfect baritone devoid of 'ja mon' syntax was a clear runner up for cognitive dissonance of the year. Right after a tea bagger on Medicare protesting too much government in his life." Either you love that sort of stuff or you don't! How best to describe this book? It's a combination of Joseph Heller meets John Carpenter meets The Marx Brothers, by way of Jimmy Buffett and Bob Marley. I think that about covers it. Alternate title for this review: "A Farewell To Arms - World War Z Edition". Another great thing about this book is it won't cost you an arm and a leg. Sorry. Couldn't resist. But seriously, give it a try. I found it to be an unexpected jewel of a read.

Obviously, this is not a book that the pope is going to be reading. But if you are more catholic in your tastes, this novel is a hoot. I was a bit hesitant before starting this, because "broad humor" books can sometimes get a bit TOO ridiculous. But this one holds together nicely. The characters are well-crafted, and the dialogue is very funny. The plot is interesting and exciting and....I know this sounds like a cliche....you can't wait to find out what is going to happen next. With most books I read I put in my 30-40 pages a night and I'm content to put the book down. With this one I couldn't wait to get to the next chapter. The author has a great imagination, and it is interesting to learn exactly what is "The Word According To Whitehead". Just to whet your appetite, here is some of what you will find in "The Reluctant Jesus": a talking cat; a talking cockroach; a miracle performed in Central Park involving  fast-food and a troop of Boy Scouts from out of town; an anti-Christ who looks like Woody Allen; a jive-talkin' gangsta doorman who is much more than what he seems; and a jealous Jesus. Oh, and Mr. Whitehead also gives us a glimpse of heaven and who resides there. He also explains what God and Satan are up to when they are not available to answer our prayers. What more could you want? If you don't take your religion too seriously, please give this book a try. It's a wild ride and a fun read. By the way, I think it would also make a great movie. Is anyone from Hollywood paying attention?

Before writing this I read the 7 reviews that were posted (so far). I won't go into the "workings" of the machine as Nespresso and the other reviewers have pretty much told you what you need to know. Let me just add my 2 cents as to why I really like the Nespresso VertuoLine.I had been using a Nespresso Citiz machine for the past 3 years. Absolutely loved it and had no problems. However, I kept wishing for a machine that could also make excellent coffee. Saw the Nespresso VertuoLine  on the cover of a Williams-Sonoma catalog last week. Read up on it, it sounded great, and I ordered it. It arrived a few days ago. Before setting up the machine I read the reviews on Amazon. 2 were posted at that time. 1 was a 5 star but the other was a 2 star. The unfavorable review mentioned that the coffee was weak and lukewarm, and that concerned me. So after setting up the machine I tried the decaf pod. (I don't drink decaf and I didn't want to waste a regular pod since this was an "experiment"!) Sure enough, the coffee came out lukewarm. I called up customer service technical support and got a super-friendly and helpful person named Jennie. She asked me to try a different pod as the machine adjusts the brewing temperature based on the blend. (She stayed on the line while I went thru the brewing process again.) I made a "Stormio" and that came out nice and hot and strong with a thick crema. Delicious! Jennie wasn't aware of any problems with brewing temperatures and she isn't a decaf drinker but she told me she was going to look into this to see if there is a problem with the brewing temperature for the decaf. She asked me if I was happy with the machine and I told her since I am not a decaf drinker I didn't have an issue as long as all the other blends brewed okay. She actually gave me her phone extension and asked me to call her back if I ran into any further problems and wasn't happy with the machine. She also took the time to register the machine for me.It is now a couple of days later and I have made 2 other blends. Both came out very hot, they tasted great (I like strong coffee) and the crema was nice and thick. I have not run into any snags since that first try with the decaf. There are 8 types of blends for the regular coffee, which I think is plenty. Not counting the decaf, there are only 3 espresso blends, which I can see might be an issue for folks who are used to a larger selection with previous Nespresso machines. Personally,  the choice of only 3 is not a problem. They offer a number 4, a 9, and an 11. 11 is too strong for me and 4 is too weak but the 9 is perfect. In any case, I assume at some point they will increase the number of selections once the machine has been on the market for awhile.As far as the cost issue, some quick math tells me these pods cost about 85 cents each compared to 65 cents for the Nespresso Citiz capsules. Since the machine allows you to make larger cups of coffee/espresso the capsules contain more coffee. I only drink 1 cup of coffee a day, so I figure the pods will cost me about $6 more per month compared to the Citiz capsules. Considering the high quality of the coffee, I don't have a problem with that. If you are drinking 3-4 cups a day I can see where this might become an issue for you, though.To summarize, this machine makes great tasting and hot coffee and espresso, with thick crema. It's a beautiful looking machine, it's quiet, and it is only slightly larger than my Nespresso Citiz. (It's about the same length, and maybe 4 inches wider.) The only reason I am giving a rating of 4 stars rather than 5 is because of what happened with that first decaf pod. I'm guessing that the machine brews the decaf at a lower temperature but it should be hotter than lukewarm. Don't know if there's a glitch with how the machine reads the decaf barcode or if my machine just wasn't properly "primed" since that was the very first cup of coffee it was making. If you are a regular or occasional decaf drinker, as a precaution you might want to call Nespresso customer service and talk to the technical support people before purchasing the machine, just to see if there is an issue. Other than that, I give the VertuolLine a big thumbs up.Update 3/12/14.....Was finishing up the sampler pack that came with the machine, so I made the half-decaf/half-regular pod. (I wouldn't usually drink this since it is part- decaf, but it IS half-regular so why waste it?!) Had the same problem as I had with the full-decaf pod on the first day I used the machine. The brew came out just a notch above lukewarm. Definitely not on the hot side. So it does seem there is a problem with the brewing temperature the machine is set for when there is decaf involved. It doesn't change my 4 star rating since I don't drink decaf, anyway,and all the non-decaf blends came out nice and hot, but you low octane folks should be aware of this problem!

How to describe this book? A wild, rollercoaster ride through place and time, with dashes of history, both political and religious, philosophy, mysticism, etc. At one point in the book the author mentions the novel "Catch-22" by Joseph Heller. I suspect it's one of his favorite books and you can see its influence in his writing. The plots are totally unrelated but, like Heller, Mr. MacGregor uses vast quantities of humor and absurd situations to explore very serious issues. Maybe 2 or 3 times a year I will read a book where I get about halfway through and find I can't put it down. I've got to know what happens and I don't want to wait. This book was like that for me. The plotting is intricate and clever and exciting. I also liked all the moving around from place to place. How often do you see a book that moves from rural Australia to Westminster Abbey to the hills of Haiti? How often do you have characters as varied as Aborigines, middle-class students, bums, clerics and "witch doctors"? It doesn't hurt that Mr. MacGregor writes beautifully of people and places and there is a lot of snappy dialogue. This is very impressive stuff from a first-time author. The only thing that marred the book a bit was that in the transition to e-book a few spelling errors crept in, which sort of pulled me out of the book and back to reality from time to time. But that's really a minor criticism and doesn't change the fact that this was an impressive and enjoyable reading experience. 5 stars.

This is an impressive book, especially for a first-time author. It gives a comprehensive look at what a golfer has to go through to try to make it at the highest level. The author covers: the expense involved in going to the qualifier and pre-qualifier events;the small or non-existent payouts; the varying conditions of golf courses that are not always top-notch; working with swing-coaches, putting gurus and sports psychologists; advances in technology and being properly fitted for clubs (which allowed Keith to hit the ball further at age 50 than he could as a scratch golfer at age 16); the importance of a good "looper"; fraud on one of the mini-tours; playing with golfers who cheat (in the author's experience, these tend to be the better golfers rather than Joe Ordinary!); etc. The book flows along smoothly and Keith has a nice writing style (except for an unfortunate penchant for using the word "couple" on almost every page! How about "several" or "a few" once in awhile?) The only reason I am giving this book 4 stars rather than 5 is because the author tends to go into too much shot-by-shot detail of too many rounds. Even for a golf-nut such as myself it got to be a bit too much at times. It might have been better if some of these rounds had been eliminated, even if the book would have been a bit shorter. Or maybe Keith could have included a few more anecdotes about his fellow players? Still, these are minor quibbles and this is a very good book and it gives a wonderful behind-the-scenes look at the real world of the journeyman golfer.

I really enjoyed this tongue-in-cheek mystery. The characters were quirky and interesting and there were enough plot twists and surprises to keep me engaged. I kept trying to guess where the book was going, but the author threw in enough red herrings to keep me off balance. The ending pulled everything together and was satisfying. My only complaint is that the publisher did the author a bit of a disservice with the editing. There are quite a few typos! Other than that......no complaints. This was a fun read.

I first bought this item sometime in 2011. It worked well for about 9 months and then it just died. I bought a 2nd one in August 2012 and in February or March 2013 it started acting strangely....i.e....I would recharge it and then a few days later it would lose the charge. It went on like that for about a month...sometimes holding the charge for a full 2 weeks and sometimes holding the charge for just a few days. This past week it started doing something different. It would be fully charged but when I'd push the "spray" button it would only work once or twice and then the green light would go off. If I turned it on again it would work for a few seconds and then stop again. And so on......With the first unit I figured I just got a bad unit. But now that this has happened a 2nd time I feel it must be a basic problem with this flosser. While it worked I had no complaints with the effectiveness or ease of use. But I won't buy this item again due to the problem with the battery. Just a few hours ago I looked around on Amazon and decided to go with the Waterpik Spray Flosser as it had no bad reviews. I think it is a plug-in unit and it looks a bit clunkier, but I notice that it comes with 6 tips and has 10 power settings so you can adjust the force of the spray. Once I've tried that unit for awhile I will post another review in case anyone wants to compare that item with the Phillips rechargeable flosser.

Interesting little book which explains the difference between fables and proverbs, and then goes on to explain how some of Aesop's proverbs had their basis in fables while others did not. The author goes on to show us that some of the proverbs were not written by Aesop, but were written by later authors merely "in the style of" Aesop. Some were Greek but others were Roman in origin. This brief beginning section of the book leads us into the proverbs themselves, and we are shown some of the fables the proverbs were (or may have been) based on. We are also given some proverbs by later writers that are in a similar, or opposite, vein. I don't read Greek or Latin and so cannot attest to the accuracy of the author's translations, but the translations flow and read smoothly. It is interesting, but not surprising, that some of the proverbs make perfect sense today while others make you scratch your head.
