But I also use my hose to wash my classic convertible. I need the option of a softer distribution of water for the delicate task of rinsing off soap without damaging the finish of my car. For that I use the Shower, Soaker and Cone settings. The Mist setting works well on the cloth convertible top. And for a strong stream of water to clean brake dust from the wheels, I use the Jet and Flat settings. The Coolife Nozzle is one of the most versatile tools on the market. Highly recommended. A sample product was provided for this review.

I like to grill during summer and roast during the holidays. And I’ve found that there’s no substitute for a good thermometer to ensure meats are not overcooked. When I’m grilling boneless, skinless chicken breasts, for example, I use this digital thermometer to pull the meat off the grill at 164-degrees. Knowing that chicken is done at 165-degrees, I understand that the meat will continue to cook off the grill, and the extra time gives the meat time to rest and redistribute its juices. The JMR Digital Wireless Thermometer is accurate and easy to use, both on the BBQ grill and in the oven. The device’s stainless steel probe and heat-resistant 3-foot cable facilitates measuring temps from my counter top. The internal temperature is displayed on an LED backlit screen in Fahrenheit or Celsius, making it easy to read day or night, indoors or outdoors. I like having the built-in alarm to let me know when the desired temperature, or cooking time, has been reached. This will be especially useful when roasting a turkey next Thanksgiving.This is easily the most versatile digital thermometer I’ve ever used. With presets for several different kinds of meat, and options for levels of doneness, this device makes it easy to customize servings for individual preferences. With a 65-foot wireless range, I‘m happy not to be tied down to the BBQ grill. Also nothing beats a manufacturer that backs its product with a lifetime warranty. But as much as I like this device, I do have a minor issue. It requires four AAA batteries, which are not included in the box. At this price the batteries should have been packed with this excellent device. A sample product was provided for this review.

I use Viva Organic Hemp Protein as an ingredient in my vegetable/fruit smoothies. A tablespoon of hemp protein mixes well with my other ingredients such as chia and flaw seeds. I’m not a vegan, but I try to include at least one smoothie in my daily nutrition regiment. The added gluten-free protein and fiber is a dividend that pays off in the long run, and I’m not making a great sacrifice, in terms of taste. A sample product was provided for this review.

Let’s face it, there is a bucketful of Apple certified charge/synch cables out there. But close examination reveals slight differences in quality. Seedforce backs up its well-designed lightning cable with a 24-month warranty. Granted, this is not the longest, or the strongest cable, but it exceeds the quality of many such cables on the market. And it does a great job of synching my iPhone 6 to my iMac’s iTunes. At three feet long, it’s a perfect length for charging my iPhone on the kitchen counter top, a bedroom nightstand, or the passenger side of the car. However, this cable is not adequate for long distance charging such as in airports or car repair waiting rooms. I like the color a lot; it makes the cable easy to find in a drawer or glove box. A sample was provided for this review.
This timeless love story looks great in Blu-Ray.

Made in China, this Apple MFI certified anaconda-long lightning cable opens up all kinds of charging possibilities for my iPhone 6. From out of place outlets in airports to the back seat of my car, no power source is too far away. Hi-Mobiler’s 10 feet of charging/synching distance is nice, but the thickness of this cable ensures charging stability and reliability. Also I like that the blue color makes it easier to identify my cable among the several other device cables vying for power outlets at home. A sample was provided for this review.

As a New York pizza lover living in the South, the Teikis Pizza Tool Set is not only useful it’s essential. My homemade pizzas are baked on a large pizza stone that produces a crisp thin crust that’s hot-hot-hot. And while I prepare my pizza on a large wooden peel, the Teikis stainless steel peel slides easily beneath the crust for removal from the oven. This peel is strong enough to hold a pizza with the myriad of toppings they use in the south, or the NY holy grail of “plain” pizza. I like the offset design of the handle, which folds away for storage. And the 14” pizza cutter allows me to cut my pizza professionally and efficiently, because I can apply more cutting pressure with two hands. After several uses I can re-sharpen the cutter using my knife sharpener, which is hard to do with a pizza wheel-type cutter. Included in this set is a blade cover for safety. Teikis seems to have thought of everything. Both tools clean up easily with a damp cloth, but before the first use I would suggest using soaping water to thoroughly remove all protective oils from the stainless just as you would for a new wok. Highly recommended. A sample product was provided for this review.

OK, I’ll admit that I had never heard of CLA. But I was anxious to try a product that supports a healthy metabolism and reduced body fat. In addition, Viva Labs CLA appears to be a one-stop health store in a bottle. And while it may sound to good to be true, I’ve used other proven quality products made by VL, so I quickly added CLA to my daily routine of supplements. So far I’ve not been disappointed.  I seem to have more energy for performing tasks, as well as exercising. And after-workout recovery time seems to be shorter. I really like this supplement. A sample product was provided for this review.

Viva Labs Magnesium tablets are what I needed to maintain a healthy body. At 68, I take a considerable number of pills each day to help me deal with diabetes and hypertension. But as I lose weight and exercise more, I am gaining more control of those diseases on my own. The Magnesium tablets help me to regulate bowel function and blood pressure. Also, I seem to be getting more sleep, too, and I’m sure that it has a lot to do with my feeling better on a daily basis. This tablet is larger than most, but I take it with a lot of water or seltzer and it goes down just fine. I have worked the Viva Labs Magnesium into my daily supplement intake, and I feel consistently better than I did before. Had I known I would live this long I’d have taken better care of myself years ago. But it’s nice to know that using this product I can recover some of what I’ve lost. A sample product was provided for this review.

Before using CoQ10 I needed one of those copper-infused knee braces when I exercised or walked for long distances. But after using the supplement for a few months I found that I no longer needed the brace. The knee joint pain was gone. My exercise sessions lasted longer and were more productive. The miraculous recovery properties of this supplement make it a great part of my daily routine. So having already been convinced of the benefits of CoQ10, I was further drawn to the Viva Labs brand by its size and potency. These pills are smaller and, therefore, easier to swallow and digest A sample product was provided for this review.

In recent years I’ve become increasingly interested in physical fitness and better monitoring of the food I eat. The DBPOWER Digital Kitchen Scale is a new tool that I use daily to measure the weight of fruit and vegetables for smoothies and light snacks. Sleek, black tempered glass with a low profile, this scale is attractive enough to keep on my minimalist counter top. Unlike several power hungry scales on the market requiring multiple AAA batteries, the DBPOWER scale requires merely one single CR2032 button type battery. Tare functionality allows me to subtract the weight of the container for a more accurate reading. And the auto-off feature extends the life of the battery. I also like the fact that this scale measures in universally accepted units like grams, kilograms, lbs-oz, and ounces. For liquids it measures units in cups, as well as milliliters. It has a whopping 11-pound/5kg weight capacity, which comes in handy when weighing small packages to estimate postage costs. Of course, even the best looking, highest weight capacity scale would be useless if it weren’t accurate. In my comparison tests with a different high priced scale, the DBPOWER Digital Kitchen Scale showed weight measurement results that matched the expensive brand. So, in addition to being a quality product, it’s a great value. Precisely engineered, impeccably designed. Highly recommended!

In a kitchen utensil market that’s flooded with salt & pepper grinders, this easy to hold hourglass ceramic grinder stands out at the top of the heap. It’s made of acrylic and brushed stainless steel - durable enough to withstand daily, full-family use, yet gorgeous enough to be the star of my counter top. And when it comes to gadgets and appliances on my kitchen counter top, I’m a minimalist. But this sleek looking grinder only occupies 49mm – less than 2 inches - of space. So it makes a flawless transition from counter to tabletop. And it works even better than it looks.While my cooking ingredients usually include kosher salt, my tabletop grinder is invariably loaded with coarse sea salt for its rich flavor-enhancing properties. I stock the pepper side with the finest black tellicherry peppercorns. And this is why the deluxe hourglass salt and pepper grinder is so impressive. Its precise ceramic grinding mechanism gives me the option of selecting the size of the granules of salt and pepper.  And while it’s true that any grinder worth its salt (or pepper) will allow you to select granule size, very few are as accurate as this one. Maybe it’s just me, but I find the end caps included with this grinder bothersome. I’m a guy; I’m not fussy. I want to reach for a grinder that works right off the counter and use it without having to prepare it for use. The good news is that the grinder mechanism works so well that I don’t even need the end caps, because I haven’t found the usual leakage found in similar grinders of lesser quality. A sample product was provided for this evaluation.

There’s nothing new about iPhone battery cases, but I’ve found that they are not all created equal. Some boast a lot of power, while others add too much weight and girth to the svelte profile of iPhone 6. Of course, the best Apple-certified battery cases have found a sweet spot in the power-to-weight ratio. The new Powercase3000 by Macally offers substantial power, wrapped in a sleek, slim, sultry black case. The case’s smooth rubberized matte coating makes it easy to hold on to and more comfortable in my hand. This battery case may not be the most powerful on the market, but it doesn’t bulk up my iPhone with the size and weight of a larger battery. So I now have an extra 9 hours of talk time in my pocket with a minimum of added size and weight. But that’s not all.The Powercase3000 features an automatic shut-off when my iPhone 6 is fully charged, which saves battery power. These days, when everything is “smart,” smart charging makes a lot of sense. There have been many improvements in the design of battery cases over the past few years, and Macally seems to have taken advantage of each advancement. Some battery cases are rigid, making the iPhone difficult to insert and almost impossible to remove. But the Powercase3000 is flexible and my iPhone 6 slips into it easily and snugly. I really love this battery case; it’s one of the best I’ve tried. But given the number of quality battery cases out there, this one may be a tad over-priced at $70. A sample product was provided for this review.

Six months ago I reviewed the Virilem Fingernail clipper, and I couldn’t hide my enthusiasm:“Nail clippers? Really? My immediate reaction when approached to review this product was a huh-moment. One would be hard pressed to find a junk drawer in America that doesn’t hold at least one dime store nail clipper. So I didn’t think there was anything a manufacturer could do to improve upon something so basic in male grooming. Wrong! These aren’t the same cute little chrome clippers; they’re turbo-charged. I’m talking strong, durable stainless steel, and precision sharp at the business end.As a single guy, a million years ago, I learned that first impressions go a long way when meeting women. They are very detail oriented, and a man’s fingernails are a visual calling card that can be more impressive than a platinum bankcard. Virilem Nail Clippers are well made and very sharp - sharp enough to also do a great job on toenails. But clear the room, because those thick toenail clippings can be semi-dangerous projected missiles.While this device looks like most other nail clippers, once you hold it in your hand, the difference is clear. It has the feel of a real tool. Virilem has designed and manufactured a high quality clipper that precisely cuts nails. But there’s more! The rounded edge of the clipper’s lever is perfect for pushing back cuticles to facilitate uniform nail growth. So it’s a complete nail grooming station in one little device. A lifetime or 30-day money back guarantee tells me that Virilem Nail Clippers For Men has set a new gold standard for the well-groomed male.”Virilem has done it again! With the packaging a fingernail clipper and a toenail clipper, Virilem now offers a complete nail grooming solution. There are growing concerns about the sanitary conditions of some local nail salons. So I opted to do my own nails. This quality set simplifies the task for trimming both my fingernails and toenails. Highly recommended! A sample product was provided for this unbiased review.

I’ve auditioned several sports-type Bluetooth headsets. They interest me because I use them when I’m exercising and power walking. Connected via Bluetooth to my iPhone 6, a great sports headset is worth its weight in gold. Some Bluetooth headsets are better than others. Some are much better than others. DBPOWER BE-900 is impressive in its stealth styling, comfort and design. It features 5 hours of music listening time and 6 hours of phone talking time. But I don’t expect I’ll ever need its 60-hour standby time. This headset also features quality sound, including solid bass and crisp treble. I suspect that the slightly thicker, shorter cable may have something to do with the better sound quality. The controls work just fine, and the set uses “Intelligent Voice” to answer and end phone calls. The only knock I can find on this product is in its wireless tech. The latest Bluetooth technology on the market is version 4.1, and DBPOWER BE-900 features Bluetooth v4.0, which is, essentially, 2010 tech. However, it’s not a game changer. Since iPhone 6 uses Bluetooth v4.0, I won’t give the DBPOWER BE-900 a low rating. It’s an excellent, well-designed headset. A sample product was provided for this review.

There are several good sports headsets on the market today, but this headset seems to have avoided all the pitfalls of most them. The Blackzebra Bluetooth 4.1 uses all the advancements in wireless technology without scrimping on sound quality or comfort. My litmus test for headsets begins and ends with musicality. Poor bass frequency response will expose a trifling headset every time. The Blackzebra features snug fitting earbuds, and that alone helps accentuate the bass and midrange. The highs are crisp as a bell without straining. As for comfort and stability, this adjustable headset fits well on my ears as well as in my ears, and they are never on the verge of falling out no matter how rigorous the activity. The cable is strong and secure, and the controls are very responsive. Bluetooth 4.1 connectivity is flawless, and transmission range extends to an impressive 66 feet. This headset is good for 5 hours after a full charge, and it is capable of pairing with two different devices at the same time. The controls of the Blackzebra hang on the cable, with the microphone positioned perfectly for voice transmission. A simple push of a button answers the phone. A single click of the same button ends the call. I like this headset a lot. A User’s Manual, USB charging cable, and 4 extra earbuds are included. A sample product was provided for this review

As an author, I’m in the habit of jotting ideas down for future reference, because some ideas are fleeting, never again to return. So when I was given the opportunity to review the iGearPro USB Voice Recorder I was happy to accept. This bad boy records up to 13 hours on a single recharge of its lithium battery. The Instruction Manual is clear and concise, with an easily readable font. Operation of the recorder is a simple, one-button process. The added bonus is the 8 GB USB file transfer capability. Mac users will need to download a special free Application from the Internet, which will facilitate playing the recorded WAV files on your Mac. Once the software was setup, I was able to store my recorded notes and ideas to transcribe later. I like using the iGearPro for both data transfer and voice recording. A sample product was provided for this review.

As a flight attendant my wife travels a lot. During her down time in various cities she often plays the role of tourist. This Winkine canvas tote bag fills all her travel requirements - being lightweight, easy to pack and casual/versatile to compliment any outfit. It’s big enough to carry pop-decision souvenirs or an impromptu lunch. She likes the style and detail work of the bag. The heavy-duty zipper, buckles, riveting and double stitching give it a rugged shabby-chic appeal suited to jeans and sandals. It’s large and heavy, but not oversized for a tote bag. The great thing is that she doesn’t feel the need to coddle it, like her designer bags. She really likes this canvas tote bag, and I think she looks sensational with it. A sample was provided for this review.

GMYLE’s iPhone 6 Black Marble 2 Snap Cover is a great looking durable cover for my iPhone 6. I particularly like the way GMYLE provided for easier access to the triple bank of buttons on the left side instead of two cutouts like other skins and cases. Also the entire top and bottom edges are cutout for better access in charging and speakers, as well as the antenna for Apple Pay reception. I’ve tried to find flaws in the impeccable black marble finish but I can’t. It looks great and feels smooth to the touch. It’s a fingerprint magnet, of course, as is the iPhone display itself. But I keep a microfiber cloth handy to maintain the shiny, pristine finish. A sample product was provided for this review.

I’d be the first to admit that I’m no skin care specialist, but after including Ellie’s Best Fractionated Coconut Oil in my daily routine, I’ve begun to notice remarkable differences. I use the product for skin care and hair care. But I’m most impressed by its performance in shaving prep. Applied to my face prior to shaving it seems to be absorbed quickly by my skin, and I top it off with my favorite shaving cream for a smoother shave. After shaving, a small drop of the oil soothes my skin and further restores it. I also apply it to my hair after showering. Fragrance-free and non-greasy, it leaves my skin and hair extremely touchable.This product was produced in Indonesia, and bottled in China to meet obviously stringent quality standards. So I continue to use Ellie’s Best with confidence. Highly recommended for both men and women. My wife loves it too, and she was the first to inform me of the benefits of fractionated coconut oil.

Keyboard cover design has come a long way since the clumsy, thick covers of the 1990’s. This keyboard skin perfectly fits my Mac Bluetooth keyboard, as well as my 15” MacBook Pro Retina. Given my past experience with old covers I was a bit skeptical about how effective this cover would be. But this skin is so thin and flexible that it doesn’t dampen key touch or undermine my keyboard’s response sensitivity. The GMYLE OS X Shortcut Keyboard Cover is a great Mac accessory. I never before realized that there are so many built-in OS X shortcuts on the keyboard, but this skin helps me take advantage of every shortcut without taking a class. And while this skin looks and feels very delicate, it’s durable enough to withstand maintenance and cleaning. So accidental spills, crumbs and dust are no longer a problem for my MacBook Pro keyboard no matter where I’m using it. I think this is a must-have add-on for any Mac keyboard running on OS X.

Keyboard cover design has come a long way since the clumsy, thick covers of the 1990’s. This keyboard skin perfectly fits my Mac Bluetooth keyboard, as well as my 15” MacBook Pro Retina. Given my past experience with old covers I was a bit skeptical about how effective this cover would be. But this skin is so thin and flexible that it doesn’t dampen key touch or undermine my keyboard’s response sensitivity. Right out of the box the skin reminded me of the facial skin disguises used in the old Mission Impossible TV show. But while it looks and feels very delicate, it’s durable enough to withstand maintenance and cleaning. So accidental spills, crumbs and dust are no longer a problem for my MacBook Pro keyboard.As for technical advantages - the added convenience of having Photoshop shortcuts literally at my fingertips - I could not have found a better keyboard cover. Brightly color-coded and easy to read, the keyboard skin really speeds up my Photoshop navigation. And the more I use the skin, the more proficient I become with Photoshop, because it’s now easier to understand. Highly recommended. A sample product was provided for this review.

The labels are well made and weatherproof. They also provide enough space for adequate labeling of plants and herbs. I also use them in my garage to labels small tool accessories like nails and screws. Recommended.

It is described as having a double reinforced heel and toe, but the only difference I've noticed is a difference in color. There is no extra padding at all. In the future I'll pay more for a different brand with real padding in the heel area.

After some heavy duty hinting, I received the Wahl 9818 Trimmer as a Father’s Day gift. Right out of the box, and after a full charge, the trimmer worked flawlessly. The kit includes every possible attachment for the trimming of every hair on the body – head, beard, ear, nose, and even the unmentionable areas. I’ve used it now for more than a week and have not needed to recharge it. I've found no problems with the power button after turning it off an on many times. So I’m very pleased with this trimmer. But after reading several scary negative reviews, I wondered why I haven’t found similar problems with the same trimmer. I’m just hoping that the trimmer production has been upgraded and improved to the extent that this model is now worthy of the 5-star rating I’m giving it. I will, however, update my rating if any electronic or mechanical problems pop up. Right now, it’s an excellent product that I would recommend to anyone.

When life hands you a lemon, first you squeeze it… and then you make lemonade. The Kitchen Frontier Lemon Squeezer makes quick work of turning a whole lemon into pure, seedless juice. It has 12 holes in its recessed bowl as compared to 7 holes in most popular squeezers. Of course, the secret of making perfect lemonade lies in harnessing the lemon oil from the skin. No lemon squeezer can extract that oil, but immersing the squeezed lemons into a large pitcher of water for a couple of hours will effectively flavor the water with a more intense lemon fragrance. Add a teaspoon of pure honey, along with granulated sugar to taste, and you have old fashion country style lemonade. But it all begins with a great lemon squeezer. This one is the perfect size and weight for a kitchen hand tool. The handles are longer than they appear to be in the photos, which means better leverage for a better squeeze. It is constructed of the same heavy-duty stainless steel found in pro kitchens, and will last for generations of family cooks. Since it’s not painted, I won’t be concerned about a chipped paint surprise, as the squeezer gets older. Full disclosure, this product was made in China. Many lemon squeezers on the market these days are painted yellow – aesthetically pleasing, but raising all kinds of health concerns about possible lead paint in cheap kitchen tools made in other countries. Stainless steel, however, cleans up nicely in my dishwasher.A sample product was provided for this review.

Lately Bluetooth earbuds seem to be falling from the sky. But some hit the ground with a thud. With so many out there, it can be difficult to distinguish a contender from a pretender without side-by-side comparisons. The Soundpeats Qy7 V4.1 brings quality sound across all frequencies, with solid bass, precise treble and uniform midrange. I’ve found that certain recordings bring out the best, or the worst, in a speaker, headphone or earbud. For earbuds the challenge lies in reproducing deep bass. The better the earbud seals in the ear canal, the better the bass response. Soundpeats meets the design challenge by enclosing a variety of earbud sizes in the box. I was able to custom fit this product to my ear canal and discover that sweet spot combination of great sound and ultimate comfort. Right out of the box, Bluetooth pairing with my iPhone 6 was seamless, and the featherweight connecting cable is so light that I sometimes forget that I’m wearing the earbuds.The set has a microphone for smartphone communication, but its location on the earpiece (on the ear) sometimes hampers the mic, particularly outdoors.  But I’m happy to report I have not experienced any of the sonic dropouts I’ve read about in previous reviews here. In fact, the headphones sound great and are a bargain for the price. A sample was provided for this review.
Great for accenting a New York display. Four double-sided signs give you a choice of which street names to display.
This song is too beautiful to be buried among the closing credits of a nice movie.

In creating a display of a New York City street scene for my home office wall, I knew I needed to have the Fire Department well represented. This Daron FDNY Ladder Truck was the most authentic model I could find, and it fits right in with the other vehicles usually seen on a typical NYC street – taxis, buses, mail trucks, etc. Admittedly, I’m only using the truck for display purposes. For others it would make a nice gift for children, because it has all the nice amenities like flashing lights and sirens. However, caution should be exercised, because this truck has small parts that can be dangerous for kids under 3 years old. Also, this product was made in China, where there have been lead paint issues with some toys in the past. In other words, this is not the toy for toddlers who tend to put toys in their mouths, but older children will love this truck.

As an airline flight attendant, my wife travels in uniform to several cities each week. The jewelry she wears must be understated yet elegant without detracting from her uniform or hampering her flight duties. She loves this 18K gold plated platinum bracelet, because it’s both beautiful and comfortable. It’s also a splendid accent on her wrist as she serves her passengers. Several compliments! With dimensions of 8” long x 0.7” wide, and radiant at the slightest turn of her wrist, this bracelet can take her from workday to party-hearty with a minimal wardrobe change.U7 Fashion’s meticulous design and manufacturing process have created an affordable alternative to over-priced fashion.  Costume jewelry of 20 years ago looked too cheap to give, and too embarrassing to receive. This is a new day, with a new night adorned by the subtlety of candlelight.  This exquisite gold-plated bracelet whispers love in such light. A woman in love appreciates that kind of nuance. She’ll also appreciate this kind of quality. As a gold plated alloy this bracelet requires slightly more care than a solid gold item, but the payoff is a beautiful yet inexpensive piece of jewelry. A sample product was provided for this unbiased review.

Flashy men’s jewelry is so 1970’s, so it was refreshing to come across this understated men’s bracelet-necklace combo by U7 Fashion Jewelry. Made of exquisitely detailed alloy material and 18K gold plating, the necklace and bracelet are a perfectly matched set. Granted, this kind of jewelry can be somewhat fragile for everyday wear. Even the manufacturer suggests that wearers keep this jewelry away from too much water and sweat. The items were shipped in an OPP bag for protection from moisture. But at this affordable price you allow for high maintenance. All I know is the set looks great and displays well as occasional accent pieces. I’ve found that all I need to do is keep these items well maintained. A sample product was provided for this honest review.

I have been taking PacificCoast NutriLabs CoQ10 softgels daily for almost three weeks and I’ve noticed improved health in terms of lower blood pressure numbers. Now it’s not magic; it didn’t happen overnight, but as part of an overall change in diet and a regular exercise program. PCNL products meet strict standards of quality, and the extra strength 100 milligram CoQ10 have been easily worked into my daily routine. The bottom line is that I feel better; so much better that I was compelled to research further the benefits of CoQ10. But I’ve also learned that all CoQ10 supplements are not created equally. PCNL CoQ10 has no preservatives and the company backs its products with a full 100% guarantee. This CoQ10 has become part of my better health regimen. A sample product was provided for this unbiased review.

Let’s face it, there are many brands of Omega 3 Fish Oil on the market, so you research as much as you can to find the best. PCNL is a brand that I trust, because of their quality CoQ10 softgels. I was happy to discover their Omega 3 Fish Oil Platinum. Understanding the benefits of this product, especially when added to a sensible diet and regular exercise routine, I take two softgels daily with meals. I can’t say that I completely understand all the benefits of this supplement. But at age 67 I’m happily living with more energy and less joint pain. I used to wear one of those compression knee braces when I exercised, because of periodic, excruciating knee pain. I no longer need the knee brace, because the pain is gone. I’m not saying that PCNL Omega 3 Fish Oil cured me. But I’m not saying that it didn’t, either. All I know is that I feel better. A sample product was provided for this review. Highly recommended!
When it comes to memory for my cameras and devices, there's only one brand I trust - Transcend. I've used their memory cards and flash drives for years, and they've never failed me.

I had always wondered about the value of a dashboard car camera. And then, a few years ago, I experienced an auto accident, when a moving truck turned into my car. Once the insurance lawyers got involved, it was reduced to a he said/he said case, with no undisputable evidence on either side. What I would have given for a dash cam then. The SecurityMan Car Camera is just what I was looking for, with its simple setup, ease of operation, high-def recording, and wide-angle lens. This car cam is an affordable alternative to the overpriced, feature-laden models on the market, and it does the job. In fact, the only thing missing from this package is a micro SD card, and I prefer it that way, because it allows me to choose my preferred brand.There is much to like here. The appropriately named Securityman camera easily detaches from its windshield bracket, allowing me to hide it in the glove compartment when I’m away from my car. It also features an auto, motion detection, or manual recording option. The windshield suction mount is firm and secure. Granted, this is not SecurityMan’s highest-grade dash camera, but it offers many of the same features as the higher priced models, and it’s a great introduction to dashcam technology. It offers continuous loop recording at 1080p resolution. It records 30-second, 3-minute, or 5-minute continuous video clips. Also there’s an Infrared LED array for improved nighttime recording. Dashcams available north of $300 may offer larger screens, but the SecurityMan’s 1.5” screen is all I need with high definition. After all, this is for viewing collision video not Dr. Zhivago. Highly recommended. A sample product was provided for this review.

We are part of an exclusive club, those of us that own cars.  At some point we’re all gonna have to replace automobile light bulbs. Modern car light bulbs last longer, but the great news is that newer LED bulbs can be retrofitted to older cars. My old car used tungsten bulbs, so I was happy to discover the Yorkim 194 LED bulbs replace the old T10 Wedge type tungsten bulbs. This new technology offers so much more than traditional bulbs. 300% brighter/whiter, 1,000 times faster, with a lifespan that trumps 50,000 hours, the Yorkim 194s can replace all the cute little interior bulbs such as dome, courtesy, trunk, etc. They work for license plate lighting. These bulbs also work for lighting on motorcycles, truck, RVs and boats. And with the price of LEDs getting lower, I can see myself replacing each and every tungsten bulb with Yorkim 194 LEDs. They run longer, cooler and brighter. For me, that’s the bottom line. Highly recommended. A sample was provided for this unbiased review.

I’m one of those people that don’t understand the need to camouflage anything outside of a war zone. But this Eltronica Lantern (Made in China) brings all the necessary camping specs – including a compass. It could fulfill anyone’s Grizzly Adams fantasy, but it also works for the rest of us. I know it will make an essential emergency lamp if my electrical power shuts down during a storm.  With LEDs putting out a super bright 120 Lumens, the Camo Lantern can also be used as an emergency light to be carried in my car trunk. At 5.5 inches – expanding to 12 - this bad boy is easily added to backpack, glove box or picnic basket, so you don’t need a deer’s head on your den wall to fully appreciate this device. Three AA batteries (not included) power the Camo Lantern, and the LED technology allow for a projected 100,000-hour lifespan. Road-tested. Since it was designed for the outdoors, I took it outdoors (in my backyard) and tossed it around on the grass. The ruggedly lightweight camouflaged lantern withstood every blow admirably. And it wasn’t even that difficult to find in the grass, because the camo is light green.

This portable speaker surprised me. It looks small but it’s heavy for its size; the kind of heavy that an exceptional speaker needs. And then there’s the amazing sound. I heard a big booming wall of sound and I couldn’t imagine it all came from this tiny spaceship looking hockey puck. But it’s all there - deep bass, precise treble, and a well-dispersed mid-range. The sound emanates from a 360-degree wraparound speaker, and placed in the middle of a room it’s difficult to tell where the sound originates. I love all kinds of music - from Jazz to Classical, R&B, Pop and some Country. The Arespark speaker handles everything I throw at it without sonic strain.There is much to like about this speaker. But make no mistake, this is serious equipment; it’s not a toy for small children that tend to put things in their mouths. The product was made in China. That said there are many things to like about this speaker. I love the fact that the controls are right on top, easy to read and simple to operate. Bluetooth pairing with my iPhone 6 is flawless. This speaker makes a great take-along, whether in backpack, glove compartment or picnic basket, though its camouflage design may make it hard to find in the grass (wink, wink). Mostly this quality speaker is FUN. Arespark has thought of everything. The included D-shaped carabiner snap clip adds to the device’s mobility in that I can clip it on to anything… and go. It also comes with two cables – a micro USB charging cable and a 3.5mm audio cable. There’s even a slot for a micro SD card. Highly recommended!

The Clear Plastic Tote Bag by Lifestyle Plus is a great little carryall for sports arenas, airports and picnics. It’s made of weatherproof heavy-duty plastic, and facilitates carrying with its well-stitched straps – both hand loops and shoulder straps. Sure, the see-through feature is helpful (even mandatory) for security people at public facilities, but I find it useful to easily see what I’m carrying. Thankfully it comes with either black accents, or pink accents. There is also a neat little detachable pouch where I can comfortably carry small personal items.  I like this tote bag. It makes a nice gift, and it’s ready for summer fun. A sample product was provided for this review.

LifeCHARGE has ushered in a new day of smartphone charging on the go with its AC wall adapter. And it doesn’t matter what smartphone technology you use. The Source 101mAh Powerbank is equipped with dual microports and a USB port to make it a universal charging station. So at 5100mAh, this is not the most powerful external battery on the market, but it just may be the most versatile. The approximate dimensions of this unit are 3”x2.5”x1” thick and it weighs a relatively light 6.4 ounces, so it packs well in carry-on luggage or a picnic basket. The sleek, compact design of the Source makes it a device that I don’t hesitate to carry with me as a mobile charger. The multi-LED battery indicator keeps me informed of remaining power. The pack does not include Apple cables, but it makes a great gift for multi-device, multi-smartphone tech families. Highly recommended. A sample product was provided for this unbiased review.

I’ve been searching for the ultimate iPhone 6 case since I purchased my iPhone on launch day. I admit to being a case snob, preferring a case that doesn’t compromise the thin profile that Apple designed. But I also want a case that offers some degree of protection in the event of a minor drop. The Protekme case combines style, functionality and protection at an affordable price. For those who like their iPhone well protected the Protekme offers 360-degree, 2-piece armor. But those of us that want our iPhone to remain uncovered and immediately available for action or viewing, prefer a case less encumbered. In other words, this case is more case than I need. Much of the beauty of the iPhone 6 is its screen. Why cover it up? I’m sure others will find it adequate for their iPhone 6. Also, in theory, the kickstand is a nice idea, and it works in the landscape position. But in the portrait position this case does not stand up. It falls backwards and does not balance – either with the iPhone 6 attached, or by itself. Also I’m not sure I’d want to carry my iPhone 6 clipped to my belt. The belt clip reminds me of a pager… 30 years ago. Besides, I’m not inclined to secure a $300 iPhone with a $13 belt clip.  This case may satisfy some. It has a great price, but you get what you pay for.

Back in the 1970’s my favorite headphones was an inexpensive, lightweight, yellow foam-padded headset that sounded terrific. In the current market of popular $300 headphones this SoundPEATS headset comes as a big surprise, both price-wise and sonically. With good quality, Bluetooth connectivity and a built-in microphone, this headset satisfies on many levels. I don't think it competes well with expensive headphones, but it's a good set for casual listening. The SoundPEATS features the deep bass - which is a little boomy for my tastes - and crisp highs of the higher priced headphones, and their lightweight makes them comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The sound sometimes breaks up, which can be annoying. Bluetooth-paired to my iPhone I’m never worried that I’ll miss a phone call, because the well-placed controls allow me to switch from music to phone with the click of a button. This headset would make a great gift for a student, but it’s a gift that you may want to keep for yourself.  A sample product was provided for this honest review.

I like kitchen tools and gadgets, but I love those that really work as designed. The HappierChef Apple Slicer and Corer is the best one I have tried. I’ve used others made of flimsy plastic and cheap metal, but this one is relatively heavy stainless steel. It feels like a tool used by professional chefs. The stainless steel blades slice easily through the apple skin, and the heft of this slicer ensures that the apple core will break away flawlessly. There are no jagged edges to cling onto bits of fruit. The non-slip rubberized handles feel great in the hands. I have no doubt that this slicer will clean up nicely in the dishwasher. Highly recommended! It’s crazy, but I can actually see myself buying more apples and pears just to use this tool. A sample product was provided for this review.

When you become familiar with quality cable you recognize the FRiEQ brand name. MFi certified and compatible with Apple devices, this cable works with most wall adapters in charging my devices. All lightning-to-USB cables are not created equal, and the difference can be found specifically in flexibility and strength. The length (3.3 feet) of the FRiEQ cable will accommodate charging my devices from the backseat of my car, and synching my iPods and iPhone with iTunes on the back of my iMac. The cable is reinforced at both ends and, like all FRiEQ cables its kink-free thickness ensures that electronic interference during data transfer is a non-issue. I consider FRiEQ the best of electronic cables. Highly recommended.

The ipow wrist wraps are lightweight, flexible, yet remarkably strong in supporting my wrists during weightlifting exercises. The Velcro closures fit securely and remove easily. I would recommend this product to those in weight training, but also for those who on occasion need to lift heavy furniture or equipment around the house. They strengthen the wrist as a preventive precaution before a possible strain.

The ipow adjustable heavy-duty silicone trivets do a wonderful job in protecting my black granite countertop. The silicone provides a non-slip surface that does not slide like other pot pads. The triangular configuration is flexible enough to suit both large and small pots. The description mentions that the item is part silicone and part metal, but the metal does not come into contact with the countertop or the pots. A sample product was provided for this unbiased review.

The ipow knee support brace works as advertised, but it smells a lot. The product description does not state where the product was made, but it does mention that the material is from Japan. I tried on the product and it does support my knee, but I don’t think I will wear it because of the toxic-like smell. I don’t trust this product in that respect, and I cannot recommend it. A sample product was provided for this unbiased review.

The ipow CD slot holder was the perfect accessory for my wife’s car. She uses her iPhone for everything, including GPS and compass headings. It also works well when she uses the speakerphone option – hands remain on the steering wheel and eyes on the road. I was impressed by the build quality (minor assembly is a snap) and the way in which this accessory fits the CD slot. It is totally adjustable and swivels easily to the portrait or landscape position. A sample product was provided for this review.
This was a really good story and I sure enjoyed it. I loved the characters of Van and Dulcie, they really made the boo worth wild to read.
very nice images
these are great

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Kate Kent. This is part of the series Confessions of a Mail Order Bride by the author.Marcie Shore came to Shifters Grove with out much money but she was determined not to let that stop her but she didn't find love like she was looking for and ended up the talk of the town.Kane Foster thought Marcie was cute and curvy in all the right places but he was a little shy. When things work to his advantage Marcie finds herself falling for the sexy shifter.The author wrote some very good characters in this story . The story line flow was smooth as silk from start to finish.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Ariana Hawkes. This isShiftr: Swipe Left for Love Boxed Set (Books 1 - 3) by the author.Book 1 DinaHaving almost given up on dating Dina finally agrees to join a shifter dating site. When she looks over the men 1 special guy sticks out in her mind but when she accidentally deletes his photo she thinks all is lost until a garden party hands her the bear of her dreams.Book 2 KristinKristin is introduced to the online dating service for shifters and humans by her friends Lauren and Dina after they met their mates. Kristin has had bad relationships before so getting into another she is hesitant to do but she agrees. When a tiger shifter catches her eye she needs to decide if she wants to be happy or continue to be alone.Book 3 MelissaMelissa Ericson thought she had met her match but that was wrong so with the help of her friends she filled out an a profile with Shiftr. When she finds her 99% match who happens to be a doc but painful memories cloud things for her until she finds out the truth about what happened. Can Melissa find love or will her past stay in the way of her happiness.This is an awesome series by the author.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Sedona Venez. This is book 1 of the new series Bear Elite  by the author.Raven Holiday is a guide and she is leading a group into the wilderness. She is suspicious of the leader but it is not until her radios are stolen that she finds out how dangerous they really are.Bear Armstrong is an alpha and does some work for the military with his team. They are tracking a rouge werewolf and find a human in the mix. Can they save her before she is killed.Great action and I loved the 2 main characters in this story. I could not put the book down.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Sarah Makela.Morgana is a special kind of treasure hunter because she is a raven shifter and she can sneak in and get out fast. After loosing her boyfriend Morgana hides herself away from people so she wont get hurt again but when she is enlisted by Cody to help track down his family's talisman she starts to let herself feel again but it could get her killed.This story was 1 I had to read to the end because it grabbed me when I started reading it and I could not stop. Wizards, shifters and romance, what more could you ask for in a paranormal romance.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Michelle Irwin. This is book 1 of the series Daughter of Fire by the author.Evie Meyers is living a lie and now she is in real danger from it and being hunted down. Why has her father never told her the truth? To protect her from the people who killed her mom. Clay Jacobs called her a monster 4 years ago and now he shows back up in her life again.This started out a little slow but once it got going it was a good read.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Sylvia Frost. This is book 4 from the Moonfate Series by the author.Artemis Williams  is running and after Orion is shot she is not sure who she can trust now. They say her mate is working for the "other side" but is it true or are they trying to get inside her head. Can Artemis find the truth to put her world back together again.Lots of action and betrayal involved here in this conclusion of the series. Loved the character of Artemis and how she deals with her pain and strength.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Kaye Blue. This is book 3 of the Romanian Mob Chronicles by the author.Lily got into the Constantine Clan and was now taking care of Christoph Constantine senior but what she wanted was to destroy him once and for all. Anton thought there was something up with the nurse that was hired to take care of the senior head of the organization but he had to find out what to keep the old man alive.This is a must read for any mobster romance book reader

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author  Kim Fox. This is book 1 of Ultimate Shifter Championship series by the author.Dakota worked as a barmaid in Alaska and the whole town was "owned" by rhino shifter Walter Cash. She is very interested in the handsome stranger who comes into the bar. When Grayson comes into the bar for a beer he ends up in a cage fight against his new boss's son which causes problems for him and for Dakota.This is well written and the characters of Dakota and Grayson were well written.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Jeanne McDonald.Alexis York and Ryan Fisher grew up together and were always there for each other through thick or thin. Now 15 years has passed since they have seen each other but when they meet up it is like coming home for both of them and maybe even a start of something new. Alexis is now a doctor in Dallas and Ryan is a co-pilot with a home base in Dallas. Only time will tell if these 2 are meant to be together.WOW this story is very well written with some great characters. The author wrote a clean and smooth flowing story line in this book.This is for any mature contemporary romance book lover out there.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Emme Rollins. This is book 2 of Tyler and Katie's Story by the author.Tyler Cook is the guitarist for the rock group Trouble and he lives up to the bands name for Katie. But when he gets straightened out Katie can't let go of him. Katie set her sights on Tyler because her best friend went after the lead singer. Things take a turn and start spiraling out of control Katie needs to decide if being with Tyler is worth it or not.The flow of the story was amazing and the character interactions was so riveting through out the whole book. I had a hard time putting it down because it was so good.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Leslie Johnson and Elle Dawson.This is book 4 of the Shattered series by the authors.Duff and Grace finally make it to his cabin and think they are safe for a little while but Duff knows better. He knows even though he cares about Grace he has to leave her to keep her safe. Grace feels the loss of her family when they watch tv and hear her grandfathers words. Now they are on the run again and still do not know who is targeting Duff.Action, adventure, sex and bad guys are in the awesome story. This is for mature suspense readers.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Anne Lowe. This is a review for her novella only Desert Yule of the series The Wolves of Twin Moon Ranch.It is Christmas time at the ranch and Carly is home for the holidays but she really isn't thrilled to be there. Each couple has their own special together time with their mate. Will there ever be a mate for Carly to share this special time of year or will she continue to be alone.This is really special because it gives the character couple something special. Tina and her mate Rick, Kyle and his mate Stef, Lana and her mate Ty, Cody and his mate Heather plus all the kids.
liked the patterns

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Erika Masten. This is book 1 of a new series Sons of Fenris MC by the author.Tabitha is a latent wolf and wants to be a full fledged wolf and she chooses a notorious biker gang to make it happen even if the guy she had a crush on is a member of that gang. Finn was turned and almost killed Tabitha but he ran away to save her but now here she is and the prez wants her either changed or dead.This is a really good story and great characters. Mature paranormal romance book lovers will enjoy this book.

I was given a complimentary copy for an honest review by author Crystal Rister. This is book 1 of The Burn Series by the author.Sara watched as her mom and dad perished in a fire when she was young. This program is an inexpensive and generally useful replacement for Adobe Acrobat and has good capabilities for Optical Character Recognition.  A powerful and cost-effective product.

This handbook for the data analysts emphasizes the tools which predictive analytics and data provide for decision maker, rather than particular software tools or the detailed mathematical analysis which underlies these techniques. It provide a framework for using and choosing analytic methods for decision making based upon the CRISP-DM model.  It does not draw a strict line between"Predictive Analytics" and "Decision Analytics" and cover such methodologies as Classification, Clustering and Text Data Mining, which I might have thought lie within the domain of Decision Analytics.This handbook is a valuable addition to the library of a business analyst or decision maker attempting to make the bet use of modern data mining and analytic techniques.

This is a first rate text for those whose knowledge gap it seek to fill.  It is not a do-all introductory text for web development for someone completely new to IT looking to develop skill to get up their first web site.  Rather, and quite successfully, it instructs anyone who has some significant exposure to other areas of IT, in all they need to develop strong database and client-server web applications using Open Source or Free tools.  Many of us "oldsters" who come from another area of IT seek to rapidly acquire the skills to develop a significant interactive and database-backed web application.  For us this is a perfect 'no-BS' compact book that transmits these skills.  It could also be used, perhaps with occasional access to a mentor, by anyone who has mastered basic HTML and CSS-based web development and seeks to develop more robust skills.

For anyone either new to Microsoft Office or new to the features of the Office 2013 edition this reasonably priced book and online video series presents clear instruction in all the basic and general procedures necessary to use Office 2013.  I have only deducted one star because this book/video combination covers only the basic and generic feature, and because the video instruction is not accessible on the same screen as one's practice session with Office.  While all basic menu features, ribbon, and formatting commands are covered in sufficient depth, the instruction is not sufficiently deep to allow a subject matter expert to use and carry out advanced operations with the software.  For example, even one quite knowledgeable in basic statistics or financial operation would not be able on the basis of this book and video series to construct an Excel spreadsheet using linear regression, or calculating risk and the time value of money.  Likewise, I would not attempt to author a scientific article or thesis in Word merely on the basis of this instruction.But,, for anyone seeking to learn the basic feature of Office 2013 and its differences from prior editions the instruction is a bargain and more than adequate to thee purposes.

The accuracy of dictation is about 90%. Workable with the editing tools provided.  But I prefer dictating even with an older version on the Window's desktop.  If you are committed to Mac Applications and you don't wont to explore virtual machine options this is a reasonable product.

Phil Simon is a prominent speaker and writer on business trends particularly those involving "Big Data".  He presents this beautiful full color volume as a set of Case Studies on how organizations ranging from the multibillion dollar Netflix, to the small yet innovative start-up Social Polling organization Wedgies benefit from the use of innovative data visualization of Big Data to their corporate advantage.  He states he is ot redoing the greats of data visualization strategy like Tufte, or concentrating on the detailed heuristics of a bar chart versus a pie diagram.  Thus I was not as surprised to see that while he mentioned big data tools like R he did not concentrate on their best use in Visualization. After all this is a book of Case Studies.  But I noticed that all of the successful visualizations he illustrated took significant steps in planning how people use their cognition (decision making skills) and emotions in making a decision or reaching conclusions about big data. Mr. Simon might have offered some advice on how an organization should proceed in making cognitive and emotional impact with their presentations.This is a fine effort in describing the Impact of Data Visualizations of Big Data have on Organizational Success.  It is also a beautiful book.

This text provides a decent introduction to programming in the Python Language suitable for "high schoolers" and hobbyists.Many of the applications involve libraries such as Pygame and CV which are available in a variety of programming environments including standard PC's.  I would have preferred to see more direct instruction and diagramming of the Pi specific functionality in device I/O and Network Services specific to a Maker performing experiments in this environment.

This is an excellent business decision making and consulting guide, which relies on a combination of statistical and behavioral measures. It is particularly applicable to decisions involving risk, valuation, and the value of information.  It is not as is stated in the first half of the title a guide to "Measuring Anything"; for example little insight is provided that would be applicable to measurement of physical quantities, or rates and bottlenecks in a factory.  Some methods discussed while insightful involve non-standard definitions of quantities.  For example a behavioral measure of correctness based on knowledge sufficiency tests is given as an example of Confidence Intervals, rather than the conventional definition of Interval Estimates in a Normal Probability Distribution.I highly recommend this text as an addition to the Internal or External Consultant's library.  It is a valuable set of insights into business decision making.

I need to preface this review by saying that I am an Information Technologist rather than a Medical Professional.  I requested thisreview text from Amazon's Vine program to enable me to ask more intelligent questions of my Cardiologist on his treatment of my Atrial Fibrillation.  It has more than adequately satisfied my curiosity in that regard.  The amount of terminology which is unfamiliar to a layman while significant is not an insurmountable barrier to understanding the content and reasoning behind treatment.  I would recommend this text to any scientifically trained patient suffering from a Cardiac Arrythmia, or one having a patient in the family.

Jonathan Fenby is a leading expert on the PC, who doubts that it will dominate global power projection in the predictable future.  His piquant analysis is based on considerable expertise in the political, social and economic (financial) spheres.  I would have preferred that the essay offered greater technical analysis of the manufacturing and military position of an emerging PRC.  Certainly more and higher quality products can be expected from China's manufacturing prowess (as I have seen in the electronics market and semiconductor industries).  Also, whether or not China's military expenditure is considerably less than that of the US may be less important than whether a blue water navy can project china's influence in the Pacific and Asian regions.Mr. Fenby's essay is knowledgeable and insightful in the areas it analyzes, I would have additional questions about his prognostications as far as they might reflect technical expertise in the manufacturing and military domains.
This is a great book to keep your websites and information organized. It's small and I like the elastic strap that closes it.

This is a wonderful corkscrew. The Rosewood is gorgeous, and it is easy to handle. It does exactly what it's supposed to do, and I have no complaints. It is a great addition to our home bar.Disclosure: I received this product for free in exchange for an honest review. Did I enjoy this book: I really did. This was a fantastic read that had me glued to my Kindle from beginning to the end.Annabel is a working mom of two adorable children, and she has a wonderful husband. They are living a pretty good life. The major snag in Annabel’s seemingly perfect life is her mother, Bea. Bea is very opinionated, rather stubborn, and sometimes just a bitch. Annabel just wants her mother to show that she loves her and her children. However, there is way more to this story than what meets the eye.I can’t go into too much about the story itself or the arcs of the characters for fear of giving away some major plot lines. I will say this: Plan Bea is a great example of the fact that everyone . . . everyone . . . has a story, a history. Nobody’s life is easy or perfect as they may lead you to believe. Ms. Grossman does a great job getting you to like all the characters, down to the kids, and she even has a few surprises up her sleeve. I didn’t see them coming. There was a bit of a cliffhanger. Bit isn’t quite the right word . . . When will the next book be out?!?!?!?!? I can’t wait. (Please don’t get me wrong, the cliffhanger does not in any way spoil the book for me. It just makes you want to read more.)All in all, Plan Bea was a great read. You’ll laugh, cry, hope, wonder, shake your head, and gasp. At least, those were a few of the reactions I had.Would I recommend it: Absolutely! Any chick lit or women’s fiction lover should read Plan Bea.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

4.5 starsDid I enjoy this book: I really did! I loved Surviving the Rachel.Bree is young and trying to find her footing after an unexpected start post-college. After moving home, she finds a friend in her neighbor, Jack.  I love their chemistry. They make great friends, and more.  There were a few times that I wanted to smack each of them and ask them what they were thinking, or why didn’t they ask the other one very pertinent questions! It was a good frustration. I was invested in their stories, in their lives. I loved watching Bree come into her own in her new profession.On top of that, there were quite a few swoon-worthy moments, giddy moments, sweet moments. And fireflies! And the end! Wonderful.Another aspect of Ms. Ellis’s books that I really like is that they are all connected in some way. They all use Connectivity. Avery and Deke from Chronicles of a Lincoln Park Fashionista show up in Surviving the Rachel. You feel like you are in the same community. These aren’t sequels or books in the same setting/series. But they all fit together. Oh, and the Friends references were perfect! It is one of my favorite TV series of all time. I’ll say it again: wonderful.Would I recommend it: Absolutely! Ms. Ellis is a must-read author for me and she should be for you as well!Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

3.5 starsDid I enjoy this book: I did enjoy The Originals: The Rise. It kept me interested from start to finish.I’ll admit: I haven’t read or seen The Vampire Diaries. And I haven’t seen the show The Originals. But I didn’t have to in order to enjoy this book. Anyone can jump in with this book and become fully engrossed and hooked.  There are werewolves, witches, and vampires. There is a family feud, a merging of families/species, and unlikely love. There is fighting, war, and romance. The Originals has it all. I love the setting as well. Although I’ve never been to New Orleans, I’ve always been fascinated by the city. The Originals:The Rise also makes me want to read the rest of the series as well as The Vampire Diaries. And I wouldn’t mind watching the television show.Would I recommend it: Sure!Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: I couldn’t put it down. The writing is beautiful, the characters are amazing, and the story will stick with me for years to come. Neelie’s Truth is going on my “favorites” shelf. Fitzgerald’s written some lovely, heartbreaking stuff. Read it.Would I recommend it: Yes. Go buy this book. Now.As reviewed by Melissa at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: It was a big bag of propaganda masquerading as a novel. I hated it. I’ll give Rawles a single star because he did give me a few ideas for additions to my Go Bag (Yeah, I have one. Because Zombies.), but as a novel it lacked, well . . . let’s just say it lacked. The characters weren’t memorable, the plot wasn’t original, and though I’m all for disaster preparedness, it’s hard to take advice from characters who feel the need to add hipster labels to their lunches (oh no, these aren’t hard-boiled eggs, these are PASTURE-RAISED hard-boiled eggs).Would I recommend it: Absolutely not.As reviewed by Melissa at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

3.5 starsDid I enjoy this book: I did enjoy this book. It was a good end to the Husband Maker series.We are back with Charlotte and Angus as Angus is getting ready to leave for his fellowship halfway across the country. And Charlotte has a decision to make–fight for Angus or let him go. I’m glad she made the tough choices she made. Those decisions showed courage and drive. Some may think they were foolish, but sometimes you have to make those rash choices to get what you want.I don’t want to say too much as I don’t want to give away the story. I will say it was a good end, and the very end was great.Would I recommend it: Yes, but be sure to read the first two books in the series, The Husband Maker and The Match Maker.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: I really enjoyed the first book in the Outer Banks Tennis Academy series, Game. Set. Match. (See my review here.) And Losing at Love is a great addition to the series.I have to say I’m not much of a tennis fan–watching the matches, learning how to play–BUT I love reading about it in this series. I found myself getting caught up in the matches and practices. I felt bad for Penny when she was injured. I rooted for Indy and Jasmine. I love Jack, Alex, and Paolo. I can’t believe Dom. And I can’t stand Caroline. I even learned more about the game in general. I may have to watch a few matches now.Would I recommend it: Yes, I would. And I can’t wait to read the next book in the Outer Banks Tennis Academy series.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: You know what? It’s funny. I’m not saying I guffawed or anything, but it’s just the sort of snarky satire I love. I mean, sure, there were more commas than are strictly necessary, and sure there were several pages I skimmed, but it’s an irreverent little book and I liked it.Would I recommend it: Go for it (especially if you aspire to write novels)!As reviewed by Melissa at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: I really liked this book. Secrets of the Porch made me think about faith, forgiveness, and love. I think one of the biggest themes is love. Yes, there’s romantic love, but there’s also a love for family and friends, love for God, and finding a way to love yourself. My favorite character is Lila. She is a strong woman with love running through her veins, and she has many layers. I think she made the book for me.The only thing I don’t love about the book is how quickly the dramatic event happen toward the end. The whole thing seems to be thrown into the book to draw out something dark, but it seems out of place and out of character. The only thing I can think of is that maybe Sellon was hoping to use the event in order to add an emotional punch to Lila’s story. If that was the case, it worked, but I wish it had been done better.Overall, I found myself happy that I read this book. It gave me that warm fuzzy feeling, just like a grandmother’s hug.Would I recommend it: Yes, I think I would.As reviewed by Gina at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: I did, but it started out rather slow for my taste. I know that characters need to be developed, but it felt a bit sluggish. I found myself wanting to put the book down a few times. However, once the second half of the book started, I really did want to know what happened to the characters. And although I wasn’t totally thrilled with how some of the story ended, it did make sense. There were many ways characters could have crashed and burned Gatsby-style in this novel, but I’m okay with the fact that Riddell didn’t take it that way.Would I recommend it: Sure.As reviewed by Gina at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: I read the first chapter of this book and was hooked. I didn’t want to stop reading it. I left the kids up in their cribs an extra ten minutes after naptime just so I could finish a chapter. Yeah, it was good.To Ride a White Horse is what a historical romance should be. It has plenty of kissing, longing, passion, and of course, well-placed historical elements. The history doesn’t take a backseat. Ford does a great job describing the Irish famine for those who aren’t familiar with it. I’d heard some things in history class, but Kathleen (the leading lady) and her family really made it real for me. I felt what they were feeling and actually cared what happened to her family. Also, Jack (the leading man) isn’t a dominating jerk. He has a heart, and his backstory made me root for him and Kathleen even more. I could see myself having a candlelit dinner with him.Would I recommend it: It’s a perfect summer read. Definitely add it to the to-read list if you like a good love story.As reviewed by Gina at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.

Did I enjoy this book: This is a really fun book! I’m pretty sure I enjoyed it as much as my son did! We’re working on introducing the concept that not all books have pictures, but they’re still fun to read, and The Book With No Pictures was wonderful for that!My son was a little skeptical at first (as one would expect of a 2.5-year-old), but once my husband started reading all the silly words in funny voices, we started giggling together and having a great time! The Book with No Pictures is also a great lesson for parents on how to read aloud in order to keep small children engaged. (Hint: funny voices are key).Would I recommend it: The Book With No Pictures is my go-to gift for new parents! It should be in every child’s library. It’s fun, silly, and a great way for parents to interact and share a love of reading with their little ones.As reviewed by Sara at Every Free Chance Books.

3.5 starsDid I enjoy this book: Alexander was a staple of my own childhood, so I was eager to share him with my own children. My son loves it just as much as I did as a child. The best aspect of Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day is that it demonstrates that you don’t always get your way and sometimes (even in Australia) you have a bad day. I feel this is a lesson that many children today are lacking.The illustrations are black and white and could be a little more engaging, but my toddler doesn’t seem to mind all that much. One of the things that bothers me from a parenting perspective is that Alexander uses the word “hate” quite a lot. As a parent, I try to encourage my children to express themselves without using negative labeling words like “hate” and “can’t.” It’s okay not to like something, but I would rather my children explain what they don’t like instead of just applying a label. That being said, I still read this to my children frequently. We talk about better ways for Alexander to express his feelings about things that he doesn’t like, so it all works out to be a teaching moment.Would I recommend it: This is a fun book that I enjoy reading to my children, and I would recommend it to parents who are looking for an entertaining story with a useful lesson.As reviewed by Sara at Every Free Chance Books.

Did I enjoy this book: The first aspect of the book that struck me was the characters. They are well developed and multi-dimensional. Quality characters are a must for me, and Mythos does not disappoint. I was immediately drawn to Itzy–she has just enough “every girl” to relate to a wide range of readers while still having plenty of mystery to keep us interested.The plot was engaging and kept me wanting more up to the end. I have to admit I was a little worried when I discovered there were “aliens” (there are so many ways to go wrong with aliens), but it was very well done. I am also a lover of all sorts of mythology, so I really enjoyed that Pendred incorporated several different ancient cultures into her story.Further, I was quite impressed with how imaginative the characters’ alien powers are. The descriptions of how Itzy and the others use their mental powers are very engaging and very cool, too! The only thing that bothers me is that several of the characters have very powerful abilities. In fact they are so powerful I was left wondering why the climax even needed to occur because Aiden could have resolved the issue with a thought. This is always a risk in magical worlds, because if you give your characters amazing powers your plot has to be robust enough to support them. A tiny bit of willing suspension of disbelief got me past this though, because I love magic.Would I recommend it: I sure would! Mythos has everything a lover of paranormal young adult fiction is looking for: magical beings, unrequited love, love triangles, cool mythology, and a slightly misfit heroine! What’s not to love? I certainly want to read the rest of the series!As reviewed by Sara at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

Where I stopped reading: I only made it through the first several pages.Why I stopped reading: I’m clearly not the target audience for this book; not only do I not have enough working knowledge of Excel to make sense of Santiago’s tips, but I was also horrified at the blatant sexism she uses to explain things. I was expecting an “Excel for dummies with a feminine twist” sort of thing, and instead I had to keep reminding myself I’m allowed to vote. Disappointing.As reviewed by Melissa at Every Free Chance Books.Disclosure: I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange  for an honest review.

The charm offered by Joe the Barbarian is enough to draw you in, but it's the hypnotic effect it has on you that will make you stay.  Written by the great Grant Morrison, Joe the Barbarian finds our young teen protagonist Joe in some dire straits.  He's an extreme diabetic, he's home alone, and he seriously needs to get his sugar up.  Making matters worse is the storm outside that kills the power inside his house, which really exacerbates the vivid hallucinations he has involving his action figures and his pet mouse Jack.  It all sounds like a ridiculous mish-mash of non-sense that wouldn't work with any other writer, but Joe the Barbarian shockingly manages to do all just that.  Morrison weaves a gripping and inventive tale, while artist Sean Murphy draws us such a gorgeously brilliant world that it becomes hard not to become trapped in it yourself.  All in all, do yourself a favor and pick up Joe the Barbarian, you'll be glad that you did.

As much as I love Garth Ennis' The Boys, I'll be the first to admit that the past couple volumes of the series haven't been as great as the first few of the series.  All that being said, Butcher, Baker, Candlestickmaker is a spectacular read, and a brilliant origin story of Billy Butcher.  Collecting the six-issue mini-series, this volume details the tragic early youth and soldier years of the future leader of The Boys, leading up to meeting his eventual wife Becky, and the horror to unfold in the years afterwards.  Like the series has pretty much always been, Butcher, Baker, Candlestickmaker is a bloody, brilliant, and darkly hilarious trip.  Darick Robertson's artwork is still bloody brilliant as well, but it's Ennis' trademark writing and fully fleshing out the Butcher we all know and love that really makes this a winner.  Oh yeah, the final panels of this collection make it worth picking up in itself.

From director Tarsem Singh (The Cell) comes Immortals, a visual dynamo of a film that offers little to nothing else.  Henry Cavill (from The Tudors and soon to be seen as the new Superman) is Theseus; a mortal man chosen by Zeus (Luke Evans) to stop the evil King Hyperion (Mickey Rourke) from finding a mythical bow used for unleashing the mythical Titans and laying waste to the rest of the world.  Along for the ride are a thief (Stephen Dorff) and an oracle (Freida Pinto) as Theseus fights and flexes his way across the screen, with blood and swordplay being the order of the day.  Much like The Cell, Immortals is a visual feast that features amazing technical achievements while offering little in the way of story or character development.  Not to mention the fact that there are so many plot holes and inconsistencies along the way that you'll be hard pressed keeping track of everything going on.  The film's battle and fight scenes are good, but there are too many slow moments that bog up the pace and as a result Immortals feels uneven.  Cavill does little to prove himself leading man material, as the rest of the cast (including John Hurt, Alan Van Sprang, Isabel Lucas, and Kellan Lutz) pretty much phones it in, but it's Mickey Rourke that manages to leave a lasting impression in an otherwise mediocre affair.  All in all, Immortals is visually appealing, and little else.

Reign of Doomsday, which concludes Paul Cornell's run on Action Comics, is a super thrilling and wonderfully enjoyable.  Beginning with Superman facing off one last time against a super-powered Lex Luthor, and then continuing with the Superman family (Supes, Superboy, Supergirl, Steel, The Eradicator, and even the Cyborg) taking on multiple Doomsday's.  While the storytelling is fairly simplistic, part of the charm of Cornell's Action Comics run is that it provides everything a mainstream superhero comic should.  Smart and intelligent action and storytelling, with brilliant artwork from Pete Woods and a variety of others.  Not to mention the fact that this collection also features the landmark 900th issue of Action Comics, as well as a handful of backup stories featured in that issue featuring work from Geoff Johns, David Goyer, and more (and features the controversial tale involving Superman giving up his United States citizenship).  All in all, Reign of Doomsday is a wonderful and thrilling Superman tale that deserves your time and attention.
