It would be if Dyson used a removable battery system similar to my Dewalt tools.Overall another excellent product from Dyson.  The battery / run time should be something to consider before making the purchase

Based on the instructions the pasta should be done in 12 minutes.  You still need to watch the pasta.  It is not a set it and forget it instructionsInstead of the stove top directions, I decided trying making a pasta dish with Alfredo sauce in the oven.  Too make it work I had to use 4 cups of liquids (Cream / Milk) add the cheeses and the pasta.  Total cook time was around 35 minutes. I did stir the dish one time around twenty minutes to ensure no noodles were getting over baked.  The dish turned out great.  The pasta tasted the same to me.I have not compared the prices in the grocery stores but if the cost is close I would purchase this over regular pasta.

The balance bar bites make for a better snack for the kids.  When it comes to "healthy" bars my kids normally do not like the taste.  Between the Clif bar for kids and now these Balance bar bites I have some additional snacks to provide.  Balance markets themselves as the 40-30-30, which may true but these bites lack fiber. So these may not completely curb their hunger.  They are perfect for having in the car for an after school snack.  Fruits and vegetables are better options for their during the day snack.My only negative is that the chocolate flavor is light so the bites are bland.  I will be making future purchases of this product

I would rate these earbuds 3 1/2 stars. The earbuds are comfortable once you get the rubber piece that fits your ear and the design is nice.The sound quality is average.  The highs and mids are good but there not much speak of in the way lows.  I have Bose and Sennheiser earbuds and both are better than the creative in the balance of sound with better bass.  The Sennheiser are in the same price range.The noise isolation does perform well.  Distortion does occur when your turn the volume all the way up no one should be listening at this level so the distortion is non-issue.The carry pouch is nice and including the airplane adapter is a nice touch.  Depending on what you are looking for in earbuds, these creative may work for  you.  If enjoy the lows then I would recommend looking elsewhere.

We have had the curling iron for a couple of weeks now. The T3 does make the process of curling your hair easier because it slowly spins so there is no need for your to turn your.  That being said, if you have been curling your hair for any length of time, you can expect the time to curl your hair to take longer.  The designer is beautifulThis curling iron gets hot and does so quickly.  One issue I noticed is you sometime have to turn on the twist on to get the lights to be on top.So far no complaints but we are not seeing any better result with T3 vs our $35 curling iron.

BLU has produced a good low cost entry level 4G LTE phone. There were some sacrifices made by BLU in order to achieve the price, which means this phone is not for everyone.In my opinion this phone is perfect for anyone who does not want to be stuck in and contract and does not plan to install many apps or play more graphic intensive games.  The phone is good for using the Internet, taking pictures as long as you are using a microsd card, making phone calls, and a lighter usage of apps.I rated this phone 4 stars. The rating based on the criteria I have listed.I have tested this phone on both at&t and T-Mobile networks.  I am including screenshots in my review. Feel free to ask questions in the comments field and I will try to answer them.CONS- Device Storage: This is my biggest CON.  The cost difference between 8GB and 16GB NAND Flash is minimal. The company should have gone with 16GB even if they decided to slightly increase the cost of the phone. Considering the Android OS takes up a good portion of the storage, which will be worse with Lollipop once BLU pushes out the upgrade later this year.  . available storage showed 4.66GBYes you can add a Microsd card but many apps cannot be move to the MicroSD card.- RAM:  1GB of RAM limits the amount of multitasking you can perform without suffering from stuttering. No issues watching Netflix- Shipping with KitKat rather than Lollipop does not make much sense with a new phone.- Missing BAND 5 (at&t) and BAND 12 (T-Mobile) LTE Bands.  This could impact some people.- Single Band WiFi.  2.4Ghz only.PROS:- Not much bloatware like you see with the major manufacturers.  Mostly Google apps and only a few BLU apps- Easy to navigate and use interface.- Nice display, sure it is not 1080 or Quad HD but the battery will last longer and allows for the lower price point- Multi Sim: You can have to 2 SIM cards in the phone but you cannot use a microsd card if you use both SIM ports- Price: Even with the low device storage, you still get a more than capable 4G LTE phone- Camera: The photos look great with the camera.  Lower light photos do suffer from noise.- Battery: While not removable this battery performs well enough to last the day with moderate usage.  Overnight with phone idle, it lost about 7% of battery after about 8 hours.Other options: At this price point you could look for older models from the big manufacturers like the S4 or G2.  You could also consider spending a little more a get the Alcatel Idol 3, which gives you more storage and RAM. It also has all the LTE bands in the US.  There is also the ASUS Zenfone 2 or phone from Huawei.  I have not had any experience with the idol 3. Zenfone 2, or any Hauwei.  There many other options out there but not many new phones with 4G LTE phone around $150.  There is not really any competition for a LTE smartphone at the $100 introductory price.As I mentioned above, I have tested this phone on T-Mobile and at&t networks in SoCal. T-Mobile’s 4G LTE was much faster than at&t’s Network. I tried both the phone and pta at&t APN settings.  I also added hipri to the at&t APN with little change.  Results will vary depending on where you live and the bands you connect to.  I did receive the 4G LTE logo on the phone from both networks.Overall the phone is good and will work for many people but if you are app lover and or gamer you should look elsewhere because you really need a phone with more storage and RAM.  I will continue to update the review as I get more use with the phone.

Kelty has been in the outdoor equipment business for many years and their products are top notch.  This backpack is no different with its polyester construction.  You can use a hydration pack but there is also a mesh bottle holder on the bottom belt.I have not been on a weekend excursion as of yet with the backpack but I did go on hike with it.  I loaded pack with about 30lbs of equipment, not much by any standard but a good place to start.  Before I started the hike I took the time to properly fit the backpack on me.  The quick pull system made this process easyI hiked for about two hours. I did not experience any pain in my back or shoulders.  The support system in the backpack held strong. I did not have to do any re-adjusting from my original adjustmentI am looking forward to getting more usage with the backpack.  I have no cons at this point.  The 50L may not be enough for a longer trip.I would recommend this Backpack

It is definitely not the right time of the year to test the full potential of the sleeping bag, I have no doubt the bag will keep you warm in cold temperatures.  While I have not gone backpacking yet since receiving the sleeping, I did give it a try for one night.  Within 10 minutes I was unzipping the side to allow some air in.  The sleeping bag warmed up quickly.  I am looking forward to using the sleeping bag during the winter.The construction of the sleeping bag is good. The stitching and the fill is even dispersed throughout the bag. The bag is lightweight and easy to roll up but there is some struggle to put it back into the bag the sleeping bags come with. There is not much wiggle room once you are in the bag, which may be an issue for some people.If you are trying to decide between the regular or the long, this is my opinion.  If you are in the 5’10” to 6’ range I would recommend going with the long. It is a tight fit and you would be better off with the extra length.I would recommend this sleeping bag to friends and family.

The portable WD 2TB provides plenty of storage in a small form factor with ability to lock the drive with a password.With the drive being 2TB, the thickness is more than a slim 500GB drive but this will not be an issue for most people.  I had no problem powering the drive from one USB port.  If you have a really old laptop there is the possibility of the drive not powering on.  If your laptop has USB 3.0 there should not be a concern.  The drive is backwards compatible with USB 2.0.With the initial tests on transfer speed I was averaging 45MBs.  This is not as fast as my other WD 1TB portable drive, which I average 50MBs.  The drive is still fast.The backup software works but I prefer Macrium over the WD Backup.  It does a good job automatically locating file types for backup.  There is also “a” cloud backup option, which is dropbox. I am hoping WD changes this to include some of the other big players in the market.  (Microsoft OneDrive, Google Drive, and Amazon Cloud).  Dropbox is too cost prohibitive.With the WD security you can setup a password to lock the drive.  You can have up to 25 character password.  The one negative I have is, I could not paste the password into the fields when setting up the security.  It is not fun having to type a 25 character password that I generated from my password safe.  I reached out support on the paste issue.  I did receive a response fairly quickly but there is no solution.  They did ask me to sign-up for their community and idea labI have not had the drive long enough to make a comment on reliabilityOverall this a good drive and I would recommend this product.  If anything changes as I get more usage, I will update my review to reflect the changes

Considering the price point the pendant necklace is good.  Though I do believe the list price is unrealistic.The chain is very thin but it is stamped with 925.  I do have some concerns that chain will break easy but should hold up under normal usage.  Definitely do not want your kids pulling on it.  The clasp is small but I had no issue opening and closing it.The Blue Topaz stone shines while the created sapphires give the pendant a diamond look but are small.Overall I do believe it is a good value

With a vote looming in California and with multiple cities already banning plastic bags, there is a need to have an alternative unless you want to pay 10 cents per paper bag.The canvas bags are fairly heavy duty and can hold a good amount of weight.  The only issue I have is they are narrow so the bags do not have a wide base.  Nothing fancy with the plain color ones.Couple other options;Many grocery stores sell reusable bags for a $1 to $1.5.  They are not nearly as strong but you can buy a larger amount to distribute the weight. Depending on the material they may not be washableA big membership warehouse has their branded canvas  They are bigger and cheaper.Overall the bags are good but if you are looking to replace plastic bags consider larger bags.

My other food processor is Kitchenaid 5 Cup, which complete looks tiny now. The 5 cup is 15 years old now so it has held up overtime. This 14 cup is massive and is impressive in performance as it is in size.  Hopefully it lasts as long. Upon opening the box, I quickly realized how things have changed.  The food processor comes with a storage bin for all the blades, which was not the case with my old one.  I have the food processor for about a month now and have used it a few times.  So far I have only used the dicing and slicing blades.I immediately broke out of the dicing kit to give it a try. Dicing potatoes for breakfast potatoes and Potatoes O'Brien was a breeze.  The dice size is excellent for them.  I also made Pico De Gallo.  While the Pico De Gallo look and tasted good, the dice size is too big for traditional for Pico De Gallo.  I looked through Kitchenaids website for a possible smaller dicing grate that could be swapped with the one that came with it.  Unfortunately, I did not see one at first glance.The other blade I used was the slicing,  The thickness of the slice can be adjusted quickly.  Slicing through cucumbers and potatoes was a breezeFor the most part clean was not difficult. However, when dicing tomatoes and onions there is fair amount that get wedge into the top of the lid.  I found using the handle of a spoon or fork get the tomatoes and onions out easily.Overall is this a fantastic food processor and would have no problem recommending it to friends and family.  I am not able to comment on the durability because I have only had it for a month but if holds up like my 15 year old 5 cup then I would be happy.  As I get more use I will update my review if my opinion changes,

Having put this shredder to good use within in a month I am on the fence for recommending it. I already have a 20 sheet shredder, which I have owned for around 4 years and has been a great shredder.  So I had expected another great shredder considering the price point.The only way I see this shredder shredding 200 sheets of paper without problems is if you take them out of a ream of paper. This shredder has issues with paper that is not close to perfect.  I never used more than 40 sheets of paper.  There was only one time where I did not have to open that lid and re-seat the paper.  I have not come close to running it for 12 minutes.Another I issue I have is I believe Fellow completely shortcut the paper bin.  They used corrugated plastic instead of plastic like in my other Fellowes shredder.  I do not see this holding up over time.  If this bin does not hold over a couple of years than I may raise my rating from 3 to 4 stars.A major plus, this shredder is much quieter than my other Fellowes shredder.As I mentioned in the beginning, I am on the fence for a recommendation. The shredder works but I would have expected better results based on the price point

I am very impressed with this impact driver after using the Bosch Impact driver for almost a month. This is a good choice for anyone who is looking to make an investment in cordless tools.  You are less likely if you have already invested in another brand but the Bosch hybrid Impact driver would be a great addition to your investmentI already have big investment in Dewalt 20v Max cordless tools.  I will not start making a any large investment in Bosch simply because of all the Dewalt batteries and tools I have.  I will pickup an additional battery because current I do have any Dewalt tools with the 1/2 socket.Comparing this to my Dewalt Impact Driver.Size: The Bosch is only slightly bigger and heavierDriving Power:  The Bosch has more torque than my Dewalt but I do not notice any difference.  Both drive with ease.Battery life:  Both batteries hold their charge and can weeks with light usage.  I did not try run the battery down to see how long the induced battery lasts.  I would always recommend having at least two batteries when you are work with the tools all day.Items that my Dewalt does not have:Wireless Charging:  While it does take longer to charge the battery vs my Dewalt charger. The convenience of placing the driver on top of the charger is good.  However; I will say you are most likely to take the battery off so you can continue to use the driver.  So the gain in the time will be minimal and charge time is longer but not by much.If other manufactures begin making wireless charge tools, it would be nice of the charge stations would be interchangeable. I know the batteries will not be.Socket Driver:  Having the a socket driver built in is nice.  I will have to buy a separate tool for this.  Having the hybrid does increase the cost of the tool; however, I would say this justified because you normally have to buy two tools.  The socket driver works well, you will not be taking the tires off your car but it does an excellent job in many applicationsAt this point I have nothing negative to say about the Bosch.  This could change as I get more usage.  I will update my review in that case.

This a big step up from my current set of steak knives from Ginsu, The Ginsu are good set but do not have the quality feel of these Lenox.  They are heavy weight forged steel and cut through steak, pork, and chicken with no effort at. Clean up was easy with soap and water. I plan you keep them out of the dishwasher. I have had these knives for about month now, so I can speak on well the hold up the test of time.  I do believe they will last; however, if I do have problems I will update my review based on how well they honor the warrantyThe gift box is a nice touch but it is not something to get excited about. I would have liked to see the knives in a wooden box.I would definitely recommend these knives to friends and family

We currently have Remington 1” flat iron, which does not get as hot and does not vibrate like the Infiniti pro.  There is no difference in the results. Both do a good job straightening curly hair.  My wife’s hair dresser swears by the vibration but we saw better results with the vibration off. To be fair the hair dresser does use a different flat iron where the vibration is much more pronounced. With the Infiniti Pro the vibration is minimal.The Infiniti Pro is good flat iron and I would recommend it because does keep the hair straight.

Big price tag but with the picture that it produces the cost is justified. This Epson Cinema projector is big and puts out a fair amount of heat.  The heat should not be an issue unless unless are encasing the projector.My previous experience with a cinema projector did not have a good level of black; however, the gray did bother me.  This is no longer an issue with the 5025UB.  The picture is fantastic and blacks are black.  Currently I have 100" screen but plan to upgrade to 120" soon.  The lens shift help square up the picture with the screen The color balance is excellent. The colors are on par with our 46" LG LED TV in our bedroom.The 2200 lumens does allow for the picture show through even when there is a fair amount light in the room. Obviously it is not ideal and one should try to eliminate light to see the quality of pictures it produces.You can hook up your sound / HDMI connections through any receiver that has the HDMI support.I did not try 3D, 3D has never been a selling point for me. Not a fan of wearing glassesI would not hesitate recommending this to friends and family.

This fan does a great job circulating air around the room but I would recommend going with a bigger fan if you are looking for a fan for a larger room.  Having the inner plastic piece really pushes the air in multiple directions While Keystone does not provide the best instructions, the fan is easy assemble. The remote was not too difficult to open even though no instructions are include.  You can see that you need to push the tab in and pull the battery cover I do like how the height adjustment works but it does lower too easy with very little pressure.  With the price point one would expect a little better build quality.  I have 18" Holmes fan that is built better and is lower in cost.  I have not owned the fan long enough to comment on if it will hold up to the test of time.One item I do not care for is having the buttons on the base, sure you can use the remote but I would rather have the buttons on the riserI rated the fan 3 stars because I believe it is an average fan.

One recommendation for the seller. Please include the instructions for the pump.  While one can look online for instructions, they should be included with the pump.  It is fairly easy to figure out how to reverse the stem.I have used this pump on both types of valve stems.  I deflated the tires all the way so I could determine how quickly I can fill the tires.  Filling up the tire on my road bike with the Presta valve was quick and easy.  The mountain bike tire with the Schrader was not as easy.  I had to push the tire so the stem would stay up as I attached the pump. Once attached the filling process did not take too long but you do get a better workout in.The pump comes with an attachment and screws to attach the pump to the bike.  Not sure if the attachment will hold the pump in place, if the pump is accidentally hit.  While it does grip the pump well, it does pop out fairly easily.  Thy did include velcro to giving it better holding power.  I mam using the velcro and plan to continue to use it.The build quality is good. my only concern is the lock lever feels a little loose.If you are looking for a low cost pump that handles both Presta and Schrader the BV pump will fulfill the requirement

The reacher is lightweight and easy to use.  Our 5 year old no problem closing the gripper with one hand.  It does an excellent job picking up small items.  The grippers do become slightly misaligned when picking up itemd but it does not lose grip.  I had no problem grabbing items the were 2 to 3 lbs and above head.  One should not have any issue grabbing items that are heavier as long as you can control item once you have it locked in the gripper.My only concern is if it will up over time.  The plastic pieces where the claw  connects does not feel durable.  I have not owned the reacher long enough but if it holds up well in coming months I will rate the product a 5 star

Daughter wanted to play this.  Find out there is no solitaire or kid mode.  Bad business practice to not have an age setting  Wants too much access to device and requires an email to start the game.  Has a built in chat function, which opens the door to predators.  Look elsewhere for a trivia game.  I do not recommend this app

I have used this speaker for about 1 month.  The sound is definitely better than the sound from laptop or phone. The sound is not full range. You mostly get mids and some highs. I also have a JBL clip and the sound from the clip is better than this speaker.  The design of the Orei is definitely better. The footprint is small and it has a rubber bottom to keep locked in place.The NFC connection failed to work for me.  I put my phone on the speaker, the connection was attempted on my S4 but it failed to establish. Tried multiple time without success  The bluetooth scan and pair worked without issue.The other concern I have is the support of the product.  If you go to OREI's website there is not much in the way of support information of this product.  I was looking for any possible issues with the NFC.  Keep this mind if you are looking for a portable speaker.  You may want to consider going with an established company.

If you are already a user of Wemo devices then understand how the devices work and the ease to plug them in and get them working quickly. The Wemo Make is different.  While the Maker opens up many possibilities in automating devices, there is a learning curve.  There is a Wemo community website that is a good resource.  There is also a site for recipes.  I have had some struggles with the MakerThe application I am still working on is controlling the sprinkler system through the app. I have not completed it as of yet. As I mentioned there is a learning curve. I also plan on using it for Christmas lights.  I plan to add pixels to my light setup next Christmas.The Wemo maker is really for the person who likes to develop.  If you like Rasberry Pi and Arduino then you will enjoy the Maker. The Maker will only get better as more applications appear in the community and Belkin brings updates to the Maker.If you are person that wants a device that just plugs and works then I would recommend looking at other Belkin devices.

I have had this set for a little less than a month now.  While I have not cooked with all the pots and pans, I have gotten fair amount of usage.I the first item I noticed, when removing the pots and pans from the box was the weight of each one.  The handles have a excellent finish.The initial impression was there is quality built into them.  There is a big difference in a cheap set of pots and pans vs one that has a quality buildOnce I started using them my impression did not change.  For informational purposes, I have a gas stove. I have made multiple meals that either required boiling water, frying in the pan, or simmering.  The heat balance across the pots and pans is excellent.Cooking is easy with the pots and pans having the non-stick finish.  In order to test the non-stick surface, I made some over easy eggs.  I used the small sauce so I could leverage the higher walls to flip the eggs.  The test was successful.  The eggs flipped with easy and yolks stayed together.I have not tried cooking with them in the oven.  If I do, I will update this review.  Additionally, I cannot speak on well they hold over the test of time.  As I use them more, I will update my review if my impression changes.I would recommend this set to friends and family.

I have had this LED light for a couple of weeks now.  While it is brighter than the 60 watt equivalent LED it is only brighter by a small margin. The spread is bigger but I would have expected more with a lumen rating double of the 60 watt.  My 3 star rating is because I see this as an average LED bulb and not outstanding.  Definitely considering the upcost between a 60 watt and 100 watt.I replaced all my lights in my house with LEDs in the past 18 months.  90% are Cree but I have couple of GE and Couple other brands.  In my opinion the Cree perform much better than GE.I cannot judge the life of the bulbs because I have not had any failures unlike the CFLs that I replaced.While LEDs are more expensive than CFLs, they are definitely worth it because they provide better light, do not contain mercury, and the life expectancy is better

Good laminator, quick heat up time.  Good for home office use. The pouches provide a smooth finish to your flyers, membership cards.Can get expensive purchasing the Fellowes laminating pouches.Does take up a fair amount of desk space. The auto shut off feature is niceI have the laminator for about a month, so I can comment on how well the Neptune 3 will hold up over time.  However, it is well built and I do believe you should get years of use,  I will update my review if anything changes.

This is an impressive laminator.  I have only used low end laminators in the past. The Venus 2 is impressive. The heat up time is fast.  While I have only laminated a few items at this point, I can say that the seal created by the laminator  is smooth.  The laminator auto detects the thickness of the laminating job.The only negative comment I have is you need a fair amount of space because of the size.This laminator is perfect for a small business office or small home office. Not everyone will need all the features of the Venus 2 and should be able to get by with some lower end models

I hate ads so I bought the paid version for my daughter.  The "Pro" version still advertises other games.  The biggest issue is the free version has many pencils / drawing methods to choose from.  The paid version does not.  Completely disappointing and a waste of $0.99. Oh well..Do not buy... Just live with the ads in the free version even if they are annoying.

This set wood good for anyone who is starting out with drawing a needs a range of soft to hard.  Personally I would suggest buying a bigger set if you enjoy drawing. The six pencils only gives you a couple of pencils in each part of the scale. The build quality is great.  The wood is solid. I also own a set of Derwent and between the two Tombow's build quality is better. The Tombow's are also a bit smoother.The eraser is great for erasing small details but you will need to invest in a larger eraser for erasing a large area.I would recommend these pencils to friends and family

This good sketch. Normally I buy Strathmore Sketch paper when it is on sale at a large craft store. Strathmore is 50lbs.  This sketch is heavier. Even though it does not state the weight, I would put it  around 60lbs.  The paper tears out with little effort. Mead did a great job on the perforated edges.  My only complaint is with me being left handed the wirebound gets in my way.I would recommend this paper to family and friends; however, I will continue to purchase Strathmore.

I have had multiple Belkin cases over the years. Some are great and some are "functional".  I  have already switched back to my Pellem. The build quality of the case is good.  The multiple position stand is great for having your tablet at different angles.  The reason for three stars is the case adds large amount of extra bulk versus the Pellem that I am using now.  Additionally, Belkin to not include a magnet to auto turn the screen off and on.  Sure your tablet screen times out and goes into a idle state but having the magnet makes it that much quicker.If you are looking for a case that is a good stand and do not mind the extra bulk then this case will fill your need.  I would recommend  looking at all other cases available for the Tab Pro 8.4 that may also fill your need at a lower cost

I have transitioned over the years as Gillette has improved their technology.  I have tried electric razors but they just cannot cut close enough. I had been using the Proglide Fusion Power before I had the opportunity to try this razor.  I noticed right away that the shave was smoother then the previous generation.  Not sure if the Flexball helps or not but blades are real thin and flex easily. Of the course the downside is the price of the blades.  I still fall back to my Mach 3 from time to time.  I usually wait when a good deal with coupons for Proglides.If your are a Gillette user I would recommend moving up to the latest razor technology

My house is full of craft stuff. My wife has multiple paper cutting machines from different vendors. She makes our cards for holidays and birthdays.  These scallop rounds allow you to quickly print out some words and add to the design of homemade cards.  I recommend going to font websites and download typewriter and stamp fonts they look great on the labels.  You can also just write on them if you want.I definitely recommend these labels to card makers

This is one heavy duty set.  It is replacing by Kitchedaid set that I have for more 15 years. (It served me well)  After cooking with these for a little more than a month I wonder why I never upgraded my starter set. I would expect this set to last me a long time.  It does come with a "limited" lifetime warranty.  No sure if Anolon is know for being good with their warrantiesI have gas stove and the distribution on these pots and pans is fantastic.  They heat up quickly.I have not had any problems with food sticking.  I am use to cooking with Stainless steel because the Kitchedaid were stainless steel. They clean up easily.The one thing I have to get use to is because it is all stainless the handle get hot.If you are looking for a heavy duty cookware set you should consider this set.  You may also want to check out the set at local department stores.I

We normally get our 3" binders from C ostco. Those are definitely more heavy duty.  I guess if they describing the rings inside then I guess it could be heavy duty.  The binder is being used to store rubber stamps for crafts.  Turn the pages is good as long as you are only turning a few at time.  It is undetermined if the outside will hold up over time.  The binder works for what we are using it for and if the binder fails in the coming months I will update my review accordinglyAs of now I would give my recommendation

I have had the switch running for a couple of weeks now in my home network.  My first impression has been good.I have the switch connected to one of the gigabit ports on my router.  Currently I have my media server and 5 other devices connected to the switch. My transfer speeds are ~50MB/s between my computer and media server and also to my NAS on the same switchThe switch is slightly warm but not hot. Nothing that alarms me or is of any concern.I have no complaints at this point, it does exactly what I expect. I would not use this at a business until I have used the swtich long enough to know what the reliability of the switch is.I will update my review if anything changes as I use the switch longer.

The storage drive with multiple functions market is becoming crowded and dependind on what are you trying to achieve this seagate may fill your need. I have had the drive for a couple of weeks now and this review based on my initial impression of this drive.  My first impression has not been goodSetup was easy. Power it on and plug into a port on the back of my router. Browse to the drive and go through the configuration, which allows you to setup your remote account for using the drive in the cloud.  The drive does not plug into your computer.The drive has a built in DLNA media server that scans the public folders on the drive looking for any media. I was able connect and stream a movie to my TV that is compliant with DLNA.  The movie was a DVD rip and there was no stuttering within my network. I did not test any further because I use Plex Media Server for streaming including streaming to my devices when they are outside of my network.Using the drive as a NAS works ok when connected to the gigabit switch.  I can get transfer speeds around 40MB/s.  When using the wifi the speeds are not too good. Averaging around 3.5MB/s in Wireless N network. (My router is a Netgear 4720)  I would have expected speeds in the 6MB/s range.As cloud storage it just did not work for me.  After the initial setup it worked for about an hour after that it stopped and never worked again for me.  I did a factory reset and when through the setup again but it still did not work.  My router fully supports UPNP and I use for Plex streaming. I eventually gave trying to get to work after a day. I have no issue with my Netgear ReadyCloud so I will stay with that.If you are in the market for a storage device that has DLNA and Cloud capabilities, I would not recommend this drive.  Maybe it is a software issue that can bee fixed by Seagate.  If anything change I will update my review.

I have had the Innova 3130c for a couple weeks now. Right out the box the scanner is easy to use and easy to read.  It comes with a nice carrying case and a quick start guide.  You will need to download the full guide because quick start guide does what states "Gets you started with the scanner. The connector cord is long, which is a plus not having to stay close to the port. The scanner also has ABS, I see other reviewers posting about a fee for ABS.  I am not sure where they are being charged but I contacted Innova for clarification.  I was told there is no additional fee.  However, the scanner does not do airbags.I am not having any major issues with my car, so I cannot determine how well it works on major diagnostics or whether FixAssist works,  When doing the scanning while my car was running it did register some battery errors.As I get more usage from the scanner I will update my review.  I am looking  forward with having more time with the scanner, hopefully not because my car is having issues.5 stars until I am able to use the scanner more.

Excellent SSD drive with high read and write capacity.  Corsair / Micron have brought the market a good competitor to the Samsung 840.  It does not compete with the 840 pro line.  This is Multi-Layer Cell SSD, which should give you many years as a typical computer user.  One item to be aware of is that this SDD has a 3000 program erase cycles due to the smaller die.  The typical MLC ssd has 10000 program erase cycles.  At point it is hard to know the expected life of the drive but you would need to be doing a large amount of data cycles per day to impact the life of the drive.  There is a 3 year warranty so I would not hesitate buying this drive because of the great performance.I have had this drive in my laptop for three weeks.  I noticed a big performance boost with my Adobe Photoshop when working with larger files.  There was not much of a boost in battery life.  The i7 CPU and the 1080 screen kill the battery, so I am plugged in 90% of the time.  If you plan to replace your main system drive with this SSD, I would recommend using Macrium Reflect Free for cloning your drive.  The software is easy to use,This is my 4th SSD drive.  I have 2 - 128GB (Corsair / Kingston), 1 - 240GB (SanDisk),  I have been happy with all of them except Kingston.  It died in less than 3 months.  Once you make the change to SSD you will never want to go back other than for storage or where perfornace is not requred,I added an image from a read / write performance test that I ran.  Keep in mind if you have an older sata controller you will have the same performance results. If you are on the fence on whether to get this drive or the Samsung, I would say it comes down to cost.  Both Samsung and Corsair are top tier flash storage makers.I will update this review if anything changes as I get more usage,5 Stars / Recommended

I have had the binding machine for couple of weeks now.  There are two important pieces of advice I would give to anyone new to a comb binding machine. First practice, practice, practice.  It is important to get have paper consistently  lined up as you punch groups of paper. If you are off by a little the edge of the paper will be too then and the paper will ripe out easily.  The second piece of advice do not bother with the book that comes in the box.  Go YouTube and watch the many videos on the product because is not very helpful.Once you have the hang of it you should enjoy it. One of the first books I created was the various drawings that our daughters have done over the years. I was punching 10 sheets at time to ensure I keep the pieces lined up.There is a tray to keep your extra combs in and it also as a guide to measure the thickness of your book to bound so you know the size of the comb to use.  Additionally, you need to keep the paper tray clean so the punch part continues to work well.I would recommend this product to friends and family. As I get more use with the product I will update my review and adjust the rating if need be.4 Stars Rating (-1 for poor documentation)

My review based on using the Seagate Wireless Plus for a couple now.  I use it for videos and files storage for now. Having used and returning the GoFlex Satellite in the past, I can safely say Seagate has learned from their mistakes with that product.  Additionally, the overall look of the wireless plus is betterI have also used the Corsair Voyager Air and I would recommend the Seagate over the Corsair.  Corsair still has comes kinks to work out.Overview:No need to really go through what is in the box you can read that in the description.Transferring of video and larger  files via USB 3.0 is fast.  If you do not have any USB 3.0 ports the drive still works but the transfer is much slower.Seagate Wireless Plus has a DLNA server builtin so you can easily stream to your DLNA devices.Unlike the Corsair, Seagate does not have gigabit LAN port to this drive so it cannot be used as a standalone NAS.  I would assume most people looking to buy a Wifi hard drive are more interested in the streaming aspects of the drive.Seagate has a 10 hour battery life claim. I have not been on a long enough trip to prove otherwise.  I wish Seagate had added a battery life indicator with % left on the drive itself.  The Seagate Media App does provide a battery indicator with the app itself, which is great unless you are using a Windows laptop or tablet.Streaming:For my streaming test I used 4 different tablets.  1 - iPad, 1 - Windows 8 Pro tablet, and 1 - Android Tablets (10")Connecting the WiFi. After turning on the drive and wifi all tablets found the network and I was able to connect to the driveSeagate provides an app for IOS and Android but not Windows 8.  You just map a drive to the drive in Windows.The APP has a good interface with thumbnail previews. Having the thumbnails are great when you have younger kids who do not read yet, he or she can start the movie based on the image.  However; this is the little annoynance, you have to put an image in the folder of the movies and most of the text within the file name has to match the name of file.  Seems easy enough but it also has to be large enough of a file or the drive completely ignores the image.  Then you add the fact if you have a large amount of video files that the time to do this for every video file adds up. Maybe Seagate can add the ability to do a media lookup to something like freebase when the drive is connected to the computer.You need to use Seagate's media app to change SSID and password of wifi network.  I high recommend you do both.I started the stream on all 3 tablets.The stream  worked well on all devices without dropping.  The Corsair would work for about 20 minutes then to drop all the devices and happened multiple times.While I do not know product roadmap, one can assume Corsair will address any bugs that are discovered with a software update.I would recommend Seagate Wireless Plus to family and friendsI rate the device 4 1/2 stars.  I will update review and ratings if anything changes with this drive.

My review based on using the Corsair Voyager Air for a few weeks now.  I use it for videos and files storage for now. My one line thought is, The product has the potential to be great but unfortunately Corsair may have brought it to the market before it was ready to be released.That being said the product is still good but if you are looking to buy now with a product that just works then consider the Seagate wireless plus drive.  If you are no rush and you can take a wait see approach with what Corsair will do with software update then maybe take a chance with this drive.Overview:No need to really go through what is in the box you can read that in the description.  The setup is straight forward; however, my newer Dell laptop would not recognize the drive without restarting.  Plugging the drive into your computer also charges the drive.Transferring of video and larger  files via USB 3.0 is fast.  If you do not have any USB 3.0 ports the drive still works but the transfer is much slower.Corsair added a gigabit LAN port to this drive so be added to your network as a NAS.  Seagate wireless plus does not have this option.  This option is not a selling point for me because the streaming feature is what I use the drive for.The drive does not have a DLNA server builtin like the Seagate Wireless PlusStreaming:For my streaming test I used 4 different tablets.  1 - iPad, 1 - Windows 8 Pro tablet, and 2 - Android Tablets (7" and 10")Connecting the WiFi. After turning on the drive and wifi all tablets found the network.  Unfortunately, none of the tablets would browse the drive after connecting to the network.  I had to turn each device off and back on before I could browse the drivesCorsair provides an app for IOS and Android but not Windows 8.  You just map a drive to the Voyager air in Windows.The APP is a basic file browser and very intuitive at all but gets the job done. If you have younger kids who do not read yet  who will select the movies for them.  Have thumbnail images for younger children would be great if Corsair decides to add that in an update.  The APP kept crashing on the 7" Dell Streak, so I could not test it on there.You also need to use the app to set the wireless password for the deviceI started the stream on all 3 tablets.  The devices were all within 5 feet.  I tested around 20 feet within the same room and the stream still worked.The stream was going well for about 20 minutes until the voyager decided to drop all the devices.  Even though the blue wifi signal on the drive still showed blue none of the tablets saw the network.  I turned off the wifi and back on but the network still did not show up.  The drive was fully charged so I shut it off for 10 minutes and then back on and I was able to see the network again.  The movie starts over and not from where you left off.  After about 20 minutes the same problem occurred.  It is possible the drive is not handling multiple streams very well.  I have not yet tried streaming with only one device because my Seagate Wireless Plus work fine with multiple streams.  As a note I put all my videos in iPADs M4V format because it supported by most players and it keeps the iPAD happyWhile I do not know product roadmap, one can assume Corsair will address any bugs that are discovered with a software update.I would not recommend this over the Seagate Wireless Plus. As mentioned before if the NAS is a must then the Seagate will not work with being connect to a computer to share the storage.I rate the device 2 1/2 stars.  I wish I could give 2 1/2 instead of 2 or 3. I will update my review and ratings if anything changes with this drive.

Being able to move away from using the computer for the Skype to the TV is a great upgrade.  Sure the price tag to do this is steep to buy a niche product.Please ensure you have an open HDMI port for this or invest in a HDMI switch.  Between gaming consoles, media players, cable boxes, and bluray players HDMI are filled quicklyThe setup is straight forward, put the camera on top of your tv with the include holder, plug in the power, and the HDMI port.  You can use the LAN or Wifi Connection for the network.All the configuration is done with the included remote. Once logged into your Skype account, you select the person you wish to have a video call with and start the call.  Unfortunately, you can not do a group video only voice. Hopefully Logitech can make it possible in the future with a software update.  Additionally, there is no screen share or IM, which is understandable with the product being made for a TV.The video quality is surprisingly good for the TV, there is some pixelation in the video. My family is able to sit on our couch that is out 10 feet away from the camera and our parents are able to clearly see all of us at once. I have encountered some drops in the video but that could be a network issue on my parent side.  I would assume if your internet speeds are not very good you may experience issues with video performance.  The microphone does a good job picking up our voices as we talk.  I have not experienced any echo effect,  which suggests he noise cancellation that is built-in worksWith Skype being the largest consumer video call/chat I understand why Logitech targeted only Skype with the camera.  However, I wish it also supported Google.  This would cover all my video call needs.We enjoy the product and would recommend it to friends and family because you un-tether yourself from the computer.  I would give it 5 stars if we could do group video calls.

Brief BackgroundPhotography is a hobby for me; however, taking  great photos is important to me. Having the right gear is a must for creating great photosI have had various cameras over the years.  My last 4 have all been Digital SLRs.  My current camera is Canon 5D MKIII.The Fuji HS50 sits between a standard point and shoot and a digital SLR. The camera has an equivalent 24-1000mm zoom(42x) and includes image stabilization. The 16MP Sensor.  The sensor is 1/2 size, allows Fuji to reach the  long range of the lens. The f stop range is 2.8 to 5.6. The camera has a built-in flash.  The camera can do 11fps when shooting in jpeg mode. There is a microphone socket so you can add an external mic for video.I have used the camera for a month so my review is based on my initial impressions.  As I have more usage, I will update by review from time to time.Indoors:The first thing I noticed with my first couple of shots indoors was how fast the camera focused and the speed of the shutter.  I was shooting at 24mm and 800ISO with no flash during the mid afternoon. The quality of the photo were good. The noise on the images was not overwhelming, which will allow for larger prints.  Once I started using the longer range on the lens the photos started to getting to soft. The colors were no longer popping. Still acceptable for 8x10 prints.  When using the flash indoors I had to dial it down a little because they pictures were a little blown out. The flash did restore some quality to photo. The camera is above average indoors as long as you have enough light.  I did test the camera at 1000X indoors and there was some bokeh within the pictures. Not a large amount but that is expected at 5.6. At 1600 iso there is too much noise on the photos, you will need to cleanup the photo if you plan to use 1600 unless noise does not bother you.Outdoors:Being able to lower the ISO really helps the camera excel.  I was impressed by the  zoom.  While does take a little longer to focus at 1000mm, I was amazed by going from wide to zoomed.  The photos do suffer at the 1000mm but there are usable to print.  I will post some samples of wide to zoom.  As I have already mentioned the camera is fast so you will be able to capture the kids running around without motion blur.  I also used the camera to take macro photo of flowers and a lizard that happen to walk by.  The photos turned out well but you get much better images with the SLR and Macro Lens.Other features I have not tried yet is the panoramic mode and taking video. You can do a 360 panoramic.  I will update my review once I had the opportunity to try the features.I would definitely recommend this camera to friends and family.

Not sure why Kingston did not add a USB 3.0 port when they added the 128GB to Wi-Drive family.  They also used the older mini usb instead of the micro usb. Seems like the engineers did nothing to improve the Wi-Drive other adding more storage. That being said the drive does do a good adding extra storage to my tablet via wifi.Because the drive is small they had to make the internal battery small, which I get around 3 1/2 hours battery life.Personally I would recommend looking at the Seagate Wireless Plus or the corsair voyager if you do not mind the larger size.  The battery life is better and you get more storage.Where Kingston shines is when you are traveling for business and you need the extra storage in your meetings but do not want the larger footprint.  With Apple keeping the iPad lockdown and not adding a microsd slot, it is nice to be able to store additional videos on the Wi-Drive.The videos play smoothly on the IPad.  The kids have a better selection of movies on road trips now.While I recommend the Wi-Drive, I would looking at the Seagate or Corsair first.

This shower handle is pretty helpful. Its fairly easy to install, it'll stick to any flat and smooth surface. You can attach it to the wall of your shower or to the edge of you tub. It attaches to surfaces using suction cups, and tells you if you attached them correctly thanks to two small indicators. The indicators turn from red to blue when the suction cups have been firmly attached, once they're attached you'll have to lock it by using the blue switches on each cup. The handle has some kind of spring mechanism built in that keeps the suction cups from losing their suction. however I recommend that you reattach the handle from time to time just to make sure it still has it's grip. The handle has either a silicone or a rubber grip on it to prevent your hand from slipping off when its wet or soapy. When attaching the handle I recommend to not place the suction cup over the grout lines between tiles (If you have them) as this will weaken the suction cups strength or make it so they can't attach at all. The handle is pretty strong, it can hold quite a bit of weight. You can hang items off of it like wash cloths or shower caddies. Overall this is a great product for showers and is helpful for keeping your balance while washing your feet or getting in/out of your tub/shower.Free product  in exchange of an unbiased honest review.

Unfortunately, I can't just throw out my mail or my paperwork with ID theft so rampant. I really like that this unit is compactand sleek looking. I have shredded single papers at a time as well as 8 and it shreds completely. I have also shredded credit cards which was a priority for me and I had no problems. I like the cross cut so no matter the size of the writing it will be unreadable after being shredded.These helps ease my mind when I need to discard my personal documents and unwanted mail.Product provided for unbiased honest review

This baking mat is perfect for me. This allows for spacing and sizing portions of cookie dough making this a great cookie baking mat.Nothing sticks and its easy to clean. Storage is simple using no space as I can roll it back up and tuck it away. I love love love this mat!!!I already bought one for a gift!Free product in exchange of an unbiased and honest review.

I have a few cutting boards that I use regularly but I was looking for something smaller and something that would not move when I use it.These Acrylic Polypropylene Plastic boards fit my needs to a tee. I usually cut fruit in the morning for a smoothie and I can use the smallest board. My daughter can also use this as I know it won't slide and it will be easier for her to use. These lie flat on my countertop and they wash very nicely. I think the red around the white of the board looks attractive so I can also serve celery sticks and such on them too. I like the "juice" grove so that if I move the board, water from washing fruits and vegy's don't spill on the counter. Overall with a few weeks of use there is everything to like about these cutting boards.Free item in exchange for a unbiased honest review

This headlight is awesome! It is incredibly bright for being so small. When it arrived it came in a nice little box. I quickly read the instructions to fully understand it's features and put 3 AAA batteries into it and turned it on. I was surprised at how bright it was! The light goes really far, and even further if you focus it. The lamp has a few different modes which you can switch through by pressing the power button repeatedly, there is Glare Mode, which is its brightest setting. Low Mode, which is slightly dimmer than Glare Mode and Flash Mode which makes the light blink very quickly. Flash Mode would be useful if you needed to get someone's attention if you got lost while camping. All three of these modes can also be performed by the two red lights. You can turn the red lights on by holding the power button down for a few seconds; switching between modes the same way as the white light. The red lights are very dim compared to the white light and they don't go as far so I don't see much use for them. The white light can also be focused, this concentrates the spotlight into a smaller size but makes it brighter. The lamp is water proof, it can operate in the rain but the instructions say not to submerge it in water. The headlight is quite comfortable to wear and the band is adjustable. The lamp is also pretty durable, it can be dropped from a short distance and still function normally. Overall I think this lamp would be great for emergencies working in ill lighted places like under the sink and if you like to go camping and spelunking.

This oil diffuser works great. It's fairly simple to use, just plug it into a wall outlet and insert the power cord into the back of the base, twist the diffuser onto the base, add water and oil and it's ready to go! The diffuser's light turns on when it is working, the light changes color which is kind of cool. If you want to turn the diffuser off, you can unplug it from the wall or twist it off of the base. I used a few different kinds of diffuser oil with this product and I found that depending on thickness of the oil or how much you put in, you'll need to add more water accordingly. I found that using a 1/2 a teaspoon (2.5 mL) of oil and 1 cup (240 mL) of water seems to work best for most oils. But you're free to experiment a little with the measurements as you may want the odor of the oil to be more potent or less potent, depending on your preference. I also found that mixing the oil and water before adding it to the diffuser allows it to create more mist. I think it's best to put the oil and water in a bottle or jar and shake it to mix it. Mixing the oil and water together breaks the oil into small droplets which are more easily turned into mist. The diffuser creates quite a lot of mist, however, most of the mist seems to pool up inside the diffuser, despite this it's able to fill a small room with fragrance in a few minutes, especially if a fan is present and on. It's also very quiet. If left to unused for awhile the oil may separate from the water and either sit on the surface or the bottom. Some oils with dyes or color in them may stain the inside of the diffuser, I haven't tried to remove the stains from my diffuser so I don't know if they're permanent or not. The diffuser will turn itself off if the water level gets to low, but this hasn't happened often for me as it takes a long time for all of the water and oil to be used and I often refill it before it gets too low. If it's not turning on when you want it to then try adding more water and oil. Make sure not to overfill the diffuser as it won't be able to produce mist. If the diffuser is used for a long period of time it may get hot, I recommend only turning it on for 3.5 hours or less.

While reading this I was pretty frustrated and kinda mad with the ending. I could not make myself like the main character, Estelle.Her husband Jack and father of Mia, from what was revealed wasn't much and not likeable. Getting to know Estelle was exhausting; from her emotional turmoils and self revelations, for me it wasn't intriguing reading, it was annoying. There was some plot holes here and I guess they don't matter because it would have just been more exasperating to read. I did appreciate the different take on premise of the plot and the complexity of the storyline, however, my dislike for the character overshadowed that.The ending here,literally the last page, validated how I fell all along and overall why I didn't like Estelle.

This is the first book by Wendy Corsi Staub. I have always wanted to read a book by her and I was glad that this bookwas available from Vine. Blood Red is the first of a trilogy with the setting of Mundy's Landing, which is a character on its own. Mundy'sLanding has an interesting history behind it which makes for a great backdrop. The writing here is so good too, like a comfort read; great setting, good characters,  and a good mystery to be resolved.The characters here are also very interesting and likeable. Although I couldn't relate to Rowan's dilemma at all,I was still reeledin by the suspenseful writing and wondering how Casey tied into the story. This had a satisfying reveal and conclusion and I am certainly interested in reading the upcoming books in the trilogy.

I like this water flosser, it works well. It's very simple to use, it has three settings, normal, soft and pulse. When I use this flosser, I tend to use the soft setting as the pulse and normal setting hurt if I accidentally shoot my gums or the inner cheek of my mouth. I found that when using this flosser, it's best to hold it a small distance away from the area you're trying to clean. Also, I recommend using this with your mouth closed as leaving it open will get water everywhere. It does a good job cleaning the plaque off my teeth however it's not too good at removing food that gets stuck between my teeth... Its battery lasts awhile on a single charge so that's good. It does run out of water quickly so you'll have to refill it at least once if you want to do a thorough cleaning. Refilling the flosser is a simple task, you can either remove the blue tank on the back of the device and fill it up or leave it attached and fill the tank by using the small white lid on the top of the flosser. It comes with two replaceable heads so you can share it with someone or keep both heads for yourself in case one gets dirty or damaged. Overall, a good product.

This started out at a great pace and the anticipation of the reveal or mystery as to why Cat/Emily left her husband was what carried me though tothe end.At some points Cat was understandable and at other times she was just off the charts. The ending and reveal did substantiate her emotionalroller coaster ride but I wish I we had gotten there a bit sooner. A major twist in the storyline added suspense and and even more intrigue so overall I was caught up in this story and I liked most of the characters, especially Angel.I will be reading more by Tina Seskis.

This is a book filled with practice problems. This will not teach you geometry.For this book to be helpful you already need to know and understand definitions, properties, and postulates."These problems provide practice with the most important geometric properties, postulates, and definitions you need in order to get started."This is what the book goes into and continues with the online access:Geometry BasicsConstructionsGeometric Proofs with TrianglesClassifying TrianglesCenters of a TriangleSimilar TrianglesThe Right TriangleTriangle InequalitiesRegular PolygonsProperties of Parallel LinesProperties of QuadrilateralsCoordinate GeometryTransformational GeometryExploring CirclesCircle TheoremsThree-Dimensional GeometryLocus ProblemsEach section will go into "Problems you will work on" and "What to Watch Out For" which are tips and things to remember before practicing that section.Then each section contains  about 8 pages or more of problems to solve. The answers are in the back of the book with a brief explanation.The online access is great as it allows you to create tests with different difficulty levels, topics and how many questions.Overall, this is an excellent way to obtain plenty of practice to sharpen your skills in Geometry.

I have been sewing off and on for years but I have always shied away from making collared shirts especially with cuffs.In this book, David Coffin provides information and patterns that I can alter and customize to whatever I need to fit and be creatively.What I particularly appreciated about this book was that there were lists with further reading and other materials to benefit my future sewing experience.I can't wait to utilize the information within this book to finally create a shirt that will work for me!

Be Safe I love You is a very well written fast paced novel. I think that Lauren is one of the most interesting and unique characters that I have read about in quite awhile. Cara Hoffman is adept at reeling you in and keeping you there; making you feel the turmoil that Lauren felt.One thing I did have trouble with was with the character of Lauren's father and being a psychologist and not realizing he had depression to the point where he didn't provide for his family? In turn causing Lauren that much more chaos, stress and responsibility at a young age which added to whatever pressures and instability she felt coming back from war.Overall though, I liked this story and I am left wanting to read Hoffman's first novel, So Much Pretty.I am definitely keeping my eye on this author.

I really liked this read for several reasons.The first of which is that the main character,Hannah, is very likeable. Not at any time did I feel the author portray her totally naive or stupid in her reactions to her daughter Dawn and their situation.The writing and pacing and reveals were so well done. The timing for how and what happened in Hanna's life was so perfect. I could see where she was coming from and really relate to her thought process and reactions.I also appreciated how the author uniquely uses the title, Lacy Eye in explaining willful blindness.

This scale very nice as its sleek looking and its very accurate in its measurements. This comes with the lithium battery which is nice soit can be used right out of the box. The auto off is a great feature as I never remember to turn it off myself.This unit is compact, thin and easy to clean and very easy to use.Free product in exchange for an UNBIASED review.

I really like this lamp. When I got the lamp I had to do some assembling, however that was a simple task. It comes with instructions to help you with assembly. I had to screw on the metal lamp shade and put the clamp together and install the light bulb that came packaged with the lamp. The lamp attaches to objects using a clamp, the clamp can attach to a flat surface that is approximately 4 centimeters in width. You can attach the clamp to both horizontal and vertical surfaces and the lamp will stay. The clamp also has a good grip, I shook a small table that the lamp was attached to to test out it's grip and the lamp didn't fall, which is good as you won't have to worry about knocking the lamp over. The lamp is somewhat flexible, you can position it almost anyway you want. You can tighten and loosen the joints. However, a gooseneck would provide even more flexibility. Overall I like this lamp, it can be used for lots of my crafting tasks.

This is a powerful steamer! I like to keep this outside my closet for quick steamingbefore wearing an item from my closet.The steam setting is adjustable with four settings. I prefer the highest setting for most of my items and this Ivation steamerreally makes those wrinkles disappear! I also used this on some of my fabric stash to get out the folded wrinkles before sewing.If you need or want those crisp edges and lines, of course you will need an iron. The steam is very hot, over 200 degrees. I steamed severalyards of fabric and I still had plenty of water in the tank for more. The best outcome in using this steamer was to make sure the garment(fabric) was hanging and to take a slow swipe down the fabric. The slower, the better the results and then I didn't have to go over the fabric again.Also, remember that the nozzle and hose needs to be going down not sideways or upside down. The steam is continuous that way. Another great feature is this only takes a few seconds (10) to start steaming, I really love that!Product provided for and UNBIASED review!

I have a trunk full of paper photos and their negatives.I have always wanted to go throught them again and convert them.So now that I have received the Jumbl22mp All in one, I have gotten started. The  process is easy and this unit comes with everything I need.I am just so excited to see my old photos digitised!Also, I am so glad  to be able to do this at home by myself. I can fix the color as I need to and its an easier process than I had anticipated.I am so truly happy with this product!

I found As Night Falls to be a suspenseful read. I did, however find the ending to be a bit of a let down.The characters were a bit underdeveloped except for Nick, the antagonist. There is a lot of insight as to what makes him tick.I didn't feel that there was much depth or even likeability to the other characters, Sandra, Ivy, and Ben. Harlan was by far the most complex character but he was not featured as much or focused on to move the story forward in a more thrilling manner.Jenny Milchman' s writing is adept but I couldn't help feeling bummed by the ending. It was really anticlimactic and curt.Overall, it was an entertaining read and I think I'd pick up another of her books in the future.

So far I am loving this coconut oil!  There is no scent, it is light and absorbs right away. No residual feeling or excess.I like that this comes with a pump as well as pour cap and a sealing cap if I travel with this or need to make sure it won't leak.I like this coconut oil for my hair as it is dry and processed. Regular conditioners don't do much for my hair at all.Coconut oil really makes a difference with the shine, manageability and no more frizzies! I also love to use this as an all over bodymoisturizer!  And this is great for my nails too! This is my do-it-all item I must have!

I am very impressed with this essential oil diffuser that I received in exchange for my review.This is a nice size as it doesn't take up much room at all. The soft color changing lights, which can be turned off, also provide anatmosphere for relaxation and or sleep.I had been using a reed diffuser with a bottle and fragrant oil. While this provides a lasting fragrance, it is expensive to replace the oilto keep the scent going.With this diffuser, only 3 drops of fragrant oil are needed. After adding the water the scent is diffused into the air. The fragrance is light and lasting.Combined with the lights, size and timer I find this to be the perfect diffuser for my room! I love it!
Fun and more fun!

This is really great as I just started a walking regime. This feels secure and its it very comfortable.I can hold my keys, phone and chapstick. I could probably fit something else too but that is all I needfor walking. The convenience and placement of the water bottles is fine and I can refill them as needed butI don't tend to carry that much on me as I can go back to my car or just have an extra bottle with me. This would also be great for Disney World or other themed park.

I love the butterfly pattern on this beach cover up! The fabric is very sheer but its nice to wrap around. I have the wrap with the thinstraps that you slide your arms through. I would like to try the other wrap that looks like it has a tie for around the neck or to hold up the top.There are a few ways to wear this that makes this beach cover up extra nice. I would definitely hand washthis or put it on delicate in the washer. The sizing seems to be accurate. The length goes to my kneesand when my daughter wears it its mid calf as she is 5'3 and smaller than me.Free product for unbiased review.

This wig is very well made. The fit is adjustable with the elastic type clip. I also really like thatthis wig can be styled with your hands and it stays! This wig offers a few different looks with styling.I plan on wearing this for a cosplay event that is upcoming and I think it will make the difference!The one con is that the wig makes your head a bit hot. I downloaded the software and downloaded the driver, which didn't take that long. The software and driver are on the installation CD that came packaged with the WiFi USB. I recommend reading the guide that comes with the CD and USB before using them. I then plugged in the WiFi USB into my Laptop and I was wireless and online. I haven't noticed an improvement with my internet speed, but I think the range is better and I can now connect to a 5 (AC) WiFi network, previously I could only connect to a 2-4 WiFi network using my Laptop's built in WiFi.

This juicer works well.The juice stays in the bottom, it doesn't leak out.This is lightweight and stores easily. This also keeps the seeds and pulp out of the juice.The spout works well to pour the juice with out splattering.Free product for unbiased review.

My kids and I love this juicer! Its summertime and we love making lemonade. This juicer makes it extra easy for my kidsto make the lemonade alone and I love it because its all in one piece and can go into the dishwasher. It works great and isreally convenient and easy to store and keep together, can't ask more than that!Free product for unbiased review!

I absolutely love this bracelet. It is so pretty and has a beautiful shine. I have a 7 inch wrist and it fits fine and isn't tight at all.My daughter has about a 5 inch wrist and she had lots of room and the bangle could move up and down her wrist but not fall off.The bracelet is secure and I don't have to worry about losing it off mine or my daughters wrist.The rose is so perfectly sculpted. I have been wearing it for a few weeks and I have gotten several compliments.

This garlic press is heavy stainless-steel. I wouldn't be surprised if it lasted the rest of my life. The weight allows it to crush garlic with minimal effort. The sieve swings out from the masher (and it's stainless steel) which makes it easy to clean. Sometimes, when pressing several cloves in a row, some garlic will come up and out past the masher instead of through the sieve. Not a deal breaker, as it only happens when their is sufficient build-up. The pressed garlic also sticks to the sieve - but I imagine that's a "problem" with just about any garlic press. If you're looking for a basic garlic press, this is definitely a solid choice.

These earbuds sound great! They are comfortable to wear and the best part is they stay where they are supposed tonot matter what I am doing. These earbuds took about 2 hours to charge and lasted me about 6 hours.One thing I didn't not likewas the recording saying power on/off/connected it is loud and annoying. Its only a second but still loud and annoying.Paring was easy and quick.Since sound and its comfort  is what I am looking for, I really like these.

I have an older dog who is 8 years old.I have been brushing my older dogs teeth for years but it isn't always enough. My vet says to brush at least 4x a week, at least, to make a difference.He was never a bone chewer but for recently and with "Greenies". Most times, his breath is terrible. This freshener and tooth cleaner does not require a toothbrush, thank goodness (that's another story in itself).All you have to do is spray this in the dog's mouth and it does its thing. Luckily, my dog likes the taste and licks offthe foam and after his breath is fresh smelling for several hours. This is much easier to use than a toothbrush and dogpaste.My dog's vet appointment isn't for a few months but hopefully when I take him the vet will remark on his teeth!
This game is so fun. The story is great. The dialog is great. I love it. This game is a must buy!

This spray has a natural smell, nothing chemical, which is rather pleasant. I have sprayed the area and usedmy carpet cleaner in unison and I have not only removed the odor but the stain is gone as well. I have also used this without the carpet cleaner and its really important to dilute the urine first. This also has worked well with an older stain I had to remove.This is a four step process and its important to follow the directions. This is NOT a spray and wipe away product.Product received free in exchange of an unbiased review.

This light works pretty well! It uses three AAA batteries which come packaged with the light. I tested this light all around my house, I looked for things that might be dirty or things that just look cool when the light is on them. The light works best in the dark or when held close to a surface or object so it's best to use this at night or with the blinds shut. I found that dust usually glows green or a light blue when under the black light. I also found a few stains on my carpeting using the black light. I suppose my puppy had been secretly going pee on the carpeting, (the pee stains glow greenish) I cleaned the stains as soon as I found them. Neon or bright colors glow the brightest when the black light is on them. I also found that if you shine the light on glow-in-the-dark items it charges them up immediately.

I received these socks free in exchange for an unbiased review. The fit is is true to size, I wear a 9 and ordered themedium. These socks are very well made and wash very well. The design is colorful and unique which I like a lot.I have worn these socks several times and they allow my feet to breath and my feet still feel good after a whole day running arounddoing errands and or yard work.I definitely would recommend these to my friends that run.

I tried to use this with my Moto X and even with the d/l app, it would not work.I also used my Samsung Galaxy S4 Zoom and with the app it worked great!  I have to mention that my zoom is a lot wider than any other phoneso the clip that holds the phone is only so secure.Otherwise, the pole is sturdy and about 9 inches closed and extended it is about 39 inches.So far, I like it a lot and plan to use this often.Free product in exchange for unbiased review

This thermometer works pretty well, It is powered by a small watch battery which comes included. It has a few different features. It can measure with both Fahrenheit and Celsius so you can use whichever temperature measurement format you like. You can switch between Fahrenheit and Celsius with the press of a button. It also has a Hold feature, which will pause the display, preventing the temperature from rising or dropping. I'm not exactly sure what you could use this feature for but its there if you need it. It also has a Min & Max feature which will display lowest temperature and highest temperature ever recorded using this thermometer, which, again I see no point in. Overall, it does do a good job measuring temperature, its very accurate. Its also simple to clean although you'll have to clean it by hand.free product for unbiased review

Do you know your children? Very poignant here in terms of this novel. Unfortunately, we hear about the end results of bullying in the news and hopefully this novel, along with others will help in the movement to eradicate bullying of all kinds.Callie and Rebecca are well thought out characters, multi faceted and realistic. Their situation all too real. The perspectives of the characters are voiced separately and, for me, made this read more interesting.The writing is well done and it moved along at a fast pace and the build up and ending is profound and powerful.I think this would make a great read for discussions.

Finally! I have been looking for exactly this type of bag for my phone! I don't jog or run but I wanted something to use to go shopping or for walking around Disney World to just hold my most important items. This is perfect!I have a Samsung Galaxy S4 Zoom. Not only does my phone fit but I can put in my mini wallet andchapstick and a few other things. It can even hold my compact camera.The armband is sturdy and it doesn't move up or down. The velcro is very securely held together. There is enough padding that I feel comfortable using this everyday. The zippers are secure and move smoothly. There is everything to love aboutthis case. This also can hold a Moto X phone as well.Product free in exchange for an unbiased review.

I am so very happy with this wicker storage basket. The color, a milk chocolaty brown is really pretty and fits in with my decor and actually it is neutral enough to fit with any decor! This medium size; 21 inches long by 7.8 inches tall, is large enough to accommodate all the toys of both my puppies. I am using it right now for dog stuff but I am really contemplating using it as a sewing basket.This item is really striking sitting on the floor, its one of those accent pieces you see in a catalogue/commercial layout that pulls a room together.The basket itself is very light but sturdy. There is no liner in it so I would not store food or treats inside unless they were otherwise wrapped or sealed.

I want to preface this review by saying up front that if you are looking to future proof yourself for 4k entertainment early on, this is the AVR you need to buy. At the writing of this review, the Onkyo 646 is the ONLY AVR on the market that uses HDMI 2.0 allowing 40 at 60 Hz AND HDCP 2.2. This is extremely important if you plan on investing in a 4k tv now and do not want to buy a new AVR later.This AVR was a big upgrade for me and something I have been waiting to purchase. I was using an out of the box home theater set up from Onkyo as my current AVR. I could tell it was not giving my speakers the power they needed as I have been slowly upgrading my living room sound system.
