I am currently using;Front: Bowers and Wilkins CM 9sCenter: Bowers and Wilkins CM Centre S2Rear: Cheap out of the box Onkyos I do not know what they areSubwoofer: SVS PB-1000To fully test this AVR I had to order the SVS PB-1000 online right then and there because I did not have a powered Subwoofer. THIS AVR ONLY ALLOWS A POWERED SUBWOOFER. YOU CANNOT USE A PASSIVE SUBWOOFER WITH THIS AVR. I got the  SVS PB-1000 because research told me it's the best sub for $500. I felt like that was a good price point for me.I first ran Onkyo’s calibration set up with the provided Mic. This only took five minutes. Once complete the difference between my AVRs was night and day. I “feel” the sound better; it blew me away! Everything was crystal clear and smooth. Everything had depth and power. This is really awesome equipment!While I do think the calibration set up may have under-powered my center, a quick adjustment in the menu was not a problem.The features on here are pretty self explanatory and I did not need the instructions to find what I wanted to do. I easily connected it to my home Wi-fi network. I logged in with my Pandora account and everything worked as it should. I have to admit it’s easier to just use your phone and the Bluetooth option to stream anything that way you can change the songs from any room.Some things I do not like about this device are:If I turn on the TV the AVR will shut off too. I then have to go and turn the AVR back on if I want to listen to music without the TV being on any more.The boot time on this AVR is long. It takes at least a minute for it to “initialize”. This collides with the problem above.All around for the price features and amount of inputs this is the most solid AVR I have seen at this price point and a must have if you are adopting 4k soon.If you have any questions, post in the comments and I will respond as soon as I can.

This wig looks very natural when fitted properly and the hair itself doesn't have a shine that makes it look like plastic. The feel of it though is stretchy and artificial. There are no bald or patchy spots on this wig which I really like.  Its very long and heavy; it feels full and also gets kind of hot.The inside of the wig cap is has a strap and hook that makes it adjustable to your head size. Its very nice and once on properly I don't feel it coming off.The bangs are nice and very cute when combed to the side. Since this wig though is so long I found it kind of hard to manage. It would tangle easy and would be difficult to un-knot. It sheds a lot when brushed but can actually be brushed out.I love how natural the pale blonde part is and the other colors are very nice too. It has a very nice peachy orange, a cotton candy blue, lavender and mint green. It looks very pretty when braided!Overall I find this wig to be really fun and colorful. I can see myself wearing it out naturally.

I really like this car storage bag as it allows me to organize my purchases and it keeps my trunk and backseat neat. I often shop at a warehouse store and I don't use bags so this comes in handyto put all those little items so they don't get misplaced. There are pockets on the outside and severaldivisions of various sizes. I especially like the handles because I can just carry the whole thingwherever I need my groceries.Free product for unbiased review

I like these lanterns because they are bright and very portable. However the LEDs in these lanterns are placed so that they are exposed, meaning if you look at the lantern the light could hurt your eyes. I wish the LEDs were covered by a piece of white translucent plastic, this would give them a soft glow and they'd no longer be harmful to your eyes. They are small so you can easily pack them into a bag to take camping or store them in a closet, ready in case of a power outage. They use four AA batteries, but they last a long time especially if you're using good batteries. They also have a handle with a curve in the center, this is so you can hang the lantern from a hook and it'll stay balanced.  I also like that this is a 3 pack, one for each of my kids for their rooms. Convenient!I am glad I was given these for free for an unbiased review.

This headset is adjustable, you can change it's size to fit your head comfortably. The headphones completely covered my ears when I put them on, I suppose they're made that way to block out sound, which is nice. You can also adjust the volume using a dial on the back of the head set. The sound quality they provide is pretty good and the built in microphone works well too, however I sounded somewhat quiet in the recordings I made with it. The reason for that might be because the microphone is somewhat distant from my mouth, I can't adjust the mic to be closer which is somewhat disappointing.

I like to drink tea several times a day. I have several kinds of loose tea but the infuser I have been using isn't good at keeping tea leaves out of my mug. Since I was offered this for free in exchange of an unbiased review, I was thrilled to get to use this Dechunxian Tea pot/infuser. After placing my chosen tea leaves into the infuser part, I pour boiling water over it, let it steep a bit then push the red button to expel the tea into the pot to pour. Finally, no tea leaves in my mug! This is also small and compact for storage, however I would love for it to be able to hold more water (16+oz.) as I usually have a much larger amount of tea to drink each time I indulge.This is a great infuser teapot that is pretty, sturdy and does the job well.

I received a Hammered Mug free for review and the reason I wanted to review was specifically that I like the lookof the mugs. They are different and the shine on these mugs are beautiful. At the time, I had not realized these were intended fordrinking vodka and or vodka drinks.So, the point of the copper mug is to keep the drink colder longer and also from keeping the ice from melting and watering down the drink. You also need less ice. All pluses in my drinking book. Also these are nickel lined a brass handle.I have enjoyed several COLD drinks from my mug and I do notice the drink staying cold longer. Really enjoyable.

I have been using this serum for about a month. It absorbs quickly and there is no sticky residue. My face feels smooth and soft.I have these intense wrinkles on my forehead that I can see the Argireline helping to minimize. They are not gone but there is definitelya difference. I will continue to use this product as I believe there will be more results with more time.Also, there is no odor to this serum and I like the dropper bottle which makes it easier to apply the correct amount.I received this product free in exchange for an unbiased review.

I like this chopper a lot, It is compact and works very well. It is easy to clean and I have put mine in the dishwasherand it comes out fine,So far I have used this to chop a variety of nuts,onions, garlic and even chocolate for a dessert.The Mini Chopper provides the size I need for certain recipes, salads and toppings for our sundaes.I love the color and the alternate extra blade storage is convenient.I am very glad I received this free for my unbiased review.

This lantern is great! It uses three AA batteries (not included) as a power source and gives off a very bright light. I like its compact design, it makes it portable so it's easy to pack into a bag to take camping. It is also very light weight. It has two metal handles on the top which fold to it's sides for easy storage. The compass, which is built into the top of the lantern is pretty nice although it becomes inaccurate if the lantern is shaken or unbalanced which is annoying when you're trying use it while walking. This problem can be fixed if you set the lantern down on a flat surface or hold it steady for a few seconds, so it isn't too bothersome. You turn the lantern on and off by pulling it in and out of it's cylinder shell/case, sort of like a piston or telescope, which I think is kinda cool. Overall, it's a great lantern and it can come in handy for emergencies like power outages.

If you love listening to music while your out and multitasking, then you need these Soundpeats.First, they come in this nice hard square case that's small enough to throw in a bag or even your pocket (about the width of your average wallet.) Inside are nicely packaged accessories such as: different size ear buds that to swap out so they'll fit snugly into your ear, typical for earbuds. A small clip to I guess keep your cord together, the charger; and a huge variety of ear hooks.The ear hooks help to keep the buds inside of your ear when you're moving around. They do not irritate my ears at all or feel uncomfortable in any way, and I can wear these for a couple hours.I think the ear hooks are amazing, there are different sizes to choose from so you can pick which your most comfortable with, not to mention they look cool. I can swing my head back and forth to the beat without losing an earbud, (something that would happen with my normal earbuds.) So these are perfect for runners, people who workout at the gym or do yoga.Or if your just sitting at a desk and don't want to bother with the ear hooks, you can leave them out and the buds fit snug into your ears normally. Though the buds have some weight to them compared to normal earbuds, so its why I always prefer to have the hooks in.Overall everything is comfortable and fits snug ONCE I can fit it perfectly into my ears. It did take me a while to get used to using these earbuds. At first I really struggled with the ear hooks fitting in at the right angle and not have everything slide out which was annoying. But after wearing these buds so often and playing around with them; I've gotten used to it and everything is fine.I love these Bluetooth headphones, honestly. There is no annoying cord that gets caught on everything when I'm maneuvering. I hang the cord behind my neck and its no bother at all. I can leave my phone in my pocket with no cord hanging out or I can leave my phone on my desk and go about my house with no disconnection of any kind.These charged pretty quickly and lasted for a good 5 hours. For the compact size that's not too bad. Connecting them to my phone via Bluetooth was quick and simple. Once holding down the power button there is a voice that will tell you "power on" or "power off" or when the battery is low.There is a protective flap on the left bud that reveals the charging port. On the right ear bud there is a mic, the volume buttons and a "qyc" logo to pause the music or take a call.I love these features! Without having to reach for my phone I can raise or lower the volume, or hold the volume button to change the song playing or even pause the song. The headphones make listening to music while out so much nicer. I can take a call without holding my phone because of the mic built in, and the person on the other end can hear me quite clearly.These earbuds have the best quality of music I have experienced out of all of my normal earbuds. (jbuds as an example of other buds I've used.) It blew my mind. It can get pretty loud, which I love and the earbuds themselves block out noise really well, making the music more clearly heard. They're great!Overall I am excited to use these to listen to my music from now on. I love not having to deal with a cord, not having to reach for my phone to change the song, how comfortable and tangle-free these are; and the quality is impressive! I'm raving about them to my friends and I highly recommend them!

I found these walking/ trekking poles to be extremely useful and helpful to me during my outings.I see that they definitely help propel me forward, increasing my speed and efficiency. I feel more secure withmy footing and they have helped stabilize me. My walking party always accuses me of being too slow. I now do not have thatlabel any longer. These poles are sturdy, easy to extend and have a great grip, the straps are wonderful too.I also like the travel bag so that the poles stay clean and together when I am not using them.I like to use the one pole also when I am shopping, I have often miss- stepped almost tripping and these help me walk moresecurely and confidently.I am very grateful for receiving these in exchange for my unbiased review. Most importantly, using these Vorosy walking poles has allowed me to walk more comfortably, further and for longer periods of time

I really love this lunch bag. There is lots of room in the larger bag for a sandwich (s), snack and a water bottle.It is great to have my lunch cold instead of room temperature. The handle and zipper are of great quality so I will be able to enjoy this for a long time.I actually plan on now using this as a make up bag to help offset my makeup clutter.The smaller lunch bag will be my travel make up holder.Green is my favorite color and the pattern is pretty too.I am really happy to have gotten these  free to review as these are quality really nice sized lunch bags.

When I picked this I thought I was getting an origami set and I was so excited! However this "amigami" isn't the same as the paper folding art, origami.This set comes with two figures, a penguin and a polar bear. The figures come with accessories such as stickers and pop out pieces of glossy paper to decorate with. I'd like to add that the figures are hollow plastic so they're very lightweight but sturdy.What you do is pop out a shape from the glossy paper designs; in my case a pair of wing shapes for my penguin figure, and take one of the many star pegs provided to poke through one of the holes already made through the glossy paper and right into the figure. Each figure has hole placements on the top of the head, the sides for arms, the front of the chest and the behind for tails. Another option are stripes of glossy paper that you curl around a stick piece provided in the kit and make curly accessories such as a tail or curly ears. You don't necessarily need the curling-stick to curl your paper pieces, as you can do it by hand. But it is very helpful because there is somewhere to hook your glossy paper onto so it'll hold as you wrap the paper around as it curls.These are a lot of fun decorating but I have to say they are very colorful with the designs. There aren't any solid color pieces and to me it can look like there is just too much going on. They definitely aren't boring looking! I wish the sets had more pegs, a few solid colored pieces and perhaps an extra hole placement for added crazy decoration fun.I  definitely think this can provide and spark creativity.

The writing in Whiskey and Charlie is very well done.  With two interesting and unique characters and with them being twins I wasimmediately drawn into the story. I am a twin and I always like to read anything with a twin theme.I found Whiskey and Charlie to be one of those rare reads that I could read in one sitting. It was emotional, there were many tears shed during this reading. I especially enjoyed reading about Whiskey and Charlie's childhood and reminding me of how family can be and what it should be and overall how important it is.

I really like this collapsible silicone bottle. It is extremely lightweight and rolls up to nothing should I want to store this anywherebut especially in my purse. I always like to have water with me and I always recycle so this saves me from having locate a recycle bin for a regular water bottle or mostly the frustration of not finding one. Just being able to reuse this all the time makes it extremely convenient.I love the color and the harbinger clip. Even if this is half full it stands up and it doesn't leak.I've put this in the dishwasher and it comes out ready to go.Very useful!​I received this product free in exchange for a true review.

This is a beautifully functional umbrella. I love the colors (green with Big Ben) its so smooth the rain glides off.This umbrella is also large enough for 2 people. It is a one handed opening umbrella with the push of a button.One thing was that to close this umbrella I had to push it against the wall to closeas I am not strong enough to close it by myself. My husband had no troubles closing it though.I love that this came with a matching case and that has a handle. I can store this in my purse or carry it along.Overall, this is a very pretty umbrella and serves its purpose protecting me from the rain!A lot better than my past umbrellas!

I remember when I first saw the article for the first Dexter book, Darkly Dreaming Dexter. I was so excited, told my book groups at the time about it and impatiently awaited the release.I wasn't disappointed, it was one and still is my favorite thriller  series books.Dexter was/is the coolest serial killer!A few years in and there's a TV show?! I was in book/movie heaven!So, needless to say, I would run out and buy every Dexter book.In this final installment, I was a bit surprised to know this is the last book and Jeff Lindsay doesn't disappoint!I will miss Dex but this is another great character driven novel by Lindsay, solid, thrilling and all I could want for a wrap up book for a strong series. I am looking forward to reading more books by Jeff Lindsay!

While I was reading this book, I had a lot of mixed feelings. The characters were so well developed both in character and dialogue that I was moved from liking to hating to not being sure how I felt. This whole book but especially the ending is certainly food for thought.The only real problem I had was several times the storyline became tiresome and a bit tedious.I love character driven novels and in this one I wanted to shake them, all of them, at one time or another. Clearly mental illness was involved here but when it isn't properly addressed or ignored it just makes for a frustrating read.Usually, characters that frustrate/(pmo) tend to make me not like a book but here for some reason I can't put my finger on, did not however I was left irritated.This book will move you and it will definitely be great for discussions.

I love reading Linwood Barclay's books. I know that I am guaranteed in depth characters that are likeable and a solid plot.In Broken Promise, there is several mysteries going on that​we are made aware of. The main topic here is that David Harwood has come back to Promise Falls to raise his son near his parents.David has a past that is hinted at but we don't get the full back story.David visits his younger cousin to find her taking care of a child, one she calls her own but as David and all in town know, her child was born stillborn, a tragedy Marla is still coming to terms with a year later.Who is this child and what happened to his mother?​After a few chapters in I noticed that this book had me feeling a familiarity. When I finished I realized this has a bit-just a bit, of a similarity to Linwood Barclay's first novels involving Zack Walker. Maybe because he was a reporter too, whatever it is, this has that kind of humor; light and sporadic which is what I love about the Walker series. Which makes this different than the last several Barclay books.As I mentioned earlier, mysteries abound in this novel and I was really excited that the ending  (not Marla's story) was a cliffhanger and we will get to read about t​hese characters again in the next book in this character series.I can't wait!

To start using the mouse, plug it in to a USB port. The mouse will start working right away, so there is no need to install the software to make the mouse function. The software is only used to customize the mouse. There are plenty of options for customization, you can change the color of the lights on the front of the mouse, in the wheel and the in Turtle Beach logo. You can make the lights any color you'd like. Except black, the light just turns off when you turn it to black... You can also change what all the buttons do on the mouse, you can set buttons to control a media player, so they could adjust volume, pause and play etc. You can also set buttons to act like keys on a key board, you could set a button to act like the shift key or control key, which could be useful for editing or playing games. You can also set a button on the mouse to open a application/program/game, so you can open your favorite application/program/game with just the press of a button without having to find it buried some where in your computer. You can also adjust the speed of the mouse. You can save up to 5 different customized profiles. So you can have one profile for editing, another for gaming and another for browsing the web. I kinda wish there was a setting that'd let you quickly change between profiles but the best way to do that would probably be to set a button to open the customization software and change the profile there.

I really like this wallet, it's exactly what I was looking for.I wanted something small that I could use when I just want to run to the store for a quick shopping trip.All my cc cards fit and I love that it's secured with a zipper closure.The RFID blocking is a super plus especially after one of our credit card numbers was stolen.Also, this is a great color,most of the wallets with RFID are just black.This is perfect for me,I really love this wallet!Thanks for providing the wallet in return for my honest review.

When I finished this book my first thought was what a great read! Then I started to pull it apart a bit.I definitely did not like any of the characters and normally this turns me off a book but in this case the atmosphere,plot and setting kept me intrigued enough to continue.The mom, Sarah, from the beginning I couldn't put my finger on it but she bothered me some how- in the end this resolved itself and I knew what it was and why I didn't care for her character.The dad, Angus, just plain creeped me out as well as the daughter (s) Lydia and Kirstie . I definitely like creepy.Really though, to stir this much dislike also insinuates the author knows what they are doing.I did have an issue or 2 with the plot but overall I liked this book and it had me glued to the pages the whole time.

I really like this light! I attached it to my bed frame so I can read at night. This provides the best lighting.I can also hold my finger on the button and it will dim to barely on; as a nightlight. I love that feature! The gooseneck is long enough so I can move it either to my right or left and angle it as I need it.The clip is very secure and the plug can also double as an USB in that I can plug into the wall or my computer.This feature is pretty coolbecause the new surge protectors have USB ports and I use that instead of clogging up the regular plugs.And thank you camarketing for providing the light for my honest review.

Where Women Are Kings is a unique read;compelling and incredibly sad.For the first five years of his life Elijah was abused. Abused by his mentally ill mother and her church's bishop.After two years in foster care we find Elijah living with Nikki and Obi who are in the process of adopting him.They do everything they can to help Elijah get better. It's clear they love Elijah with all their hearts and souls but will it be enough to release the brainwashing of his biological mother's delusional love?Christie Watson's writing is so well done it gives me goosebumps when I think back about this story.The characters are strong and likeable and I kept reading to see how all this would play out.All I can say is that Where Woman Are Kings is one of the most depressing reads I have ever read.I really need to go watch a comedy now.

There has been a school shooting. Jake Connolly is missing, his parents can't get a hold of him and no one has seen him since he was with the known shooter, Doug.Jake is a bit different; quiet, shy. Some say keeps to himself, a loner. Is this boy different or is he like the school shooter that has been identified. Jake, perhaps the second shooter hasn't been found but many have already declared him a murderer. Is it because of what he has done or what the people think he is?It's been a long time since I finished a book in one sitting. Finding Jake was fast paced and captured my attention until the last page. I really liked the perspectives by Simon, Jake's father; one starting before Jake was born and one currently depicting what was happening.This is an emotional read and one that makes you think and reflect. One that will stay with me for quite awhile.

Overall, I liked the book.I liked the protagonist and found the plot to be interesting.I did think that some of the plot or the "why" of what was happening was lost a bit because the storyline dragged toward the ending. Other than that I thought this was a good first novel and I am definitely interested in reading more by Paul Mendelson.

I wore these earrings over the weekend where I attended several events and I received several complements.The sparkle on these earrings is fabulous and the lever back closing is very secure. I have even slept and showed in theseand no problems. They have weight to them but are in no way heavy. I love the rose gold color as its different. They are beautiful, sparkly and a perfect.

I thought this was a solid read, suspenseful with a smart, likeable protagonist.When I had to stop reading I found myself thinking about Clarissa and her dire situation.​This was a fast paced read and although I had  a problem wit​h a few plot points, in the end, I feel its an emotional and vividportrayal of one being stalked.I am definitely interested in reading more books by this author.

I really hated the character of Mr. Heming.So much so that it tainted the whole read for me. Everything he did or said, thought or acted on irritated me to the point of hating to pick up this book to read. I finished it just because it was a buddy read.I hate wasting more time writing this review but there really is nothing to say other than utterly unlikeable characters and droll story with no atmosphere,  mystery- plot or anything to make my time worth it.

I was drawn into this story immediately and found it to move quickly.I liked the characters,especially Ellie and Beth who were most relatable as moms.Normally. I don't care for books with a too eager reporter but in Broadchurch, I liked the character of Karen White. Even though she was ambitious she was also very concerned for the victims. I liked her part in the story.I thought I had this mystery figured out but I was off base and surprised with the ending; which made this book all the more likeable to me.There were a few minor points not wrapped up for me but they were nothing to throw me off track or mess with the ending.I found this to be a really suspenseful mystery and I plan on reading future works from this author.

I could not find anything to like about this book.It was repetitive, unfocused and tremendously boring.The repetition is so often (like it will talk about something or describe something several ways several times or more within the span of a page.)I did not find any of the characters to be interesting or at all likeable.When I put this book down I dreaded to pick it back up; in fact I read 3 other books while trying to get through Butterfly Skin.There are way better books to spend my time on.

While I sped  through this novel thinking I might like all the characters by the end I was sorely disappointed and found Kathleen to be the only justifiably one to like.This story is told with two points of view, Curtis, the dad to Daniel and Olivia, Daniel's sister.While the dialogue and character's insight rang a bit true to a point, I found the characters Curtis, whimpy and totally full of fake inner self bravado. Olivia was self absorbed and babied to the point where I wanted to shake her.The ending pissed me off.Kathleen certainly got the raw end of the deal and it was just maddening. Ugh!
My dogs love these! Pretty durable so far, great squeaky sound too.Fast delivery too.
My son loves this sneaker. He is very happy with the fit and says they are extremely comfortable! I bought him the size 5. They look well made and should hold up really well.

I really loved reading this book. I had a great time getting to know the Gillespies.I fell in love with all the characters and I wish I had neighbors just like them.The depictions of the surroundings was done so well, I felt like I was on vacation in South Australian outback. What really kept me reading was the relationships within the Gillespie family. Also, an intregal part of the story, close family friend, Joan who addded the down to earth advice and Aunt Celia who added just enough spice.For me, this was a true feel good entertaining read. I plan on checking out a few of Monica McInerney's other books, especially The Alphabet Sisters,At Home with the Templetons and The House of Memories.

I like these a lot, they are gentle on my sensitive skin but exfoliates well. They are really cute and easy to hold even with slippery soap. I appreciate that they have a string so I can hang it to dry. They dry pretty quickly in just a day and its always fun watching it grow as it soaks up water. I like that they are natural and long lasting! I always use this to cleanse my face nowadays.

Overall, I liked reading the perspectives of the Campbell family after the return of Justin and their reflection of how they dealt with him missing.The novel is well written as a character driven novel; the characters were three dimensional and portrayed realistically. Even with all this I did still find this novel dragging a bit. I would have liked to have read less about what the parents were thinking instead of what actually happened to Justin and his four year captivity. Not nitty gritty details but maybe more of what Justin was thinking then and how he was dealing with coming home now.

It is a little off the wall, and probably not something you’d expect to receive, but it would probably be something random enough to make an impression on someone if you were all out of gift ideas.It is also the perfect thing to bring along on a camping trip, or to a backyard barbecue with a fire-pit.  (I like the idea that it is purely self-contained, and you don’t have to rummage about in your pantry for the separate ingredients… no, “oh shoot, I thought we had marshmallows!” to spoil your outing.)And, you know what? If you are like me and it is highly unlikely you are going to go camping in the near future you can always use this as the “I-am-so-hungry-there-has-GOT-to-be-some-emergency-junk-food-in-this-house-stash”  I mean, it comes with EIGHTEEN candy bars.THAT said, it seems WAY overpriced to me.  You could have made it and sold it for $20, so I don’t think it is a very cost effective package.  Buy the ingredients separately if you just want to make smores, but consider buying this box if you want to present it as a gift.And yes, you can make smores in the Microwave.  You just need to keep close watch on them!

This is a decent crock pot.  The one thing that it missed which I would have liked, perhaps, would have been a small red LED light so I could tell at a glance that it was on.  Otherwise you have to wait until it starts heating to know that you are good to go.Other than that, I thought it worked pretty well.  It was very easy to clean –I just take out the center bowl and the glass top and put them both right into the dishwasher to do most of the work.One other item which I hadn’t seen before that was actually pretty cool was that the glass lid has handles on both sides.  This appears to be so that you can turn the lid over to lower the vertical height further, if you need just that little extra bit of space in order to squeeze it into the fridge.  Nice touch!I also like the design.  My other crock pot has a stainless steel finish, but this one looks nicer, perhaps because it is so different.  (I wonder how it will look to me in a couple of years…)Recommended.

I like to use these bags for larger jobs.  I can usually deal with medium sized bags for most everyday use, but once in a while I need to do some serious cleanup, OR, I want to seal something up to make it somewhat airtight (like a car seat I need to store, or an out of season wreath), so that I may keep it in the basement which is exposed to a lot dust and dirt.  For these types of uses these bags are fantastic.They also have a ribbon drawstring which allows you to tighten the heck out of it and reduce the opening to mostly nothing.  (No complaints here! They are real drawstrings, and not just extended ends which some other bags have instead of the separate drawstrings.)However, one thing I was slightly disappointed by was that these were not as durable as I thought they’d be.  These are definitely NOT contractor bags.  Contractor bags are very large, and very thick, and are used for getting rid of debris that you might encounter during home renovations, for example.  They pretty much resist poking and ripping, and are a great catch all for drywall, plaster, or wire mesh.  THESE bags are NOT those.  They don’t appear to be any thicker that your standard garbage bag, which is not a bad thing, I just want to point out that they are not “industrial strength”.  If you want that, buy “contractor” bags instead (like “Hefty Heavy Duty Contractor Bags”), and I guarantee that you’ll be thrilled at the thickness and durability of those bags, if you have a rougher job than just everyday use.That one item aside, I recommend these bags.

I usually shy away from polyester blankets, but I have to say that this one grew on me.The first thing I did was to throw it into the wash, and then on a low dry cycle, because I was most worried about 'shedding' or 'pilling', and figured I wanted to know right away if I was going to eventually be disappointed after I cleaned it, and it started to fall apart.However, after drying it and checking the lint screen and the blanket before and after I have to say that I had nothing to be disappointed about.  There was no more shedding than usually occurs with regular clothes, and the blanket still looked brand new -thank goodness.Once that was out of the way I was able to appreciate it for what it was -a pretty durable, and versatile throw blanket, perfect for a cold night, watching TV, ALONE, with a bowl of ice cream.  (It is too small for two, but perfect for one!)But seriously, I rather like that you've got two completely different sides to this blanket.  One side is more like a shag rug, and it is luxuriously silky and tactile, while the other side is a more conservative darker color, without the deep pile.  So, you really can choose from two completely different experiences.By the way, I imagine if you have pets, you are going to have to hide this blanket, because if you leave it 'deep pile up' your pets are going to find this immediately, and live on it, and you are never going to be able to use it again.  It is that soft and comfortable (and reflecting of heat, since it is polyester).I actually liked this.  My only complaint is that I would have liked it a bit larger, so it could be more useful for two, instead of for one.  (What a nice gift it would be for a significant other if you could share it...)

I had never used this type of product before and didn't know what to expect.  Once I took the rolls out of the plastic, however, I was overwhelmed by the strong scent that just wafted everywhere.  It was so pervasive that it overpowered everything in my storage room (while on the floor) until I moved it to the top of the shelves.I was turned off by the strong scent and would have much rather had an unscented option, but there you go.Anyway, aside from that, it worked pretty well. I was able to use one sheet, add a little water, and do some good cleaning.  I can see the appeal if you don't use cleaning wipes but don't want to dirty a dishcloth.  One use, good scrubbing, and then you can throw it away.

Though a bit pricey (I think) this is a relatively durable and thoughtfully designed outdoor-oriented garment which should please your backyard explorer with its versatility and carryability-of-things-found-and-picked-up! (I know that I am always being asked to hold rocks for my child, and I am happy to give that opportunity back to him –go ahead, load on up, as much as you want, as long as YOU carry it!)The vest is relatively versatile.  It has seven small straps that you can tie things to (though I am not sure I’d want much swinging against my side when walking) but the IDEA of the straps is a good one.It also has four pockets with which to hold all your backyard or nature walk finds.Next, it has a zipper for easy/on, easy/off performance and the entire back is made of mesh to allow breathability and prevent overheating.  (I found this to be really important because no one wants to drape their child in canvas when going outside on a hot summer day…)It is a pretty simple idea, and executed reasonably well.  Keep in mind that no other items come with the vest –no magnifying glass, and no binoculars –so if you want to gift this vest you may want to purchase one or two of those items on your own and include them, to make it more functional.

I liked this book, and it actually fascinates my 2 year old as well.  For the past week he has asked me to read it to him every night.  (“Daddy, read Princess and Po-ny!”)At first he just wanted to listen to the words. Now he actively scans the more detailed pages (with a lot going on in the background) and points at items (like things hanging on a wall) and asks questions.  “what’s that?” (“uh, a poster of 3 warriors”) What’s that? (“a picture of her mommy and daddy”), “what’s that?” (“ah, I guess it is a couple of ticket takers at the battle event.”) Does he understand it all? No, he is a little young for this, but he enjoys it nonetheless.So that is my first comment.  The backgrounds are lush and detailed.  A lot of care went into them, and they are fun to scan and find supporting story artifacts –like what sweaters are people wearing? What does the princess have in her bedroom? What are all the warriors doing during the big battle?Second, the book is pretty funny.  Having no prior knowledge of the author I didn’t know what to expect, and I found the book to be slightly dry and absurdist –which felt just about right for the young children reading this book.  I did worry a little bit about the presumed violence that is mentioned and shown in one panel, but aside from that bit of awkwardness, everything works out in the end and it turns out to be a fun, well written story, which fights traditional stereotypes and which I feel will be a nice addition once again when my children are a little older and will ‘get’ different aspects of the book which are mysterious at present.Finally, I like how the book doesn’t talk down to children.  There is a good use of vocabulary in the book, and a couple of words I know I won’t be teaching them for years –but why not start early?This book makes a nice gift as it is not traditional, and is quirky and fun.  Recommended.

I probably wouldn’t buy this for a professional/tradesman who would use this as their primary tool, but for a normal tool around the house guy this makes a great present.It is extremely versatile, and I like it.  Here’s why:+++ The head can swivel all the way around.  This means you can actually use it completely vertically (to pry crown molding, for example, off of the ceiling), or turn it 90 degrees to allow for maximum leverage to pull up regular nails.  You can also swivel the head and stop it in what appears to be around 10 degree increments to allow you to pick your angle for the best leverage or clearance.+++ It is very versatile.  My first thought was –well, here is an excellent nail puller, but then when I played with the swiveling head, and the sharp ends I realized that it could also be used to delicately pry two pieces of wood apart.  This would allow you to take off baseboards or molding, for example, with the very good possibility of doing so without unnecessarily damaging the wood, allowing you to reuse the pieces.  (This makes it very useful to the craftsman who wants to do some renovation work.)++ There is a bit of raised steel where you can strike a hammer.  This allows you to wedge the head in there between two tight pieces of wood and tap away safely with some extra force.  No trying to hit a curved corner (like on a normal pry bar) and risk having the hammer skid down the bar and hitting your fingers.++ The size (18 inches) is small enough to carry around easily, and unlike the much larger pry bars this one is very easy to store and carry through hallways without worrying you’ll drop it or clip a corner or something.+ It is a big, meaty, nail puller and pry bar and it has a good plastic handle to hold on to (instead of a cold metal bar).But, it isn’t perfect.It doesn’t appear to be made with junk steel, but it also isn’t made with the highest quality grade of hardened steel either.  This means that it might not work perfectly on extremely repetitive work like prying out a ton of nails.  (I pulled around 6 really tough nails and spikes out of the mortar on the side of my brick wall house and though it was a success, I can absolutely see how this caused a little bit of wear and tear on the tool, and I bet performance would be really degraded if I pulled out 100 such nails.Overall I like this tool and I would recommend it as a versatile catch-all tool for someone doing normal home renovation.  Or, if you price the cost of replacing this tool after doing major jobs, then I’d also allow that a tradesman might also get some excellent use out of it.  Just don’t expect it to last through repetitive and damaging work over time.Recommended.

I tried this and I liked it relatively well.  It took some getting used to the tubeless roll, but in the end I think in the name of efficiency and waste prevention it is worth it.So the deal with the tube is this.  It just isn't there.  The paper is instead wrapped around (what I would guess to be) a square rod which is later removed.  This leads to the toilet paper roll being slightly square, which is not really noticeable until you pull it from a dispenser -then the thing jerks slightly at every quarter turn, just like those dispensers in some public restrooms where they are made to be off balance so that the roll doesn't keep rolling if you pull it, and where the paper tears every turn (getting you to use less paper).  Well, the paper doesn't tear inefficiently here –it will keep rolling- but it does take some getting used to the continual pulling that you need to do to get the paper you need.  (On the flip side, however, no 2 year olds are going to be able to easily spin the whole roll off with a few big swipes!)HOWEVER, what I couldn't get past, and why I won't be buying this regularly is that it isn't as soft as the brand that I have found I like best, and I am not willing to give that up.  Probably the main reason for this is that it comes from 40% recycled paper.  Again, another WONDERFUL thing, but recycled paper does not lead to the absolute softest rolls -you need fresh trees for that.  So, if compromising some softness is something that doesn’t bother you, then I would highly recommend it.  Believe me, you can get used to the tubeless roll.  It isn’t that big a deal.

I have yet to be disappointed by the durability of Belkin products.  I've bought cheaper items, but they usually end up disappointing me in one of two ways: 1) The adapter fails and stops charging (or charges really slowly).  This is usually when I buy a too good to be true Chinese knockoff, and it just stops working after a week or two 2) And this is most common, the end of the cable (where it joins to the device) ends up becoming worn very quickly and usually detaches from the items, leaving to exposed wires.  (I've even had this happen on an Amazon basics cable, which surprised me.)Therefore, off of the bat this device has already passed my two "pain tests" above.  I have used it regularly, and bent the heck out of the wires, and it has not degraded one bit.  All four ports continue to perform, and I have no complaints.One suggestion, though.  Do yourself a favor and ALSO buy two short cables for charging whatever devices you have, and permanently leave them in the car hooked up to this device.  You will thank yourself for not having to remember to always find a cable in the house or another car and will never be in a situation where you have the charger, but no cables  It is a worthwhile investment, trust me!There was nothing about this product that failed to meet my expectations.  Recommended.

The neat thing about this kind of product is that it does not require any adhesives.  You literally can pull it off if you don't like it, and can adjust it or move it to another window without too much difficulty.However, there are several things you must do to ensure success; good prep work is an absolute must.  For optimal results you need to do the following: 1) Measure the exact interior dimensions of your window frame.  You should do this it to the millimeter to ensure perfect placement.  This is because you MAY have to trim your window film to fit your window if it is a slightly different size, or if you want to cover only the bottom or top window pane.  (If you need to do this I recommend laying the unstuck window film down on a collapsed cardboard box, and using a razor blade to trim the plastic right on top of the cardboard).  2) You need to do a really good Windex cleaning of the window before placing the film.  Don't skimp on this part.  Clean all the way to the edges, as any dirt or grime under the film will, over time, cause the friction to be less.  3) And finally, definitely use a squeegie to press the air bubbles out of the window film, don't try to do it by hand.  And, if you squeegie is really dirty on the rubber blade (like mine was, from using it on outside windows that got dirty), either clean it really well or buy a new one to ensure proper movement.If you do all of these things you should have a painless setup.  (It is also forgiving, as you can pull up the film and redo it if you need to.)Finally, the appearance of the product is pretty good.  I hadn't tried any stained glass films before, mostly just the blurry privacy ones, but this worked just as well.  Note: the clear parts are really clear, so I personally wouldn't use this as a privacy shield -if you are looking for that I would look specifically for that model.Recommended.

I think this works pretty nicely.  We use it for our 2-3 month old at the dinner table (since we have another young one we are watching as well).  She is active enough that she won't sit still in a non-moving chair, but is soothed or entertained enough on the lowest setting in this one that we can actually eat dinner together!Yes it is rather noisy (with sounds like gears grinding) when the swing starts, but that actually mostly goes away after about 20 seconds.  What you are hearing is the seat's automatic weight detector, and (something like) a transmission slippage until the weight of the seat is heavy enough to activate the lowest gear.  It is kind of like your 5 speed bike as a child -with you pushing down to the fifth speed too early, and your legs really working to get you to where you aren't exerting a lot of effort at that speed.What I really like about this swing is that you are only a simple button push away from changing the seat from swinging from left to right, to front to back, or from back to front.  This is actually easier than you'd think to do, and you can do it in mid-motion without stopping the machine.Also, the seat adjusts to two settings -one is mostly horizontal, and one is mostly vertical.  This is an excellent choice to have as well.Additionally, there is a mobile which can spin around (if you desire) and you can choose between playing forest sounds, or music.We only use the first speed setting for our 2 month old, but our 2 year old (who is still a few months under the weight limit) likes to get in from time to time, and asks us to put it on the fastest setting, which is reasonably fast, but not "oh my god!" fast.I was pleasantly surprised by the versatility of this seat, and yes, its construction.  It was a breeze to put together, and I mean that.  I think there are only 4 or five pieces to connect (along with the padding and harness) and you can do so with the tool provided.  Very nice.  Recommended.

This lives up to my image of Belkin products: it is well constructed and durable.  It is also stylish and reasonably well designed.PROS:+++ HIGH QUALITY CONSTRUCTION.  This isn't going to snap or wear out too quickly.  All the pieces are either thick plastic or (internally) metal.++ EASY INSTALL.  Very simple to use –just pull open the side grippers and plop your phone in.  And if you want to charge your phone, too, you can thread a cord through the hole in the back of the mount stem.++ GOOD VIEWING ANGLE.  I had no problems with the rotation ability and viewing angle of the mount.  I could see my phone screen without issue.+ OK INSTALL OF MOUNT.  Though it works, it does so by a twist-to-lock (circular compression) instead of a push-to-lock (lever compression) method.  I like the lever compression method better, as I think it provides an easier (and more suction-y) install, but I haven’t had the mount fall from the windshield yet, either.NEGATIVES:- TWO HANDS REQUIRED FOR USE.  It takes TWO hands to put your phone in the cradle and to take it out (or else you risk pulling the mount off of the windshield.)  This is NOT something you can install while driving (though you can remove it one-handed.)Overall I am pretty happy with this holder.  Not a huge fan of the circular compression grip, but I’ll update the review if I find that it fails more than the standard (lever compression) mechanism on other grippers.

As a regular detergent it is fine.  It cleans clothes adequately, and is not crazily overpriced for a name brand.  However, I came away from this thinking it would somehow be safer for my baby than other “normal” detergents, but I didn’t find that to be the case.  Well, I will say this –this detergent did not cause any rashes on my children, so I have no complaints about it causing any skin irritations, but why on earth are they putting scent in this detergent for babies? Baby smell is about the best thing on earth, and I hate to cover it up with a non-natural perfume.  I would much rather this product had NO scent at all, since Dreft already sells scent boosters which can be added if so desired…The other thing that bothered me is that you can’t find any of the ingredients on the bottle.  I am certain this is done because there is only a negative benefit to the company to do so, and after checking the website and finding the pdf link with the ingredients list, and then Wikipedia-ing the list, I can see why.  Some of the ingredients here are just as unsafe as other chemicals in other detergents.  (I don’t know any more about these ingredients than a regular person, but I’d be lying if I said it didn’t bother me a little bit.)  Be that as it may, I have used Dreft in the past but I suppose I was misled into thinking it was somehow better or safer than “all natural versions”, or products from Seventh Generation (for example).SO, if you DON’T want artificial scent on your baby –this is not for you.  If you DON’T want the suspect ingredients (as listed on the Proctor and Gamble website) touching your baby’s skin, then this is not for you.  If you DO want something more natural, organic, or with fewer artificial additives or chemical, then this is also NOT for you.BUT, if those items don’t concern you, or if you if just want a detergent that will be less harsh on your baby’s skin, than say “Tide”, then this is a valid choice.

I like these.  I use the ultra-fine black Sharpies all the time to write on glossy white label tape (to mark Tupperware bowls for school), so was interested in seeing how the super bright colors would hold up.  Overall they are nice.  They write really easily and the colors are bold.However, the colors are NOT fluorescent colors like you might find in some other specialty ink pens, so don't buy them if you are hoping to get wowed by inks.  They are, instead, nice and slightly more muted versions of the colored cap covers sealing the pens.  I liked them, but I can see how I'd be a little disappointed if I was REALLY looking for colors that POPPED!Finally, if your hands cramp easily because you are applying too much pressure when writing (like I do), or, if you want a good pen to write on those glossy greeting  cards or wrapping papers (where inks tend to smudge immediately!) then it might be worth giving these a shot.  Recommended.

Ok, so I am someone who usually sleeps in a sleeping bag outside of the 4 coldest months, so I don’t worry much about insulation.  I also don’t mind hard surfaces and don’t usually use any other mats for support (or insulation) under my bag, or a pillow –usually just rolled up clothes.  (If I do use something for insulation I’ll use a yoga mat.)  I don’t do a lot of hiking, so weight isn’t that much of a concern for me.And with that background, I gave this a try.  But before I did so my thoughts were the following:1) Why on earth is this thing so expensive? Can’t you just buy an inflatable mat at  the price?2) Do you REALLY care that much about weight that you have to cut out of the mat?After using it I’ve mellowed a bit on the product, but for ME (and my type of camping) it isn’t necessary.  BUT, I’ve come to respect the professional quality of the product, and I recognize the value it will provide to more professional (or avid) hikers and campers.PROS:+++ IT SAVES A LOT OF SPACE.  No more rolling up the yoga mat and strapping that on under the sleeping bag –unless you need it for insulation.  (If you just want comfort then this works fine.  If you really want to keep distance between you and the floor, then I might still consider some other ground covering first.)  This item really is about the size of a soda can when rolled up.  If you are interested in SERIOUS hiking, and have to minimize bulk, then this could definitely be for you.+++ VERY EASY TO SET UP.  It took me 3 breaths for the pillow and 6 for the body to get it fully inflated.+++ HIGH QUALITY AIR INTAKE NOZZLES.  I expected the old fashioned plug nozzle, and I was pleasantly surprised at their advanced design and superior craftsmanship.  They were VERY easy to blow into, and very easy to use to deflate.  I see where some of the premium price comes from.  This does not have the typical lower quality parts of an el-cheapo air mattress.+ VERY LIGHT.  This isn’t that big a deal FOR ME since it is so small I expected it to be light, and yoga mats (or whatever) aren’t really heavy, but if every ounce counts, this is a plus.+ COMES WITH A REPAIR KIT.  And the kit is tucked inside the storage bag, so you don’t have to remember to pack it separately.  A nice touch.+ SELF LEVELING PILLOW IS NICE.  Because it is angled towards the center you tend to slide towards the center, instead of sliding off of the pillow.  This is a good design.+ REASONABLY COMFORTABLE.  I am a side sleeper so it wasn’t quite as comfortable as when I was on my back, but I really had no complaints.  I don’t know if this is because I like hard surfaces, or if I was truly supported where I needed to be, but there you go.CONS:- VERY EXPENSIVE.  No, it is not a rip-off, but it is definitely a premium product designed for a serious hiking market.Basically, if you’ve got cash to spend and want high quality goods, or if you camp all the time then this might be for you.  BUT, if you are like me, and are only a “once in a while” camper, you may not find that it is worth the price premium.  Would I personally buy this with the amount of camping I do? No.  Would I consider it for someone else who LOVES to camp? Yes.

This is a great value.  It is not going to last forever (like a Kitchen Aid) but it isn't going to need replacement in a couple of years (like a mixer half the price).One thing I really liked about this one was that it came with a lot of attachments.  It comes with both a big bowl and a small bowl.  It also comes with a set of two whisks, two beaters, and two dough mixers.  (You don't have to buy these attachments separately!)It is lighter than a Kitchen Aid (and a lot easier to move around).  You are not going to strain lifting this if you store it somewhere other than on your counter.It is well balanced and offers a tilt function (which locks open) so you can get full access to the bowls, and to eject or insert more attachments.Adding attachments is as easy as you'd expect: push in and click, and they are locked in until you press the eject button to remove them.The motor has twelve speeds and it whirs faster and faster on a continuum as it reaches the higher speeds (or slows down to a lower speed).  Therefore speed increase or decrease is not immediate (like it is with a Kitchen Aid), but perhaps it offers a little finer control (since you have double the speed options).  This means, though, you can't lower the speed extremely rapidly (like shifting a gear) --it is more like you are turning down a fan speed and it slows down gradually.  This is not BAD, just different, and you have to plan for it.  (I did think, however, that the top speed was pretty darn fast!)One really nice function I like is that the base has a switch which allows you to push the bowl over a few inches (while still mixing).  This means you can add ingredients very easily (while the mixer is on).  This is very difficult to do with a Kitchen Aid mixer, and I usually have to stop it and raise the top when pouring in liquids to mix.Overall I really like this mixer and if I wasn't interested in an industrial strength Kitchen Aid I would seriously consider this for the average kitchen.  Recommended.

I’ve used this lock for a couple of weeks now and overall it is pretty good.  I am not crazy about the “push to open the cover” aspect of the lock, but over time it works reasonably well most of the time.  Yes it is a little “fidgety”.  Sometimes you have to push on the front or the back several times with different angles to open the lock (or the lock reset mechanism), but it has always eventually worked for me.Here’s the main thing.  If you want a lock on YOUR stuff, and YOU are the one opening it, this is a good security choice.  BUT, if you want a lock on YOUR FAMILY’S stuff, unless they all get trained on how to open it they are going to struggle and potentially not be able to easily figure out the lock.  This is because of the fidgety latch, and also because you have to know to squeeze BOTH sides with some pressure before the lock will open.  It doesn’t automatically pop open like other locks.One advantage to this is that it is more secure.  You can’t just bumble your way through this lock, trying all the combinations in the hope that the lock loop will just automatically pop out if you happen upon the right combination.  And, you aren’t going to know you happened onto the right combination until you push in the buttons and the lock opens up.  This is going to make it really frustrating for someone who doesn’t know the lock try to open it up, even with the correct combination.Another thing about this lock.  It is very easy to set.  You don’t need a pin inserted (like some other locks) to change the combination.  This makes it a breeze to change it on the fly, but this may not be something you want.  For example, I will likely NEVER change the combination on the lock to my shed.  My family all knows it, and I don’t have too many valuable items in there, just items that are dangerous to young ones.  So, if someone got the idea that it would be funny to change dad’s combination, they could do it in a flash –making things very difficult for me.  (In this case I prefer the other style of lock, like the “Sesamee K436 4 Dial Bottom Resettable Combination Brass Padlock “, where without the lock setting pin no one is going to reset the lock.)One more important note.  This is a DOUBLE lock.  It won’t be noticeable in normal use (except for having to squeeze both sides to open), but if you (theoretically) cut through one side of the boron shackle it won’t allow you to take the lock off unless you also cut through the other side to cut a large enough gap in the shackle.  This is absolutely more secure than a standard lock, and would take twice as long to cut through, if that were even an option.Finally, the combination dial isn’t on the bottom like traditional locks (or the Sesame lock mentioned above, which I also have –and love).  It is recessed on the side and you have to open a panel to see it.  I am not a fan of this design, but I suppose it keeps the dials less exposed to the elements and would be a plus in a marine or wet/freezing environment.Overall this is a good lock.  It is very easy to reset, and very hard to open –either by brute force, or by guessing the dial combination.  It is also very resistant to the elements, and something I’d feel safe using in a situation where a keyed lock wasn’t desirable.

I thought these curtains were fine.  Though not initially impressed with the fact that they were polyester, they do have the advantage of being less likely to stain when used in high traffic areas, and touched by fingers all the time.I found the edges of all the curtains to be un-frayed and had no qualms with their construction.My only complaint is that they were not as fine as I would have liked.  I thought they would filter out more light, but the only filtering was on the thicker pattern, while the areas WITHOUT the pattern were almost see through -not a good idea if you (like I) happen to be using this on a stairwell window where the idea is to let as much light in as possible while providing as much privacy as possible (since there were no other curtains).  As a result I found them much less useful for my needs.  However, if you don't require as much light filtering you'll probably be fine with them.

So the main thing about the tape measure is that it works fine without any major defects.  It has a belt clip for ease of carry, it has good readability on the tape (and it is a matte finish so it won’t reflect much outside), and it has very precise measurements for the first half a foot.  (Not sure why they didn’t carry that all the way through, though…)It is a rather odd size, however, and because of this I don’t see a way to measure something like a floor to ceiling without bending the tape 90 degrees (at the floor or the ceiling) at one end to read it.  I mean, how wide is the thing, EXACTLY? My other tape measure is exactly 2.5 inches long so I know to add this to anything I measure if I put it on the floor and pull the tape measure up. (MINUS 1 star.)The other thing, and this is relatively minor, is that it stands very precariously when you tilt it vertically and let go.  It WILL stand up, but only barely, and any gentle touch will knock it over.  The design could have easily been made ‘less cool’ and the product made much more stable.  As a result I would not take this anywhere on a ladder (or on any tall object or shelf) unless I placed it sideways all the time, because it WILL fall and hit someone or break something.  (MINUS 1 star –I knocked it over already and it bounced down the stairs).On the other hand, it does have a fantastic feature which sells the product: it has an auto-lock mechanism.  This means when you open it up it stops automatically where you opened it without you having to adjust a tension knob to prevent it from retracting.  This is a superb feature and I will look for it in future tape measures. (PLUS 1 star –this is a wonderful addition.)Overall I really like this tape measure.  Though, I would not recommend it if you do a lot of professional measuring (like making cabinets or something like that) due to the inability to judge the size of the casing of the irregularly sized tape housing, and the slight instability of the device.  (Even if you place it on its side, since the casing is slimmer on the edges and slightly fatter in the center, it will wobble, flat.) NOW I understand why professional tape measures are a little boring -fully flat on one size, and about the same thickness in all parts of the device, with a very stable housing, and easy to measure (with the housing included in the measurement).Those caveats aside, if you are an amateur, like me, and don’t do much carpentry it works wonderfully and I recommend it.  I would absolutely get this as a present for the casual user.  They will love it… (…as much as one can love a tape measure).

These aren't the best scissors I've used, but that is fine -these are medium level craft scissors.  You can cut paper as easily as you can cut fabric, and I like not having to find different scissors for different tasks.I also really like the wide base grip which allows you to get your whole hand in there for leverage, and to reduce strain on your hands if you are doing a lot of cutting.The blades are pretty sharp and they look like they'll keep their edge longer than you'll need the scissors.  They are a good value, too; you don't have to think too hard if they are a good investment or not.  They are good scissors, and I would have no regrets purchasing these.I haven't felt the need to adjust the cutting tension but the ability is there with the special screw holding the blades together.  I suppose if I were doing a lot of crafting this would be a huge plus -as there's nothing worse than repetitive ANYTHING if it isn't comfortable.The only thing I would change is that I would make the handle a little softer, but I understand that THAT is really something that you find on more expensive scissors.

This food seems to be working a little too hard on a fairy-tale food image.  There is a picture of a child mixing a batch of “something”, and then the advertising says “we take the time to mix every batch”.  It seems kind of funny that I’d associate some sort of industrial cat food mixer with a child or a chef mixing a delicate soufflé or a chocolate ganache with a wooden spoon –like the act of mixing somehow is (their words) “unique”, and that it somehow (their words) “provide(s) your cat… with uncompromised nutrition.”  That seems a rather strange cause and effect, and really seems to me that their advertising department was really stretching for something to say, while not really saying too much.  I mean, OF COURSE you mix each batch.  You don’t just slop the ingredients in there separately –the cats wouldn’t go for it.That ridiculous advertising intro aside, I think all that matters with cat food is three things: 1) Price 2) Quality and 3) Do your cats eat it.1) The price is reasonable given the other similar alternatives on the market.  No complaints there.2) The quality appears to be high.  There’s not too much that the company says about the ingredients other than they are “sourced” and “authentic”.  (This is what you can say when you can’t say organic.  I mean, I sourced my ham sandwich for lunch today –right from the bag in the fridge.  AND, I made sure to source authentic HAM, and not a cheap knockoff made from something non-ham-ish.)  I will say this, though, I liked that when reading the ingredient list I was able to identify a bunch of them: apples, egg whites, green peas, potatoes, fish oil, carrots, chicken, pork liver, and so on… it wasn’t just cheap filler or unknown mixtures.3) Yes, it appears to taste good.  The cats eat it.  And, they lick up the gravy –so I call that a win.Silly advertising aside, I didn’t find anything in this cat food that disappointed me.  When trying wet cat food I’d likely start cheaper, but if I were trying to find a higher quality brand for a finicky cat I’d give this a shot.

We use frozen packs for "boo-boos" all the time.  It is much more psychological than medical, and my child loves to go get it himself when he gets a minor "hurt".  (There's not much swelling to worry about, but the coolness helps "fix" the problem.)What I like about this one is that I can chill the ice pack separately from the covering.  (We have other brands that have no covering, but we struggle with keeping them out of our little one's mouth, for fear that the gel pack could get punctured and leak over time.)  This lion cool pack, however, since it is furry on the outside, is not appealing to my toddler to place in his mouth, and really is only used for the purpose we intended, which is to place directly on the skin, or the head.It is a little harder than I thought to insert the ice pack, so is not something my toddler could do on his own -an adult really does have to get it ready.  That aside, for the price it really is a reasonable solution.  (The fact that it is an animal also makes it something that my toddler can visualize and easily associate with his "boo-boos".  So, I can say "do you want to go get the boo-boo lion?" instead of "the ice-pack" or something like that.)Recommended.

I have a garden and last year the rabbits just destroyed a couple of plants all summer long.  This year, again, the rabbits destroyed a plant and ate all the leaves. However, I received this product and decided to put it down around the plant anyway to test it.  A few weeks later I was pleasantly surprised to see that the plant had regrown perfectly, and didn't have any damage to any of the leaves.  This was a shock because I realized that I don't think I'd ever seen the plant with leaves like that.  Usually they were nibbled away as fast as they could grow.The product is composed of pellets, and I find this a more durable delivery system than a powder (that stunk to high heaven) I used a few years back.  The pellets are easier to spread, and you don't have to worry about the pellets blowing into the plants while you are placing them down.On the other side, they are NOT odorless.  They do stink, but they are not noticeable (to me) a few feet away, which is how I want it.  The powder I used before tended to get more airborne, and really reeked.  This was much more acceptable.It seems pretty pricey, but if you really have a problem with rabbits it's worth a shot!Recommended.

This organizer has two straps to connect to the back of the car seat -one on top (which goes around your headrest), -and one on the bottom (which goes around the base of your seat).  Both of the straps are adjustable, and both of them can be made to mostly disappear by tucking them under the headrest, and in the section of the seat which joins the top and the bottom.  You won't really see the straps, or feel them when sitting in the seat in front, which is great.I found the installation and adjustment pretty easy, though I thought the top strap wasn't perfect.  It was a really awkward angle for me to apply the last bit of pressure to keep the top of the seat really tight, and I gave up when it was "good enough", instead.  It works fine, but I imagine I'll have to give it another go when it sags a bit over time.As for the pockets, there are several sizes and styles and I found those to be mostly useful.  The drink pockets aren't big, but they are big enough -you'll find containers that will work, even if the pockets don't fit larger ones.  (What I think is a complete waste, though, is that clear plastic pocket on the back.  The suggestion from the company is that this is where you should put a phone -that is about the dumbest idea I've heard, especially since it is a tight fit, and you are prevented from hearing sounds by the plastic, and from touching the screen effectively.  You should have changed the pocket slightly and perhaps marketed it as a place to store those small pocket tissue packs or something...)The design is cute, and my little one is yelling "Mon-keeeeeey!" when he sees it, so that is nice.Finally, what I like best about the organizer is that there are mesh pockets.  This allows me to put my little one's toys in there (like matchbox cars) and still allow me to see where things are stored without having to go digging for it.For the price this is a decent deal, and it does the job without any major flaws.

These lights impressed me by their extremely solid construction.  They are made from metal and glass -a nice change from the cheaper plastic versions I've used in the past.  They also have on/off switches (which aren’t really necessary) but which allow you to wait a full day/night cycle before turning them on to ensure they are fully charged the first full night of use.What I really liked about them was chiefly their rugged build quality, but also the fact that their light continued shining bright, all night long.  I’ve used other versions which really are only bright for a few hours, but these seemed to make it the whole way through.Keep in mind, though, that these are really PATH lights –they don’t shine light UP at your house, as the light is directed downward, in about a one foot radius around the light.  This makes the light PERFECT for lighting up a pathway that you always want seen, or for placing in flower gardens to bring a pleasing color contrast into the night, and giving you a little more visibility/safety around your house.They weren’t perfect, though.  I did have a flake of paint which came off on the stake of one of the lights, and though mine was pretty minor, and not viewable from the angle it was staked at, I gather it is a bigger problem for other users.The other item of note is that I had a tough time twisting on one of the stakes.  One of them went on fine, but the other one required me applying a significant amount of pressure, and then unscrewing the pole, and re-screwing a different part of the pole into a different part of the pole –which helped to fix my problem.  I didn’t have to go to my final step (which was to apply oil or WD-40 to the jamming threads) but I almost had to go there.So, in conclusion, I really like how hearty these path lights are, and I really like the quality and the duration of light they produce.  I thought I little more attention, however, could have been given to quality control in shipping, and I thought the installation experience was harder than expected, and could be very difficult for those with less strength in their hands.  (Use WD-40 to lubricate the threads if this is the case!)EDIT: around a month after I wrote this review one of the two lights has completely died and will no longer function.  Not nearly as durable as I thought!

Ok, so there are too many brands of diapers out there –and there are too many sub-brands of diapers as well.  Huggies and Pampers have at least 5 brands and it gets old really quickly trying to compare and contrast them, along with generic brands and other lesser brands.In our household, we use a combination of Pampers and Huggies, depending on what’s available, and the age of the child.  (We favor the Huggies Overnites for night time sleeping from a size 3 upwards, and mostly Pampers, otherwise…)So, when I got these to try I was really struggling trying to tell the difference between the Huggies Little Snugglers, the Overnites, and a couple of other Pampers brands.After comparing them I really see only a couple of minor differences, but they might be appealing enough to warrant a purchase for testing with your child.First, there is no “pee strip”.  For a really young one I find this essential, so I would choose the Pampers or Huggies versions which both include those instead.  For an older child it becomes less important once the volume of liquid increases, and you’ll smell it before you see the indicator.Second, (and the key for this diapers), there is a nice stretchy waistband on the back which seems to work pretty well.  I’d say that if you are struggling with blowouts that leak out the top back of the diaper then I would definitely purchase these diapers to see if the more secure fit in back makes a difference –because it should.And third, they seem to be a more “value” brand when compared to the other versions, which should save some money.  They are not marketed as Huggies’ “best” diaper, but if you feel you don’t need the “pee strip” then I see no reason why you shouldn’t give these a shot –especially if you can get a good price on them.

I thought this would be somewhat underwhelming and I am happy to say I was wrong.  It really had everything in it that I would have bought myself if I were starting from scratch, and didn't have any of those useless items that companies try to sell new parents who don't have the experience to know whether or not it would be useful.To begin with, in a wise move the box contains three sets of diapers -1 set of newborns and 2 sets of size one.  I say wise because if this is a gift for someone you really don't know how long their infant will be in newborns.  If it is a big baby, not long at all! This allows you to cover all bases, and gives the mother a size up for when the newborn size just doesn't cut it anymore.It also provides you a travel size of baby wipes.  That is nice, but what makes it a real winner is that the case is refillable AND the box comes with a HUGE amount of refills that you can seal with a Ziploc type seal, only taking what you need to refill the travel case.Finally, there are three other features that this package has which makes me really happy with this box:1) The wipes are unscented.  With children's allergies on the rise, and with no knowledge yet of what causes them I try to stick to a less is better mentality when it comes to scents or artificial anything that goes on or in the body.  As such, I always look for unscented wipes, and these fit the bill.  (I was surprised; I thought a gift box would definitely come with scented wipes.)2) The newborn diapers have a cutout for the umbilical cord.  Though only a big deal for a week or so, it was nice that these diapers --unlike another brand I was also using- came with a cutout that prevented abrasion against the umbilical cord.  This was a thoughtful addition, and made it easier to put on the diaper for the first week of life.3) It has a "pee strip".  This is something I'd only previously seen in another brand, and is a must have in my household, so I was pleasantly surprised that these Huggies diapers now included it.Highly recommended as a gift for someone else (or yourself) starting out with a newborn.  It is so useful that if a family got one from someone else as well you'd still be able to use everything in both boxes.Recommended.

We wash our bottles every night in hot soapy water.  However, there are times when this is not feasible –like in a pump room without adequate washing facilities, or while traveling.  In such cases where only a brisk cold water rinse may be possible, and with the availability of a microwave, this product comes to the rescue.It is very simple to use, portable, and sterilizes what you’ve put in the bag in a relatively short time.Another thing I like is that the bag allows you to mark right on it that you’ve used a cycle, so that you can discard it after 20 cycles, when (presumably) the bag starts degrading and potentially leeching plastic byproducts in future cycles.The only downside that I found was that the bag is small and can’t easily fit more than a few items –but if used in travel situations then I’d rate it 5 stars.  (If you plan to use it mostly for home use be sure to buy a bigger bag so you can fit more in it!)

I am a HUGE fan of Five Crowns and of SET.  Those games are really original and entertaining.  This one, however, was not as thought provoking as those were.
