You hear the name of The Mangler, and the sounds of chains and sickles so many times that you get immune to them, rather than scared. At times I felt like I was reading a novel for a young adult reader, sort of a Hardy Boys horror story. The writing is just not mature and creative. The characters - even that of the main character, Brandon - are never really developed into flesh and blood people. And the ending is a total cop out. I didn't give this one star because I reserve that for books that I truly hate and have no redeeming qualities. This had possibilities if put in the hands of a genuine writer. If Mr. Lopez wants to write horror he should read some early Stephen King, Andrew Van Wey or Joe Hart.  Don't just throw clichés at us. If you want to read a real spooky book, read Forsaken, by Andrew Van Wey. Sorry, Mr. Lopez.

I read Andrew Van Wey's Forsaken and I had to get his other books and stories. This is the first I've read of those. I was not disappointed. It is a short novel or novella, which is a story that consists of stories within the story. It borders on fantasy, but is truly a horror story. Written in his usual excellent style, the imagery was vivid, the stories within the book fascinating, and the end truly horrifying and mostly unexpected, though I knew something horrible was going to take place. I don't have much else to say except that Mr. Van Wey did not let me down and I'm looking forward to reading his other books.

This book has been out for a while and reviewed many times, more eloquently than I can write here.  Just let me say that this is one of the best books I have read in the two and a half years I have owned my Kindle. It is beautifully written and is a tremendous courtroom drama, a suspense thriller and, most of all, a psychological portrait of a family in crisis all seen through the tormented mind of the lawyer/protagonist who is narrating the story. It is powerful and will stay with you for a long time. You will probably want to go back to it and reread sections of it. I suspect not many people will read this review, but if you do, you can't go wrong with this book. The only people who might have trouble with it are those who want non-stop action. This is not an action thriller. It is an intelligently written, thought-provoking book and I highly recommend it.

I enjoyed the book, but was hoping for a five star book.  It had a great premise, which you've undoubtedly read about and good characters.  I agree with the reviewers that said this was all about characters, much like Stephen King. But where King's writing is thought provoking and mature, I thought the style of this book, at times, to be a bit simplistic and the plot movements somewhat rambling. Also the ending was not very compelling and was overly abrupt. I think a more imaginative ending was needed along with more exposition on the aftermath. Yet, all in all, it was a very interesting book, with some really mind-blowing action, and certainly quite different from any other books I've read. If you like the premise, then go for it.  Although I enjoyed it, I thought it could have been better. I don't think it is the five star book I was hoping for, but it's still a great first novel.

I have been waiting breathlessly for another novel from Andrew E. Kaufman. He had me in the palm of his hand with the first book I read - The Lion, The Lamb, The Hunted.  I immediately read his other books, While The Savage Sleeps and Darkness and Shadows.  He never fails to disappoint me. I believe he is the best writer of psychological thrillers we have today. This book did not disappoint. It was a mind game to beat all mind games.  At times I felt I was in the middle of a Twilight Zone episode. But the wildest episode ever.  It had me coming and going with all kinds of theories. Written in the first person, from the point of view of the protagonist, Dr. Christopher Kellan, it had you seeing and thinking through his eyes, and wondering what in the world was real. I thought, at times, Mr. Kaufman has finally delved into the supernatural.  What a ride! If you're into psychological thrillers, by all means read this book!

I started out, as I was reading this book, believing I would give this five stars.  But, as it went on, I settled on four.  I didn't go lower because I love Mr. Russell's writing.  I think that's what makes the book, rather than the story.  This is the second book with Detective Gideon and his dog partner Sirius, the first one being Burning Man.  I loved that book, and I believe I gave that 5 stars.  I am not a dog lover, but I love the interaction between Gideon and Sirius.  The writing is very humorous.  Also, unlike one critical reviewer, I like Mr. Russell's references to music and literature.  He seems a knowledgeable and intelligent man.  As to his descriptions of LA, I have learned to skim description that I don't find important and don't find that interferes with my enjoyment of a book.  My problem with this book is the misnomer of calling it a mystery.  That is what I expected.  The initial premise is fascinating.  A homeless man, who is actually an intelligent former engineer ruined by alcohol, witnesses what appears to be the murder of an angel.  Finding out what happened there is what I expected to be the mystery.  Instead this veered off into high tech villains, an actress of dubious motives, a reunion with the killer from Burning Man, a Reluctant Hero, and events that unfolded in a very rapid pace towards the end of the book.I think this is more of a thriller/suspense.  I found the events a bit far-fetched and somewhat confusing.  Yet, Mr. Russell's writing kept me sufficiently interested to want to get to the end.  Maybe if this had been billed as a thriller, I might have not been as critical.  I still think this was a good book, but not what I was led to believe.  I think Burning Man and Multiple Wounds were better Russell books.Spoiler:  (The original mystery is never really resolved, except by conjecture at the end of the book.)
Got this for my girlfriend.  She loves it.  She can't get enough of it.  Makes all kinds of things with it.

I thought this was the best movie of the year - not Slumdog Millionaire (which I also loved).  Brad Pitt was phenomenal, as was Kate Blanchett.  A truly classy movie.  One I love to watch over and over.
All of their greatest songs.  A must-have for fans of this group.  I love it.

I am clearly in the minority, here.  This book got rave reviews, apparently not only from Amazon readers, but from the literary world alike.  The book is a great period piece and, for those wanting that and some history added to their murder mystery, this might be the perfect book.  I agree with one reviewer that Nell seems to have acquired a great deal of knowledge, unbelievably so, in the four years since she was taken in by the doctor, from the low life she was living, to the point of knowing languages, philosophy, psychology, medicine, what have you.  Hard to believe.  But that didn't bother me.  I just couldn't get into the pace of the book and the constant painting of the period and the people.  Ms. Ryan has clearly done a lot of research and for history buffs who also like a murder mystery, this might be a five star book.  I was somewhat annoyed that Nell never even asked the accused if he was actually guilty until the end of the book.  Anyway, three stars is the best that I could do for this book.  Read all of the other reviews and make up your own mind.
This is just what I hoped for.  A well-made CD wallet for my CD's.  The cover is strong, the stitching good and the pages seem durable and hold all of my CD's.  No complaints here.
I don't usually rate movies.  Only books.  But this thriller is a winner.  Watch it!

This is a great little thriller.  It is over a hundred years in the future.  Global warming has taken over and everywhere it is parched and dry.  Man has engineered produce to grow in this climate of little rain.  Yet, progress has been made.  Man has isolated the gene that causes psychopathic killers and they have disappeared (at least from this country).  Yet Sheriff MacArthur Gray, who moved from a big city to a town called Shillings, somewhere in the mid-west, is suspicious over a number of deaths and disappearances that, to him, point to a psychopath on the loose.  Anyone he hints this to tells him he is crazy and not to voice his suspicion or he lose his job, or worse.  No one will take him seriously.  I like the way this protagonist thinks and talks.  The dialogue and writing is very intelligent.  Although the main villain is guessable, I had him on my list of suspects but was leaning in a different direction.  I would give this 5 stars, but I did not care for the climactic scenes.  There was way too much description of the fighting, which went on and on, was not that exciting and a bit unbelievable.  I equate long fighting sequences in a book to car chase scenes in a movie.  They are just not that interesting.  It is the mental games that are played, leading up to them, that are of the most interest.  I also did not like the abrupt ending.  I would have like a bit of an epilogue as to what played out after the final battle.  Otherwise, this was an exciting thriller and I will look for more from Joe Hart.

I usually write a review when I have finished a book.  Not so in this case.  I am a bit over halfway through with it and not very impressed.  I recently rated another collection of short supernatural stories and gave it four stars.  My object in downloading books of this nature is simply to find diverting reading, while waiting for the beginning of the month and my next books to borrow or download for free.  The stories don't have to be great or memorable.  Simply diverting and good for passing the time.  That book (I don't remember the name, offhand) was that for me.  This one is not.  I simply don't care for the stories.  Maybe in the second half of the book there will be one or two I would rate highly, but in the first half there was not one good story.  Definitely too gory and just not very well written.  If I change my mind when I read the rest of the book, I will amend my review.  But I don't expect to.

Let me start by simply saying I just didn't get it.  This is sort of a fantasy/science fiction/thriller/romance.  I didn't really take to the characters and I didn't find it all that thrilling.  Romance is something I am not interested in reading.  This takes place in some unknown world at some unknown time.  Some things seem behind us in technology and others ahead of us. A lot of things are named in Latin and it takes some time to even understand what some things are, such as the motorcycle Penny (the protagonist) rides, the mechanical butterflies and mechanical horses, etc.  I just didn't take to this fantasy world and found the battle of the good guys against the bad guys confusing and not that interesting.  The only experience that I've had in fantasy is my favorite book, which is Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings. This is not that kind of fantasy. I can only rate this based on my own tastes. I picked this book from the Kindle Firsts, because the editor raved so much about it. I do believe that many readers will give this four or five stars, if this is their kind of book. It's not a bad book, just not very interesting to me.  I have to admit, though, that it is different.I just read some other reviews and discovered that this book is in a genre called Steam Punk.  That is where the setting is something like the late 19th century, but there are inventions like those of H.G. Wells, that take us into the future.  I must say that this may be why I found this so confusing.  Now that I know this, I can say that I am not a fan of Steam Punk. I suppose it might have helped had I known the genre before I started. It didn't engage me.  I see it got a lot of high reviews.  I suppose there are a lot of fans of this type of book. So my rating can't be based on how this rates within that genre, as I am not familiar with it, but simply what I thought of it as a book. Boring, confusing and not believable.

The cover may look scary, but I assure your the movie is not.  It sort of plays like a network movie of the week.  The acting is like family fare.  The ending has a bit of a twist, but when you think about it, it makes no sense.  Diverting fluff, but not much horror.

I saw a request from Amazon to review this short story.  I didn't even remember reading it. I had to retrieve it from the cloud and skim it to remember what it was and why I didn't bother reviewing it.  I think this story is a total waste of time and am amazed at the four reviews it has, all giving it 5 stars.  It plays on the premise that you will be scared for this blind person who hears noises in her new apartment and will be terror-stricken about the fact that she is blind and has to calculate every move.  The story makes absolutely no sense and the ending is extremely vague and ludicrous.  I wouldn't waste 5 minutes on this story.

I'm not up to writing a long review.  This is a solid courtroom mystery/thriller.  The characters are well-developed.  The dialogue and the courtroom action seem genuine.  I was intrigued and looked forward to getting back to it, after putting it down.  However, it was a bit overlong, at 419 pages, and lacked a real twist of an ending, which I had expected.  Nevertheless, it's a good book and I recommend it.

I am a great horror/ghost story fan.  Outside of Stephen King, it is often hard to find a good one.  Even Koontz doesn't always fit the bill, often writing good thrillers, but not in the supernatural vein.  I really look for good ghost stories, as I enjoy these more than vampires, werewolves, zombies, and slasher novels.  One of my favorite movies is "The Changeling" with George C. Scott.  I'm in good company, as Stephen King, in a documentary interview, named that movie as one that influenced him.  It is not only a spooky ghost story, but has a great mystery back story that unfolds to a tremendous climax at the end of the movie.  This book has the same aspects.  The characters are well-developed.  You really get to feel for Evan and his son, Shaun.  That is an important ingredient in a story.  Then, it has a great back story, that slowly gets unraveled, as Evan does more and more research about the island that he is staying on, thanks to his friend Jason, who let him stay there when he lost his job.  I won't go into the details of the story, as I don't like to give much away, and other reviewers are already telling you much.  But it builds and builds to a whopping climax, that you won't want to put the book down until you get to.  The ending makes perfect sense and doesn't leave you dissatisfied.  If you like a good ghost story, with a good mystery behind it, go for this book.  I am so surprised when I find a good story like this, free for the borrowing, or free for the buying.  Good supernatural stories are rare.  Read this one and you won't be disappointed.I want to edit my review, somewhat.  I still give this book 5 stars (though four and a half would be more accurate).  The ending made sense in the context of the story and didn't leave me angry, but was not the ending I had hoped for.  This, after a comment from Rich B, who said it was not a perfect ending.  I agree, it was not a perfect ending, but acceptable.  As to his comment that it was not really scary, I find that most horror stories can be spooky and creepy, but don't usually scare me, the way a movie can.

I debated giving this book 4 stars due to one problem I had with it, but since I enjoyed the book so much and really find Jeff Gunhus' writing to be up there with the best of the horror writers, I decided to give it 5 stars.  Oddly, the plot line reminded me a bit of the King book Doctor Sleep, which was a sequel to The Shining, and also involved an evil group going after someone with psychic powers, carried over from the previous book.  I wonder if Mr. Gunhus was at all influenced by King's book.  Nevertheless, it is a powerful book, in its own right and well worth reading by horror fans.  It has just the right amount of blood and gore, excellent pacing, and terrific characters, especially Joseph Lonetree and the evil Mama D. (not to mention Sarah, the main character).  It was a worthy sequel, and this from someone that doesn't care for sequels.  I loved Stephen King's The Shining, but was not that taken with Doctor Sleep.  This book never had me bored and had me eager to get back to it whenever I could.  I read one reviewer's take that you wouldn't understand this if you hadn't read the first book.  I do agree that reading the first book is very helpful.  In fact, I had forgotten some of the first book, and since I had only borrowed it from the Amazon library, I couldn't go back to check some things.  So it is helpful to have read the first book, and even more if you had just read it, or own it to go back to.  On the other hand, the author does make many references to the events in the first book, so it might be possible to read this on its own.  My only problem with the book was the ending.  Not the final ending, which seemed to leave room for yet another sequel, but rather the climactic confrontation (I won't go into detail, as not to spoil anything).  I found it a bit over the top and hard to suspend disbelief (even for horror fans).  A bit too confusing with the out-of-body brain traveling.  But I enjoyed the book so much, that I let that go.  I still prefer the first book and strongly recommend that you read Night Chill.  It is one of my favorites.  But this is a worthy sequel and I think I've rambled enough, so go read both of these - NOW!  (LOL)
Terrific addictive game.

Ian Colmes is having trouble getting over the murder of his son, Alex.  He keeps seeing and hearing him.  Is he going mad, or is he seeing ghosts?  The police have found the murderer, dead, partly from Alex defending himself, but is there more to the story?  Why is Alex back?  This is a terrific ghost story/mystery/thriller.  I loved it.  The character of Ian Colmes is painted with good detail and his life follows a pattern you would expect from what he is going through.  You want to find the answer and you won't put this book down until you do.  Unless the subject matter puts you off, and I can see that with a lot of parents of young children, I heartily recommend this book.

I have to admit that I only read half of the stories, so far.  My rating is solely based on this anthology of horror stories fitting my needs.  And that is to fill up the time between novels, with very readable and diverting stories.  This perfectly fit the bill.  The stories are between 20 and 30 pages and vary quite a bit in their style and content.  But I have found them to be eminently readable and diverting and quite useful to fill in the gaps when I have nothing to read.  They're not all great, but they're mostly okay and the length is just right for short stories.  I have read those 3 page shockers and found them a waste of time.  So if you like supernatural or horror stories, want some stories that are light reading, to fill in the time, this is a good collection.

It's not often that I don't finish a Kindle book.  Not only did I only get a bit over half-way, but I found myself playing Solitaire to avoid getting back to this book.  This book was definitely mislabeled as a mystery.  It should be called a young adult mystery.  Hail all Nancy Drew lovers.  This is a book for teenagers and I often felt I was reading a book written by a teenager.  It involves two teenage girls attempting to solve a murder mystery, with the aid of a delinquent teenage boy, who grows pot in his back yard, and convinces one of the girls' mothers that he is a private detective, or something of that ilk.  Although the boy's chapters are written in the first person, most of the chapters involve the girls and, though they are written in the third person, you get the feeling that you are reading a book by the one girl, Betty.  You have groundings, boys being dumped or not being dumped, school papers, teenage issues.  I am really dumbfounded by the amount of good reviews this book got.  I can only guess that there are a lot of Nancy Drew fans (or former fans) out there, who liked this sort of thing.  I found it intensely boring and finally gave up after reading 54%.  I really don't care who the murderer turns out to be.  The only admirable thing about this book is the adult way that it handles the fact that Betty has two lesbian mothers.  No big deal about it and handled as a normal fact of life.  Bravo for that!  Otherwise, I found the writing of this not to be on a par with many of the other books I've read on Kindle, even the self-published ones.  If you're into teenage sleuthing (as improbable as it is) and teenage issues, then give this more stars (maybe 3) and go for it.  As for me, I'm glad to take it off of my Kindle, be done with this review, and get on to my next Kindle book, which is a Prime Lending Library book called Alex, and which looks a lot more my style.

I would like to have given this book a higher review.  It was written well.  The characters were drawn well with sufficient depth and the protagonist, Jeff Resnick, was a likeable character.  I didn't mind the use of visions appearing to Jeff, as a result of his mugging in Manhattan but don't get the idea that this is a book on the supernatural.  It is simply used as a device in this detective mystery.  My main hangup with this book is that the murderer is discovered early on in the book and the majority of the book is uncovering evidence and more facts surrounding the murder.  I would have liked to have a surprise ending or, at least, an attempt at one.  There was no attempt to hide the identity of the murderer, only the circumstances surrounding the murder.  That took away a lot of suspense for me.  Too bad, because Ms. Bartlett seems a talented writer.  I liked the device of the ESP, but would have liked to have been surprised.  So it's okay, but could have been better.  I would possibly give one of her other books a try.

I would have liked to have been more enthusiastic about this book.  It is not badly written and I have the feeling that Mr. Wier is capable of writing good mysteries.  Unfortunately, this is not one.  The protagonist, Bill Travers (a money launderer who likes to call himself a financial advisor), seems intelligent and likeable, but the characters are not deeply drawn.  You don't feel much for them.  The love affair jumps in right from the beginning and you feel it is obligatory.  But most of all, there is no compelling mystery.  Usually a mystery starts with a murder - or it may contain a series of murders, and you have to guess "who done it."  There may be a back story, usually something from the past, that adds even more to the plot.  Unfortunately, this novel's only mystery is "where is the money?"  Not only that, but everyone, including Bill Travers, seems to know early on, except for the reader.  And who cares anyway?  Yes, there are some killings along the way.  But suspense is never really built and you don't really care about the solution.  Frankly, I found this rather boring.  I am not talking about the style, but the plot, which I find rather weak.  Even the back story from 1927 - who cares?!!  Since mysteries are all about the plot (not to say that the characters aren't important, as well) this lacks the substance of a good mystery.  I'm not going to go into the details of the plot.  It's not worth talking about.  Maybe his later books in this series are better.  Sorry, Mr. Weir.

This was a reread of this book for me.  I read this book a long time ago, along with Shoeless Joe (the book Field of Dreams was based on).  I loved it then and still loved it now.  It deals with baseball and fantasy, like Shoeless Joe, but is much more enigmatic.  Shoeless Joe ultimately becomes a "dream come true" while this leaves you with ideas to ponder on the nature of obsession, dreams, love and reality.  It is still a fantastic and magical trip that takes the protagonist back in time to witness the obsession he has had about the existence of The Iowa Baseball Confederacy in 1908, which only his father and he seem to know about.  It is a delight to read.  It requires extreme suspension of disbelief, as the most fantastical occurrences seem to happen, but go with it and enjoy it.  I won't say more about the plot, as many other reviewers have done so already.  But if you love the game, love time travel and the fantastic, and are willing to question the nature of our loves and goals, this book is definitely for you.  My favorite, though, still remains Shoeless Joe, which I intend to reread next.

I did a whole bunch of research before I settled on this flash drive and I'm quite happy that I did.  I wanted a large capacity flash drive to put on my key chain to carry around my photos and music, should something happen to my home.  My first backup is an external  hard drive which stays in my home.  I wanted something to carry with me at all times and would fit on my key chain.  I already have an Integral encrypted, password-protected flash drive for my documents.  I didn't need encryption for my music and pictures.  I looked in Amazon at many drives.  Many didn't have keychain loops.  Of those that did, this seemed the best.  The similar-looking Kingston Digital Data Traveler had several accounts of the insides falling out.  I didn't want to take that chance.  The San Disk Cruzer Fit seemed very small and more suited for a laptop or car stereo and not to be taken off and put on.  Also the loop seemed too small for my keychain.  The Patriot Pulse Series had one comment that it was not good for a key chain, as the cap would fall off.  Most of the rest were not made for key chains.  I have had this for a while, now, constantly deleting my old picture backup and replacing it with a new one (my music doesn't change that much).  First of all, it feels quite sturdy and fits beautifully on my key chain.  Banging around with my keys doesn't seem to have affected it.  No sign of the insides falling out and never a crash.  It inserts well into both my computer and my girlfriend's.  I am not an expert on speed, but it seems to be on a par with most flash drives. By the way, I took one person's advice that the 128 GB flash drives are not that stable, yet.  So I am very pleased with this purchase and recommend it enthusiastically for anyone looking for a large capacity flash drive for their key chain.

There should be a rating for 4 and a half stars.  I liked this book a lot and was considering giving this 5 stars.  I may still consider it a 5 star book.  I was, however, a bit disappointed in the climax.  But really, finding the main culprit is less the purpose of this book than becoming intimate with the character of Danny Beckett and the need for him to discover who the murder victim was.  First of all, several people compare him to James Lee Burke.  I have not read anything by that author, so I can't compare them.  There have been complaints by some of boring parts.  I find that incredible as this was a short novel, not filled with a lot of extraneous descriptions.  I have learned, on all  of my reading, to skim through description that I think is superfluous.  There was not much to skim here.  As to the criticisms of this as a police procedural, that a cop wouldn't be listening to BBC, or that race wasn't mentioned, or other police procedurals, I think they are missing the point.  This is really more of a character study, both of the detective and the murder victim.  Danny Beckett is intriguing, and I do believe he could be listening to BBC. The mystery was more who was "Bishop," the murder victim, and what was he all about than capturing the bad guy. I was a bit disappointed in the ending, as I expected more. Hence the 4 stars.  But this was a very well crafted book, which I had trouble putting down.  It's sensitive and, I feel, genuine.  I would recommend this to anyone, except those looking for a punch ending with a complete twist that knocks your socks off.  It's not that kind of book, and, if you don't crave that ultimate twist and surprise ending, give this 5 stars.

I had read many reviews before buying this set of horror novels and most said that, though not all of them were winners, there were some that were very good and this was a great buy for 99 cents.  I haven't gone back to look at the reviews, but I have to say that I read many horror books and I truly feel there was not one single real winner in this set. There were some truly creepy moments and a few had you turning the pages, not wanting to put it down, but I feel all of them were, in some way flawed or not up to a really top-notch horror.  I'm giving it two stars, instead of one, because it had some good moments.  Here is a rundown:1. Virgin - this was written in the style of a horror novel, but early on you saw it was religious in its substance.  The story was moderately entertaining and kept your interest, but the ending was pure religious hogwash. Really disappointing ending.  Totally corny.2. Haunted House - I had read several books by Kilborn (Konrath) and, although he is a bit gory for my taste, I was prepared for that and was expecting a really good haunted house book.  First of all, there are a lot of characters and it goes back and forth, so at first it can be a bit confusing.  You do get to know them and settle in for a really good haunted house book.  Once again, the ending totally ruined this book.  The secret behind the occurrences is a big letdown and the conclusion of the book has the feeling that Mr. Konrath just wanted to end this and threw the ending together without a lot of thought.  This could have been much better.3. Wolf Hunt - Forget this one altogether.  I call it "Waiting for Godot" meets "The Wolfman."  Two thugs are hired to transport, in a caged van, a supposed werewolf to a rich client.  Is it really a werewolf?  Since this is a horror story, I'll give you one guess.  There is carnage galore, so that is not a problem.  The problem is that for the majority of the book, these supposed thugs are discussing, and discussing every little thing as though they were intellectuals.  Totally out of character for thugs and really boring.  It goes on and on, and you can't wait for this book to end.  It is also overlong, especially in the light of the endless repartee.  I suppose you are supposed to find the repartee amusing but I just found it boring.4. Eerie - This book about missing people, including a cop, and a monster under the bed causing weird things to happen, is a real page turner.  I couldn't stop reading this and was all set to give this one top scores.  The action was really intriguing and you cared about the characters.  Then came the most ridiculous ending I can imagine - sort of a cross between science fiction and religion.  Totally ludicrous and ruined what should have been the big winner in this set.  Makes no sense whatsoever.  Give this book a good ending and you have a real 5-star book.5. Speed Dating With The Dead - Believe it, or not, even with this ridiculous title, this one comes closest to a true horror story.  Similar to Konrath's "Haunted House," a group of ghost hunters, or paranormal investigators, set about to investigate the most haunted house in the country.  The manager of the group seems to be only out for money, and not really a believer.  Or is he?  That is one of the problems with this book.  Not a bad book, it is very complicated, with many characters, going back and forth between them, and you don't totally understand the motivation for all of them. Do they believe? Do they not believe? Are they trying to disprove or are they trying to create hoax. A bit convoluted and, sometimes confusing.  But it does come together as a true horror story and has a good ending.  No hogwash.  It could have been written in a creepier style, though.  A bit too matter-of-fact. So, again, not terrific but not bad.6. The Final Winter - I'm not sure what to say about this one. I'm not even sure I how I would rate this on its own.  The entire world seems to be covered by a tremendous snow storm that threatens life on earth.  The story centers around a group of characters in a bar, a supermarket and a video store. The characters were handled in depth and you really got to care about some of them.  There were some truly horrifying scenes and this was a page-turner.  The ending was somewhat satisfying, but again  (note this may be a spoiler for some) veered too much to the religious for my taste in horror stories.  If you don't mind that, then this one was the real winner of the group.
Forget it.  Don't bother downloading this free story.  I read it a while ago and didn't bother rating it.  Totally unmemorable.

I was just looking for some short horror stories to read on a train ride. This was a waste of time. The stories are much too short to leave you with anything meaningful. The only good short horror is The Turtle Boy.

After reading The Bird Eater, I decided I had found a good horror writer. When I saw this in the lending library, I knew I had to read it. I wasn't disappointed. Ms Ahlborn has crafted one chilling horror story. Almost a bit too chilling. I might have ended it a bit differently. But I don't want to give anything away. This is sort of like The Bad Seed meets The Omen, meets the Exorcist. The characters are well crafted and the plot moves swiftly. It just followed a different road than I would have liked and was frustrated at times. But it's a good story and I recommend it.

I am a Prime member and had to choose a free  book for this month.  I couldn't decide between this and the international thriller (whose name I can't recall right now).  I opted for this one because it looked like an easy read and the thriller was very military, and supposedly overdone with military jargon - not my cup of tea.  I didn't expect too much out of this book, but boy was I wrong!  This is an expertly done mystery and thought provoking look into morals and life's meanings.  I am dumbfounded that some reviewers found this book either boring or confusing, or both.  True, it starts off with very short chapters, like small vignettes, but very early moves into more conventional style.  I disagree with those who said it didn't flow.  I thought it flowed beautifully. Rather than jumping from one character and scene to another, as is the current trend, I find this basically follows a linear flow.  True, it is broken up, almost between every chapter, with flashbacks (in italics) to an earlier time relating to the facts behind the murder/accident.  But that only heightens the mystery.Yes, the characters, basically the lead investigator, Franza, are flawed, but that only makes the book more meaningful. Is there a lot of talking and do we go into Franza's head to see what she is thinking?  Yes, but that makes the book all the more real, and I did not find it in the least boring.  No, this isn't action-packed, with a killer on the loose, threatening everyone, including the detective.  It is more intelligent than that.  It is somewhat like a good foreign film compared to an American blockbuster.  What kept me riveted to this book was the mystery behind the girl and the gradual uncovering of her life and the people who were part of it.  I felt it kept uncovering more and more layers, until I couldn't put the book down without finding the terrific conclusion.You don't have to like Franza, or any of the other detectives to love this book.  Sure, there is infidelity that seems to be more accepted than in this country, but that only adds to the reality of this book. The driving force behind the book was the girl and the mystery behind her death.  There seems to be something hauntingly beautiful about her and you want to find out what really happened to her.  There seems to be much more to the story than meets the eye and you sort of know that and can't wait to find out more.  I did not guess the ending and am surprised at the first reviewer who thought it was easy.  I am also surprised at the reviewer who criticized the translation.  How can you do that, unless you have read it in German, or unless it was unintelligible?  On the contrary.  It was highly intelligent and often poetic.  Would I like to see a sequel?  No.  It ended perfectly.  More novels with these detectives.  Yes.  In short, I thought this book was terrific - and to think it was her first adult novel!  Excellent.  Don't pass this one up!  I'm sorry my review may have come too late to get much attention. I wish I could have reviewed it sooner.

This so-called horror movie, about a junkie and his friend who's trying to clean him up in an old cabin in the woods, has supernatural events that aren't very scary and an end that leaves you totally dissatisfied.  It's not bad enough to be a one-star, but you can pass on this.  Mostly, a waste of time.

I really was looking for a head set versus ear buds for work as we moved to an open floor plan and wanted something that singled from behind that I was in the zone.Positives: Easy to carry/store, foldable, nice sound quality. Easy to adjust. Expands size to fit around larger heads- I actually used the smallest setting on my head- I'd find the set harder to fit on smaller heads (children). Comfortable- compared to ear buds. Cord is wrapped - less tangles than my previous pair of ear buds. Didn't really use the play/pause button but love the idea of the feature.Negatives: A little smaller than my ear so feels a bit weird of a fit- but got used to quickly. It does not cancel out outside noise.No issues with pads or set but it's only been 11 days of use.**received sample at a discounted price for review purposes**

I had no idea what tor eally expect when receiving these.Application: Easy to put on, started at the top above my belly button and guided my hand down to avoid wrinkles. Easy to apply- no immediate reaction. It was a cool feeling when applied.Use: I didn't feel anything different while in use. No stiff feeling from the wrap. You do have to wear it for 6 hours. I did this while sleeping and did not experience any adverse effects (or dreams).Removal: This was the tricky part. It hurt... not a lot but it was painful in the areas I have stretch marks from pregnancy. It really sticks tot he skin and doesn't peel... which is great except when it's been 6 hours and in the AM, you are stripping it from your skin.Does it work? I feel like it worked a bit but not enough for me to purchase these regular at $10+ a wrap. If it was more like $2 to $4 per wrap, I'd consider it or if it was $40 a month versus 10 days. I love the idea of a detox wrap with cleansing my diet on Mondays after a rough weekend- just don't have solid proof it's working.**received sample for review purposes**

This is my second similar looking toilet seat. It was a bit weird with the anti-slamming function. When installing, I thought I had a defective lid but turns out I was reading the instructions wrong. Overall- I love these types of lids- easy to maintain with a toilet training toddler and this one is way better than the last- it stains less and more adult friendly with the  anti-slamming. It's only been about 2 weeks but thus far better than the last.Another note- My son never used the plastic seats you buy at the store and went right to this- Avoid adding another potty to your bathroom and try this first. It worked for my second.... my first I bought too many toddler potties and spent the time to wash it out. I'd rather flush and forget ;) lol

Love the sticky notes- works well for the office. The calendar is a nice touch- 2015 and 2016 (versus the picture which is 2010). I use a lot of sticky notes and usually name brand but these worked decently.  Wish I could purchase in different colors but the colors provided are the standard which is fine. I thought the holder was the best feature... easy to add to and can use your favorite brands and select whatever you'd like. Perfect for your favorite colleague, receptionist or office manager- OR yourself. I select myself :)Negative: My only issues is the quality of the pen holder. It's not a selling point for me (the pen holder)**received for review purposes**

Love the labels- the pen is ok. I have a couple pens in random colors that I like better BUT the labels are great! We put them in jars and labeled them with numbers and I have my kids put in the number of marbles that matches the numbers. It's a great way to teach counting and you can re-label them by simply wiping the label. I suggest wiping after you are done because a few days in- it can stain the label.**received sample for review purposes**

I've been using this hamper for the past 3 weeks. I wasn't sure if it would be sturdy enough or hold enough but it's been PERFECT for my kids clothes. Not only does it teach them about lights and darks but it's keeps my life organized. It does fit adult clothing (not to exclude this) but it's almost impossible to get my husband to sort his clothing.It's much sturdier than it looks... while it does wrinkle (shown in picture) you can steam it out to look nicer if you'd like.  It holds a lot of clothing. Each side is a full load of clothing...in case you were wondering.**received as a sample** but am interested in purchasing another. At $15- it's definitely worth it.

Initially got these at a department store and it was the only thing I could find in khaki at school time. I wanted something more brand name (like store name) and was weary with the name "French toast" but after bringing them home- I fell in love! These have the adjustable waist and it's in pink to give a little more girl feel to them. Overall, fits perfect and great quality & durable. Bought a pair for each day! Also bought the French Toast shirts.
Terrible movie... I actually left the room midway through of boredom.

Love the color changing!1. Came with TWO mugs!2. Really work with hot water!3. Different design than I’d expect!4. Simplistic colors5. Nicely packaged in individual boxes6. Nice gift for the office!**Received sample for review purposes**

Love that these have funny sayings on them. I am always in the market for foil opener- These dull out or I lose them.1. Funny with sayings2. Sharp enough to open foil3. Easy to use4. Comes with 25. Nicely packaged in individual boxes6. Nice gift for wine night with the girls!**Received sample for review purposes**

Have not used this yet but overall based on experience with lures- it’s an 8 out 10 leaning to the better side of lures used.1. Decent size2. Lure is stainless steel3. Bit of glow in the dark4. Individually wrapped5. Lightweight.6. Sharp**Received sample for review purposes**

Very Cute & Inexpensive set. This is a perfect set for anyone who LOVES to decorate for the holidays.1. Festive!2. Easy to set up- literally 5 minutes.3. It’s easy to wash- dropped it in today to do a test run. No issues4. Full set to decorate whole bathroom5. Lightweight.6. It’s relatively thin- so don’t expect something you might typically purchase for your bathroom that you’d have in there for regular use.**Received sample for review purposes**

Overall, these are not the average crappy organizers you may get at the local department store. These are perfect for anyone who wants to pay the money up front and have quality & stylish organizers for years.Design: 3 boxes in all- each different shapes. All fit together in one drawer for maximum organization. Each box is made of a thick material & sturdy with a fabric outside. These are collapsible but not a huge selling point for me since I would necessarily store them flat.Size: Somewhat small as they all fit in one drawer. I’d have to get 6 sets for my full dresser which would be a bit pricey for me.**received for review purposes**

Positives: Looks like it’s easy to wash- just drop in washer. Bed is soft. My cat liked the bed and being at the window. No issues with suction cups- only been a week but so far so good.Negatives: Look a while to put together & was a huge PITA. I actually had to stop and then restart later.  The strings don’t look all that attractive. Doesn’t look like it will hold a lot of weight.**received sample for review purposes**

Cute product! I got these as fun décor for my instax camera and wanted a fun way to scrapbook and share pictures with people. It's a little weird to peel on the go but fun! Hoping to get another set for a friends wedding for a different type of photo album that people can take pics of their own and put in a scrap book with a note. I saw a review of someone who used regular pictures and though that was a great idea! Not sure why I didn't think of that. Overall- sticks good, cute variety, lots of frames! solid deal!**received for review purposes **

I went through previous reviews and tried to test this product out for the area's that people had issues with. I've used this hose a total of 12 different times in the span of 6 days (AM and PM). Results:1. It is lightweight and easy to carry2. It is a bit cheaper feeling that I'd expect however I didn't have any leaks in the hose itself3. I did have a hard time getting a solid fit on the spout and it leaked every time I turned it on. Not sure if this is user error or product issue.I think the trick with these types of hoses is you need to drain all the water our and then store the hose someplace- just not leave it on the ground. I had a similar one in the past and someone gave me that feedback and it's worked well for me.**received product for review purposes**

I purchased these for the dance class Halloween party. I had a great experience with custom body art products and was excited to try out another product as the last product I tried was awesome. This product was great. It was easy to use and had every possible color you could imagine. For 100 kids, this was the perfect solution. Waiting to use it for all the kids but did a trial on my  kids and it was awesome! The make up lasts but then it's hard to get off- needed to use witch hazel wipes to remove. Overall- nice product- lots of colors- perfect for parties. ***received for review purposes**

Very hipster... cute style and nice fit. Made from Bamboo and extremely unique. Definitely a conversation starter. Hard to break. Comes in a nice case to keep the  glasses part unscratched. Very light to hold- feels like nothing at all. Super sturdy... already dropped a few times and they are fine. **received for receive purposes**

These curtain are very lovely. Wasn't sure how the color rust would look but has a great fall look! They are not as solid as the picture but have a see-thru look to them. Perfect for a little light but also cover so no one can see inside.  Picture shows my hand and my kitchen with multiple lights. Love the design which allows for some blockage. Love the grommet openings- looks great on my curtain rod. Overall- happy. Did not wash yet so will have to come back and respond to durability on washing. ***received for review purposes**

Liked the dress a lot. I'm 5'11 and 170 pounds and have a chest portioned. This fit wel and looked nice. Wish I got it in black versus blue but overall happy. **received a slight discount for review purposes**

I stopped using my coffee maker because I didn't want to spent the money for $1 a cup... they eliminate the issue and allow me to buy the coffee I want. BRIGHT color sets it a side and use this for decaf. Overall nice quality- allows for 2 "cups" versus having to wash one to make my husband a set. ***received for review purposes**

Very cut but meant for a smaller chest. I'm  5'11" and about 170lbs... with a chest to fit my frame and it wasn't great in the large size. everything but the chest was nice. LOVE the design and the fabric is nice. Meant for C cup or less. ** received at a slight discount for review**

Had a huge rain shower and put this in my basement.... went down in a couple hours and was able to dump a little water- helped eliminate some smell and relieved some of the humidity in my basement. After a few hours- the Adaptor was hot which made me nervous. Not sure I'm sold on the product- tried a few times but was hoping for better impact- it's a huge storm and expected more. LOVED another product so may have expected more out of something so small **received a slight discount for review purposes**
It's small and short. It went to my belly button. Got X-large to be bigger and need an XXL though I wear Medium and Large normally. Order up but know it's not long. What a waste of $18. :(

Etekcity smoke detector was a replacement for our kitchen detector. It works well- maybe a bit too well for the kitchen. lol..Positives: LOUD, Lasts 10 years versus replacing every 6 to 12 months-no need to buy batteries- just replace in 10 years , smaller than our other detectorsNegatives: It's good for 10 years which puts us out of rotation- but could be something new for us if we replaced all of them.**received for review purposes**

The dress is ok for my body- IT60064_BLACK . it is not as attractive for an hour glass figure and not quite big enough for my chest. I'm 5'11" and about 170 pounds and purchased a large. It fits but just isn't as flattering as I'd like. The stitching is solid and the material is thick... just not flattering to my shape.**received for review purposes**

Sometimes I wonder what the exact temperature that I like wine. This product is really cool- I've been testing it out for a week and figured out how long I need to have a bottle in the refrigerator to drink (I don't have a ton of room to leave bottles in when not planning to drink). My perfect temp is 42 degrees and takes about 60 minutes in the refrigerator after being in our basement.**received for review purposes**

I've seen these at several weddings and got these for as a bridal gift for a bride who has been looking for these! They stuck on great and she loved them!! Perfect for any bride. They look just like the picture. **received a discount for review purposes**

I freaking loved this pillow cover. It's nice to have a Christmas decoration that is something that can be folded up and packed up. I want a set for every holiday and just bought a second case for my other pillow- AWESOME PRICE. Pictures below show the case against the pillows I have and it stuffed in the case. Wish they had these for fall! I'd buy for each season if they had them. **received a slight discount for 1 for review purposes- bought a second at full price based on how awesome it was**Revised- Bought a second one (full price) and it came in a lighter color- same print. Very odd.

Elf on the shelf is MANDATORY for anyone with children. I already brought this out even though we have a few months because it helps my children understand that you are only rewarded for being good & Santa is always watching. I have the original boy with the book but love that this one comes with the DVD and for the same price if not less than what I bought in the stores. Perfect for anyone with a child 1 year or older... it might be bribery but it's worth it! **received a slight discount for review purposes**

It's a nice set but it's not made of the quality feeling material of the diaper bags I've purchase previously- though this is a lot less than I've spent in the past. It's worth the cost as it comes with 3 pieces and has a lot of compartments. Easy to wash and functional. Not sure I like the backpack part- made for a thin mom- someone under 5'8" and less than 160lbs. Cute though for active moms that want something cute and again- I washed it twice to test it out and it held up. Was impressed as the material didn't feel like it would hold up. **Received a slight discount for review purposes- I only purchased this for review and did everything to "beat it up" for review. I

Very cute summer dress. A little short for someone my height 5'11" but perfect for summer. I'm about 170lbs and the large fits great. It gives me curves and fits great. It's a little thin but perfect for warmer temperatures and is a great price. Love the blue with the stripes. Covers my chest but allows a little peek to show my shape. Cute for those who want the look of the model but are a bit bigger. **received at a slight discount for review purposes**

I wasn't sure what to expect for the price but it's what I see a lot at bars. I currently use it for a lot of at home dance parties and it's AMAZING! There are multiple functions of different light settings and it's great for parties. We brought this out for two parties at our house and everyone loves it and asks where we got it. I have used it a total of 13 times and it's been fantastic. Perfect for a room- probably not big enough for a hall without getting a could (which would be awesome having multiples in a room). My only warning is that it needs a 3 prong outlet which we have a few of in our house but not all have been converted. Just a warning for purchasers. **received at a slight discount for review purposes**

Nice set. Large strainer is prefer for fruit. Medium is perfect for 1 person set. Third one is really small.Positives:  Work well & easy for even my toddler to use. Light weight. Easy to use for washing fruits or vegetables. Made of stainless steel. Dishwasher safe (at least I used them in there and it didn't rust.Negative: No idea what to use the third one for. It's really small. These are not deep so for single use washing.*received for review purposes*

Ordered an XXL for my husband and it's more of an XL. Watch the sizing on this. Overall, nice quality and very nice looking. It's a fitted feel. Fabric is a nice feel.... overall- great price for a product but go up a size. Best look for un-tucked as it is fitted and would be a tight fit for tucked if a bigger guy. Thicker material so wear an undershirt if you sweat.**received a small discount for review purposes**

As a sprinkler for kids: This worked really well for my toddlers. It rotated back and forth which let them decide to go in or just run away. It also expanded a larger span so the grass didn't get too soaked in one spot. Totally worth $25 as that's the cost of a small pool that lasts for the year. This seems like it would last a few years. Lots of fun.As a sprinkler for grass/gardens: it's large so great for grass. If you want to centralize on a small location- this is the right tool but great for large spaces and does a good amount in a short time.**received for review purposes**

I didn't realize this was a refill kit and no straws came with it. Overall- I used them like regular water balloons and they were good- nothing insanely special about them- just come in bulk. Bright colors. Can't wait to get the straws and try the full set. **received at discount rate for review purposes**

My favorite part of this salad spinners is that you can shred carrots right into the spinner. Overall- the spinner is nice, seems to really ring out the lettuce so sit's not overly wet. I had to spin it a good 10 times to get it dry enough to use dressing- typically I get bagged salad to avoid having to wash it.Favorite parts: Large, Love the colors- bright, easy to spin, Shreds carrots and/or other vegetables, easy to carry/bring with you.Negative parts: it's plastic so I'm not 100% sure this would last but will come back and give more feedback- I've only used it 4 times.**received sample for review purposes**

Nice set- comes with 3 different tweezers and each one has a purpose.1. Case is nice- holds all three & easy in and out2. Variety of types of tweezers is nice- anything from eyebrows to splinters*received sample for review purposes**

It's really cute but it super short! I'm in my 30's and am about 5'11" and this barely covered my butt. Would be adorable for a teen or early 20's and need to purchase a size larger than expected but overall- material is nice and can't see through. Wish it fit and was a bit longer. **received a SLIGHT discount for review purposes- it's actually now at the price I paid- $5.99.

First: Pairing took a bit longer than othersSecond: Stick worked AWESOME!Third: Great for taking selfies.Fourth: Easy to use- one piece and ready for use.Fifth: Love the wrist strapSixth: Fits in my purse**received for review purposes**

First- I didn't expect that it could flip around and be two sided. My husband has a CK one that he loves that does this.Second- love the name of wolverine.Third, this is a very sturdy, quality belt. It's been two weeks and no divots in the belt or fraying.It's just a nice belt and excited I found a brand my husband loves that is' ridiculously expensive. I ordered a size up because when I buy belts it comes too small. This is true to fit. Great find! No rub off of color (though this isn't normal- happened once)**received sample for review purposes**

I'm probably a bit OCD on my nails but paint my finger nails 2 to 3 times a week and my toes 1 to 2 times every 2 weeks (depends on what I change my fingernails to). Great set- I used the gloves already and LOVED them. They are in the wash tonight so can review later if they fall apart- I'm not expecting this. The files are quality and love the size of the smaller ones as they fit in my wallet. Overall- great set.**received a slight discount for review purposes**

My husband is a firefighter and never wears his solid gold wedding ring because it can get destroyed with the amount of equipment they are throwing around. We talked about tungsten but he wanted the value of a  straight gold ring... I'm prefacing this because my husband LOVED this run and honestly has not taken this off. He has been wearing this since it came in- even to bed. If this was around when we were getting married- I have no doubt this would have been his wedding ring. I actually love it bc LOR is a variety of both of ours and this is a fitting ring. Its EXACTLY how it's show- which is rare for me to see during reviews. **received a discount on this item for review purposes- would probably have paid double list price after seeing it*

A few things I noticed:1. You need to press the button for 30 seconds to let out the extra water before it really is steam2. It only lasts about 5 minutes- great for a couch OR to steam windows clean.Tested this on my couch and my windows. I actually ran out of window cleaner and it was the most wonderful fall day out- did all my windows downstairs (7) in a single try... I washed my front door handle and outside down while it cooler to add in more watcher and got my whole sectional cleaned in one turn.Loved all the accessories- endless possibilities.One thing to note: It's 3 prong. It's not a huge deal but a friend asked to use it and she had to use an extension cord from the kitchen to use it.**received sample for review purposes**

I did a taste test of 2 of the same wines- I noticed a very slight difference between the two with this aerator. Normally- I just let rad wine site for 10 to 20 minutes prior to drinking... but what happens when you open the 2nd bottle? I found this product elegant and useful. Thought it only provided a bit of a difference- it's really how wine is to be served. It's a nice collection piece OR as a housewarming gift. **received for review purposes**

While I may not have purchased this unless was given the opportunity to review- It's been AWESOME. My husband has not been able to put this down- leaving me with listening to him talk about this often. The most impressionable chapter was death- in talking to our kids is about death we fumble. This booked helped us in simplifying it for us to talk to them. We always have a hard time saying why people die and what happens but we learned ways to say this more elegantly that didn't terrify them....all while learning ourselves what this means. It's been an eye opener of things we knew but puts it into reality. **received for review purposes**

I'm an avid wine drinker and my husband and I made wine. I thought this book was great and education. Is a guideline to help you understand wine more. Includes:• History of wine• Wine Making• Wine types• How to taste wine• How it's is served and what to do with left over (never experienced this)This is a good resource for those who want to life wine or really like it and want to learn more.**received for review purposes**

The only purpose for this would be as a gift package accessory. It fits in the palm of your hand and the shell is plastic. It does however actually play as an xylophone. I'd use this as a shower party gift- but would need them in packs of like 10 for less than a buck a piece. Otherwise, it's over priced as a toy.

Bow is really cute and was very excited since it was less than $2. My only issues is my bow wasn't checked before it went out- it looks burnt in the middle. I'd return it but it took a while to get and it's not worth it. I'll give it you my daughter to put on her daughters versus a shower gift.

It has really no shape to it. You have to bunch it at the bottom yourself to get that look- very think material. Just does not look flattering- more like a t-shirt that is worn out or not stitched right. I received this at a discount rate for review purposes- and still feel I paid too much.

Very pretty dress- fits snug in the chest area and flows throughout.  Actually seemed long enough (I'm 6ft tall). Loved the straps were thick enough to allow me to wear a bra- the cups were thicker but if you are large set- not very supportive. Not see-through.Received a slight discount for reviewing.

It's a decent product. We don't have a chainsaw and don't typically do any DIY projects at home and hire professionals but this makes it nice for very small tasks like cutting a small branch off the tree. It's great for the small jobs we need it for - not for larger or even medium size jobs. Overall- it worked nicely. No issues with it. Great for camping! **received sample for review purposes**

Seems to work well with my I phone. The case is boring and I only used it when I knew I wouldn't be able to charge my phone. I didn't have any issues with this but I haven't updated my phone in a long time due to lots of pictures and haven't downloaded them to my computer yet.Positives: Case is decent- protects phone. Adds charge to my phone, kick stand option was different,Negatives: Charge isn't double, Plain case**received sample for review purposes**

Nice Mat for kitty litter pan. The design of the paw print in cute & makes the little pan not as unattractive. It's heavy duty- my cat uses it as a bit of a scratching mat once he comes out of the littler. This mat seems to contain the litter that comes out of the pan when the cat comes out. Overall, pretty satisfied with this mat- much nicer than my last one and already can tell by the quality of the product that it will last much longer. One nice little piece of advice, I used a little powder on the mat once a week and it leave a nice scent around the litter area. :) **received for review purposes**

I brought this down the shore with 5 toddler/preschoolers and it was absolutely the coolest thing I could have brought down. Lots of fun stencils, no issue with getting a bad picture (stencils fit nicely on skin and easily peel off) and the glitter comes in a ton of fun colors!Overall Directions: The stencils stick nicely to the skin, then you put the glue over it and then brush over the glitter. SUPER easy to use and these little tattoo's are one of a kind! I even did some designs without the stencils.They lasted a few days- outside all day at the beach. Overall probably last the full week if you aren't spending all your time outside or in water.Plan on buying another set for my kids birthday! It was that much fun! **received this set for review purposes**

So far- it has been working great! I tried every angle to make it fall apart but thus far, mine has been pretty sturdy. I have 2 other sticks from other providers and this works just as well. Overall, happy with my purchase- fair value at $10. ** received a slight discount for review purposes**

I purchased this 1 day before fathers day- pay the extra for 1 day shipping and it is TOTALLY worth it. I was worried it would look cheap but it's really adorable!! The mat looks very pretty and the silver heart is a nice embellishment. Would totally buy a mothers one if I can find it :)

These are very nice- much larger than expected but makes them stand out. Wore them once without any discoloration or stain to a white shirt. Will have to come back and review after a few times of use. Overall- GREAT gift. My husband loved the surprised! The silver is bright and not dingy like some of my previous sets I purchased. **received at a discount rate for review purposes**

Normally- I buy these at the dollar store but couldn't pass up getting 100 for a discounted price. Overall- worked well... a few didn't glow but 95% did. Brought them down the shore and was a huge hit! They lasted from 6pm (before it got dark) till past bedtime at 9pm... past that I can't tell you how long they lasted but it's what I expected. **received a small discount for review purposes**

This is a decent bicycle computer, but I also have had some issues with it's readings.  It took me a while to get it sorted out to where I felt it was accurate with the speeds.  I finally got it situated and figured out and I paced it alongside my wife's car to determine if the speed was finally reading correctly or not.  After a couple more minor adjustments on the sensor and magnet, I have it all sorted out and reading where it should.  The device is good, has plenty of functions, but it is a bit tricky to figure out the directions.  Lets just say they aren't the easiest to read.  The device itself is ok made.  I do feel it will break if dropped tho.  I think the case needs to be a bit more robust or it should come with some sort of outer rubber drop proof skin or something of that nature.  I ride off road and it has taken the shock of bumps and jumps quite well I must say.  Pretty tough little unit for as much jarring as I have given it.  Just not drop proof I don't think.  Overall, after some fine tuning, it finally works well enough for me.I received this product at a discounted price for a review.

This is a good little solid knife.  It is small and compact and easy to stash.  Can be worn a multitude of ways.  Neck knife, boot knife, strap it to a bug out bag, etc.  I have it lashed to by bug out bag for emergencies.  It works great as an EDC knife or a back up.  It is a full tang blade with a poly plastic handle.  I took some paracord and wrapped the handle for added grip and paracord comes in handy for extra uses.  This has a nice look and feel to it.  Easy grab handle with a finger slot for extra grip and dexterity while using it.  Overall, really good small knife that has a variety of uses as an every day blade or a back up.I received this product at a discounted price for a review.

Nice tempered glass screen protector. Fit was spot on with this. Both the top and bottom cutouts were precisely placed with no issues. Install was super easy to do with the included prep items. Once lined up and laid down on the phone's screen, this left absolutely no air bubbles. These tempered glass protectors are just so much better than the old film style ones that were such a nightmare to put on. These go on easily and they stay on. Even with aftermarket dropsuit cases and bumper cases these aren't affected. They work together great. The touch response is still exactly as it was without the screen protector installed. Really nice glass. Works fantastic.I received this item at a discounted price to review.

Very slim slider style case for the iPhone 5.  This doesn't add very much bulk to your phone at all.  Nice textured feel to it.  This is a thin case, so I am not thinking it is going to offer much in the way of drop protection from major drops.  Or how well it will hold up after a few of them.  This is a nice case.  It's decent, but in no way is it a dropsuit case.  It is a minimal, thin case.  It looks good and feels nice in the hand.  Fit is spot on too.  Buttons are cut out in the right spots.  Camera cutout is perfect.  Overall, nice case, just not too heavy duty for big drops.I received this product at a discounted price for a review.

Nice thin dual layer bumper case.  This is a decent case, but it is not a drop suit heavy duty case.  It works well, is nicely designed and fits really good.  Very easy to install and covers the phone well enough.  This is a light to moderate protection case.  This will do fine for small drops or anything like that.  I doubt it'll save it from anything too high up tho.  I don't think this case can handle that type of drop to be honest.  Granted it is not a cheap case.  It does offer some decent protection for such a minimal thin styled case.  But if you are rough on your phone, you might want to invest in something a little more robust.  Overall tho, it is a nice case that works good.  Very nicely designed and made.I received this item at a discounted price to review.

This is a great fit for those who want a clear case.  Good fit, and good look.  Easy to install on the phone.  Took all of about 1 minute to get it on and set.  Basically a naked case for your phone just to have extra protection on it.  Seems it will offer some drop protection with it on.  This has no screen protection at all, so I would recommend investing in a tempered glass screen protector too.  All the cutouts for the cameras and buttons are spot on.  They all work good with no issues or obstructions.  Works great, fits great and looks great.I received this product at a discounted price for a review.

This is a good case, but it is a little thinner than I expected it to be.  Granted it is a nice bumper case, it does offer some drop protection, but I wish it would have been a bit more robust material wise.  The fit and finish are really nicely done.  Nicely designed and well made, but like I stated, it is a little on the thin side for my liking.  I think it would offer some decent drop protection for the phone, but it isn't a serious drop protection case.  Minor bumps and drops yes, major no, I don't think it is suited for that.  I like the case, it fits nicely.  None of the external ports/mic/s-pen/headphone jack locations are covered so they are easily accessible.  This will work if you aren't rough on your phone, but if you tend to damage them more than most, I would look at a beefier case altogether.  Still a decent case none the less.I received this item at a discounted price to review.

Nice tempered glass screen protector. Fit was spot on with this. Both the top and bottom cutouts were precisely placed with no issues. Install was super easy to do with the included prep items. Once lined up and laid down on the phone's screen, this left absolutely no air bubbles. These tempered glass protectors are just so much better than the old film style ones that were such a nightmare to put on. These go on easily and they stay on. Even with aftermarket dropsuit cases and bumper cases these aren't affected. They work together great. The touch response is still exactly as it was without the screen protector installed. Really nice glass. Works fantastic.I received this item at a discounted price to review.
